description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Alex Gordon grew up in Lincoln, Neb., a three-hour drive from the glimmering major league ballpark that sits here off Interstate 70. Twice a summer, his family would visit for a weekend, splitting time between the stadium and an amusement park.

title: Tehran Unfetters Cellphones, and the Pictures Start Flowing
description: TEHRAN  Some days ago, Mahdi Taghizadeh did something he never thought he would  at least, not in Iran. He took a screen shot and shared the image with his followers on Twitter. They were all excited, Mr. Taghizadeh, an Internet entrepreneur, said. Finally.

title: Test Your Knowledge of New York Fashion Week
description: How much do you really know about New York Fashion Week and the designers who show here?

title: Facts & Figures: Guns for Tots
description: Although federal law prohibits handgun ownership for anyone under 18, there is no federal minimum age for long-gun ownership. In 30 states, its legal for a child to possess a rifle or shotgun.

title: Melissa Subbotin, Nathaniel Sillin
description: Melissa Dorothy Subbotin and Nathaniel Borden Sillin were married Saturday, at Queen of the Snows Catholic Church in Squaw Valley, Calif. The Rev. Michael Shay, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Steven Anderson joined the Sarofsky Corporation, Chicago, as executive producer. He succeeds Rachel Steele, who is now a freelance producer. Mr. Anderson had most recently been the senior producer at Tris3ct, Chicago.

title: Six George Harrison Albums to Be Remastered and Reissued
description: George Harrisons first six solo studio albums  the ones he released between 1968, when the Beatles were still a going concern, and 1975  will be reissued in remastered form on Sept. 23.

title: The Strange Allure of Higher Fees
description: Just about anything that comes with the alternative label is automatically enticing to plenty of people. Alternative rock spoke to so many music fans that it became more or less mainstream in the 1990s. On a smaller scale, consider the people you know living alternative lifestyles, like the cousin in the nudist colony or your friend from high school who joined the Rainbow Family.

title: Six Steps in Alibabas 12-Figure Valuation
description: How do you value a tech company? What about a dominant, fast-growing, profitable tech company with no peers that operates in an opaque economy?

title: Eric Cantor Cashes In, Goes to Wall Street
description: After Representative Eric Cantor announced his resignation, having lost the Republican primary in June, the editorial board predicted that he would take a job on Wall Street. It was a safe bet.

title: Simpson Thacher & Bartlett Hires a Wall Street Prosecutor
description: Updated, 5:41 p.m. | Jeffrey H. Knox, a senior federal prosecutor who butted heads with a number of Wall Street banks, is switching sides.

title: The Economic Price of Colleges Failures
description: Four years ago, the sociologists Richard Arum and Josipa Roksa dropped a bomb on American higher education. Their groundbreaking book, Academically Adrift, found that many students experience limited or no learning in college. Today, they released a follow-up study, tracking the same students for two years after graduation, into the workplace, adult relationships and civic life. The results suggest that recent college graduates who are struggling to start careers are being hamstrung by their lack of learning.

title: Russias Foreign Minister on Ukraine
description: Sergey V. Lavrov, Russias foreign minister, said that the party of war in Kiev was trying to disrupt peace negotiations between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Today in Small Business: Made in the U.S.A.
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Some of New Yorks Signature Dishes Are Yours to Take Out
description: A few of the citys best restaurants quietly offer some of their specialties in a takeout version that can be ordered for home to serve one or two, or a party. But youll need a bicycle, because they dont deliver.

title: T Time | Hotelier Sean MacPherson
description: Hotelier Sean MacPherson shows T his newest property, the Ludlow, and reminisces about New Yorks Lower East Side in the 1980s.

title: Why a Breakup of Citigroup Is Still a Good Idea
description: Nine years ago, Breakingviews proposed an extreme idea to Citigroups then-leader, Charles O. Prince III. The $240 billion market capitalization of the New York bank was lower than the worth of its parts valued separately. By splitting into three separate units, the idea was, Mr. Prince could hand shareholders an extra $50 billion or so, the equivalent of one entire U.S. Bancorp at the time.

title: Ads for Marathon Tap Into New York City Spirit
description: A campaign to promote the next running of a premier marathon is getting into a New York state of mind.

title: Obama to Visit Estonia to Reassure Baltic Allies Over Russia
description: KEFLAVIK, Iceland  With concerns rising about Russias intervention in Ukraine, President Obama will use a visit to neighboring Estonia on Wednesday to reassure fretful allies that the United States and Europe are serious about defending them from a newly aggressive Russia.

title: Palestinian Leaders Seek Actions in Security Council and Court
description: UNITED NATIONS  Israels 50-day war with Palestinian militants in Gaza was a game changer that persuaded the Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, to shelve the already moribund American-sponsored peace talks and decide to join the International Criminal Court, even if that meant defying the United States, a senior Palestinian leader said Tuesday.

title: Questions for the Government in an Insider Trading Case
description: What if the government knows a crime is about to take place but does nothing to stop it and instead allows the crime to happen so it can gather additional evidence for a later prosecution? When the crime is insider trading, perhaps the fact that there are no individual victims justifies allowing someone to use confidential information to earn illegal profits. But there is still something troubling when a crime that can be easily stopped is allowed to occur.

title: ISIS Says It Killed Steven Sotloff After U.S. Strikes in Northern Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  An Islamic militant group released a video on Tuesday showing the second beheading of an American hostage in two weeks and blamed President Obama for the killing. The video raised the pressure on the president to order military strikes on the group in its sanctuary in Syria.

title: Staten Island Congressmans Fraud Trial to Start After Fall Elections
description: The federal fraud trial of Representative Michael G. Grimm will begin on Dec. 1, clearing what could have been a substantial obstacle to his re-election efforts.

title: New Bars Offer Barrels, Beer and Boilermakers
description: The demise of one of last falls splashiest new bars, the 1970s-themed Golden Cadillac, has created a sort of downtown drinking diaspora. Most of its partners are back in the same space with a new venture, Boilermaker; one, Greg Boehm, is also opening an East Village saloon, Mace, while the former Cadillac barman Giuseppe Gonzalez will unveil Suffolk Arms just blocks away. Three live bars for one dead one? Pretty good bargain, Im thinking.

title: Where to Eat, Unwind and Caffeinate Downtown During New York Fashion Week
description: New York Fashion Week unofficially kicks off tomorrow. And since the shows have become decentralized in recent seasons  with many marquee events now taking place in lower Manhattan  trekking between runway presentations and store openings also provides ample opportunity to explore whats new on the downtown food scene. With this in mind, we rounded up the best spots below 14th Street to find the perfect croissant (hint: its in an arcade), drink a flat white, slurp oysters atop the deck of a 142-foot schooner, enjoy an al fresco cocktail or savor a breakfast sandwich after midnight.

title: Meet Two Business Owners With Opposing Views on Minimum Wage
description: Last month, in a discussion about how raising the minimum wage might affect small companies, we noted that there could be more empathy among elected officials for how entrepreneurs manage their businesses. Inspired by the suggestion that members of Congress ought to try managing a small business for a week, we invited small-business owners who were willing to open their doors to an elected official for a day to let us know by email.

title: 1914: City Prepares for War Wounded
description: AIX-LES-BAINS  In spite of the deadly silence which has reigned here for more than a fortnight now, Aix has not been idle. There is hardly a person here, native or visitor, who has not done a little to help. Wonders have been achieved in all the hotels, schools and garages in establishing hospitals and cantines, and everything is now in readiness to receive the wounded. About 1,200 beds are installed, and it is touching to see how much hard work has been done and real sacrifice has been gladly made. The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 3, 1914

title: DNA Evidence Clears Two Men in 1983 Murder
description: LUMBERTON, N.C.  Thirty years after their convictions in the rape and murder of an 11-year-old girl in rural North Carolina, based on confessions that they quickly repudiated and said were coerced, two mentally disabled half brothers were declared innocent and ordered released Tuesday by a judge here.

title: Daughter Confirms Joan Rivers Is Still on Life Support
description: Joan Rivers remains on life support on Tuesday, days after she was hospitalized in Manhattan, her daughter, Melissa Rivers, said.

title: A Virtual Jeff Koons Work to Grace Garage Magazine
description: Garage Magazine, an art, fashion and literary magazine that publishes twice a year, will include a surprise for its readers in its seventh issue, due on Thursday: a virtual art work, created for the publication by Jeff Koons. The work, Lady Bug, is virtual in the sense that it can be seen only on mobile devices, by way of the Garage Mag app. Viewers will be able to use the app and their devices to walk around the piece  virtually  and see it from all angles.

title: Andy Murray Reviews His Place Among the Big 4
description: As Andy Murray reaches the pointy end of the draw at the United States Open, he finds a familiar face in Novak Djokovic waiting in the quarterfinals. Murray and Djokovic have met 20 times, four in Grand Slam finals (each winning twice). In his latest conversation with The New York Times, Murray discusses his role in the so-called Big 4, the four players who have dominated mens tennis in the past 10 years. In previous interviews at the U.S. Open, Murray has discussed his perspective on this years tournament, female coaches in tennis, the idea of an independent Scotland and his favorite stops on the tour. This interview has been condensed and edited.

title: Putins War of Words: A Roundup
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia told the president of the European Commission, If I wanted to, I could take Kiev in two weeks.

title: Nude Photos of Jennifer Lawrence Are Latest Front in Online Privacy Debate
description: Perez Hilton has made a career of posting anything and everything about celebrities and their lives. On Tuesday, he thought better of it.

title: Active Role in Class Helps Black and First-Generation College Students, Study Says
description: The trend away from classes based on reading and listening passively to lectures, and toward a more active role for students, has its most profound effects on black students and those whose parents did not go to college, a new study of college students shows.

title: Lessons Learned from the Ebola Epidemic
description: On July 24, I wrote on this blog that the Ebola epidemic was spinning out of control and pleaded with the international community to join my organization, Samaritans Purse, on the front lines of the fight against this deadly disease.

title: Motorsports: Labor Day Weekend Rewards for Power, DeJoria, Kahne and Mrquez
description: Will Power, capping what he said was 15 years of hard, often frustrating work, was officially crowned champion of the IndyCar series on Sunday at an awards ceremony in Los Angeles. Power had clinched the title by finishing ninth in the season finale Saturday in Fontana, Calif. His teammate, Helio Castroneves, needed to win the race to beat Power for the title. He came in second, foiled by a time-consuming stop-and-go penalty for a pit stop infraction. Tony Kanaan won the event.

title: Creating a Homework Habit
description: Homework.

title: Richard Nixons Signature Draws Attention to Nu Skin
description: Former United States presidents dont typically become bankers after their time in office. Nor, for that matter, do they come back from the dead.

title: Pakistani Lawmakers Support Premier
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistani lawmakers met in an emergency session on Tuesday to express support for Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, after days of violent protests had appeared to bring the government to the brink of collapse.

title: Federal Program Helps Keep Some Delinquent Borrowers in Their Homes
description: A four-year program by a federal housing agency to sell its most delinquent mortgages to private investors is producing modest returns when it comes to keeping those struggling borrowers in their homes.

title: The Supreme Courts Cash Gift to Republican Candidates
description: The instant the Supreme Court demolished overall donation limits in April, the money burst forth from the dam. As The Washington Post reported this morning, more than 300 donors immediately wrote checks beyond the old limit of $123,200, adding $11.6 million to the political system that would not have been allowed earlier.

title: Fantasy Football: Waiver Wire Picks for Week 1
description: While the rest of your league was busy winning your draft (and telling you about it), they were also leaving good players on the waiver wire for Week 1, and possibly beyond.

title: Book Portrays Eichmann as Evil, but Not Banal
description: More than 50 years after its publication, Hannah Arendts Eichmann in Jerusalem remains enduringly controversial, racking up a long list of critics who continue to pick apart her depiction of the Nazi war criminal Adolf Eichmann as an exemplar of the banality of evil, a bloodless, nearly mindless bureaucrat who never realized what he was doing.

title: A Delano in Las Vegas
description: Las Vegas has hotels that pay homage to Paris and Egypt and Lake Como, Italy. Beginning Tuesday, the new Delano Las Vegas will channel a closer-to-home destination: Miami.

title: Tony Soprano Is Dead
description: After a week away from blogging, I think its best to return first to relatively unimportant subjects, and put off writingon Russia,Rotherham, ISISand other matters until Im a little more re-acclimated. So here are a few thoughts on acultural controversy thatflared upwhile I was away, when a writer for Vox, Martha Nochimson, apparentlygot David Chase on the recordsaying that Tony Sopranohad, in fact, survived the famous cut to black at the end of The Sopranos  implyingthat the blackout was not, in fact,a Tonys-eye view of the gangsters own whacking.

title: Sean MacPherson on His New Hotel, the Ludlow
description: In the latest installation of our T Time video series, Ts online director Jesse Ashlock interviews Sean MacPherson, the hotelier who created the Maritime and the Jane. MacPherson talks about his new hotel, theLudlow, located on the Lower East Side, and how the city has changed since the 80s.

title: Colts Owner Is Suspended and Fined After a Guilty Plea
description: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell suspended the Indianapolis Colts owner Jim Irsay on Tuesday for six games and fined him $500,000 for violating the leagues personal conduct policy when he was arrested on the suspicion of being intoxicated while driving near his home in Carmel, Ind. Goodell imposed the punishment hours after Irsay pleaded guilty in court to impaired driving.

title: Scouting the Scene
description: Being hailed as one of the greatest chefs on the planet is nice and all, but when it comes to success in the New York restaurant scene, that and $2.75 will buy you a quick ride on the F train to indifference.

title: He Said, She Said, and Getting It Right About Voter ID
description: Two recent articles on voting disputes would have benefitted greatly from a single clarifying sentence  one that would have cut through the he said, she said language that so many readers understandably tell me they dislike.

title: How Can Men Help Prevent Sexual Assault?
description: As the summer wanes, college students are moving into their dorms to get ready for a new semester. But this year, male students say they arent as eager to flirt and drink as they have been in years past.

title: Summer Reading Winner, Week 10 | A High School Journalist on the Execution of James Foley
Lincoln Center Loses a Bit of Luster
description: Nothing fades faster than a shiny new toy.

title: Home Depot Investigates a Possible Credit Card Breach
description: Home Depot said on Tuesday that it was investigating a report that customer credit and debit card data was stolen from its systems and put up for sale online.

title: Europe Crisis Is Resistant to Medicine of Low Rates
description: FRANKFURT  It is getting harder and harder to find free parking for large sums of euros.

title: At 28, Peng Shuai Advances to Her First Grand Slam Semifinal
description: When the United States Open began, Peng Shuai said she did not relish being the highest-ranked Chinese player in the tournament, preferring that Li Na is around, absorbing most of the pressure and attention from the Chinese fans who have become quite a cheering section in Flushing Meadows in recent years.

title: New Berlin or Not, Leipzig Has New Life
description: By 1989, Leipzig stank. The East German industrial hub was said to have the worst air in the country  if not the continent. Factories belched tons of sulfur dioxide into the skies and the polluted waterways reeked. But just a quarter-century later, Leipzig has shed its reputation as Germanys poverty capital and entered safely into the realm of poverty chic; it has been born anew as a cultural mecca  and, just maybe, the New Berlin.

title: Restaurant Report: Tern in Palo Alto, Calif.
description: In Piedmontese slang, Tern is a derogatory term for Southern Italians. It means rednecks or hicks, said Franco Campilongo, who hails from a small town in Calabria, the toe on Italys boot. But rather than taking the term (pronounced tay-ROON) as an affront, Mr. Campilongo wears it as a badge of honor  as does his year-old restaurant in Palo Alto.

title: Larry Davids Fish in the Dark to Open on Broadway in March
description: Fish in the Dark, the new Broadway play written by and starring Larry David, will begin preview performances on Feb. 2 at the Cort Theater and open on March 5, the producer Scott Rudin said on Tuesday. Additional cast members were also announced: the Tony Award nominee Jayne Houdyshell (Well), Rosie Perez (Fearless), Jonny Orsini (The Nance), Jake Cannavale (Basilica), and Jerry Adler (The Sopranos).

title: David Lynchs Doughnut Obsession
description: Trippy dream sequences. Doppelgngers. Laura Dern. One associates them all with the fun-house mirror maze of a David Lynch project. But doughnuts? From Special Agent Dale Coopers insatiable sweet tooth on Twin Peaks to the metaphor Lynch uses in the 2012 documentary Meditation, Creativity, Peace (Transcendental Meditation gives an experience much sweeter than the sweetness of this doughnut), sugary fried rings have popped up throughout the filmmakers cabalistic canon. And so, Michael Solomonov, the chef and co-owner of Philadelphias Federal Donuts, jumped at the invite to make confections in honor of the first major retrospective of Lynchs work, at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts (where Lynch studied painting in the late 60s). With names like Blue Velvet and Good Coffee  a Twin Peaks reference  Solomonovs creations are an homage to the master of magical realist cinema. Theres one, though, that wont see the light of day: the David Lynch. I would have done a little clove and allspice, to get at the Indian-mystical thing, and a bit of malt powder since he used to have a daily milkshake, Solomonov says. Plus a healthy dose of windowpane LSD.

title: Hotel Review: Fletcher Hotel in Amsterdam
description: Rates

title: Steven Sotloff: Another ISIS Atrocity
description: Its hard to imagine that anyone was surprised by the news of yet another atrocity by the terrorist group that styles itself as the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, as if there is anything Islamic  or religious in any way  about these thugs, or that they represent any kind of state.

title: Laughs Draw a Crowd to McNallys Its Only a Play
description: Broadway has been light on comedies lately, but its latest one looks to be a hit. Its Only a Play, a showbiz send-up featuring Nathan Lane and Matthew Broderick  the stars of the 2001 musical smash The Producers  grossed $793,046 last week for its first five preview performances, which were all sold out. According to box office data released on Tuesday by Broadway producers and theater owners, Its Only a Play also had an average paid admission of $146.81, with only the hits The Book of Mormon and Beautiful: The Carole King Musical drawing higher average ticket prices.

title: Wheelies: The Corvette Sinkhole Filled Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: A Grand Stage for a Second Act
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J.  Chris Cannons lavish new hive of restaurants in this suburban town is wrapped in gilded splendor. A long, thin reflecting pool, flanked by urns, stretches out in front of what looks like a Mediterranean palazzo. Inside, theres an imperial staircase of Italian marble and thick columns that soar to the ceiling.

title: Daria P. Salusbury
description: Ms. Salusbury, 60, is a senior vice president in charge of the luxury residential leasing operations for the Related Companies. The rental portfolio consists of about 6,000 units, mostly in New York, with more planned in Relateds coming Hudson Yards development and other projects.

title: Awesome Road Trip for Andy Murrays Fans From Down Under
description: In January 2007, Andy Murray was ranked 17th, another up-and-coming player in the orbit of Roger Federer. But Nick Holloway saw something special in Murray and set out to do something about it.

title: New York Fashion Week Guide: Whom and What to Know
description: As the United States Open winds down to its final chaotic days, another late-summer New York spectacle takes its place, one with its own crowds, prized seating spots, celebrity sightings and, of course, winners and losers. Yes, we are talking about New York Fashion Week. The spring/summer season is upon us, with more than 100 shows taking place between now and next Thursday, followed by the same again in London, Milan and Paris until the first week of October. Fashion month has become a cultural phenomenon as globally pervasive as the ginkgo tree. You cant avoid it, so you may as well embrace it, and find out what you should be ready to discuss during cocktail parties and water cooler conversations everywhere. Indubitably, questions of geopolitics and the stagnant European economy are more important, but think of it this way: What happens at fashion week will inform in large part the shape  literally  your identity will take six months from now. So in the interests of self-awareness (anduseful banter), following is my crib sheet for what to watch, whom to know and where to focus during the collections.

title: Three Roads to Hard Money
description: So, a hedge fund manager, a right-wing politician, and a freshwater economist walk into a restaurant and order wine. No, this isnt the setup for a joke  its a real story. We dont actually know what they talked about, but all three have been prominent in warning that the Fed is embarked on a dangerously inflationary path. And as I have written many many times, this inflation paranoia has proved remarkably resilient, enduring despite five-plus years of utter empirical failure. Why?

title: Bank Seizure Leaves Bulgarians Stranded
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  What seemed at first to be a short-term banking crisis is looking more like a chronic condition.

title: There Is No Secondi Choice
description: Main courses are never as good as the starters, people like to say. Ive always argued that a good chef wont let that happen, but I have to admit that it does seem true for a lot of Italian restaurants, at least in New York City. There are exceptions, of course, but as a general rule, its all downhill after the spaghetti.

title: Walkabout: Traveled in the Last Year? Most Americans Say No
description: HomebodiesDid you travel in the last year? If so, you are in the minority of Americans. According to a survey conducted by the travel site Skift, 62 percent of adults in the country did not travel for business or pleasure. (Skift)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Outside the Fall/Winter 2015 New Zealand Shows
description: A peek at what some of the guys and gals in New Zealand were wearing.

title: Arizona Police Report Says Parents Didnt Realize Daughter Had Shot Gun Instructor
description: When the police arrived, the shooting range instructor who had been accidentally shot by a 9-year-old girl with an Uzi was still breathing, lying on the ground and moaning as a colleague tried to stanch the bleeding from a bullet wound to his head, according to a police report released on Tuesday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Washington and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Washington, Ukraine, Germany and India.

title: Enrique Olveras Love for Avocado Filled Vegetarian Tacos
description: Most top chefs will tell you the same thing: When they finally escape from the elaborate labors they oversee in the kitchen, they crave late-night street food thats poetically simple and satisfying  hot dogs, fried rice, a bowl of noodles. For Enrique Olvera, that hand-to-mouth haiku can be found in avocado tacos, which he scarfs down around the clock. He eats them for breakfast; he eats them in the middle of the night. They serve as both a comfort, he said, and a cultural expression.

title: A Tip Sheet for a Season of Surprises
description: The coming months promise a rich menu of options: fried chicken, Asian-Latino fusion, snack stands and opulent new dining rooms.  Florence Fabricant describes the highlights. (Dates may change.)

title: Anne Griffin Seeks to Void Prenuptial Agreement With Ken Griffin
description: Updated, 5:47 p.m. | When the billionaire hedge fund manager Kenneth C. Griffin moved to divorce his wife of 11 years this summer, his action took many by surprise.

title: Cara Delevingnes Quilted Leather Mulberry Backpack
description: A leather quilted backpack, like the one Cara Delevingne designed for her new Mulberry collection that hit stores yesterday, is an obvious choice for glamming up back-to-school wardrobes. And in all black, its also a smart carryall for the fashion set during the spring/summer 2015 shows, which kick off tomorrow in New York.

title: Two Met Opera Unions Ratify Contracts
description: Two of the Metropolitan Opera unions represented by the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees have ratified the contracts negotiated with the opera late last month. One of the unions, Local 1, which represents the carpenters and those responsible for the lighting, sound, props and set construction, approved a six-year agreement; the other, Local 764, representing those who work in the costume shop and who dress the singers, approved a four-year contract.

title: With Storms Outside, Inner Conflicts Swirl
description: In the new issue of Tin House, the literary quarterly, theres a terrific conversation  conducted on Google Chat  between Annie Nugent Baker, the Pulitzer Prize-winning playwright, and the novelist Benjamin Baker Nugent, her brother.

title: A Kingdom for Some Fans
description: I could have spent my television time over Labor Day weekend catching up on any number of brainy, critically beloved shows in preparation for the fall season. Instead, I was sucked into a world of inept archery and ill-fitting armor, where people who have no business trying to save a kingdom have been given the responsibility to do just that.

title: Depression, a Persistent Demon, Stalks One Family for Generations
description: With Rocks in My Pockets, Signe Baumane presents a sharp, surprising and funny animated feature, plumbing the depths of depression via her family history. Guided by Ms. Baumanes almost musically accented voice-over, this hand-drawn debut feature is based upon the mental struggles of her Latvian grandmother and other relatives. Its told with remorseless psychological intelligence, wicked irony and an acerbic sense of humor.

title: Circus Tent Boxers in Australias Outback
description: Looking to make pictures of Australia that did not involve surfers or kangaroos, Viviane Dalles cast her luck with an itinerant boxing show.

title: What Were Reading: Great Summer Picks
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an email. Sign up

title: A Clash Over History
description: To the Editor:

title: The Rise in Evictions
description: To the Editor:

title: Sri Lanka and Human Rights: An Ambassadors View
description: To the Editor:

title: Minor School Infractions
description: To the Editor:

title: FanDuel, an Online Fantasy Sports Site, Raises $70 Million
description: The trading of athlete on fantasy sports sites may be fake, but the business is real  as are the investment dollars flowing into the industry.

title: Q. and A.: Ren Jianming on the Fight Against Corruption in China, and His Own Solution
description: Ren Jianming is one of Chinas leading corruption researchers and an expert on one of the hottest topics in the country: President Xi Jinpings anticorruption campaign, which is netting hundreds, and possibly thousands, of officials, including very senior ones.

title: Millys Michelle Smith on Navigating New York Fashion Week with Kids
description: New York Fashion Week throws the work-life calculus into chaos for just about everyone in the industry. But its hectic schedule is especially challenging for parents of young children. The designer Michelle Smith of Milly, who will present her spring/summer 2015 collection on Monday and is also the mother of a seven-year-old girland five-year-old boy, has more experience than most in navigating the unique demands of the week (which also coincides with back-to-school time).

title: Will China Defeat Obesity?
description: Say what you will about the Chinese, but they know how to make wholesale changes, and sometimes those changes are inarguably for the good. As noted in an editorial in The Lancet last week, the life span of the average person in China in 1950 was 40 years; by 2011 it was around 76. (The average life span in the United States in 2011 was 79.)

title: Still Dealing in Intimacy After All These Years
description: Two women, robed in black, gazed at each other across a low table at the Alexander Kasser Theater at Montclair State University. They were rehearsing Imagining O, Richard Schechners reinvention of Shakespeares Hamlet and Pauline Rages novel The Story of O, which opens next Wednesday as part of the Peak Performances series. Mr. Schechner, as brash as he is gentle, asked the actresses to work the scene again. I want absolute intimacy, he said.

title: A View of the Heavens Needs Some Retouching
description: Just over a year ago, MoMA PS1, the Museum of Modern Arts outpost in Long Island City, Queens, quietly shut the door on one of New Yorks most beloved works of art. Meeting, James Turrells room-size installation whose roof opens to the sky, on view since 1986, has been closed to the public as the museum and the artist decide how to restore it.

title: More Than a Million Ukrainians Have Been Displaced, U.N. Says
description: GENEVA  Amid rising international tension over Ukraine, the United Nations refugee agency said Tuesday that the fighting there had displaced more than a million people and warned of devastating consequences if it did not end soon.

title: Tested to Extremes
description: The way to ensure a Rolex wearer can go faster, further and deeper.

title: A Family Album
description: CHICAGO  One summer afternoon, at the industrial loft space where he rehearses and records, Jeff Tweedy was sitting in a corner with a guitar across his lap, rooting his way around an impromptu cover of Neil Youngs Cinnamon Girl. By his side was a drummer who is not a member of Mr. Tweedys influential rock band, Wilco, but who has worked closely with him for many years, and who kept an enthusiastic and undeterrable beat while watching him contend with some awkward chord changes.

title: Hotel Dining, Updated Chinese and More
description: Great restaurants no longer wait for fall. Consider Btard and Racines NY, which both arrived in the last few months. Nonetheless, armed with my shiny new pencil case and notebook, I anticipate the fresh crop of restaurants the way I do the new theater and opera seasons.

title: Reading the Paper With Gay Talese
description: Gay Talese, best-selling author (and former Times reporter), has a white, low-slung 1957 TR3 convertible and a routine. My routine is I get in the TR3 and drive to this gas station in Roxbury, Conn., early in the morning, get the paper and come back home. No one is up, the dogs are not up, the wife is not up, and for the next two and a half hours, I read the paper, alone.

title: U.N. and Medical Group Make Appeals for Ebola Aid
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations and the medical aid group Doctors Without Borders each issued urgent appeals on Tuesday for international aid to contain the Ebola outbreak in West Africa.

title: Concours Season in the East: At Lime Rock Park, a More Relaxed Atmosphere
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn.  Returning from nine days on the Monterey Peninsula, having tried to see as much as possible of the extravaganza of events leading up to the Pebble Beach Concours dElegance, it was a refreshing change to drop into this picturesque village in the northwest corner of Connecticut and to what might be called the real world of auto shows and vintage car racing, Lime Rock Parks Historic Festival 32.

title: In Hobby Lobby Ruling, a Missing Definition Stirs Debate
description: The Supreme Courts decision in June that some companies did not have to provide contraceptive coverage for their employees only started the debate.

title: Video Shows Panic in Liberia as Man Wanders Out of Ebola Clinic
description: As Liberia struggles to contain the deadliest Ebola outbreak on record, health workers say that fear of the disease, and the stigma of being identified as a possible carrier, is creating a hostile environment for those seeking treatment.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Waging Desperate Campaign, Iraqi Town Held Off Militants
description: AMERLI, Iraq  The children lined the unkempt boulevard in this northern Iraqi town on Tuesday to welcome some of the men who had saved them from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: Help Families From Day 1
description: THE opening of Mayor Bill de Blasios universal pre-kindergarten program this week will give 53,000 children access to free, full-day pre-K in New York City, compared with 20,000 enrolled last year. This is well worth celebrating, and other cities and states should follow suit. But this investment in school preparation is not enough. If we want to close the income-based achievement gap, we need to begin much earlier.

title: Dealing With Iraq, Syria and ISIS
Culinary Trends in New York
description: FLYING COLLARS With just one to an animal, fish collar is a rarity saved for specials at places like Alder. Pork collar is in steadier supply than fish collar, and is the star of the charcoal grill at Kang Ho Dong Baekjeong in Flushing, Queens, and soon, Manhattan.  Pete Wells

title: Gal Monfils vs. Roger Federer: Expect Sparks to Fly at the U.S. Open
description: As Gal Monfils played in the fourth round of the United States Open on Tuesday, it was impossible to tell that he was winning his match in straight sets, or that he had not dropped a set in the tournament.

title: Is 'Don't Do Stupid Stuff' the Best Foreign Policy?
Conshohocken, Pa., an Old Steel Town, Now an Office Hub
description: CONSHOHOCKEN, Pa.  The view from the 15th floor of the Eight Tower Bridge office building here looks over two interstate highways, a commuter rail line, an old warehouse and a riverside stand of woods.

title: U.S. Health Agency Advises More Vigilance on Campuses
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has advised American colleges and universities, and any students or staff arriving from nations hit by the Ebola virus, to take precautions against spreading the disease that go beyond what most schools have done.

title: Think Tank to Ponder a Future for Ballet
description: When she wrote Apollos Angels, her sweeping history of that most evanescent of art forms, ballet, the dancer turned historian Jennifer Homans was widely hailed for taking an engaging, scholarly approach to more than four centuries of dance. But within the dance world, her book became famous  or perhaps infamous  for its final 10 pages, a downbeat epilogue in which Ms. Homans sounded a blunt warning, writing, I now feel sure that ballet is dying.

title: Executive Director Leaving Friends of the High Line
description: Earlier this year, Friends of the High Line introduced its new executive director, Jenny Gersten, on its website, saying that even though she had been on the job for only a few weeks, we feel like this dynamic New York City native is already part of the family.

title: India: Militants Are Killed in Shootout in Kashmir
description: The Indian authorities said they killed three antigovernment militants Tuesday after a shootout in the Indian-administered region of Kashmir. Indian forces had surrounded the militants house when the men inside began firing, officials said. Vijay Kumar, the area police chief, said the police had taken the father of one fighter to the site to ask him to surrender, but the man refused. The authorities said that the men were members of Jaish-e-Muhammad, a banned organization.

title: Bracing for New Challenges in Year 2 of Health Care Law
description: The first year of enrollment under the federal health care law was marred by the troubled start of HealthCare.gov, rampant confusion among consumers and a steep learning curve for insurers and government officials alike.

title: After Eric Cantors Exit, House Turns Sympathetic Ear From Big Business to Oil and Gas
description: WASHINGTON  Eric Cantors move on Tuesday to a boutique investment firm in New York drove home a new political landscape emerging on Capitol Hill as the Republican leadership reshuffles in the House: Wall Street and Big Business have lost their most sympathetic ear, oil and gas industries are on the rise, and Louisiana once again has a booming voice at the table.

title: Report Counters Claims of Migrant Abuse
description: Investigators have found no evidence to support a complaint that young migrants crossing the border illegally had been subject to systemic abuse in detention, according to a report released Tuesday by the inspector general of the Department of Homeland Security. The report also found that conditions had improved notably since mid-July in border stations where the young migrants were detained.

title: The Simpsons Marathon Lifts Ratings for Fledgling FXX Network
description: A quarter-century ago, the animated comedy The Simpsons put the fledgling Fox network on the map as the fourth broadcast network. Now, with a much-promoted marathon of all 552 episodes that ended Monday, The Simpsons has repeated that feat, lifting a year-old cable channel called FXX to the top ranks of the 105 cable networks measured by the Nielsen Company.

title: Louisiana: U.S. Joins Inquiry Into Death in Police Car
description: The United States Justice Department said on Tuesday that it was investigating the death of Victor White III, 23, who died while in the custody of Iberia Parish sheriffs deputies in March. The local coroner determined that his shooting death in the back of a police cruiser while his hands were cuffed was a suicide. His family has disputed details of the shooting and called for a federal investigation, comparing his death to the fatal police shooting of another young black man, Michael Brown, in Ferguson, Mo. The United States attorney for the Western District of Louisiana, Stephanie A. Finley, said on Tuesday that the F.B.I. had been working parallel with the current investigation by the Louisiana State Police, and that the federal investigation would supplement, rather than supplant, the state investigation. Officials from the F.B.I., the United States attorneys office and the Justice Departments Civil Rights Division will review the results of the investigation and determine whether to investigative further and whether any civil rights violation occurred, Ms. Finley said.

title: Lida Moser, Photographer and Journalist, Is Dead at 93
description: Lida Moser excelled in capturing the realities of New York life.

title: Halliburton to Pay $1.1 Billion to Settle Damages in Gulf of Mexico Oil Spill
description: Halliburton, the company contracted by BP to cement the ill-fated Macondo oil well in the Gulf of Mexico, has reached a $1.1 billion settlement with thousands of businesses, individuals and local governments that suffered losses from the 2010 Deepwater Horizon oil rig explosion, the company and plaintiffs announced on Tuesday.

title: N.F.L. Season Is About to Begin. Any Questions?
description: The N.F.L.'s regular season begins Thursday night, when the Seattle Seahawks, the defending Super Bowl champions, host the Green Bay Packers. On Sunday, Rex Ryans Jets will play host to the Oakland Raiders, and on Monday night, Eli Manning and the Giants will take on the Lions in Detroit.

title: Ready, Aim, Fire. Not Fire, Ready, Aim.
description: President Obama has been excoriated for declaring that we dont have a strategy yet for effectively confronting the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, or ISIS. In criticizing Obama for taking too much time, Representative Mike Rogers, the Republican chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, told Fox News Sunday that this dont-do-stupid-stuff policy isnt working. That sounded odd to my ear  like we should just bomb somebody, even if it is stupid. If Obama did that, what would he be ignoring?

title: Lida Moser, Photographer With an Urban Eye, Dies at 93
description: Lida Moser, whose genre-spanning photographs appeared in magazines including Look, Esquire and Vogue during their heyday in the 1950s and 60s and who went on to write about photography for The New York Times, died on Aug. 11 near her home in Rockville, Md. She was 93.

title: Charles Bowden, a Writer on the Edge
description: As a 1916 book about the newspaper trade put it, the reporters job is to see for the unseeing and to become a public observer for the benefit of those who cannot observe.

title: Revival of Species Puts Some Fish Back on Plates
description: Dozens of species of popular West Coast rockfish that were once so overfished that the fishing grounds were declared a federal economic disaster are now abundant. The Monterey Bay Aquarium Seafood Watch program, considered the most influential guide to hundreds of species of popular fish, on Monday issued a report encouraging consumers to eat 21 species of rockfish it had long warned cooks to avoid. Many fish sold on menus as snapper, black cod and rock cod were moved to favorable categories, along with recommendations for consumers to choose more sablefish and petrale sole. The revival of the fisheries began in earnest in 2000, when they were near collapse and fishing families were facing bankruptcy. A series of quotas, improvements in gear, better monitoring of catches and the creation of protected areas to preserve fish habitat brought improvements in stocks off the shores of California, Washington and Oregon, said Frank Lockhart of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administrations West Coast fisheries division.

title: Bernard F. Fisher, Honored for Bold Vietnam Rescue, Dies at 87
description: Col. Bernard F. Fisher, who received the first Medal of Honor awarded to an aviator during the Vietnam War for a daring rescue of another pilot in the face of enemy fire on an airstrip, died on Aug. 16 in Boise, Idaho. He was 87.

title: Holiday Inn Express Tries Funny to Sell Free Breakfast
description: HOLIDAY Inn Express is bringing its longtime Stay smart advertising campaign into the 21st century by making it largely digital, with a Funny or Die comedian as its spokesman.

title: New York Cancels or Postpones Opening of 45 Pre-K Programs
description: Nine private programs that were to offer free, city-financed prekindergarten this year will not open because of safety concerns or other issues, and 36 programs will not be ready to open on Thursday, the first day of school, New York City officials announced on Tuesday.

title: Alaska Race Sees Democrat Quit Campaign for Governor
description: SEATTLE  The race for governor of Alaska took a decided turn into the wild on Tuesday when the Democratic candidate, Byron Mallott, said he would withdraw and run instead for lieutenant governor alongside an independent candidate, Bill Walker.

title: Judge Rejects Defenses Criteria for Convicting Ex-Governor Bob McDonnell as Jury Gets Case
description: RICHMOND, Va.  The jury weighing the fate of former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, on corruption charges that could send them to prison is set to deliberate Wednesday for a second day after hearing a lengthy set of instructions in which the judge seemed to side mostly with prosecutors.

title: Israel Says Hamas Is Hurt Significantly
description: TEL AVIV  A senior Israeli military intelligence official acknowledged on Tuesday that only several hundred Hamas operatives out of a total that he put at 16,000 were killed during this summers 50-day war in Gaza, leaving the groups fighting force largely intact.

title: Cuomo Is Running but Isnt One to Talk About It
description: Next Tuesday, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos name will appear on the Democratic primary ballot across New York State.

title: Berkeley Pushes a Boundary on Medical Marijuana
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  Since the birth of the Free Speech Movement half a century ago, this city has prided itself on its liberal values and policies, be they generous benefits for the needy or a look-the-other-way attitude toward marijuana use.

title: $1.4 Billion in Penalties Is Sought in California Gas Blast
description: Four years after a natural gas explosion tore through a neighborhood of San Bruno, Calif., killing eight people and injuring dozens of others, some of them seriously, the Pacific Gas & Electric Company has been hit with a proposed $1.4 billion penalty for suspected safety violations.

title: Ukraine, Caught in a Vise
description: Behind the continuing military conflict in eastern Ukraine lies an economic split. The country is moving toward Europe, straining its longstanding ties with Russia.

title: The Elections Cop Invites Mischief
description: The countrys increasingly lawless political system needs a traffic cop to set clear rules and rein in violators who think nothing of breaking the spending limits. Thats supposed to be the job of the Federal Election Commission, but the agency has made a travesty of its mission, encouraging bad behavior rather than stopping it.

title: All That Back and Forth at the U.S. Open, Between Doubles Partners
description: It happens after almost every point in professional doubles tennis matches, as predictably as the ritualistic high-fiving and fist-bumping the players cannot seem to live without. The point is won or lost. The partners convene. And they have a little chat.

title: NATOs Urgent Challenges
description: More than anyone, President Vladimir Putin of Russia has set the agenda for NATOs 65th summit meeting this week, which could well be the most consequential since the Cold War ended.

title: U.S. and Europe Are Struggling With Response to a Bold Russia
description: WASHINGTON  American and European officials are struggling to devise a response as Russia bears down on Ukraine, searching for new measures that will have more impact than the economic sanctions imposed so far, without risking major damage to their own industries or a military escalation that could spiral out of control.

title: In Ryder Cup Picks, Results Are Not Everything
description: DENVER  A few of the best golfers in the world this summer got a taste of what it is like to be a fringe player in the National Football League. Like Champ Bailey, Robert Meachem and Shayne Graham, all formerly of the New Orleans Saints, the PGA Tour pros Chris Kirk,Ryan Moore and Brendon Todd spent the past several weeks auditioning for a 2014 roster spot, only to fail to make the final cut.

title: Widening the Lens on Blame
description: Mistakes come in different shapes.

title: Midterms on the Menu
description: Gail Collins: Hey David, here we are again. I would personally like to thank the voters in Arkansas, Alaska, North Carolina, Iowa and Louisiana for throwing the fate of the Senate into turmoil and giving us a hot new election season to talk about.

title: Absurd or Astute: Brazils Political Ads
description: To capture attention and votes in Brazils fall elections, candidates use free allotted airtime to release outrageous and provocative ads.

title: Brazils Politicians Often Play the Clown in Ads
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  An auditor flies through the air like Superman, shooting laser beams from his eyes. A clown channels the spirit of a septuagenarian pop star. A dermatologist concludes a tirade by simply screaming at viewers, My name is Havanir!

title: New York Installs Speed Cameras Near Schools
description: With public schools set to open on Thursday, New York City officials have hurried to slow traffic using their newest tools: cameras equipped with radar to gauge the speed of passing vehicles.

title: Monument Seeks to End Silence on Killings of the Disabled by the Nazis
description: BERLIN  The first to be singled out for systematic murder by the Nazis were the mentally ill and intellectually disabled. By the end of World War II, an estimated 300,000 of them had been gassed or starved, their fates hidden by phony death certificates and then largely overlooked among the many atrocities that were to be perpetrated in Nazi Germany in the years to follow.

title: Race Advantages
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Today in bathroom humor, we have a puzzle by Peter A. Collins that is a paean to the loo.

title: What Makes People Poor?
description: Lets imagine for a moment that there are no political pressures distorting our discussion of poverty and that we can look at it as a technical problem, not a moral one.

title: Second Trial Approaching for Rowland, Ex-Connecticut Governor
description: NEW HAVEN  The accusations are similar. The judge will be different.

title: NoHo Real Estate That Comes With a Tale of Murder
description: In the annals of crime, 31 Bond Street casts a particularly creepy spell. An 1833 New York guidebook rhapsodized that the marble-trimmed brick rowhouses in what is now NoHo may vie, for beauty and taste, with those of the finest cities of Europe.

title: Sleep-Deprived, but Into the Next Round
description: As the players grew red in the face and called for the trainers on a muggy Tuesday at the United States Open, the thought of a night match sounded like relief.

title: Changes Made at Fire Academy After Drug-Resistant Staph Infections
description: The New York City fire commissioner has ordered a change in training exercises at the fire academy on Randalls Island after a number of probationary firefighters contracted the drug-resistant bacterial infection MRSA.

title: Lower-Frequency Platform IEX Raises Funding to Become Full Stock Market
description: Until March, few outside of Wall Street had heard of IEX, an upstart stock-trading platform aimed at tempering the advantages of big financial firms and their superfast computers.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 2, 2014
Yankees Offense Fades Along With Heat of Red Sox Rivalry
description: The days of on-field brawls, bullpen invaders and hit batsmen  all the ingredients that have made the rivalry between the Yankees and the Red Sox so volatile and compelling over the years  now seem little more than a faint recollection.

title: Gal Monfils Forces Grigor Dimitrov Into Mistakes in U.S. Open Win
description: Sometimes you play badly, and sometimes your opponent makes you play badly.

title: CVS Stores Stop Selling All Tobacco Products
description: At a CVS store near Times Square, the shelves are notable for what they no longer display: cigarettes. Now the only smoking products to be found are those that could help customers quit.

title: Can Exercise Cause A.L.S.?
description: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis has been all over the news lately because of the ubiquitous A.L.S. ice bucket challenge. That attention has also reinvigorated a long-simmering scientific debate about whether participating in contact sports or even vigorous exercise might somehow contribute to the development of the fatal neurodegenerative disease, an issue that two important new studies attempt to answer.

title: Word of the Day | comprehensive
description: comprehensive\km-pri-hen(t)-siv, -pre-\ adjective and noun

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (Esquire) MY FRIENDS CALL ME JOHNNY Jean Pigozzi, below  the heir to a European automobile fortune, as well as a photographer, art collector, technology investor and creator of the mens clothing brand LimoLand  hosts this new talk show, in which he interviews famous friends. In this premiere episode, he flies to Budapest for a small role in Brett Ratners latest film, Hercules; gets some tips in the art of seduction from the French writers Virginie Mouzat and Capucine Motte; and heads back to Los Angeles to interview Dov Charney, the recently deposed founder of American Apparel.

title: Wes Welker Suspended Four Games for a Banned Substance
description: Less than a week before their season-opening clash with one of their principal rivals, the defending American Football Conference champion Denver Broncos learned Tuesday that wide receiver Wes Welker, a pivotal weapon in their offense, would be suspended four games for violating the N.F.L.s policy on performing-enhancing substances.

title: Corrections: September 3, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, September 3, 2014
description: A long time ago, I wanted to find me a good wife, I wanted to raise a family, I wanted to have my own business and everything. I never got a chance to realize those dreams. Now I believe that God is going to bless me to get back out there.

title: Circus Tent Boxers in Australias Outback
description: PERPIGNAN, France  This week, Viviane Dalles will receive the 2014 Canon Female Photojournalist Award at the Visa Pour lImage festival.

title: 2 South Korean Soldiers Die in Anti-Captivity Training
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Two South Korean soldiers died late Tuesday during an exercise meant to prepare them for capture by the enemy, military officials said Wednesday. The apparent cause was suffocation, they said.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Brothers Convicted in 1983 North Carolina Murder Are Freed After DNA Tests
description: In Brothers Convicted in 1983 North Carolina Murder Are Freed After DNA Tests, Jonathan M. Katz and Erik Eckholm report on the release of two men who spent decades in prison for a crime they did not commit.

title: From Taiwan, Broad Support for Democracy in Hong Kong
description: Taiwans main political parties say they support Hong Kong residents calls for a greater say in choosing their leader following Beijings decision to limit electoral reforms in the semiautonomous Chinese city.

title: Putin Lays Out Proposal to End Ukraine Conflict
description: KIEV, Ukraine  On the eve of a NATO summit meeting focused on Russian aggression, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia unveiled on Wednesday a seven-point peace plan for Ukraine while President Obama and other Western leaders tried to keep the spotlight on the Kremlins role in stoking the conflict there and the penalties it should suffer for doing so.

title: Test Yourself | Teenagers Favor Tech Over Clothes
description: Below are seven paragraphs from the Aug. 27 article Plugged-In Over Preppy: Teenagers Favor Tech Over Clothes.

title: How Many Outsiders Does It Take to Bear Witness in Ferguson?
description: The spectacle began, as it often does, with a local tragedy. Last month an unarmed black teenager named Michael Brown was shot by a police officer in Ferguson, a suburb of St. Louis. In a less media-saturated time, we might have gone on to consider this serious news event on its own terms, with journalists providing facts and insights, and politicians pondering a course of action. But in the mixed-up scrum of politics and media that our so-called national conversation has become, a serious news event is only the start of the news. Soon after the shooting, the suburb of Ferguson became a roiling caldron of outside observers, all bent on bearing witness to the situation.

title: Job Creation Should Be Policy Priority, O.E.C.D. Report Finds
description: PARIS  High unemployment rates in most of the developed world are mainly a result of the tepid economic recovery, rather than a lack of appropriate skills in the work force, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said in a report on Wednesday.

title: Emoji for Breakfast, Dinosaur for Lunch
description: Now that emojis have been analyzed, debatedand used as the basis ofa messaging app, its no longer enough just to talk about them. Wemust eat them.

title: Will What Happened in Ferguson Change Anything?
description: Did you follow the news about the Aug. 9 death of Michael Brown and the subsequent protests in Ferguson, Mo.? If so, what reactions did you have?

title: German Online Retailer Zalando Plans I.P.O.
description: The German online retailer Zalando said on Wednesday that it planned an initial public offering of some of its shares on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange this year.

title: K.K.R. to Sell Its Stake in German Telecom Company Versatel
description: The German Internet services provider United Internet said on Wednesday that it had agreed to acquire the private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Robertss controlling stake in the German telecommunications company Versatel for about $769 million.

title: After Beheading of Steven Sotloff, Obama Pledges to Punish ISIS
description: TALLINN, Estonia  President Obama vowed on Wednesday to punish the Sunni militants whose videotaped beheadings of two American journalists he said had repulsed the world, saying the United States would lead a regional and international coalition to beat back the terrorists.

title: Western Companies Appear to Push Back Against Chinese Crackdown
description: HONG KONG  For months, foreign companies in China have been quietly enduring increased scrutiny from Chinese government antitrust enforcers, issuing only occasional terse statements as they have been increasingly targeted by surprise raids on their offices, protracted investigations of their operations and escalating fines.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: Fashion Week, With a Twist
description: Good morning on this hot-but-less-humid Wednesday.

title: Daily Report: Release of Nude Celebrity Photos Raises Questions on Web Privacy
description: Perez Hilton has made a career of posting anything and everything about celebrities and their lives. On Tuesday, he thought better of it, Mike Isaac reports.

title: Fukushima Workers Who Fled May Have Received Garbled Orders, Reports Say
description: TOKYO  About 650 workers who fled the stricken Fukushima Daiichi power plant without permission at the darkest moment of the 2011 nuclear accident may have left because they thought they had been ordered to evacuate and were not knowingly violating orders, according to new details of the episode reported in recent days by Japanese news media.

title: LVMH Boss and Herms Family in Pact
description: PARIS  It has been nearly four years since the fashion mogul Bernard Arnault shocked the French business world and added billions to his fortune by stealthily obtaining a large stake in Herms, the jewel of the luxury world.

title: Per Capita Medicare Spending Is Actually Falling
description: Medicare spending isnt just lower than experts predicted a few years ago. On a per-person basis, Medicare spending is actually falling.

title: How Investors Can Kill a Business Without Losing Money Themselves
description: This is the story of a trap into which Ive fallen twice at Posse. Investors often set the trap unknowingly  no harm is intended  while they are figuring out whether they would like to invest. Both times this happened I felt heartbroken and exhausted, with my business in turmoil. We were lucky to survive.

title: 1914: Turkish Desire for War
description: ROME  Reports of German successes, skilfully exaggerated, have enormously reinforced the following of Enver Pasha, and telegrams from Constantinople speak of war as inevitable. Turkey would attack Russia in the Caucasus and Greece at the same time, if Bulgaria will permit the Ottoman troops to traverse her country. It is known that the Russophile party in Sofia is in the ascendant. The Bulgarians are afraid that Turkey, if victorious, would refuse to evacuate the strip of territory traversed by her troops on their way to attack Salonica. It should be added that Russia has declared at Sofia that if the passage of Turkish troops is permitted she will disembark troops at Varna. The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 4, 1914

title: Making the Leap From Web to Mobile Apps Easier
description: Theres a curious paradox at the heart of mobile apps: Most people dont like to download them. But when they do, they spend nearly all of their time in them.

title: 1939: War on Germany Declared
description: A quarter of a century after the outbreak of the World War, France and Britain again went to war with Germany yesterday. Britain was in a state of war at 11 a.m., while France entered the war at 5 p.m. The immediate cause was the failure of Chancellor Adolf Hitler to reply to the ultimatum sent him by the two countries demanding that he withdraw his troops from Poland.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 4, 1939

title: Morning Agenda: Debating a Courts Definition
description: When the Supreme Court ruled in the Hobby Lobby case that companies with religious owners could not be required to provide contraceptive coverage for their employees, it did not apply the decision to all corporations, Steven Davidoff Solomon writes in the Deal Professor column. Instead, the court merely held that for-profit closely held corporations could be exempt from providing the coverage under the Affordable Care Act, raising questions about what, exactly, this phrase meant.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Dengue Fever: The Threat in New Delhi
description: The start of dengue fever season in India prompts Ellen Barry, The Timess South Asia bureau chief, to reflect on bone break fever and the threat it poses to reporters in New Delhi.

title: Fashion Week: Recommended Reading
description: Because publishers understand the value of timing as much as any businesspeople, just as Fashion Month dawns, so too comes a raft of new fashion-related books.

title: Robin Roberts Forms TV Production Company
description: LOS ANGELES  The Good Morning America anchor Robin Roberts on Wednesday announced the formation of Rockn Robin Productions, an independent company that will focus on creating documentaries, lifestyle reality series and live special events for ABC and other broadcast and digital networks.

title: Still Dateless at the Coffee Shop
description: Dear Diary:

title: Interest in Solar Water Heating Spreads Globally
description: SAN FRANCISCO  To produce milk and cheese for the world, dairies need cows and grass. But they also go through enormous amounts of hot water each day to flush out milk lines and clean other equipment. And so farmers on King Island, part of the Australian state of Tasmania, were delighted when workers began installing solar arrays on their dairies rooftops to capture the energy of the harsh Australian sun and use it to heat water.

title: Vamp It Up
description: After so many sporty seasons, brooding underworld looks finally get their moment out of the sun.

title: Gay Groups to March in St. Patricks Day Parade as a Ban Falls
description: The organizers of the New York City St. Patricks Day parade said on Wednesday that they were lifting a ban on openly gay groups marching under their own banner, bringing to a close more than two decades of bitter protests and controversy that thrust an annual celebration into the national gay rights debate.

title: Obama Condemns Sotloff Execution
description: The president said that the killing of an American, Steven Sotloff, by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria only strengthened the United States resolve to take the fight against these terrorists.

title: Money in a Time of Zero
description: My old teacher Charles Kindleberger used to say that anyone who spends too much time thinking about international money goes mad; he meant that people start obsessing about the international role of the dollar or whatever, and start to think that its the most important thing in the world, when its actually fairly trivial. What he didnt say, but seems obvious these days, is that a similar thing happens to people who spend too much time thinking about money in general  specifically, on trying to decode moneys true meaning and find the real, true measure of the money supply; they end up starting to believe that everything in economics hinges on getting that measure right, when in fact almost nothing does.

title: In the Parching West, Its Beginning to Feel like 1159
description: Doyle Rice has an invaluable piece in USA Today placing Californias persistent and exceptional* drought in the broader context of a very dry West  and the even broader context of the last 1,000 years or so.

title: With Galaxy Note 4 Release, Samsung Still Betting on Big Phones
description: Samsung is doubling down on big phones and clever design, announcing on Wednesday two new versions of its popular Note 4, one of which includes a unique curved design and features two separate touch screens.

title: Lawmakers Love AmeriCorps, but Wont Expand It
description: Like so much gone awry in Washington of late, the failure to expand AmeriCorps, the nations main public service program,is largely the fault of the right-wing Republicans who now control the House and keep approving extreme budget resolutions calling for the programs elimination.

title: Switzerland Investigates Bank With Ties to Esprito Santo Companies
description: Updated, 12:41 p.m. |

title: Echoes of Light
description: Light from exploding stars can live on in the form of echoes, rippling across space and illuminating clouds of dust and gas that might otherwise be invisible.

title: The V838 Monocerotis Star Still Has Astronomers Heads Exploding
description: For astronomers and aficionados of cosmic violence, an obscure star known as V838 Monocerotis has turned out to be a gift that has kept on giving for a long, long time.

title: Making Sure Visitors Know Theyre at Barnard, With a B
description: C is over there, across the street. This is B. B for Barnard.

title: Shanghai Museum Unveils Memorial to Jews Who Found Haven in City
description: Updated, 1:11 a.m. ET| The Shanghai Jewish Refugees Museum unveiled a memorial wall on Wednesday listing the names of 13,732 Jews who found a haven in the Chinese city during World War II.

title: E.U. Urges Sharing Data to Avert Air Disasters
description: BRUSSELS  Responding to the downing of a Malaysian passenger jet over eastern Ukraine in July, Europes top aviation safety agency urged national governments on Wednesday to share intelligence data with the aviation authorities to better enable international regulators and airlines to assess the risks of flying over conflict zones.

title: Theodore Wafer Sentenced to 17 Years in Michigan Shooting of Renisha McBride
description: DETROIT  The defendant stood facing the judge in Wayne County Circuit Court here on Wednesday, speaking tremulously and in a low voice, and apologized to the family of Renisha McBride, the 19-year-old woman he shot and killed on the front porch of his suburban home last year.

title: Chris Evans Will Answer Reader Questions
description: From sci-fi protagonist to comedy player to, yes, the Human Torch and Captain America, the actor Chris Evans has brought an interesting collection of characters to life on the big screen. Now hes going to work behind the camera as well. On Sept. 12, Mr. Evans will premiere his directorial debut, the romance Before We Go, at the Toronto International Film Festival. He and Alice Eve star as two strangers who connect one night at Grand Central Terminal after a missed train.

title: Former Goldman Banker Joins Perella Weinberg
description: Stefan Green, formerly of Goldman Sachs, has joined Perella Weinberg Partners as a partner.

title: Centerview Hires Former Bank Bailout Adviser to Britain
description: LONDON  The boutique investment bank Centerview Partners said on Wednesday that it had hired Robin Budenberg, a former investment banker who helped advise the British government on its bailouts of the Lloyds Banking Group, Royal Bank of Scotland and other banks during the financial crisis.

title: Voting Restrictions Are Key Variable in Midterm Elections
description: WASHINGTON  Voting in midterm elections, which will determine control of Congress, ends this fall. But it starts in North Carolina this week.

title: Senate Control May Turn on Whos More Unloved, Obama or G.O.P.
description: With the campaign season officially begun, Republicans hold a modest but clear advantage in the fight for control of the Senate. Leo, The Upshots Senate model, gives the G.O.P. a 66 percent chance of winning a majority.

title: Chinese Authorities Search for Whereabouts of Toxic Capsules
description: Updated, 10:51 p.m. ET| An investigation is underway to track the whereabouts of 90 million drug capsules contaminated with the heavy metal chromium that were released to the market in China earlier this year, according to officials in the eastern province of Zhejiang.

title: W.H.O. Concerned About Another Ebola Cluster in Nigeria
description: The World Health Organization expressed worry on Wednesday about a second cluster of Ebola virus patients in Nigeria  in the center of its oil industry  because one of the three confirmed victims was a doctor who had treated patients and socialized after he became contagious.

title: 9 Things You Maybe Didnt Know About Mitch McConnell
description: If you read my magazine article about Senator Mitch McConnell and what may be his final campaign this fall, youll learn that he loves Morris Deli (check the photo), owns both a BlackBerry and an iPad and has, by Senator Harry Reids count, orchestrated 442 filibusters since President Obama took office. Here are a few more facts about the senator, his state and his opponent, Alison Lundergan Grimes, that you may not know:

title: Enchanted Words
description: Every avid reader shares the belief that words are powerful. Words can hurt; they can heal, save, inspire, destroy and create. As Kelly Barnhill writes in The Witchs Boy, her latest middle-grade novel, a word, after all, is a kind of magic. Its a story with many alluring elements, including a boy who is rejected by his village after surviving an accident that killed his identical twin; a bandit kings motherless daughter; a wolf; and a little clay pot full of magic. Barnhill (Iron Hearted Violet, The Mostly True Story of Jack) creates an absorbing world of kingdoms and prophecies in which transformation comes through language, and through courage and self-awareness as well.

title: Chappaqua, N.Y.: A Hamlet in a Woodsy Setting
description: When I tell people we live in the woods, I really mean that, said Paul Keyes, describing his life in Chappaqua in northern Westchester. When I pull off the road after the long trip home from work and finally come up our driveway, I feel like Ive gone on vacation to the Adirondacks.

title: Real-World Development
description: The New York Times continued our technology internship program this summer, and Danielle Rothermel, one of the interns in this years class, discusses what she learned.

title: Penguin Random House Plans to Combine 2 Units
description: In the latest reorganization at Penguin Random House since the two publishers merged last year, the company will combine two units in another effort to streamline its operations.

title: Quality of Life Improving Across Wall Street, Report Says
description: Wall Streets efforts to improve working conditions for junior bankers appear to be paying off.

title: The Battle for New York Schools: Eva Moskowitz vs. Mayor Bill de Blasio
description: One afternoon this summer, Eva Moskowitz, who runs Success Academy Charter Schools, showed me her senior yearbook. I was the editor, she said. We sat in a half-furnished office at the construction site of her charter networks first high school. A buzz saw shrieked in the background. She graduated in 1982 from Stuyvesant, the most selective of New York Citys public high schools. I got completely engaged in how to take this sentimental book and make it a much bigger project. She fought to publish photographs capturing the political protests of that time  against nuclear weapons, against American aid to the government in El Salvador. To go with the pictures, she wrote a manifesto, concluding: We do not live in a vacuum.

title: North Carolina Men Are Released After Convictions Are Overturned
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  Henry Lee McCollum had barely slept in days, terrified that his dream of 31 years  being released from North Carolinas death row  might not come true.

title: The Sportier Side of Fall Mens Fashion
description: Theres a relaxed athleticism coursing through mens fashion, taking inspiration from the street and mixing it with the office.

title: Dan OBrien and Suzan-Lori Parks Win Horton Foote Prize
description: The playwrights Dan OBrien and Suzan-Lori Parks are the 2014 recipients of the Horton Foote Prize, given every other year to honor excellence in American theater. The prize committee announced on Wednesday that Mr. OBriens The Body of an American received the award for outstanding new American play, while Father Comes Home From the Wars (Parts 1, 2, & 3) by Ms. Parks was selected for promising new American play.

title: Why Leaked Nude Photos Are Another Frontier for Feminists
description: A trove of nude celebrity photos spread like wildfire across the Internet over Labor Day weekend, Mike Isaac writes for The New York Times. The photos, which included images of the actress Jennifer Lawrenceand the model Kate Upton, became available after someone  and who did it is unknown  posted the pictures to 4chan and Reddit, two hugely popular anonymous online message boards.

title: 2014 Fantasy Football Weekly Player Rankings
description: Jason and Justin Sablich provide weekly player rankings for standard and PPR scoring formats. They will be updated throughout the season.

title: Obama Urges NATO to Help Ukraine
description: President Obama pushed the alliance to send a message of support to Ukraine and to help modernize and strengthen its security forces.

title: House Hunting in ... Germany
description: A THREE-BEDROOM COTTAGE IN THE BAVARIAN ALPS

title: Obama, in Estonia, Calls Ukraine Conflict a Moment of Testing
description: TALLINN, Estonia  President Obama on Wednesday called the conflict in Ukraine a moment of testing for the United States and Europe, and condemned Russias intervention as a brazen assault on the nations territorial integrity that warrants a unified response.

title: Deportations Have No Observable Effect on Crime Rate, Study Concludes
description: Six years after the federal government opened an immigration enforcement program intended to improve public safety, deporting hundreds of thousands of people, many of them convicted criminals, a new study has concluded that the program has had no observable effect on the overall crime rate.

title: Today in Small Business: The Coolest New Businesses in New York
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Prosecutor on Insider Trading Cases Heads to Private Practice
description: The ranks of the federal prosecutors who played a major role in the crackdown on insider trading continues to thin.

title: 36 Hours in Nashville
description: Music City is amped for a comeback, driven by local creativity, entrepreneurship and a D.I.Y. attitude.

title: Lisa DAmours Airline Highway Coming to Broadway
description: Manhattan Theater Club executives announced on Wednesday that they would produce a new play on Broadway by a female writer in the spring of 2015  the first in two years, to the frustration of many artists. The play, Airline Highway, a dark comedy by Lisa DAmour about a gathering of friends in the parking lot of a rundown Louisiana motel, will begin preview performances at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater on April 1, 2015, and open on April 23, in time to qualify for the 2015 Tony Award nominations. It will be the first Broadway production for Ms. DAmour, who won an Obie Award and was a Pulitzer Prize finalist for her play Detroit.

title: 36 Hours in Nashville
description: Country music is alive and well in Nashville; you might even see a young family in broad daylight practicing their line dancing on the sidewalk outside a bar downtown  all in cowboy boots, including the toddler who just learned to walk. But these days, theres much more to the Tennessee capital than country. One of seven cities chosen to begin Google for Entrepreneurs Tech Hub Network, Nashville is bustling with new business.
