description: Even if its 6 p.m. on a Saturday night, some brides and grooms want a wedding reception that pulsates with that wee-hours-of-the-morning nightclub vibe. Because of that, more couples are eschewing the live band to create high-energy dance extravaganzas and hiring nationally known disc jockeys who regularly headline nightclubs from New York to Las Vegas to Los Angeles.

title: For Bob McDonnell, a Miscalculation at the Scene of a Blunder
description: WASHINGTON  On Aug. 15, 2013, Bob McDonnell visited the site of one of Virginias great tactical blunders.

title: When Philanthropy Is Weird
description: Its been a strange week for philanthropy. Just as media outlets began assessingthe effects of celebrities pouring ice on their heads for charity,Redditorsdecided to donate money in response to Jennifer Lawrences nude photos. The practice of linking charitable giving to other activities  some just odd, some ethically questionable  seems to be growing in prominence, with what some say are not entirely positive results.

title: Happy 75th Birthday, Verdura
description: This week, the American fine jeweler Verdura celebrates its 75th anniversary. To mark the occasion, the brand is putting the final touches on The Power of Style: Verdura at 75, an exhibition that opens next month in a new gallery space adjacent to its Fifth Avenue flagship. Over 150 jewels and objets dart by the companys late founder, Duke Fulco di Verdura, will be on view alongside over a selection of designs, paintings and photographs from the companys archives.

title: S.E.C. Names First Ombudsman
description: Investors are a fussy sort, quick to gripe about a shady broker here or a new regulation there. Now someone will actually have the job of listening to them.

title: On the Market in San Francisco
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 1
description: Parties for Altuzarra for Target, Gareth Pugh, Nars and Purple magazine

title: Two Vaccines to Protect Against Ebola Could Be Available Within Weeks
description: Two potential vaccines against the deadly Ebola virus ravaging West Africa could be available as soon as November and would first be given to health care workers most at risk of exposure to the disease there, the World Health Organization announced on Friday.

title: A Picture of Dementia
description: When the documentary filmmaker Banker White began turning his camera on his family in 2009, his mother had undertaken a project of great personal importance: She wanted to compile material for a book about her own mother, a Massachusetts painter named Marian Williams Steele, who died of Alzheimers disease in 2001.

title: The Rise and Fall of the Biggest Pot Dealer in New York City History
description: One day in January 2007, the disgruntled ex-girlfriend of a Queens pot dealer walked unprompted into the district office of the Drug Enforcement Administration on Long Island. Sitting down with an agent, she bitterly gave vent: Her former boyfriend, the father of her child, was selling weed.

title: Obama Hopeful Over Ukraine Cease-Fire
description: The president said he was hopeful but skeptical about a cease-fire agreement that was reached Friday between pro-Russian separatists and Ukraine.

title: Virginians, Surprised by Ex-Governors Conviction, Ponder the Fallout
description: RICHMOND, Va.  A day after Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia was convicted on 11 counts of conspiracy, bribery and extortion, and his wife, Maureen, on nine counts, Virginia was still picking through the wreckage and trying to figure out what comes next.

title: Jason Wu: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Many in West Africa May Be Immune to Ebola Virus
description: Although few medical experts realize it, part of the population in West Africa is immune to the Ebola virus, according to virologists who specialize in the disease.

title: Wheelies: The Volvos Away! Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Couscous Salads, Big Bowls and Casseroles
description: Im continuing this week with my summer pantry clean-out, determined to put some of the partly filled bags of grains Im finding to new uses. One item I found was a half-filled packet of Israeli couscous, which also goes by its North African names of moghrabiyeh and muhammas. Whatever you call it, its a spherical product made, like regular couscous, from durum wheat, more akin to pasta than to grains, but I use it like a grain in salads, big bowls and casseroles.

title: Jet Carrying Contractors Is Ordered to Land in Iran
description: WASHINGTON  A charter airplane carrying American military contractors through Iranian airspace was instructed to land in Iran on Friday, but the United States attributed the episode to an easily corrected bureaucratic issue and not a larger political incident between two countries with a long history of hostility.

title: Our Vacations with Ariana Grande and Kate Bush
description: Ben Ratliff and Jon Caramanica discuss new projects by Ms. Grande and Ms. Bush.

title: Marriott Tries a Healthy Vending Machine
description: At the Marriott Chicago O Hare, the standard junk-food-filled vending machine is getting an upgrade: the 470-room property has introduced a healthy food option in its lobby adjacent to the reception desk.

title: 1936: John F. Kennedy Goes Sailing
description: This feature looks at the first time famous names or terms appeared in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: 2015 Volkswagen Golfs
description: Taking account of its gasoline, diesel and high-performance GTI variants, the latest Golf highlights Volkswagen engineering at its best.

title: Suppose You Threw an Ice Bucket Challenge and Nobody Came?
description: I see that after coming up with the most successful fund-raiser in the history of man, the A.L.S. ice bucket challenge is getting the inevitable pushback: The chief executive of the A.L.S. association makes too much money, its an exercise in narcissism, not enough of the money is going to research.

title: Reports on Maker of Artificial Heart Shake Up Its Stock
description: PARIS  The stocks of biotech and medical device start-up companies are notoriously volatile. And the French company Carmat, which has been trying for years to bring an artificial heart to the market, felt that pull on Friday as investors bid up its stock.

title: Liking Work Really Matters
description: WE have all had to work on tasks we detest: Calculus homework, for example, is boring and hard. As soon as we start, we feel mentally exhausted, and the quality of our work suffers.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Weaker and Weaker Solved!
description: On Thursday, we challenged Well readers to take on the case of a 19-year-old man who suddenly collapsed at work after months of weakness and fatigue dotted with episodes of nausea and vomiting. More than 500 of you wrote in with suggested diagnoses. And more than 60 of you nailed it. The cause of this mans collapse, weakness, nausea and vomiting was

title: Popcast: Our Vacations with Ariana Grande and Kate Bush
description: Popcast returns with a What We Did On Our Summer Vacation edition.

title: Driven | 2014 Volkswagen Tiguan SEL
description: An aging German maintains its moves, but stumbles over the numbers.

title: The World Is Ending, and Readers Couldnt Be Happier
description: Emily St. John Mandel doesnt seem like the paranoid type. Cheerful and preternaturally poised, she spends her free time tending to the flower beds in her rooftop garden in Brooklyn and working on her rudimentary French.

title: A Solid Gold Structure for $26,000
description: For 30 years, when enthusiasts have debated which cars best blend performance, practicality and price, the Volkswagen GTI has loomed large.

title: Big-Ticket Engineering at a Deep Discount
description: Taking account of its gasoline, diesel and high-performance GTI variants, the latest Golf highlights Volkswagen engineering at its best. A Euro-sporty hatchback that the world has long embraced, the Golf helped VW to sell five million cars in the first half of 2014, sneaking past General Motors and barely trailing Toyota as the global sales leader.

title: Chef Nick Anderer on Rome, Pizza and His New Restaurant, Marta
description: After stints at the acclaimed restaurants Babbo and Gramercy Tavern, the New York chef Nick Anderer teamed up with Danny Meyer in 2010 to open the Roman-style trattoria Maialino. Now the pair is back with a new spot, the soon-to-open wood-fired-oven pizzeria Marta, inside the reopened Martha Washington hotel. In the fifth installment of the What Made Me video series by Poppy de Villeneuve, Anderer shares how his moms cooking and spending his junior year of college in Rome shaped his culinary sensibility.

title: Justin Tuck Brings Defensive Flair to MetLife Stadium, as a Raider
description: The former Giant Justin Tuck wants to make the most of what may be a bleak season, starting Sunday against the Jets when he plays at MetLife Stadium for the first time as a member of the Oakland Raiders.

title: As Its I.P.O. Nears, Alibaba Gets Ready for a Splashy Debut
description: Updated, 8:55 p.m. | It began as a small Internet upstart in China, but now the Alibaba Group is preparing for a splashy debutante party that will stretch from New York to Hong Kong and back again.

title: VW Shows Off Its 2015 Lineup
description: MIDDLEBURG, Va.  Volkswagen occupied a corner of Northern Virginias lush horse country with a collection of its newest vehicles recently, affording a group of journalists a closer look at its 2015 model line. With a chance to sample VWs wares came an opportunity to reflect on the automakers struggle to meet its ambitious sales goals in North America.

title: Mooncakes Are a Must as Chinese Festival Nears
description: HONG KONG  At the Lin Heung Tea House here, staff members rushed around with piles of mooncakes in their trademark gold, blue and red tins.

title: Federal Sale of Troubled Mortgages Draws Criticism From Community Groups
description: Community advocacy groups are giving mixed grades to a federal housing agency initiative that has resulted in the sale of nearly 100,000 distressed mortgages to mainly private investors, especially when it comes to keeping borrowers in their homes.

title: In Inventive Cooking, British Show the Way
description: Time was, when you talked about Britains global reach, you were referring to colonies, not cuisine. Though the empire ranged far and wide, you would never know it from the chip butties (a French fry sandwich) and mushy peas on plates back home; we Americans took particular joy in poking fun at that.

title: Her Villages
description: There is a certain warmth in Arlene Gottfrieds photos of East Harlem, the Lower East Side of Manhattan and Williamsburg, Brooklyn. It is not necessarily nostalgia for a bygone era, but a true appreciation for the kind of neighborhood life that gave those places a distinct feel before waves of gentrification pushed up rents and pushed out locals.

title: Video: The Volkswagen Tiguan Has Soul, but It Costs Plenty
description: This week in Automobiles, Lawrence Ulrich looks at the 2015 Volkswagen Golfs with the gasoline TSI and diesel TDI engines. The Golf now rides on VWs new and highly versatile MQB platform, which is expected to be the foundation for 40 different Volkswagen Group products, from Audi to Skoda.

title: A Scare and a Disheartening Victory
description: For Caroline Wozniacki, watching her opponent being carried from the court in a wheelchair was not how she wanted to celebrate reaching the United States Open final. Instead of reveling in her accomplishment, Wozniacki was worrying about Peng Shuai, who had succumbed to heat illness during their semifinal match Friday. At one point, Wozniacki had rushed around the net to comfort Peng before she decided to retire from the match.

title: Movie Review: Last Days in Vietnam
description: The Times critic A. O. Scott reviews Last Days in Vietnam.

title: Cushnie et Ochs: Spring 2015 RTW
description: NEW YORK

title: At Mocha Hookah in Brooklyn Heights, Tasting Mint, Orange and Home
description: New York is famously the melting pot. But in reality, maybe the city is more like a Middle Eastern meze platter: varied tastes and colors neatly and randomly assembled to please a range of tastes. This is the case at Mocha Hookah, a 24-hour hookah bar and cafe on Atlantic Avenue, and probably the only public place to smoke a water pipe in the heart of brownstone Brooklyn. There, on a recent Wednesday night, three friends huddled around an iPhone, drinking milkshakes and blowing sweet smoke from a burbling glass carafe.

title: Movie Review: Kelly & Cal
description: The Times critic Stephen Holden reviews Kelly & Cal.

title: Movie Review: The Congress
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews The Congress.

title: Dollar Generals Next Move After Family Dollars Rejection
description: No deal.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Paintings Stolen from Peruvian Church Are Returned by Federal Investigators
description: Federal officials on Friday announced the return of nine paintings by the 18th century Mexican artist Miguel Cabrera to Peru, six years after they were stolen from a church in Lima, the Peruvian capital.

title: Cant Place That Smell? You Must Be American
description: FLORENCE, Italy  WE think of our senses as hard-wired gateways to the world. Many years ago the social psychologist Daryl J. Bem described the knowledge we gain from our senses as zero-order beliefs, so taken for granted that we do not even notice them as beliefs. The sky is blue. The fan hums. Ice is cold. Thats the nature of reality, and it seems peculiar that different people with their senses intact would experience it subjectively.

title: Gen-Z Driver, Cool for School
description: NEW MILFORD, N.J.  The course of Anthony Di Libertos passion for car culture is neatly summed up in two snapshots.

title: During a Season for New Devices, a Tough Market for Smartphone Makers
description: BERLIN  The holiday shopping season is still months away. But the worlds technology giants are already trying to position their latest smartphones, televisions and other devices for their annual push to consumers around the globe.

title: An 18-Foot Bridge for the Generation Gap
description: Its not the fastest car in the lot, but this Chrysler is just right for a high school senior steeped in the 60s.

title: Russia and Estonia Differ Over Detention
description: MOSCOW  A strange incident near the Russian-Estonian border on Friday ended with an Estonian intelligence officer in Russian custody and the two countries trading sharply contradictory allegations about what happened.

title: Small Plane Leaves Rochester and Crashes Off Jamaica; Two Are Dead
description: A small plane from western New York that briefly flew through Cuban airspace after overshooting its intended destination in Florida crashed off the coast of Jamaica on Friday, federal aviation officials said.

title: Why Scotland Should Stick With Britain
description: EDINBURGH  ON Sept. 18, residents of Scotland will head to voting booths to answer the question, Should Scotland be an independent country?

title: New York Fashion Week: Jason Wu Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: Domingo Extends Contract as General Director of Los Angeles Opera
description: Plcido Domingo has extended his contact as the general director of the Los Angeles Opera through the 2018-19 season, the company announced Friday.

title: Studying Ebola, Then Dying From It
description: IN late May, a woman was admitted to the Kenema Government Hospitals maternity ward in Sierra Leone after a bloody miscarriage. Augustine Goba, director of the hospitals diagnostic laboratory and my longtime collaborator, ran a series of sensitive molecular tests and detected the first case of Ebola infection in the hospital, and one of the first confirmed cases in the country. Dr. Sheik Humarr Khan, Sierra Leones leading virologist, and other medical staff members isolated the patient and wore gloves, gowns and masks while treating her. She survived and made a full recovery, and no one else was infected.

title: Pictures of the Day: Wales and More
description: Photos from Wales, Ukraine, Bosnia and Liberia.

title: What Does the Middle Class Need?
description: When Senator Elizabeth Warren went to college, it cost $50 a semester. That opened about a million doors for a kid like me, she told the audience Thursday night at the City University of New York, where she and New York Times columnist Paul Krugman joined professor of political science Janet Gornick in conversation. I want every kid to have that same kind of fighting chance to build a future.

title: Filling the Empty Nest With Animals
description: Within a week of dropping off our daughter at college, we brought home a puppy. The reason, I persuaded my husband, was to help her younger brother feel less alone  even though we already had two cats.

title: Financial Schemes Against the Elderly Are Increasing
description: WHEN a longtime friend asked for a loan to help get her boyfriend back on his feet, Maria Voltl, 84, decided to help. Ms. Voltl had lent money to her friend before, and it had always been paid back. So without consulting a professional, she handed over $500,000.

title: Choosing Stability Over Spectacle
description: BOWLING GREEN, KY.  What can you do with what may be the best-known sinkhole in history?

title: Fixing a Hole, Despite Popular Demand
description: A sinkhole at the National Corvette Museum that gobbled up eight Corvettes last February will be filled rather than preserved as a draw for tourists.

title: Wallops of Exuberance With Traces of Yearning
description: Its a perennially heartwarming story arc: Sensitive nerdy guy faces trauma, discovers his inner strength and emerges as a hero brimming with compassion. Thats the spirit of Jack Antonoffs songs for Bleachers, which played to a sold-out crowd at Webster Hall on Thursday night. Fans responded to choruses like I cant believe I captured your heart and If youre feeling small, Ill love your shadow with singalongs and joyful squeals.

title: Getting a Real Charge Out of Ghostly Visitations
description: With surprisingly little fanfare, the great question that theologians and philosophers have wrestled with since antiquity has been answered: Our existence definitely, positively does not end with death. The dead hang around the worldly realm so their spirits can be used to power hair dryers and hot tubs.

title: Dont Tell the Parking Attendant: The New Corvette Is a Snitch
description: Soon, every moment of your life may be recorded on video, even when youre behind the wheel. Even when youre driving someone elses car.

title: Melding Two Flickr Accounts Into One
The 2014 Heisman Watch
description: A look at the top players in contention for college footballs highest honor.

title: The Arc of a Transgender Life
description: Plenty of operas are about characters finding themselves and their place in society. Laura Kaminskys As One, a chamber opera commissioned by American Opera Projects, which received its premiere on Thursday at the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Fishman Space, has a novel twist.

title: Rarity Returns: Jazz Club for Duos
description: Johnny ONeal was smartly dressed for formalities on Wednesday night, in a tuxedo vest, for the first official set at Mezzrow, a spruce new addition to the Greenwich Village jazz circuit. But as he did his part to break in the room, he put little stock in ceremony.

title: Salute the Seahawks, With a Hint of Pine Needles
description: The N.F.L. season began Thursday night just the way last season ended: with a decisive victory by the Seattle Seahawks.

title: John Paulson Bids Good Riddance to Summer
description: The hedge fund magnate John A. Paulson seemed to be enjoying himself at the United States Open on Wednesday night, watching Novak Djokovic defeat Andy Murray.

title: Waleska Gorczevski Transforms Backstage at Jason Wu
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Waleska Gorczevski before (left) and after (right) makeup by Diane Kendall and hair by Odile Gilbert.

title: The Cavendish Invitational Opening Team Event
description: The Cavendish Invitational started in New York City in 1975. It moved to Las Vegas in 1997. And since 2012, it has taken place in Monaco. It is the biggest money bridge tournament of the year.

title: Preserving the Lighthouse, Not Just the Light
description: Like many of the people who grew up in Port Ewen, N.Y., about 100 miles north of New York City along the Hudson River, Pat Ralston has a deep affection for the Esopus Meadows lighthouse. Perched on pilings about a half-mile offshore from the neighboring town of Esopus, the squat, white-clapboard house with a red tin roof was a landmark, and its keepers  who often lived there with their families  were local celebrities.

title: Counting on Cannabis to Build Buzz
description: TORONTO  In a daring marketing ploy, the indie film company A24 has struck a deal with a Los Angeles medical-marijuana dispensary to sell two new cannabis strains under brands associated with Kevin Smiths outr horror flick, Tusk. The film, about a guy who is slowly turning into a walrus, is set for a world premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival on Saturday night.

title: The Human Condition in Soviet Ruins
description: Nadav Kanders photos explore long-abandoned Soviet sites that didnt even appear on maps until the fall of communism.

title: Nonoo: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: The Catwalk Leads to the Lounge
description: New York night life is frequently maligned as sluggish and homogenized in comparison with its reckless past, but each September offers an opportunity for redemption. As usual, New York Fashion Weeks homecoming of debutantes and jet-setters coincides with a panoply of new options for depravity, each jostling for the fickle affections of the cool-kid aristocracy.

title: The Question of Coverage for Ride Service Drivers
description: There is a pervasive attitude in a prominent corner of the technology industry that goes something like this: If youre helping people rent (not share, rent) spare bedrooms or rides in their cars, then the usual regulations and niggling insurance issues should not apply. Entrepreneurs start useful services, attract millions of users, cross their fingers and hope nobody dies before the government minders and other scolds catch up.

title: Martynka Wawrzyniak Turns Daily Meals Into Conceptual Art
description: The artist Martynka Wawrzyniak has dedicated herself to exposing and sharing very precise details of my daily private experiences, she says. It is up to the viewer to digest and interpret this collection of evidence and paint their own picture of my personality and lifestyle. Beginning Sunday, her latest personal disclosure will hang from the ceiling of Envoy Enterprises NYC: a 100-foot-long polyester-cotton sculpture made from 365 dinner napkins stained with the imprint of Wawrzyniaks lips during last years dinners. Nearby are 365 6-by-6-inch paper lunch napkins colored with mouth dabs following her morning consumption of vegan green juice. Both series are presented in chronological order  the fabric pieces sewn consecutively and the paper napkins framed in calendar formation. Connecting them thematically and corporally are castings of the interior of Wawrzyniaks mouth and the hollow of her stomach made from sugar, a food that she avoids.

title: What Were Reading
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an email. Sign up

title: Toronto Festival 2014: Happy Bill Murray Day!
description: TORONTO  After days of semi-fervent speculation about whether the man himself would show, Bill Murray made a late-afternoon appearance at the Toronto International Film Festival, which had christened Friday Bill Murray Day.

title: Off the Runway: Day 2
description: Scenes from the second day of New York Fashion Week.

title: The Heirs Not Apparent
description: The story of the street photographer Vivian Maier has always been tangled  she worked much of her life as a nanny, keeping her artistic life a secret, and only after she died in 2009, at the age of 83, nearly penniless and with no family, were her pictures declared to be among the most remarkable of the 20th century. Now a court case in Chicago seeking to name a previously unknown heir is threatening to tie her legacy in knots and could prevent her work from being seen again for years.

title: Photorealisms Lasting Influence
description: Still Life: 1970s Photorealism is on view through Nov. 9 at the Nassau County Museum of Art in Roslyn Harbor. For information: (516) 484-9337 or nassaumuseum.org. The exhibition originally opened at the Yale University Art Gallery in 2013. Following are excerpts from Martha Schwendeners review, published online in The New York Times on Feb. 7.

title: Down Syndrome and Quality of Life
description: To the Editor:

title: Sturdy Silver Sandals at Peter Som
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Phragmites: A Fluffy Path to Global Rule
description: The great reed (Phragmites australis) is a handsome plant, especially at this time of year, when it is plumed with a purple shock of flowers airily waving 15 feet above our heads. But the reeds beauty is little consolation for its rampant invasion of wetlands.

title: Oil Spill Penalty Will Hurt, but Not Cripple, BP
description: HOUSTON  BP fought long and hard to avoid the defeat it suffered in court on Thursday when a federal judge ruled that the oil company was chiefly responsible for the Deepwater Horizon oil rig explosion, opening the door to new civil penalties that could potentially amount to $18 billion.

title: Unconventional Makeup Pointers Backstage at Jason Wu
description: Makeup artists often slick on creams and colors in ways that seem natural to their tribe but are rather unexpected for the rest of us. Consider the British pro Diane Kendal. Backstage at Jason Wu this morning, she traced Lancme Le Crayon Khl in Black Coffee, a dark brown liner, around models eyes, then grabbed some Q-Tips, dipped them in face cream and partially removed the strokes she had just laid down. It was puzzling until Kendal explained what she was doing. The cream takes off some of the liner and leaves a beautiful residue and sheen on the lid, she said. This gives you that soft, dewy effect. Another surprise: dabbing on Lancme Aquatique Waterproof Eyecolour Base in Sienne, a brown primer of sorts, in lieu of eye shadow to define the eyes, without being obvious about it. The final look hinted at the cool, smoldering gaze of Kendals muse-of-the-moment: British actress Charlotte Rampling. Or any woman, for that matter, who is sexy but in a natural, effortless way, Kendal added.

title: A Models Life, Chapter 2
description: Andreja Pejic, who stands 6-foot-1 in stocking feet, and a good deal taller than that in heels, looks every bit the model. She is possessed of bottle-blond hair that falls past her shoulders, full lips, a wasp waist and a pair of Cindy Crawford beauty marks just north of her upper lip. (Even Ms. Crawford has only one.)

title: Players in the Coalition Against ISIS
description: The Obama administration is now leading a coalition of nations to fight the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: New York Fashion Week Social Media Roundup, Day 2
description: On Thursday night, celebrities, media personalities and other fashion fans gathered at spots across Manhattan to celebrate the first day of New York Fashion Week. Morning brought heat, humidity and half-clothed male models strutting down the Parke & Ronen runway, though few complained. Shoes remained a topic of conversation for our writers as the shows went on. At Jason Wu, a 3-D, living, breathing Karlie Kloss made her first appearance at Fashion Week, while at Rebecca Minkoff the entertainment factor was turned up high with unexpected props. Other shows, such as Cushnie et Ochs, Wes Gordon and Adam Selman, kept the day exciting, and tennis was on the minds of some.

title: U.S. Open Mens Semifinals Feature 2 Rejuvenated High Seeds
description: The second Saturday of the United States Open is no longer super, with the womens final moved to Sunday, but an afternoon of the mens semifinals is still worthy of a pretty lofty adjective.

title: Lessons in Brooklyn, Harlem and Whimsy
description: Think of them as back-to-school bookends to the last half-century of desperate and sometimes self-destructive debate over educational policy in New York.

title: From Ashe to Williams, Rackets of U.S. Open Champions
description: The evolution of the tennis racket from wood to graphite has helped transform the sport into a game of power and spin.

title: All Email, All the Time? Get Used to It, or Not
description: To the Editor:

title: Nicole Miller: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Providing More Social Services in the Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: Andrew Kay, Pioneer in Computing, Dies at 95
description: Andrew Kay, the designer of an early portable computer, the Kaypro II, that became a smash hit in the early 1980s before his company fell into bankruptcy in the 90s as the computer industry leapfrogged ahead of him, died on Aug. 28 in Vista, Calif. He was 95.

title: Fixing Penn Station
description: To the Editor:

title: Joan Riverss Funeral Instructions, Scarlett Johanssons New Arrival and Karl Lagerfelds Mini-Me
description: All the weeks fashion news thats fit to reprint.

title: Camping Out With the Office
description: In the hope of finding fellowship with other entrepreneurs, David Heath decided to attend Summer Camp  a three-day networking and music festival in upstate New York hosted by WeWork, a company that rents shared office spaces. It was late August, the beginning of the off-season for summer camps like the one at which the event was held.

title: How to Get Over That Ex
description: The God of Love, Plato wrote in The Symposium, lives in a state of need. Nowhere is this need more palpable and vibrant than in the lover who pines for an ex: to have once reached the mountaintop but now to find oneself deep in the valley is to fully apprehend the limited charms that lie at the intersection of flop sweat and a truculent burro.

title: Christies Trip Looks Like a Campaign for President
description: PUEBLA, Mexico  Perhaps it was the war room set up for Gov. Chris Christies staff in a hotel here, filled at all hours with laptop-wielding aides and a generous supply of beef medallions with green peppers.

title: A Manhattan Post Office Is the Only Address Some People Have
description: The men and women start lining up around 9:45 a.m. along an imposing gray wall of the James A. Farley Post Office, that grand Manhattan landmark with sweeping front steps and soaring columns facing Eighth Avenue.

title: Since Nazi Occupation, a Fist Raised in Resistance
description: ATHENS  AS protests swirled in Athens during the Greek financial crisis, a silver-haired octogenarian could be seen on the front lines, raising a fist at the riot police as they shot tear gas into his face. Other times, even on the same day, the same man might be standing in front of Parliament, insisting that lawmakers repudiate an austerity package demanded by the countrys creditors, which he said would only throw Greece into greater hardship.

title: Homegrown Plays Reach New Jerseys Stages
description: Oh, I am totally taking over New Jersey, said Nikkole Salter, laughing. The Obie Award-winning co-author of the AIDS drama In the Continuum, Ms. Salter will have new plays produced at Luna Stage and Crossroads Theater Company this season.

title: Atlantic Citys Next Gamble
description: ATLANTIC CITY  NUCKY JOHNSONS town can still throw a party. Tens of thousands of fans recently flocked to Atlantic City for two free concerts on the waters edge, first by Blake Shelton and then by Lady Antebellum. With casinos shutting their doors, leaving thousands jobless, these are just the type of fun events that the resort city needs if it is to survive. But some businesses misbehaved. Several casinos charged concertgoers $50 for parking, five to 10 times the usual rate. Some people in this city never miss the opportunity to sacrifice long-term vision for a fast buck.

title: Friday Night Music: Lucius Covers John Lennon
description: I was going to do something clever and all, but my heart wasnt in it after a very tough week. Heres one of my favorite bands doing a lovely cover:

title: Silicon Valley Fights Order to Pay Bigger Settlement in Hiring Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Silicon Valley is holding on tight to its wallet.

title: Passion for the Pill
description: Republican candidates are falling madly in love with contraception.

title: Jobs Stall and So Does the Economy
description: The employment report for August suggests that any remaining hope for an economic upsurge in the second half of 2014 is largely unrealistic. The new data, which shows job creation down sharply last month, is consistent with more of the same sluggish growth that has long been the norm. Plentiful jobs at good pay  the critical underpinning of a strong economy  are still not in the cards.

title: Two Cities With Blazing Internet Speed Search for a Killer App
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  A team of computer programmers here set out to learn how many cute kitten photos can be downloaded in one second on their Internet network, one of the fastest in the country.

title: On Wheels, Too, the Game Shifts Toward Speed
description: Like the tennis being played at Arthur Ashe Stadium, wheelchair tennis has become faster-paced with more of a reliance on power.

title: N. Hoolywood: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: In California Governors Race, the Risks of Running a Low-Risk Campaign
description: SACRAMENTO  When the one-and-only scheduled debate in the California race for governor came to its end Thursday evening, the moderator, remarking on how spirited it had been, suggested that Gov. Jerry Brown, the Democrat, agree to another.

title: T-Mobile Accuses Huawei of Theft From Laboratory
description: T-Mobile has filed a lawsuit against the Chinese smartphone maker Huawei Technologies, accusing the manufacturer of stealing technology, including part of a robots arm, from T-Mobiles Bellevue, Wash., headquarters.

title: Charlie Powell, a Standout Regardless of the Sport, Dies at 82
description: The often-told story about Charlie Powell is that as a 20-year-old defensive end playing his first game for the San Francisco 49ers in 1952, he sacked Bobby Layne, the legendary quarterback for the Detroit Lions, 10 times.

title: Out to the Cemetery, Its Showtime Again!
description: Uncle Fester floats through the air as he sings a love song to the moon. Gomez is torn between a promise to his daughter to keep a secret and his pledge to keep no secrets from his wife, Morticia. Wednesday, their daughter, is in love. Pugsley, her younger brother, just likes to wallow in torture.

title: New York Will Require More Builders to Add Affordable Units
description: The next time a New York City developer seeks permission to replace a derelict factory with a shimmering condo tower, the heated swimming pool and sky-lit roof lounge will have to be accompanied by another amenity: affordable housing.

title: Indian Leaders Talk to Schoolchildren Draws Fire
description: NEW DELHI  Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday appeared before millions of Indias schoolchildren, answering respectful questions with an avuncular twinkle for an hour and a half, and telling stories about his own school days.

title: Fox Sports Develops Champions League Highlights Channel
description: When DirecTV introduced its Red Zone Channel in 2005, N.F.L. fans discovered a new way to watch Sunday afternoon games. Instead of sticking with one game from start to finish, or toggling between two network games, the Red Zone took viewers on a frenetic, stadium-hopping tour to show teams advancing closer to end zones.

title: The Secure Communities Illusion
description: Who could fault a program with a name like Secure Communities? This is the federal initiative, begun under President George W. Bush and vastly expanded by President Obama, to make sure that everyone arrested by local police anywhere in the country has his or her immigration status checked.

title: Focused Ferocity by Serena Williams on a Stage She Owns at the U.S. Open
description: If there is one tennis showplace that has been Serena Williamss proving ground, it is Arthur Ashe Stadium.

title: The Price of Glory
description: Are Football Coaches Overpaid? asks a new paper by two Vanderbilt University professors, Randall S. Thomas of the law school, and R. Lawrence Van Horn of the school of management. Its amazing the things academics can find worthy of study, isnt it?

title: A Cease-Fire in Ukraine
description: With pressures building on all sides, the adversaries in the war in Ukraine announced a cease-fire on Friday. Combat in the contested southeastern region that killed some 2,600 people in the past five months paused, perhaps for a while.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 5, 2014
Cuomo Assuming Campaign Mode Just Days Before Votes Are Cast
description: Heading into the final weekend before the primary, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is starting to look like a candidate.

title: Iran Fails to Address All Nuclear Concerns, U.N. Says
description: Prospects for an international agreement over Irans disputed nuclear program appeared to suffer a setback Friday when a United Nations monitoring agency said the Iranians had yet to meet two of five confidence-building measures to ensure that their activities are purely peaceful.

title: Getting the Catch Directly to the Restaurant
description: When Dock to Dish became an instant success in Montauk last summer, it made sense. The community-supported fishery dovetailed with a growing sustainable fishing movement and a community-supported agriculture initiative already embraced by many locals. People could now pick up their black sea bass alongside their baskets of pea shoots and snapdragons  all they had to do was pay upfront and take what the ocean provided.

title: Offering Designers a Blank Canvas
description: In recent years, if you have attended runway shows for Ralph Lauren, Prabal Gurung or Edun, or been to parties for the Whitney Museum of American Art or Google product debuts, youve been to an event held with the Skylight Group.

title: Hope for Japan, Decades After a Disturbing Loss
description: On Saturday afternoon at the United States Open, Kei Nishikori will become the first Japanese man to compete in a Grand Slam singles semifinal in 81 years.

title: Bruce Morton, Veteran CBS News Reporter, Dies at 83
description: Bruce Morton, an award-winning reporter during what CBS News veterans considered the organizations glory days, from the 1960s through the 1980s, died on Friday at his home in Washington. He was 83.

title: Another Life in the Many Lives of Zaldy
description: Hanging upside down on a support pillar in Zaldys spacious atelier is what looks like a body wrapped in garbage bags ready to be disposed of in the New Jersey marshlands.

title: A Conductor Promotes Risk-Taking in Music Programs
description: Coolly chatting last month amid the commotion at Yales soon-to-be-renovated Hendrie Hall, Toshiyuki Shimada hardly seemed the type to make waves. But that is what Mr. Shimada, the music director and conductor of both the Eastern Connecticut Symphony Orchestra and the Yale Symphony Orchestra, has done.

title: A Noise Only He Can Hear Doesnt Keep Garca From a Round for All to See
description: CHERRY HILLS VILLAGE, Colo.  Sergio Garca became aware of a beeping sound in his left ear on the sixth green of his round on Friday at Cherry Hills Country Club. He kept yawning and stretching his jaw to try to make his ear pop, to no avail.

title: A Mixed Bag of Looks: Coach, Peter Som, Jason Wu and Creatures of the Wind
description: Coach has left the stable, and the horses are running wild down the road.

title: Marjorie Strider Dies at 83; Pop Artist Satirized Mens Magazines
description: Marjorie Strider, a Pop artist who slyly subverted her male counterparts takes on consumerism and the female form, creating images of packages that oozed their contents and women whose curves jutted from the picture plane, died on Aug. 27 at her home in Saugerties, N.Y. She was 83.

title: Fresh-Hued Cuisine in a Rustic Home
description: Sitting on the veranda at One Twenty One on an August night, with cicadas whirring like windup toys, we sipped wine, ate homemade pickles and watched the traffic go by. The driver of an equestrian tractor-trailer, its sides emblazoned with the word HORSES, applied his spluttering Jake brakes and tooted his horn. The young man at the wheel of a hot little Mitsubishi revved his engine and laid rubber in a show of machismo. A pickup truck towing a speedboat, its bed crowded with inner tubes and waving revelers, slowed to the pace of a float in a small-town parade.

title: Monique Lhuillier: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Things That Didnt Happen in Miss Julie
description: A staple of the theater is deconstructed, reconstructed, teased or rewritten through the sensibilities of four different writers in Bastards of Strindberg, a collection of short plays inspired by Miss Julie, being presented at the Lion Theater by the Scandinavian American Theater Company. August Strindbergs heated drama about the combustion that occurs when a footman and a counts daughter spend a tempestuous night together has remained surprisingly present on both stage and screen. A new film version with Jessica Chastain and Colin Farrell is due soon, and a South African production was acclaimed when it played at St. Anns Warehouse in 2012. Now the play has been put under a refracting lens by two Swedish writers, Lina Ekdahl and Andreas Boonstra, and two Americans, David Bar Katz and Dominique Morisseau.

title: Most Seeming-Virtuous Queen
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  This puzzle by James Mulhern made me feel like a child again.

title: Dressed for the New Idea of Success: Carlos Campos, David Hart, Lucio Castro
description: The thorny challenge faced by mens wear designers is how to make an impact within a narrow design compass without resorting to outright gimmickry.

title: At Cemetery, a Worker Falls Down on the Job
description: They say grave diggers are the last ones to let you down.

title: Saturdays College Football Games to Watch
description: 7 MICHIGAN STATE at 3 OREGON

title: In Connecticut Ex-Governors Trial, a Window Onto Political Strategizing
description: NEW HAVEN  When Lisa Wilson-Foley, a Republican political hopeful in Connecticut, entered the 2012 congressional race, she and her husband, Brian Foley, had lots of money but not necessarily the political seasoning of some of her rivals.

title: Rare Outbreak of Dengue Fever in Japan
description: Japans health minister on Friday urged the public not to panic after a popular park in central Tokyo was closed because of a rare outbreak of dengue fever. The Ministry of Health said that 70 people had been found infected with the dengue virus in the past week, in what it called the first outbreak in Japan since 1945. Dengue, which causes fevers and in rare cases death, is common in tropical climates, but not in temperate Japan. Officials said global warming might be playing a role in the spread of dengue to places like Tokyo. This year, Japan had an unusually hot and humid summer. The ministry said most of the people found infected had spent time in or near Yoyogi Park, where they were most likely bitten by mosquitoes that carried the disease. On Friday, health workers sprayed pesticides in the park to kill the insects. No one has died in the outbreak.

title: A 65-Ton Dinosaur as a Distraction From NATO, Ukraine and ISIS
description: The important news was the convergence of a NATO summit meeting, the beginnings of a cease-fire in Ukraine and the commitment to destroy ISIS. Those events will shape the world. The news that wont change anything is the discovery of a humongous dinosaur, and yet that may have been the most compelling story.

title: Toronto Mayor Called to Testify in Canada
description: Rob Ford, the mayor of Toronto, told reporters on Friday that he had been subpoenaed to testify at a court hearing related to efforts by his unofficial driver to recover a video showing the mayor smoking crack cocaine. The driver, Alexander Lisi, was charged with extortion in connection with his efforts to recover the video, apparently made by drug dealers. Mr. Ford, who declined to comment further, will be required to appear next spring at a hearing to determine if there is enough evidence to send Mr. Lisis case to trial. Mr. Ford has confessed to smoking crack and excessive drinking.

title: Washington Stopped Here; So Did Brando
description: Outside New York City, good bar food can be dismayingly hard to find. Manhattan and Brooklyn proprietors have been nudging their bar menus into artisanal territory for a while; in the suburbs, though, many offerings seem stuck in a pre-Food Network wasteland of greasy wings and defrosted mozzarella sticks.

title: In Remote Detention Center, a Battle on Fast Deportations
description: ARTESIA, N.M.  Sitting before a small video screen in a bare room in a remote corner of New Mexico, a young Honduran woman told her story this week to an immigration judge in Virginia. She had been serially raped, she said, spat upon and relentlessly hounded by a drug-dealing husband who regarded her as his property.

title: Hague Prosecutors Ask to Delay Opening of Kenyan Presidents Trial
description: Prosecutors at the International Criminal Court in The Hague on Friday asked for another delay in starting the trial of President Uhuru Kenyatta of Kenya, saying that they could not proceed because the government had so far refused to hand over most of the information they had requested, including some of Mr. Kenyattas phone and financial records. Mr. Kenyatta, who took office in 2013, is accused of stoking violence after the 2007 election that left more than 1,000 people dead. His trial was to have started in February but it was postponed until Oct. 7 after prosecutors said key witnesses had been intimidated and access to others had been blocked. The three judges assigned to the case must decide whether to delay the trial again or end the proceedings for lack of evidence.

title: Indecision, Rewarded
description: Pan-fried shrimp dumplings arrived at the table before Id even taken my seat at Canton Palace. Eat now, they signaled, like a flashing sign.

title: Suno: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: In Win, Royals Show the Confidence of a Division Leader
description: Kansas City Manager Ned Yost was sitting in the Yankee Stadium visitors dugout Friday afternoon and discussing playoff scenarios when he made a passing comment that sounded more like a message for the rest of the American League.

title: Missed Signs in a Bloodied Girls Abuse Case
description: Even before Maya Ranot ended up badly cut in a pool of blood in her kitchen, something was obviously wrong. Her weight had dropped to 58 pounds, extremely low for a 12-year-old. She had bruises and cuts. She told classmates she was being abused. Then she landed in the emergency room, her face swollen; dirty and emaciated.

title: Candidate Not on Providence Primary Ballot Stirs Mayoral Field
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  It seemed outlandish, unbelievable at first. Vincent A. Cianci Jr., the infamous former mayor of Providence whose two administrations were both cut short by felony convictions, announced earlier this summer that he wanted his old job back. With every ounce of the bombast and zeal that has, over the past several decades, made him this citys premier practitioner of chutzpah, the man who served more than four years in federal prison is running for another four years as mayor.

title: Blinded by the Neighbors Light
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: The Knick Recap: Sins of the Flesh, With a Kick
description: Season 1, Episode 4, Wheres the Dignity?

title: 2 Lawyers Are Seeking Senate Seat in Brooklyn
description: Rubain Dorancy and Jesse Hamilton, Democratic candidates for an open State Senate seat in Brooklyn, have plenty in common. They are both lawyers who are married with children, have served on the school board and call Crown Heights home.

title: New York City Reports 3 New Cases of Meningitis
description: Three new cases of meningitis among gay and bisexual men have been confirmed in New York in the last two weeks, health officials said on Friday, in an apparent revival of an outbreak that killed seven men in the city from 2010 to 2013.

title: Bill Cunningham | Blithe Spirits
description: In an echo of Audrey Hepburns chic princess in Roman Holiday, hemlines dropped a bit.

title: Bill Cunningham | Blithe Spirits
description: Blithe Spirits In an echo of Roman Holiday, starring Audrey Hepburn, a woman rode a scooter on Fifth Avenue. Skirts like hers, pencil slim, or full, with hemlines from the top to the middle of the calf, appeared in New York the day after Labor Day, particularly at a fashion lunch at Lincoln Center. Many have not given up on Coco Chanels dictate to cover the knee, but young women have not forsaken thigh-high hemlines.

title: Evening Hours | Sunrise, Sunset
description: It was the close of summer in the country, and a new beginning in the city.

title: Unarmed Man Shot by Police Is Arrested on Various Charges
description: An unarmed man who was shot in the chest by a New York City police officer on Thursday during a confrontation in a Harlem park has been arrested on various charges, the police said Friday.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, September, 6, 2014
description: If I go back to Honduras, it is certain death.

title: Motorolas Moto 360: An Elegant Smartwatch Worthy of Attention
description: Motorolas Moto 360 smartwatch wowed when it was announced last March, and it has been talked about ever since as the smartwatch you might actually want. The main reason? It looks good. Really good, in fact.

title: New Testimony in 95 Murder Case Points the Finger at Another Man
description: One afternoon in August 1995, two men wielding pistols robbed a gambling den in the back room of a Bronx bodega. When a retired police officer inside the bodega grappled with one of the robbers, the other one shot him and both gunmen fled.

title: North Korea Reported to Test Short-Range Missiles
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea launched three short-range projectiles off its east coast on Saturdayin an apparent test of its newly developed tactical missile, South Korean military officials said.

title: As Iraqi Christians in U.S. Watch ISIS Advance, They See Slow-Motion Genocide
description: SOUTHFIELD, Mich.  Early on Wednesday morning, the sonorous sound of Aramaic rose from the pews of Mother of God Chaldean Catholic Church here. More than a hundred worshipers had gathered well before the 10 a.m. Mass, and they were already chanting morning prayers in the language of their Lord.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) 12 YEARS A SLAVE (2013) In this Oscar winner for best picture, written by John Ridley and directed by Steve McQueen, Chiwetel Ejiofor, above, portrays Solomon Northup, a free African-American man who, in 1841, was kidnapped in Washington and sold into slavery. Paul Giamatti plays the brutish Louisiana trader who sells Solomon to William Ford (Benedict Cumberbatch), a seemingly decent plantation owner, who in turn sells him to Edwin Epps (Michael Fassbender) a drunken madman, who epitomizes the villainy of slave ownership. Lupita Nyongo won a best supporting actress Oscar for her turn as Patsey, Epps favorite, whom he brutalizes. Mr. McQueens sympathies are as unqualified as his control, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. There is much to admire about 12 Years a Slave, including the cleareyed, unsentimental quality of its images  this is a place where trees hang with beautiful moss and black bodies  and how Mr. Ejiofors restrained, open, translucent performance works as a ballast, something to cling onto, especially during the frenzies of violence. And while these scenes are hard to watch, the genius of 12 Years a Slave is its insistence on banal evil, and on terror, that seeped into souls, bound bodies and reaped an enduring, terrible price.

title: Corrections: September 6, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: New York Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 3
description: Weekend? Whats a weekend?

title: The Motherhood Penalty vs. the Fatherhood Bonus
description: One of the worst career moves a woman can make is to have children. Mothers are less likely to be hired for jobs, to be perceived as competent at work or to be paid as much as their male colleagues with the same qualifications.

title: How Big Companies and Their Tech Suppliers Are Changing Together
description: Mobile devices and cloud computing are changing the work and the structure of corporations. That, in turn, is changing how tech companies behave.

title: Afghans Say Taliban Are Nearing Control of Key District
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Local Afghan officials say more than 200 police officers and soldiers have been killed during a fierce Taliban offensive in Helmand Province in southern Afghanistan that has lasted all summer and now threatens to overwhelm a key district.

title: Toronto Festival 2014: Stacked-Up Premieres Leave Bill Murray Fans in the Rain
description: TORONTOThunder. Lightning. Ferocious gusts of wind slamming all that gorgeous festival signage to the ground.

title: An Even Playing Field for the Womens World Cup
description: WASHINGTON  The clock is ticking as the 2015 Womens World Cup in Canada approaches next summer.

title: A Corporate Tax Alternative
description: To the Editor:

title: Judging the Arbitrators
description: To the Editor:

title: Sending Data Back to the Kitchen
description: To the Editor:

title: Jane Park of Julep: To Succeed, Fly Like a Bumblebee
description: This interview with Jane Park, chief executive of Julep, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: An Early Spark of Interest
description: Michael Mohler, 42, is a fire captain for the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection in Riverside County.

title: OkCupids Unblushing Analyst of Attraction
description: Christian Rudder is mild-mannered in person. But in his official capacity as the president of OkCupid, an irreverent online-dating site, he likes to provoke.

title: The Creativity Behind the Cookware
description: Robb Ginter is vice president for creative services at Sur La Table, a cookware company based in Seattle.

title: Obama Delays Immigration Action, Yielding to Democratic Concerns
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will delay taking executive action on immigration until after the midterm elections, bowing to pressure from fellow Democrats who feared that acting now could doom his partys chances this fall, White House officials said on Saturday.

title: At Goldman Sachs, Even the Legal Fees Are Different
description: Goldman Sachs has the reputation of being a breed apart on Wall Street. Its employees are smarter, hungrier and quicker to the draw than those at rival firms. Thanks to these differences, Goldman sits at the apex of the nations investment banking hierarchy.

title: New York Fashion Week: Suno Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: 100 Die in 5 Days of Flooding in Northern India
description: NEW DELHI  Officials in the northern Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir said Saturday that more than 100 people had died in five days of flooding, with rivers swollen far above their normal level and flowing at unusual speed.

title: Broaden Your Spatial Horizons
description: With a growing interest among travelers to better understand the galaxy, a number of hotels and resorts are creating ways for guests to appreciate the expanding universe.

title: Greek Leader Promises Cuts in Oil and Income Taxes
description: ATHENS  Prime Minister Antonis Samaras announced tax reductions on Saturday in a bid to appeal to Greeks weary of four years of austerity that have cut living standards and to gain political capital as the opposition pushes for early general elections.

title: Breaking Loose From Big Festivals
description: Festivals, with their multiple stages and thousands upon thousands of attendees, are meant to serve as escapes. But what about when you need to escape from festivals? This weekend, just north of New York City, two separate events attempt to reclaim the idea of festivals for people seeking something more intimate.

title: Glass and Reich Share a Stage
description: Artists frequently dislike the labels assigned to their work: Philip Glass prefers music with repetitive structures to minimalism, for example. But the minimalist label has stuck. As part of the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Next Wave Festival, Mr. Glass will be joined by Steve Reich, another pioneer of the genre, for three programs that illustrate their aesthetic with some of their best-known works. The two ensembles they founded will perform, and for the first time in more than three decades, the two composers will collaborate onstage during several selections.

title: Nucky Thompson, Back in the Day
description: Be honest and true, boys/Whatever you do, boys/Let this be your motto through life, a woman recites as a battalion of lads flit like fish through a watery underworld, grasping at gold coins raining down. Cut to the pier above, where the wealthy are toasting their sun-kissed summer by tossing away their money in Atlantic City, circa 1884. Thus begins the origin story of Nucky Thompson, a very good boy (played by Nolan Lyons) until Commodore Louis Kaestner, the power broker who becomes his mentor, gets hold of him in HBOs Boardwalk Empire. Nearly 50 years later, the adult Nucky (Steve Buscemi) is fighting to go legit by courting the Bacardi Rum family in Cuba in the seriess fifth and final season, debuting Sunday. But as he gazes down at boys diving into the Havana harbor, his mind returns to his stormy New Jersey childhood, now a world apart in every conceivable sense.

title: Olden Goldies and Wild Cards
description: Its time to fall into dance: City Centers 2014 Fall for Dance Festival unveils an early kickoff with two free evenings at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park. Presented in association with the Public Theater, the program covers a wealth of dance styles and just as many moods. The Bill T. Jones/Arnie Zane Company reprises Mr. Joness D-Man in the Waters (Part 1), created in 1989 in the thick of the AIDS crisis  its a piece about loss, resiliency and hope  while New York City Ballet offers William Forsythes Herman Schmerman (Pas de Deux), a sinuous duet set to an electronic score by Thom Willems. Hubbard Street Dance Chicago explores the heat of North Africa and Spain in Gnawa, Nacho Duatos lively 2005 group work.

title: Rossellinis Eternal City
description: Many elements set the stage for Roberto Rossellinis 1945 neorealistmasterpiece, Rome Open City, his portrait of the Italian resistance under the Nazis, coming to Film Forum on Friday for two weeks in a new restoration. A city pockmarked by bombs and wartime poverty offered a gritty backdrop; Rossellini assembled a formidable crew, including Federico Fellini as a screenwriter and the actors Aldo Fabrizi and Anna Magnani (both better known for comic roles at the time); and he was ready to doff studio confinements and shoot on streets and rooftops to capture a documentarylike veracity.

title: Calligraphy as Visual Poetry
description: Calligraphy has always been the premier classical art of the Islamic world, and it comes in many forms, some practical and workaday, others subtly expressive, reserved for religious texts and poetry. When produced by highly skilled hands, the style called nastaliq, developed in Persia from the 14th to 16th centuries, is considered so beautiful as to be an aesthetic end in itself: Use it to copy a page from the phone book, and youd still have visual poetry.

title: Variety: A Very Berry Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I was planning to write this entire column substituting the b sound for the m sound, like in todays quotation about holding ones nose, but decided against it. Its too buch, sorry, too much to ask of even the most stalwart copy editor.

title: Josephine van Delden Transforms Backstage at Suno
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Waleska Gorczevski before (left) and after (right) makeup by Alice Lane and hair by Odile Gilbert.

title: 1914: Despite War, New York Herald to Stay in Paris
description: PARIS  Beginning with this issue, the price of the HERALD will be 25 centimes daily, instead of 15 centimes. The reasons for the increase are obvious. Owing to the war, advertisements, the main source of revenue for a newspaper, have almost completely disappeared. The HERALD at present is, therefore, being run at a loss of close upon 35,000 francs a week. That may be journalism, but it is not business. Consequently, the HERALD has to choose between suspending publication or raising its price.

title: As Crises Pile Up, a President Sticks to His Deliberative Approach
description: WASHINGTON  On his way to Europe last week for a crucial NATO summit meeting, President Obama passed a mostly sleepless night.

title: Jack & Company
description: Alibabas Jack Ma, along with a group of top Chinese entrepreneurs, are part of complicated web of deals and ventures, made for both personal benefit and corporate gain.

title: The Jack Ma Way
description: At the resplendent China World Hotel in Beijing, scores of cameras snapped as colorful confetti floated down from the ceiling. It was Aug. 11, 2005, and this was the global coming-out party for Alibaba, the Chinese e-commerce upstart. After months of frantic negotiations, the American Internet giant Yahoo had agreed to invest $1 billion in cash and create deeper business ties, in exchange for a 40 percent stake in Alibaba.

title: Own a Piece of a PGA Tour Pro? A Start-Up Embraces That Idea
description: CHERRY HILLS VILLAGE, Colo.  Imagine if the opening bell rang next month on the new wraparound golf season and you owned stock in the next Jimmy Walker, whose fever chart in 2013-14 exhibited the same arc as a majestic drive. He won his first three PGA Tour events and is a lock for the season-ending Tour Championship.

title: Cease-Fire in Ukraine Holds, but Soldiers and Residents Doubt It Will Last
description: LEBEDINSKOYE, Ukraine  The cease-fire between the Ukrainian government and Russian-backed separatists appeared in danger Saturday after just a day as several artillery barrages resumed around the city of Mariupol.

title: Just 13, and Working Risky 12-Hour Shifts in the Tobacco Fields
description: PINK HILL, N.C.  On many mornings, as tobacco plants tower around her, Saray Cambray Alvarez pulls a black plastic garbage bag over her 13-year-old body to protect her skin from leaves dripping with nicotine-tinged dew.

title: In the Studio | Diane von Furstenberg
description: Diane von Furstenberg chats with Vanessa Friedman about how her fashionably eclectic office in the Meatpacking District doubles as a living space and a reflection of the DVF brand.

title: Diane von Furstenberg: A Life in Five Floors
description: In the second in a video series about designers in their offices and studios, Diane von Furstenberg, a standard-bearer of New York Fashion Week and the longtime president of the Council of Fashion Designers of America, talks about creating her work/life space, what each object represents and the importance of color. (The conversation has been edited and condensed).

title: Syrian Bombs Hit ISIS-Held Territory
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Raids by Syrian warplanes killed at least 25 people, most of them civilians crowding into a bakery, in the northeastern province of Raqqa on Saturday as government forces continued air attacks on territory controlled by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the extremist Sunni militant group.

title: Castoffs New Swing Leads to a Pennant Race
description: No team in baseball claimed J. D. Martinez on waivers last November. No team chose him in the Rule 5 draft in December. In March, he was released by the Houston Astros, who were coming off a season of 111 losses.

title: Sierra Leone to Impose 3-Day Ebola Quarantine
description: DAKAR, Senegal  With West African governments increasingly desperate to contain an ever-quickening Ebola epidemic, Sierra Leone has decreed a stringent new measure confining residents to their homes later this month.

title: Serena Williams and Caroline Wozniacki: Friends, Confidantes and Opponents in U.S. Open Final
description: Serena Williams knows the drill. On Sunday, when she looks across the net during the United States Open womens singles final, she will see a player she knows all too well and a person she absolutely adores. And this time it will not be her sister Venus.

title: Malaysia Plans to Search Crash Site of Flight 17
description: BANGKOK  Prime Minister Najib Razak of Malaysia said on Saturday that his government was seeking further evidence to build a criminal case in the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, which exploded over eastern Ukraine in July.

title: Lacoste: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: New York Fashion Week: Lacoste Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Prabal Gurung: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Giants Show Little Promise at Tight End
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  After the Giants declined to sign a notable free-agent tight end, then made it clear they were not going to draft one, either, General Manager Jerry Reese was asked at a news conference in May if he was comfortable with that decision.

title: Limbo and Cruelty at Guantnamo
description: In the hideous beheadings of two American journalists, the Islamist killers dressed their victims in bright orange prison garb. This was widely taken as an allusion to the prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba  the nightmarish American outpost where detainees have been held for 12 years and counting.

title: From Bad to Worse With Ebola
description: The widening epidemic of Ebola in West Africa looks worse with each passing day. The outbreaks in the hardest-hit countries  Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone  have outstripped the ability of humanitarian groups and fragile government health systems to treat the sick and slow the spread.

title: Meant as Portraits, Seen as Hagiography
description: THE two articles appeared side by side on the front page: one a look at Darren Wilson, the white police officer who fatally shot a black teenager last month in Ferguson, Mo., the other  a portrait of the young man who was killed, Michael Brown.

title: Rape and Rotherham
description: THERE are enough grim tidings from around the world that the news from Rotherham, a faded English industrial town where about 1,400 girls, mostly white and working class, were raped by gangs of Pakistani men while the local authorities basically shrugged and did nothing, is already slipping out of American headlines.

title: Demanding More From College
description: IM beginning to think that college exists mainly so we can debate and deconstruct it.

title: Is It WWIII or Just Twitter?
description: WASHINGTON  SHOCKINGLY, in the end, I didnt miss Brody.

title: Why Dont More Men Go Into Teaching?
description: AS Tommie Leaders, 22, approached college graduation last spring, his professors told him he would have no trouble getting hired. Youre a guy teaching elementary,  they said.

title: Leading From Within
description: I DONT know what action will be sufficient to roll back both the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, or ISIS, and Russias president, Vladimir Putin, but I do know whats necessary. And its not leading from behind, which didnt really work for President Obama in Libya, and it isnt simply leading a lonely and unpopular charge from in front, which certainly didnt work for President Bush in Iraq. Its actually reviving Americas greatest strategy: leading from within.

title: When Whites Just Dont Get It, Part 2
description: IN my column a week ago, When Whites Just Dont Get It, I took aim at what I called smug white delusion about race relations in America, and readers promptly fired back at what they perceived as a smugly deluded columnist.

title: A Talk Before Dying
description: Readers discuss coverage for doctor-patient conversations about end-of-life care.

title: Corinna Gardner
description: Corinna Gardner is a curator of contemporary product design at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London.

title: When Its the Doctor Who Cant Let Go
description: Sometimes its the doctors, not the families, who cant let a patient go.

title: Justice in St. Louis County
description: The Justice Department took a much-needed step last week when it opened a broad civil rights investigation into police practices in Ferguson, Mo., where the killing of Michael Brown, an unarmed black teenager, by a white police officer last month sparked days of demonstrations and riots.

title: Challenging the President ... but Only on the Golf Course
description: WASHINGTON  At age 4, Marvin Nicholson hit his first golf ball on the nine-hole course his father had mowed into the front of the familys farm in Ontario. By 7, he had won a Canada Dry Ginger Ale trophy for sinking a hole in one at the local public course. He caddied through college, carried Senator John Kerrys clubs in Nantucket and then lugged so many of Mr. Kerrys bags during the 2004 presidential campaign that he distributed business cards stamped with Chief of Stuff.

title: From a Texas Company to a Political Maelstrom in the Syrian Civil War
description: MURPHY, Tex.  Syrian politics were far from Suzanne Hittos mind when her husband called last year to tell her to hire a lawyer. She had not seen him in months, and he had already surprised her by quitting his job. Her first thought, sitting alone in her home in the Dallas suburb of Murphy, Tex., was that he wanted a divorce.

title: New York Fashion Week: Prabal Gurung Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Billy Reid: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 2
description: Celebrating The Daily Front Rows Fashion Media Awards and Harpers Bazaars Icons issue.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Sept. 7
description: Nine other countries joined the United States in an escalated response to the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria on Friday, with plans to use more airstrikes, to strengthen moderate Syrian rebel groups and to recruit support from friendly governments in the region. Earlier this week, Islamic militants executed a second American journalist, Steven J. Sotloff, and President Obama vowed to punish ISIS.

title: A First for a Player, Whos One Win Away
description: As Kei Nishikori has kept fighting through imposing obstacles at this United States Open, a tournament at which he was not even sure to play, his coach Michael Chang has kept reminding him, Youre not done yet.

title: How Divorced Parents Lost Their Rights
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  MY wife and I disagree, sometimes vehemently, about how best to raise our four children. Shes a lawyer, and I am sure the thought of suing me has crossed her mind once or twice. But she cannot. American courts consistently refuse to entertain child-rearing disputes between married parents.

title: Money and Influence in the Think Tank World
description: Foreign governments are a major source of money for think tanks in Washington, making donations, in many cases, with a goal of trying to influence United States foreign policy. The think tanks offer the donor governments special access to United States government officials, at times in exchange for the financial support. Here is a look at these ties.

title: Center for Global Development and Norway
description: Norway entered into an agreement with the Center for Global Development, a Washington-based think tank that focuses on how policies and actions of the rich and powerful affect poor people in the developing world. The center was to work with Climate Advisers, a consulting firm, to persuade policy makers in the United States and other countries to increase funding for forest-protection programs, a top foreign policy priority of Norway. Such programs are known by the acronym REDD, for reducing emissions from deforestation and forest degradation.

title: Atlantic Council and Norway
description: The Atlantic Council, which has experienced explosive growth in recent years, has negotiated a number of important, and lucrative, deals with the government of Norway. Here is a look at the ties between the two.

title: Azerbaijan and Think Tanks
description: The government of Azerbaijan hired a Washington-based public relations and lobbying firm in 2012 with the explicit purpose of expanding its relationships with think tanks here to try to reinforce public opinion in the United States and to make it clear that this Central Asian nation is an important security partner. It is a campaign that produced real results.

title: Longstanding Partners: Norway and Brookings
description: The government of Norway has had a longstanding partnership through which Norway funds a broad array of research at the Brookings Institution, on topics as varied as Irans role in conflicts in Afghanistan and combating climate change.

title: The High North, Climate Change and Norway
description: Norway signed agreements with both the Center for Strategic and International Studies and Brookings asking the think tanks to conduct research focusing on issues related to the Arctic Circle and climate change. Norway has long been a global leader in pushing for action to combat climate change. Its state-owned oil company, Statoil, is also preparing to begin oil exploration work in the area, where large-scale melting in recent years has been attributed to climate change and global warming.

title: Peace in Kurdistan
description: Norway made another contribution to the Atlantic Council  about $115,000 in 2007  -to fund a program that would prepare advice for United States officials and other global leaders on how to create more peaceful relations between Turkey and the Kurds, who for much of the last decade have controlled the northern part of Iraq.

title: U.A.E. and C.S.I.S.: A Mutually Beneficial Relationship
description: The United Arab Emirates has a longstanding relationship with the Center for Strategic and International Studies through which it sponsors a series of talks at the center about issues related to the Persian Gulf, papers about the region and trips that C.S.I.S. organizes that involve American security experts, to learn more about the region.

title: CSIS in Japan: Decades of Collaboration
description: Japan is a longtime donor to the Center for Strategic and International Studies, which has a program devoted to defining a strategic agenda for United States-Japan relations. The research group has organized events in cooperation with Japan government interests, bringing together members of Congress, as well as trade officials from the United States and Japan, to discuss issues important to both countries.

title: Ralph Rucci: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Why Democrats Cant Win the House
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans and Democrats are struggling for control of the Senate in this Novembers midterm elections. But there is no real fight for control of the House of Representatives.

title: Ostwald Helgason: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Rebecca Taylor: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Nick Bollettieri on the Dinosaur That Is the One-Handed Backhand
description: Wimbledon was where I did most of the reporting for my recent article on the fate of the one-handed backhand. Late in the afternoon on my last day there, I ran into the legendary tennis coach Nick Bollettieri. He was en route to an interview and I was heading for the airport, so our conversation about the one-hander was brief. A few days after my article was published, however, he emailed to say he wanted to talk some more about the one-hander. So last Saturday we met at the U.S. Open for that conversation. The 83-year-old Bollettieri was recently inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame, an honor granted in recognition of his role in nurturing some of the sports greatest talents, including Andre Agassi, Maria Sharapova, Monica Seles and Jim Courier. (Another Bollettieri disciple, the Japanese player Kei Nishikori, reached the semifinals of this years Open with a five-set victory Wednesday over Stan Wawrinka, who has what many consider todays best one-handed backhand.)

title: Two Young Stars Lead Teams to W.N.B.A. Finals
description: Travel perks are scarce in the W.N.B.A., which requires its teams to fly in coach class to limit costs. So Elena Delle Donne of the Chicago Sky, who has been bothered lately by a sore back, felt especially grateful Friday morning as she settled into her seat on the Skys flight to Phoenix.

title: Lessons From Losses Drive Massachusetts Candidates
description: MEDFORD, Mass.  As Martha Coakley, the Democratic front-runner for governor, worked the crowd at Dempseys Breakfast and Lunch in this Boston suburb Friday, Patrick Hardy liked what he saw.

title: A Note on the Dynamics of Misinformation
description: Very busy, so no substantive posting today. But I did want to share a thought from the past few days. I posted about the surprisingly good news, at least so far, on Obamacare premiums for 2015  and as usual was met with a wall of rage from the right. The idea that this thing might be working inspires a level of anger nothing else (except maybe climate science) matches.

title: On Eve of the Democratic Primary, Cuomo Briefly Hits the Campaign Trail
description: Campaign signs were plentiful, and so was praise for his stewardship of state government. Handshakes with voters were evident, but still scarce. And the entire endeavor was over in just a few hours.

title: Alexander Wangs Spring 2015 Collection at New York Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Alexander Wang at New York Fashion Week.

title: Herve Leger By Max Azria: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York
