The polls showed a tight race in Kentucky, with his Democratic opponent, Alison Lundergan Grimes, often in the lead. His approval and favorability ratings were low, often beneath 40 percent.

title: The SAT As a Brainwashing Tool? Chinese Shrug Off Fears
description: Although Chinese state news media have cited concerns recently that the United States is indoctrinating Chinese students by including its founding documents upholding freedom and human rights in the SAT, teachers and parents dont seem to be too alarmed.

title: Syria and Iraq Called Urgent by New U.N. Rights Chief
description: GENEVA  Zeid Raad al-Hussein began his tenure on Monday as the United Nations human rights chief with a strongly worded statement in which he condemned Islamic extremism and urged international action to end conflicts in Syria and Iraq.

title: New York Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 5
description: Its an early morning at New York Fashion Week. Ordinarily, key shows dont get going until the more editor-approved hour of 10 a.m. or so, but Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen play by no ones rules but their own. They may have the highest media profile of just about any designer showing during N.Y.F.W., but as proof of the seriousness of their intent, theyve made an unfashionably early, unusually quiet and ruckus-proof slot their own. You can bet that top members of the industry will be in their seats at the stroke of 9.

title: Taiwan Reels From Gutter Oil Scandal
description: The authorities in Taiwan are scrambling to control a tainted-cooking-oil scandal that has affected hundreds of manufacturers and raised fears about health risks posed in many commonly consumed food items.

title: How Are American Families Doing? A Guided Tour of Our Financial Well-Being
description: How are we doing?

title: Ty Segall, Garage-Rock Whiz, Debuts a Clever New Video
description: Since releasing his debut in 2007, the golden-locked garage rocker Ty Segall has been shockingly prolific, releasing no fewer than nine full-length albums, not to mention his contributions to records by other bands like Fuzz, Sic Alps and White Fence, plus an LP recorded with his fellow singer-songwriter Mikal Cronin. With each outing, Segall has both refined and scuffed up his love for early-70s rock. For his expansive new album, Manipulator, he eased off the gas pedal slightly, taking 14 months to write, record and even arrange a string section for it. The albums sense of craft is mirrored by the video for the title track, made by the director Matt Yoka, which premieres here. An interactive version of the video, now live on Segalls site, plays on the songs title by allowing the listener to manipulate visual elements within the frame by pointing and clicking.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Sept. 8, 2014
description: Updated: Sept. 9, 2014

title: Representing Programmers as if They Were Celebrities
description: The pitch: Software developers may not be rock stars but they are in high demand and competition for them, especially among top tech companies, is fierce. Many choose to work as freelancers, taking on short and long-term assignments for a variety of companies. These developers are often better at writing code than they are at writing contracts, negotiating fees, or communicating with clients. 10x Management represents those freelance developers much the way talent agents represent entertainers.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Andrew Ross Sorkin on the Real Bill Gates
description: Andrew Ross Sorkin, financial columnist for The Times, co-anchor of CNBCs Squawk Box and the author of Too Big to Fail, wrote this weeks cover story about the plan by Bill Gates to introduce a new kind of history classes into high schools across the country.

title: Daily Report: Health Apps May Be Key to Fate of Apples iWatch
description: Apple was not the first to create a digital music player when it introduced the iPod 13 years ago. But the device, with its click wheel and slick integration with the iTunes software that ran on a computer, took digital music into the mainstream, Brian X. Chen reports.

title: Toronto Festival 2014: Reese Witherspoon, Producer
description: TORONTOFor the record, Reese Witherspoon was all glammed up when she took the stage to talk about her glamour-free Wild and The Good Lie, among other things, at the Toronto International Film Festival on Sunday.

title: Another Royal Baby Is Expected for an Uneasy Kingdom
description: LONDON  When the rich, the powerful and the upper crust in England contemplate their families-to-be, it is said, they aim for a minimum of two children  an heir to their estates and a spare should misfortune befall the first.

title: Salesforce.com to Set Up a Venture Capital Fund
description: To help make sure that Salesforce.com can compete for the interest of mobile app developers, the corporate software powerhouse is taking an unusual step: setting up a special venture capital fund.

title: Schools Become Homes for Refugees in Iraq
description: Schools in Dohuk, Iraq, in the Kurdish north, are filled with displaced Iraqis who fled the advance of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria this summer.

title: Morning Agenda: Preparing for Alibaba
description: As it gets ready to go public in what could be the biggest stock market debut ever in the United States, the Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group will begin a roadshow for potential investors on Monday, Michael J. de la Merced writes in DealBook. The tour, which will begin in New York, will encompass 100 meetings in 10 days. Two teams of senior executives, code-named red and orange, will travel with advisers across the United States and then to Europe, the Middle East and Asia.

title: Opening Ceremony: The Play Is Not the Thing
description: I admit that on Sunday night, when I got out of the Opening Ceremony show  which is to say, the 30-minute play 100% Lost Cotton created by the designers Humberto Leon and Carol Lim, in conjunction with the director Spike Jonze and Jonah Hill, the co-writers  I was not happy.

title: New York Fashion Week Social Media Roundup, Days 3 and 4
description: In this weekends heat and humidity, walking even short distances drew the risk of profuse outbreaks of sweat. Undeterred, fashions devotees took over the streets of Manhattan, their outfits unaffected by the weather. After all, there were shows to see  and at which to be seen. Saturday began with Lacoste and moved through Prabal Gurung, Ralph Rucci, Alexander Wang and Altuzarra. Sunday brought an even more packed schedule and a bevy of highlights: a model of the canine variety at Hood by Air; a dance performance at Tracy Reese; an unfortunate tumble at Thakoon; a supermodel from an earlier era at Diane von Furstenberg; and a one-act play at Opening Ceremony. The shows overflowed with celebrities, some of whom took a break to pay their respects to the queen of the red carpet, Joan Rivers, whose funeral took place Sunday afternoon.

title: Chiquita Delays Shareholder Meeting to Talk With Bidders
description: Updated, 1:47 p.m. | Chiquita said on Monday that it had delayed a meeting for shareholders to approve a proposed inversion deal with its Irish rival Fyffes so that it could talk with two Brazilian companies that have made a joint bid for Chiquita.

title: New York Fashion Week: Edun Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Columbine Goldsmith.

title: Royal Bank of Scotlands U.S. Unit Sets Price Range for I.P.O.
description: The Citizens Financial Group, the United States regional bank being spun off from the Royal Bank of Scotland, said on Monday that it expected to price its initial public offering at $23 to $25 a share.

title: Twitter Begins Testing a Buy Button for Instant Purchases by Its Users
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Twitter is already a real-time emporium for news, photos, video clips and 140-character snippets of thought. Now, the real-time social network wants to be a shopping mall for real products, too.

title: How Mod
description: The straight-cut three-button suit is back, but with simple underpinnings, no tie and high-cuffed pants, its shed its checkered past.

title: A New Study Clarifies Treatment Needs for Water from Fracked Gas and Oil Wells
description: A good post on InsideClimate News last week explored a new study of organic compounds and other constituents inthe briny water that emerges from gas or oil wells created using the high-pressure process called hydraulic fracturing, or fracking. (This produced water is a mix of fracturingfluid and water from the rock layers being drilled.)

title: Hertzs Chief Steps Down as Icahn Maintains Pressure
description: Hertz Global Holdings said on Monday that its chairman and chief executive, Mark P. Frissora, had stepped down, as the rental car giant faced pressure from the billionaire Carl C. Icahn.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: 1939: Letters Reaffirm City Ties
description: BRUSSELS  Burgomaster Max of Brussels, famed as the man who reputedly refused to hand over the keys of the city to the invading Germans in 1914, has sent the following telegram to Sir Frank Bowater, Lord Mayor of London: When Great Britain, faithful to its promise, courageously faces the trials of war, I express to you, to the members of the Corporation of your city and to the population of London my feelings of the most enthusiastic comradeship. The Lord Mayor has sent the following reply: It is with heartfelt gratitude that I reply to your telegram. The citizens of London never forget the great ties uniting our city and yours, and will ever remember your generous sentiments this time.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 9, 1939

title: Activist Investor Barry Rosenstein to Join Walgreen Board
description: The activist investor Barry Rosenstein will join the board of Walgreen, the drugstore chain announced on Monday.

title: No Glass Ceiling for Worker Bees
description: The honeybee hive would not seem to be the place to look for individuality, flexibility in job duties and social mobility. But by using new techniques for analyzing bee behavior, researchers at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, recently found that the life of a bee is less rigidly determined than had been thought.

title: ScienceTake | Rise of the Worker Bees
description: Who would have thought that the hive had room for social mobility?

title: Happy 350th Birthday, New York
description: Happy birthday, New York. Monday is the 350th anniversary of the surrender of Dutch New Amsterdam to the British and the settlements renaming as New York.

title: A Punch Is Seen, and a Player Is Out
description: The National Football Leagues handling of a domestic violence case is under renewed scrutiny after a graphic video emerged Monday, leading to the termination of the Baltimore Ravens star running back Ray Rices contract and his suspension from the league.

title: The Trillion Dollar Zombie
description: Ive often remarked on the remarkable tenacity of the inflationista doctrine (Santellinomics? CNBCnomics?) among investors, given the fact that believing the people who have been warning about soaring inflation and interest rates would have lost you a lot of money. How much money? Cordell Eddings at BrookingsBloomberg puts a number to it: $1 trillion in gains on U.S. government bonds since QE began. Actually, this is arguably a low estimate; if you really believed in this stuff, you wouldnt just have failed to hold US debt, you would have bet against it  as, for example, John Paulson (as described in the article) and Eric Cantor did.

title: India and Pakistan Strain as Flooding Kills Hundreds
description: NEW DELHI  Relief operations struggled on Monday in the Indian-administered portion of Kashmir and in parts of Pakistan where six days of rain and flooding have left hundreds of people dead.

title: BB&T to Buy Kentucky Bank
description: BB&T, the nations ninth-largest bank based on deposits, said on Monday that it would acquire the Bank of Kentucky for $363 million in cash and stock.

title: Would Ryanair Deal Make Economy Class Even More Crowded?
description: Is economy class about to get even more crowded?

title: Jessica Chastains Unusual Love Story, Art Openings Galore and More From the Cultural Calendar
description: Monday, New YorkSee the work of some New York art stars weekly ceramics clubIts name notwithstanding, Satan Ceramics, a group show at Salon 94 Freemans, is more concerned with topical satire than pure evil. In it, the artists Mary Frey, Pat McCarthy, JJ PEET and Tom Sachs display works they dreamed up during their weekly ceramics get-togethers, including Freys unrideable porcelain skateboard and Sachss urinal made with porcelain, rope and kevlar.Salon 94 Freemans, 1 Freeman Alley, New York, salon94.com.

title: Fighting the Gender Pay Gap
description: My daughter started her senior year of high school this fall. With college fast approaching, Ive had some fun discussions with her and family friends about future professions. One thing keeps coming up: Its the 21st century, and our daughters may still earn less than men for doing the same work.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: News From the Advertising Industry

title: 1964: Elderly Can Visit Kin in West
description: BERLIN  East German Communist leader Walter Ulbricht announced today [Sept. 8] that elderly East Germans will be allowed to visit relatives in the West. He said his Interior Ministry has been told to make possible visits of persons of pension age to their relations in West Berlin and West Germany. East German men get old-age pensions at 65 and women at 60. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 9, 1964

title: Lasker Winner Calls for More Genetic Testing for Cancer
description: The Albert and Mary Lasker Foundation awards  often called the American Nobels in medical science  were announced Monday morning, and one of the winners used the spotlight to call for greatly widening the use of genetic screening for breast and ovarian cancer.

title: Betting Markets Not Budging Over Poll on Scottish Independence
description: A poll published over the weekend suggesting that a majority of Scots will vote for independence Sept. 18 has both tanked the British pound and put the issue squarely in the international spotlight.

title: Weekly Quandary: Changes to a High School Schedule
description: In the Weekly Quandary, we pull from the comments, the weekly open thread or email a question that we know (or at least suspect) plagues more than one parent. You  the readers  provide the advice: How have you made this work better in your family? This weeks quandary came via email: Should you help a high school student who doesnt like his or her schedule to get it changed, and how?

title: Koons Creating Sculptures for New Philanthropy Project
description: Project Perpetual, a new philanthropy established to raise money for humanitarian causes by collaborating with artists, has enlisted Jeff Koons to create the first in a series of new works that will be used to raise money for the United Nations Foundation.

title: Black Women Find a Growing Business Opportunity: Care for Their Hair
description: Not much seems unusual about Judian and Kadeian Browns storefront in a tidy plaza off Church Avenue in Flatbush, Brooklyn, a neighborhood where every block seems to have its own African hair-braiding salon.

title: James Corden to Replace Craig Ferguson as Host of The Late Late Show on CBS
description: In choosing James Corden on Monday to replace Craig Ferguson as the host of The Late Late Show, CBS seems to be making a statement.

title: A World, From Scratch
description: There are no rules, money or iPads on Utopia, a Fox reality show that began on Sunday. In this yearlong experiment in building a DIY society, viewers are invited, as the host put it, to imagine throwing off the shackles of convention and conformity.

title: Lawmakers Approve Cabinet in Iraq, but 2 Posts Are Empty
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi lawmakers approved a new power-sharing government led by Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi late Monday. But they left the two most divisive security posts unfilled, potentially extending a contentious debate even as American officials prepared a new campaign of military support for the Baghdad administration.

title: Pakistans Deadly Floods
description: Flooding in Pakistan left at least 190 people dead and thousands stranded in swamped towns and villages.

title: Brushing Off Threats, E.U. Votes to Toughen Its Sanctions on Russia
description: BRUSSELS  Unswayed by threats of retaliation from Moscow, including a possible ban on airlines from Europe flying over Russia, European leaders on Monday endorsed an expansion of economic sanctions against Russia, but backed off putting the new measures into effect immediately.

title: This Is Life Among the Roma, Europes Forgotten People
description: The Roma are a historically nomadic, widely dispersed people of South Asian origin. They live primarily in Europe  where they constitute one of the largest ethnic minorities  and have done so for more than 1,000 years.

title: Fei Fei Sun Transforms Backstage at Derek Lam
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Fei Fei Sun before (left) and after (right) makeup by Tom Pecheux and hair by Orlando Pita.

title: An Industrial Rebound
description: The economic turnaround in Youngstown, Ohio, is part of a transformation taking place across the heartland of the nation.

title: Old Moon, New Surprises
description: You might stare up at the supermoon tonight and think that astronomers figured out all the lunar secrets decades ago. You would be very wrong.

title: Boom in Energy Spurs Industry in the Rust Belt
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio  Waist-high weeds and a crumbling old Chevy mark the entrance to a rust-colored factory complex on the edge of town here, seemingly another monument to the passing of the golden age of American industry.

title: Carolina Herrera: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: A New Season of Typecasting for N.F.L. Quarterbacks
description: DENVER  Oh, God, he failed again. Andrew Luck, the superstar-almost quarterback for the Indianapolis Colts, faced Peyton Manning, the Old Man River of N.F.L. quarterbacks, in a Sunday evening clash of the titans.

title: Bugs on a Square
description: This week we present our second consecutive insect challenge: the classic Bugs on a Square. This puzzle has been suggested by a number of readers over the years, including the software engineer Cem nsal, who has used the puzzle in dozens of interviews (well hear about his experience at the end of this post). When a regular contributor, Dr. W, brought up the puzzle in last weeks Ants on a Triangle discussion I realized it was probably time to run the challenge as our main feature. Heres how the Canadian mathematician John McKay phrased the problem in a recent email to me:

title: Lew Says Administration Is Near a Decision on Curbing Corporate Expatriates
description: WASHINGTON  Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew said on Monday that he would decide in the very near future what regulatory action the Obama administration can take  given the partisan paralysis in Congress  to close some tax loopholes and reduce incentives for multinational corporations to avoid United States taxes by incorporating in other countries.

title: New York Fashion Week: Versus Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: A Fast, Simple Dinner for a Monday Night
description: Busy parents. Active children. Families that arrive home every evening, starved. This week, in the series Dinner: The Boot Camp, Jenny Rosenstrach, from the popular blog Dinner: A Love Story, takes a recipe for chaos and coaches all of us in the planning and preparation needed to turn it into a pleasant nightly meal.

title: Obesity Around the Nation
description: Obesity rates in states around the country are beginning to slow, but the epidemic is still affecting the poor and minorities disproportionately, new research shows.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Daniel Andreani joined I.d.e.a., San Diego, in a new post, senior vice president and executive creative director. He had most recently been creative director at McKee Wallwork & Company, Albuquerque.

title: Today in Small Business: Twitter Tests a Buy Button
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Toronto Festival 2014: Chris Evans Answers Your Questions
description: TORONTO  With his new movie Before We Go, Chris Evans is both filmmaker and actor. Last week, we asked readers what they would ask Mr. Evans, whose directorial debut has its premiere in Toronto on Friday. He sat down with us to answer a select number of those questions about his life and career. Here are those responses.

title: Be Nice to Underlings, Jefferies Bankers Are Told
description: Not long ago, analysts and associates in investment banks were required to work grueling hours. Pitch books assigned at 4 p.m. on Friday. Complex demands for mind-numbingly dense spreadsheets at 10 a.m. on Sunday. League table arranging to show that there are five planets or that Goldman Sachs is not really a top ranked adviser.

title: An Industrial Rebound
description: The economic turnaround in Youngstown, Ohio, is part of a transformation taking place across the heartland of the nation.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Irans Top Leader Undergoes Prostate Surgery
description: TEHRAN  Irans highest leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, underwent an operation on his prostate on Monday, according to state-run news media and a posting on his website. None specified whether the ayatollah, 75, has prostate cancer.

title: MetLife Hopes Campaign Will Help Change Perceptions of Life Insurance
description: A new campaign seeks to accentuate the positive about life insurance, promoting it affirmatively as a way to live for the loved ones in your life rather than taking a downbeat tack with terms like death benefit or beneficiary.

title: Michael C. Hall Will Put on Heels as Hedwig
description: The producers of the Broadway musical Hedwig and the Angry Inch have decided to keep the show running through the traditionally profitable winter holidays with a new star  Michael C. Hall of Dexter  in spite of mixed signs about ticket sales. The producers announced on Monday that Mr. Hall, who sang on Broadway as the M.C. in Cabaret and as Billy Flynn in Chicago, will play the transgender rock star Hedwig from Oct. 16 through Jan. 4, 2015.

title: Martoma, SAC Capital Ex-Trader, Gets 9 Years in Prison
description: Updated, 9:05 p.m. | The parents of Mathew Martoma, the former portfolio manager for SAC Capital Advisors, sat quietly through his insider trading trial this year. But moments after a federal judge sentenced Mr. Martoma on Monday to nine years in prison for carrying out one of the biggest insider trading schemes on record, his parents could contain themselves no more.

title: Best Selling Science Books
description: 1 IN THE KINGDOM OF ICE by Hampton Sides. Doubleday. An 1879 polar voyage gone terribly wrong.

title: Flaming Lips Reveal Guest List for Sgt. Peppers Cover Album
description: The Flaming Lips, the idiosyncratic Oklahoma band of neo-psychedelic tricksters, has been at work on a cover version of the complete Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band album for much of the last year. For the project, the Lips have brought in other musicians, turning the album into a starry tribute to the Beatles 1967 classic. On Monday, the group released the track list  not much of a surprise, since it mirrors the original  and more crucially, the guest list, which includes Moby, Miley Cyrus, My Morning Jacket, Tegan and Sara and others. The album will be released on Oct. 28.

title: A Grand Slam Idea (With Drinks, of Course)
description: Tommys Margarita. Dennys.

title: Chris Evans on His Most Challenging Role
description: The actor and director answers a question about what he sees as his most challenging role to play.

title: D.E.A. to Allow Return of Unused Pills to Pharmacies
description: Concerned by rising rates of prescription drug abuse, the Drug Enforcement Administration announced Monday that it would permit consumers to return unused prescription medications like opioid painkillers to pharmacies.

title: New Margaret Atwood Work Coming in  2114?
description: Fans clamoring for Margaret Atwoods next work of fiction will need to take a serious chill pill, or even better, seek a full cryogenic freezing. The project shes currently working on wont appear until 2114.

title: Laughs and Accolades as Clinton and Bush Introduce a Leadership Program
description: At a time of heightened partisanship in Washington, it seemed a brief respite to watch former Presidents George W. Bush and Bill Clinton sit side by side on stage and gush about each others leadership and acute decision-making skills.

title: Reddit and 4chan Begin to Button Up
description: They say almost anything goes on the Internet. Except, that is, when the lawyers become involved.

title: Honda Recalls 126,000 GL 1800 Motorcycles
description: Honda is recalling about 126,000 of its GL 1800 motorcycles for the second time because the rear brake can drag and possibly cause a fire, according to a report Honda posted on the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration website. The action covers the 2001-10 and 2012 model years.

title: AT&T U-verse to Carry Rural Media Groups RFD-TV
description: RFD-TV, the rural-focused television network, has landed coverage on AT&Ts U-verse television service after its monthslong campaign against a pair of proposed media mergers.

title: Garance Dors Pinterest, A Goop-Approved Wellness Doctors Website and More
description: Every week, T rounds up five captivating online destinations you should be visiting often.

title: A Bond Fraught With Danger
description: On newspaper front pages around the world late last month, a photograph from Gaza showed masked Hamas gunmen about to execute bound, kneeling prisoners suspected of collaborating with Israel. That same fate would probably have befallen Mosab Hassan Yousef, the protagonist of the new documentary The Green Prince, had this secret been discovered: For nearly a decade, he was an informant for Israel, operating at the highest levels of Hamas itself.

title: Carlyle Deal Concludes a Lawsuit Against Private Equity
description: The final holdout in a sweeping lawsuit against some of the biggest private equity firms has agreed to a settlement, ending a seven-year headache for the industry.

title: Tommy Hilfiger: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Afghan Candidate Vows to Reject Disputed Vote
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The presidential candidate Abdullah Abdullah once more brought Afghanistans troubled electoral process to the brink on Monday, insisting that he had won the disputed vote and vowing to reject any government formed on the basis of it.

title: A Doctors Malaise, and a Professions
description: Sandeep Jauhars new memoir, Doctored: The Disillusionment of an American Physician, tells the story of two midlife crises: the authors own, and that of modern American medicine, now in about its fourth decade under managed care. Both prove to be frustratingly intransigent, with only small signs of hope.

title: Wall Street Hand Stays the Stormy Course at N.Y.U.
description: Under the command and control of John Sexton, its president, and Martin Lipton, its chairman, for more than a decade, New York University has courted more than its fair share of controversy. So some might have expected that with the two stepping down over the next two years, new leadership might mean a fresh and less controversial direction.

title: Germany Arrests 3 on Charges of Joining Somali Militants
description: BERLIN  Three Germans suspected of training and fighting with the Somali Islamist group known as the Shabab were arrested at Frankfurt Airport when they returned to Germany over the weekend, the authorities said Monday.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 3
description: Parties for Band of Outsiders and Prabal Gurung.

title: If the Scots Gain Independence, Expect a More Conservative U.K.
description: Less than two weeks until the referendum on Scottish independence, a poll has found for the first time that the yes vote, which would split Scotland from England, Wales and Northern Ireland, was ahead of the no vote. Although its not at all certain that the survey is a reliable prediction of what will occur on Sept. 18, independence no longer seems like an impossibility (which it did a few short months ago, when the no vote was far ahead.)

title: Monday Motorsports: Hamilton Returns to Form in Italian Grand Prix
description: Lewis Hamilton, the pole-position starter driving for Mercedes, recovered from a poor start to win the Italian Grand Prix on Sunday, pressuring his teammate, Nico Rosberg, into a mistake that caused him to cede the race lead.

title: Philharmonic to Raise Funds for 2019 Renovation
description: The target date to begin the long-delayed renovation of Avery Fisher Hall is now 2019, and the New York Philharmonic is planning a campaign to raise its share of the construction costs and double its endowment, the orchestra disclosed in a recent job listing.

title: Walkabout: Airlines Say So Long to Turbulence, Hello to Cramped Seating
description: Smoother SailingJust a few years ago, pilotsdepended on radio communications and rudimentary radar to avoid bad weather.Now new generations of airplane radar systems allow for easy in-flight adjustments. (The New York Times)

title: R.B.S. Tries to Paint Too Pretty a Picture for Citizens I.P.O.
description: The Royal Bank of Scotland is applying a fair amount of lipstick to its United States unit ahead of a planned initial public offering.

title: A Sleep Sweet Spot
description: The most reliable workers are those who get seven to eight hours of sleep each night, a new study shows.

title: A New Host for The Late, Late Show
description: James Corden, a British comedian who is relatively unknown in the United States, has just been tapped as the next host of CBSs The Late, Late Show. A sampling of Cordens recent appearances.

title: Schomburg Center Plans Exhibition on For Colored Girls
description: Ntozake Shanges For Colored Girls Who Have Considered Suicide/When the Rainbow Is Enuf, an audacious, feminist cry from the heart, started life in 1974 in a womens bar in California, landed on Broadway shortly thereafter and by 2010 had morphed into a Tyler Perry film. Now, the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Manhattan is mounting a visual arts exhibition entitled I found god in myself: The 40th anniversary of Ntozake Shanges for colored girls, an exploration and interpretation of the now-classic work.

title: New York Fashion Week: Carolina Herrera Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Nina Westervelt.

title: Opening Ceremony: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Ukraines President Promises Protection
description: President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine visited an eastern Ukrainian port and promised to defend it from pro-Russian separatists.

title: When Family Dinner Doesnt Satisfy
description: At first glance, Sarah Bowens research project seems pleasant: The sociologist and her team sat down to dinner with American families. But what she found may be disturbing for proponents of family dinners  the meals were oftentimes of worryand strife. And, she argues, we cant expect moms alone to change the way America eats.

title: Former Envoy Reported Facing a Federal Inquiry
description: BERLIN  Zalmay Khalilzad, a former United States ambassador to Afghanistan, Iraq and the United Nations, is under investigation by the Justice Department for possible tax evasion and money laundering, an Austrian magazine reported on Monday.

title: U.S.C.s Pat Haden Fined for Altercation With Referees
description: The Pac-12 Conference reprimanded Southern Californias athletic director, Pat Haden, and football coach, Steve Sarkisian, on Monday over a bizarre sideline debate with the referees Saturday in the Trojans 13-10 victory at Stanford.

title: A Family Cycle of Diabetes
description: Children born to women who had gestational diabetes have a substantially higher likelihood of developing Type 2 diabetes as teenagers, a new study shows.

title: Broadway Wont Dim Lights for Rivers
description: After closed-door deliberations, Broadway executives have decided not to dim the lights on theater marquees  an industry honor  to pay tribute to Joan Rivers, the comedian and television personality who also appeared on Broadway three times and earned a Tony Award nomination in 1994.

title: Chinese Game Players Add to Apple's Bottom Line
description: BEIJING  Apple has a lot to thank people like Ms. Deng for.

title: Jaguar Unveils XE Sport Sedan
description: Jaguar unveiled its XE Monday afternoon and said the sleek, compact sedan was expected to go on sale in North America in 2016.

title: Caesarism Delayed
description: Since I spent last month hammering away at the legitimacy of White Houses promised executive action on immigration, you wont be surprised to hear that I have a few thoughts following the news that its been officially delayed, at least until after the midterm elections but with no date certain set. Three thoughts, to be specific:

title: Finally a Change Atop FIFA? Dont Count on It
description: Sepp Blatter is a mutant immortal butterfly, a creature that spends years in a cocoon, oblivious to the world around him before emerging on a quadrennial basis to flap his wings, put on a short show of creativity and ambition and then, ultimately, collapse back into his self-important slumber.

title: Blaming Gerrymandering Has Its Limits, as Pennsylvania Shows
description: There is no question that Republicans have a huge advantage in the House. But there is a big debate about whether its because of partisan gerrymandering or because Democrats are gerrymandering themselves into urban, heavily Democratic districts. One reason the debate continues, despite a near consensus among political scientists, is because the wasted votes phenomenon is abstract and hard to illustrate.

title: N.C.A.A. Decides to Roll Back Sanctions Against Penn State
description: The N.C.A.A.on Mondayrestored Penn States postseason eligibility, removing one of the final hurdles in its football teams path back to normalcy in the aftermath of the child sexual abuse scandal that engulfed the university nearly three years ago.

title: Susan Dominus, Whats in Your Bag?
description: Oh, no. Youre a reporter on assignment and youre riffling through your carryall. You think youve left something behind. Whether you find it or not can make or break your day. We asked several reporters what they need to do their jobs when they leave home or office. Well share their answers over the next few weeks.

title: Turkey Is Courted by U.S. to Help Fight ISIS
description: ANKARA, Turkey  The Obama administration on Monday began the work of trying to determine exactly what roles the members of its fledgling coalition of countries to fight the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria will play, with Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel huddled with the leaders of the one country the administration has called absolutely indispensable to the fight: Turkey.

title: Jeffrey D. Dunn Named Chief of Sesame Workshop
description: Sesame Workshop, the nonprofit organization best known as the producer of PBSs Sesame Street, has named a former Nickelodeon and HIT Entertainment executive, Jeffrey D. Dunn, as its president and chief executive.

title: Human Misery and Menace, Run Amok
description: The PBS series Frontline pours a double shot of dismal on Tuesday in a program that examines the Ebola outbreak in West Africa and atrocities in Nigeria related to the hunt for Boko Haram.

title: Cuomo and Teachout Duel, if Only Briefly
description: Zephyr Teachout, the liberal law professor waging a long-shot primary challenge against Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, made a final plea to frustrated Democrats on Monday, while the governor touted his successes in Albany and assailed his opponent as unqualified.

title: A Guitarist Lays Aside Abstractions and Keeps It Sweet, Giving Whats Required
description: Sir Richard Bishop stayed on his dulcet, decorous side at the Issue Project Room in Brooklyn, which opened its season on Saturday night with a double bill of guitar solos from Mr. Bishop and Tashi Dorji. Mr. Bishops pieces, for electric guitar, were tonal, melodic and straightforward  mostly his own, although he did play a splintered, close-up version of the Beatles She Loves You that lingered over every iota of the songs harmonic tension.

title: Milly: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Pension Funds Join Lawsuit on High-Frequency Trading
description: A group of pension funds has joined with the City of Providence, R.I., in a lawsuit that claims that major stock exchanges improperly favored high-frequency traders at the expense of other investors.

title: Ancient Greek Tomb Yields Two Large Statues
description: Archaeologists excavating a recently discovered tomb at Amphipolis in northern Greece have found two caryatids  large female figures in tunics  placed as supports at the opening of the tomb, Agence France-Presse reported on Monday. The figures were holding up a lintel at the entrance, and were apparently meant to guard the treasures inside the tomb, which dates from the fourth century B.C. and which archaeologists described as the largest ancient tomb discovered in Greece.

title: U.S. Open 2014 Live Blog: Marin Cilic Defeats Kei Nishikori for Mens Title
description: Marin Cilic, the 14th seed, became the unlikeliest winner of a mens Grand Slam title in a decade, beating 10th-seeded Kei Nishikori in a lopsided 6-3, 6-3, 6-3 rout in the United States Open mens singles final.

title: Striving for a Delicate Balance, Even in Times of Change
description: In the final movement of the Cassatt String Quartets performance of Dvoraks American Quartet at Bargemusic on Sunday afternoon, a passing water taxi created a bow wake so strong that it sent a jolt through the barge, briefly pitching the stage forward. The violist Sarah Adams smiled as she shot a glance at her colleagues, who kept their eyes fixed on the music. In their playing, the wave did not register as so much as a hiccup.

title: A Twitterholic and Green Blogger Assesses a Year of Living Offline
description: You may be among those, like me, who confronted a great digital emptiness over the last 12 months as Grists prolific environmental and political blogger and Twitter presence David Roberts went into a self-imposed offline exile. Hes back, having learned a thing or two, and he charts his 12 months of analog living in the October issue of Outside Magazine. Its this weeks essential reading for students in my Blogging a Better Planet course at Pace University.

title: Pair of Partygoers Turn Up the Heat in the Kitchen
description: Suddenly, the sexual power games in David Ivess Venus in Fur seem distant, almost artificial.

title: Moments of Color Amid a Steady Parade of White
description: I cant believe were still having this conversation in 2014, said Wendell Brown, the senior fashion editor of Esquire and a highly sought after fashion stylist, referring to a persistent tendency among designers to ignore what the writer Grace Paley once called New Yorks gorgeous chromatic dispersion.

title: European Commission Delays Google Antitrust Settlement After Competitors Complaints
description: BRUSSELS  The European Commission pressed Google for adjustments to a proposed antitrust settlement on Monday, further delaying a resolution of the long-running case.

title: Braintree, Popular Payments Processor, to Accept Bitcoin
description: Soon, you may be able to pay for your next Uber ride with Bitcoin.

title: Exploring the Connection Between Alcohol and Dementia
description: Q. Is there a difference between alcoholic dementia and regular dementia in the elderly?

title: White Lyan in East London: A Bar Beyond the Status Quo
description: LONDON  More so than drinkers in American cocktail capitals like New York and San Francisco, barflies in London seem to like their drink with a side of theater. Artesian, a bar inside the luxe Langham Hotel, delivers its creations with a clown-car-full of circus tricks, from balloons filled with scent to actual smoke and mirrors. Nightjar, a speakeasy in East London, sends drinks out in vessels shaped like owls and top hats.

title: What Made Me | Thakoon Panichgul
description: The fashion designer Thakoon Panichgul describes his childhood move from Bangkok to Omaha and how Bruce Webers photography inspired his American aesthetic.

title: London Calls Him to Dinner
description: LONDON  More or less chronologically, my favorite restaurant towns of the last 20 years have been New York, Paris, Los Angeles, San Francisco, and now, London. Its been London for a few years, although a quarter-century ago  when the London restaurant scene began to explode  such a statement would have been unthinkable. Back then, I went and looked for eel pie. Back then, my attention was directed toward New York and Paris.

title: Diving With Ironman
description: Off Greece, an expedition will soon use a dive suit that looks a lot like a superheros exoskeleton to try to recover more of the Antikythera Mechanism, a complex astronomical calculator.

title: Doctors Magical Thinking About Conflicts of Interest
description: When the Food and Drug Administration creates an advisory committee to help it decide whether to approve drugs, it often asks academic physicians to serve on the committee as external experts. This is supposed to help the committee render judgments that are unbiased and scientific.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Health Chief Seeks to Focus on Insurance Site
description: WASHINGTON  Sylvia Mathews Burwell, the secretary of Health and Human Services, said Monday in her first major speech that she wanted to move beyond the politics of health care and work with members of both parties to improve the management and operation of HealthCare.gov, the website used by millions of people to sign up for insurance coverage.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New, Starring Rick Owens and Bill Maher
description: Rick Owens, dark prince of fashion whose label has inspired a cultlike following, takes on Bill Maher, religion-skewering stand-up and polarizing late-night politico whose HBO series, Real Time With Bill Maher, is currently in its 12th season. A new live comedy show on the network airs this month. (A 25-foot sculpture of the California-bred Owens is currently on view at Selfridges in London to celebrate his limited-edition collection for the high-end department store.)

title: In Performance | McElwee and Mendes
description: David McElwee and Ismenia Mendes in scene from the revival of A.R. Gurneys 1977 play The Wayside Motor Inn, about travelers at a motel. The show ran at the Signature Center in 2015.

title: Death by Audio to Close in November
description: Death by Audio, the Brooklyn rock club and musicians work space that sprang up in a Williamsburg warehouse in 2007, will be closing on Nov. 22, according to a note posted on clubs website on Monday.

title: Forum Revival Has Been Postponed
description: A Broadway revival of A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum, which had been in the works as a vehicle for the Tony Award winner James Corden (One Man, Two Guvnors), below, has been postponed now that Mr. Corden has been named the new host of The Late, Late Show on CBS. A spokesman for the Forum producers said Monday that they had concluded that time was beginning to run out to cast and produce the revival, which was intended for the spring. The Tony Award nominee Alex Timbers (Rocky, Here Lies Love) had been on tap to direct the musical comedy, which has music and lyrics by Stephen Sondheim and won the best musical Tony in 1963. The spokesman had no additional details about a possible future for the project. Playbill.com reported the postponement on Monday.

title: Star-Covered Booties at Tommy Hilfiger
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Yoko Ono, Susie Bubble and the Many Faces of New York Fashion Week
description: The illustrator Damien Florbert Cuypers shares his impressions of the fashion set around New York City this week.

title: Mosquito-Borne Viruses Hit Japan and the U.S.
description: Mosquito-borne viruses are showing up unexpectedly in affluent countries where they have been largely unknown.

title: A Superhero of Sorts in a Hunt for Artifacts
description: An international team of archaeologists plans to return this month to the site of an ancient shipwreck off a Greek island. This time, they will have the aid of an advanced diving suit that will give them much more time to probe for new artifacts.

title: Long View of History Includes Today
description: Given the multiplying foreign policy emergencies in the headlines, from the advance of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS) to the face-off between Russia and Ukraine, the subject of Henry Kissingers new book, World Order, could not be more timely. However the reader may regard the authors own historical baggage, the book puts the problems of todays world and Americas role in that increasingly interconnected and increasingly riven world into useful  and often illuminating  context.

title: New V.A. Secretary Says Hiring Spree Is Needed to Meet Patient Demand
description: WASHINGTON  The new secretary of Veterans Affairs said Monday that the department needed to hire tens of thousands of new doctors, new nurses, new clinicians  emphasizing the significance of a shortage of employees who are directly involved in treating patients, a factor many experts said was a main driver in the waiting-list scandal that rocked the agency this year.

title: The Most Economically Diverse Top Colleges
description: To measure top colleges efforts on economic diversity, The Upshot calculated a College Access Index.

title: General Mills to Buy Annies for $820 Million in Cash
description: Updated, 6:49 p.m. | Annies Homegrown, the organic food company known for its mac and cheese and earthy vibe, is joining the General Mills empire.

title: 3.1 Phillip Lim: Spring 2015 RTW
description: new york

title: Verifying the Exclusive Story of an ISIS Massacre Survivor
description: Richard Tanner is a senior video editor for International news. He worked with Mike Shum, an independent video journalist, on a video about the only survivor of a massacre by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: Space Missions Approved, if Not Paid For
description: A total of seven NASA exploration projects received the go-ahead to go on. Paying for the continued science is the issue.

title: A War Is Long Over, but Many Still Seek to Learn Its Lessons
description: SALZBURG, Austria  Margaret MacMillan, who has written one of the best recent histories of the origins of World War I, finds the current fascination with the war gratifying but odd, even with this years 100th anniversary commemorations. She says she thinks that todays interest lies as much in the very confusion surrounding the causes of the Great War as in the parallels to our own anxious, transitional time.

title: In the Studio | Narciso Rodriguez
description: Narciso Rodriguez has rocks from the birthplace of Aphrodite in his office. He talks to Vanessa Friedman about what else he collects for inspiration.

title: My Head Talks About Minimum Wages
description: I did an interview over at Business Insider, and various pieces will be appearing over the next few days. The discussion of minimum wages is here.

title: An American Yazidi Trying to Save Iraqi Yazidis
description: Sharifa Khalil was just days old when her family crawled under a fence at the Iraq-Syria border in 1988 to escape Saddam Husseins rule. She arrived in the United States at age 11, after years as a refugee, unable to speak or read English, but thrived in school, graduating high school with honors.

title: NASA Missions Approved to Go On
description: Every two years, NASA reviews its long-running scientific missions  currently, the rovers trundling across Mars, the Cassini spacecraft exploring Saturn, and four others  to determine whether they are justifying their cost.

title: Ukraine Palace Is Still Emblem of Dysfunction
description: VYSHOROD, Ukraine  It was supposed to become a Museum of Corruption, a triumphant trophy of Ukraines February revolution and a monument to its new leaders determination to uproot the lawlessness and avarice that blighted this countrys first two decades as an independent nation.

title: Donna Karan: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Amazon Cuts Struggling Phones Price to 99 Cents
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Sixty thousand people vied to attend the unveiling of Amazons first smartphone in late June.

title: The Methodology of Our College-Access Index
description: The choice for anyone who wants to evaluate American colleges is often between incomplete data and no data.

title: Top Colleges That Enroll Rich, Middle Class and Poor
description: Vassar has taken steps to hold down spending on faculty and staff. Amherst and the University of Florida have raised new money specifically to spend on financial aid for low-income students. American University reallocated scholarships from well-off students to needy ones. Grinnell set a floor on the share of every freshman class  15 percent  whose parents didnt go to college.

title: For Australia, a Celebration of China in Theme Park Form
description: Its been billed by its backers as the biggest tourism development in New South Wales, and the local mayor predicts it will rank with the Sydney Opera House and Harbor Bridge as an attraction.

title: New York Fashion Week: 3.1 Phillip Lim Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Spain, India and Hong Kong.

title: Antidepressants and Pregnancy, Carb Conundrum
description: Antidepressants

title: Bratton Outlines Police Training Overhaul
description: For two hours and 36 minutes, William J. Bratton sat before the New York City Council, his hands often posed flatly on the table before him, his Boston accent echoing through the packed hearing room as he responded to a succession of questions on his plans to overhaul officer training.

title: Love as Addiction, and Accepting It
description: Romance demands warning labels on Goddess (Harvest), the debut album by Jillian Banks, the Los Angeles songwriter who simply calls herself Banks. What if I said I would break your heart?/What if I said I had problems that made me mean? she sings in You Should Know Where Im Coming From, a dark piano hymn, then adds, Maybe you can see that I just may be too crazy to love. In Alibi, surrounded by synthesizer chords and twitchy programmed percussion, she realizes, Something so warm turned out to be/Something that I shouldve known would be the death.

title: The Banality of Evil, and the Nazis Early Victims
description: To the Editor:

title: Among the Ancient Stones, Magic as Potent as Ever
description: WILTSHIRE DOWNS, England  Standing at the center of the Stone Circle of Stonehenge in the moments before dawn, lulled by low-hanging rain clouds, I am, for a while, unable to understand why so many pilgrimages have been made here. Sure, the setting is attractively pastoral, with gently rolling fields and dark patches of trees on distant hills. But the vista verges on the ordinary.

title: Unrest in Hong Kong
description: To the Editor:

title: Airline Seats, Continued
description: To the Editor:

title: Unlike Anything They Have Ever Seen Before
description: Two species of deep-sea dwelling, mushroom-shaped organisms discovered off the coast of Southeast Australia defy all existing classifications of life, researchers from the University of Copenhagen say. The organisms, described in the journal PLOS One, are multicellular and nonsymmetrical, and live 400 to 1000 meters deep. They have been classified in an aptly named new genus, Dendrogramma enigmatica.

title: Stealing Workers Wages
description: To the Editor:

title: The N.F.L.s Absurd Marijuana Policy
description: LOS ANGELES  VIRTUALLY every single player in the N.F.L. has a certifiable need for medical marijuana.

title: In-Flight Rage? Understandable, but Rare
description: RECENT stories about angry disputes over reclining coach seats and crimped personal space are often accompanied by assertions that episodes of air rage are increasing. But are they really?

title: As Broadway Box Office Dips, Its Only a Play Excels
description: Ticket sales declined at every Broadway show last week except one: Its Only a Play, the Terrence McNally comedy starring Nathan Lane and Matthew Broderick, which became the rare Broadway play to gross more than $1 million for a week of preview performances.

title: Off the Runway: Day 5
description: Scenes from ADEAM and Karen Walker on the fifth day of New York Fashion Week.

title: The World of Rick Rubin
The Very Best of Rick Rubin
description: In the latest installment of By the Numbers, we take a look at the storied 32-year career of the Zenned-out superproducer and Def Jam Records co-founder Rick Rubin. Here, Ts editors share their favorite tracks from Rubins wide-ranging catalog, a selection of which can be heard in a Spotify playlist at the bottom of the page.

title: The Problem With Reclining Airplane Seat Design
description: To recline or not to recline? That is the question now being hotly debated among air travelers after three flights were forced to land after passengers on board began fighting about reclining seats.

title: Narciso Rodriguez: Never at a Loss for Sneakers
description: In the fourth in a series of behind-the-scenes videos of designers in their offices, Narciso Rodriguez, who introduced his namesake label in 1997 and who has twice been named womens wear designer of the year by the Council of Fashion Designers of America, reveals his for the first time. (The conversation has been edited and condensed.)

title: Knots Landing at Carolina Herrera
description: The painterly large-format prints and sculptural tailoring at todays Carolina Herrera show called for a striking beauty look to match. Complementing the makeup  clean skin, bold lips  were slick, scraped-back buns that resembled dramatic half-tied bows in back. Thanks to extensions and plenty of gel, the looped dos appeared to defy gravity.

title: Home Depot Data Breach Could Be the Largest Yet
description: Home Depot confirmed on Monday that hackers had broken into its in-store payments systems, in what could be the largest known breach of a retail companys computer network.

title: New York Fashion Week: Tommy Hilfiger Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: A Witness to AIDS in South Africa
description: Joao Silva has watched the response to the H.I.V./AIDS pandemic go from denial to ensuring those with the virus get the treatment and medications they need.

title: New York Hires Consultant to Create Rikers Island Reform Plan
description: In the wake of revelations about pervasive brutality carried out by jail staff and other serious problems at Rikers Island, New Yorks correction commissioner announced on Monday that the city had hired the management consulting firm McKinsey & Company, mostly known for its work advising corporations, to develop a plan for reforms.

title: At End of Long Road, an Effortless Victory
description: After the worry and the wait; after other years nerves and last years bitterness, it suddenly looked easy for Marin Cilic.

title: What Will Doom the Death Penalty
description: ATLANTA  TO opponents of the death penalty, recent accounts of botched executions and DNA-based exonerations of death-row prisoners have revived hope that judges and voters will finally see capital punishment for what it is: an intolerable affront to human dignity.

title: The Stresses That Put Doctors at Risk
The Secret Behind Donna Karans Elaborate Braids
description: Backstage at Donna Karan this afternoon, the hairstylist Eugene Souleiman was crouched on the floor, crisscrossing sections of hair, with two assistants by his side. It was a sea of hands weaving back and forth, like a carefully choreographed dance number. When he finished, he stood back from the plait he had just created and said, with a bemused smile, I dont even know what you call this braid! But he was keen to describe his inspiration. The textiles in the collection are Basquiat-like, or like a Mir print  everything is very illustrative, he said. So I wanted to make a braid like a paintbrush. The technique required at least four hands and two packs of hair extensions per model, but wasnt too high-fashion to escape a summer-camp reference: Its a bit like that style of braiding used to make keychains!

title: NATO Challenge on the Edge of Its Mandate
A Bartenders Tools Stir Up Trouble at Airport Security
description: IF I could have one of those sci-fi teleporters, I probably wouldnt go to the airport. But thats not happening, so I do what I have to do to get where I need to go.

title: In Era of Iconoclasts, Imagination Took Wing on Beekman Place
description: Beekman Place is about as far off the beaten path as one can get in Manhattan. Stretching just two blocks between East 49th and East 51st Streets on a bluff overlooking the East River, it is one of the shortest streets on the island and looks like many others, with grand old townhouses and stately prewar apartment buildings.

title: Ferguson Sets Broad Change for City Courts
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  In the first major sign of change in this small city since last months police killing of an unarmed black teenager, the Ferguson City Council said Monday that it would establish a citizen review board to provide guidance for the Police Department.

title: Thakoon Panichgul, All-American Fashion Designer, on His Influences
description: Since starting out a decade ago, Thakoon Panichgul has become a favorite of both editors and celebrities for his playful, approachable womens wear. In the latest installment of the What Made Me video series by Poppy de Villeneuve, the Thai-American designer, who showed his spring 2015 collection in New York yesterday, reveals how moving from Bangkok to Omaha at age 11 and discovering the photography of Bruce Weber shaped his distinctly American aesthetic.

title: In Case Filed by Rival, McKinsey Faces Scrutiny Over Employees Actions
description: McKinsey & Company, the global consulting giant, has found itself ensnared in another public relations fire.

title: U2 Said to Play Role at Apple Event
description: For Apples big announcement on Tuesday, expect some big news about the iPhone, and also about the companys latest product, the so-called iWatch.

title: Thom Browne: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: The Row: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Pastor With a Punch
description: In this short documentary, a pastor runs a fight ministry out of his church in Rochester, N.Y.

title: Reading the Times With Anna Deavere Smith
description: Anna Deavere Smith, the actress-playwright, reads the paper most days, almost always in paper form on Sundays. Why? Habit, she says.

title: Pastor With a Punch
description: Can you love your neighbor as yourself and at the same time knee him in the face as hard as you can?

title: Banks Face Tension Over Sales of In-House Products
description: Since the market collapse of 2008, scrutiny has intensified on the way large banks and securities firms treat their brokerage customers, particularly when it comes to steering them into the firms own products.

title: Veronica Beard: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Keep Your Data Yours While Traveling
description: Josh Shields, a corporate pilot, spends 180 days a year flying around the world, often to Asia and Europe. He carries two laptops, an iPad and two iPhones  all of which, he realizes, are vulnerable to data breaches.

title: After First Plan Is Blocked, Virginia Governor Reduces Medicaid Expansion Goals
description: After fuming at state lawmakers and threatening unilateral action, Gov. Terry McAuliffe of Virginia took only modest steps on Monday to extend health care to the poor and disabled, retreating on the issue he has chosen to define his first eight months in office.

title: Zero + Maria Cornejo: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Brazilian Soccer Pursues a Remake by Returning to Its Past
description: MIAMI  It takes a bit of courage to start everything over, and it is not yet clear if the people shaping the course of soccer in Brazil have quite enough of it.

title: Coalition Urges Nations to Decriminalize Drugs and Drug Use
description: A coalition of political figures from around the world, including Kofi Annan, the former United Nations secretary general, and several former European and Latin American presidents, is urging governments to decriminalize a variety of illegal drugs and set up regulated drug markets within their own countries.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 4
description: Parties for Diane von Furstenberg and Opening Ceremony.

title: Digital Paywall Companies Piano Media and Press Plus to Merge
description: Two of the biggest companies helping news organizations set up digital paywalls merged this week and hired a former newspaper executive as chief.

title: Some Get the Point: Tommy Hilfiger, Diane von Furstenberg, Carolina Herrera, the Row
description: There is some cosmic justice in the fact that the spring ready-to-wear season is taking place just as women  and what they want  are becoming a focus of attention everywhere, from Hollywood (female action heroes pay!) to Congress (choice gets them to the voter booth!).

title: New York Fashion Week Social Media Roundup, Day 5
description: Opting for an unfashionably early, unusually quiet and ruckus-proof slot, Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen jump-started the fifth day of Fashion Week with The Rows ethereal, airy show. Carolina Herreras colorful, flower-inspired designs came next, followed by a cacophonous drum set at Tommy Hilfiger (along with another sighting of the reality-star-turned-model Kendall Jenner).

title: Charges Dropped Against Climate Activists
description: FALL RIVER, Mass.  In May 2013, two environmental activists piloted a lobster boat close to the vast pile of coal at the Brayton Point Power Station, the hulking plant that overlooks this industrial inlet near the border between Massachusetts and Rhode Island.

title: Forget Video; the Facts Are Shocking Enough
description: Did N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell see the video of Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice cold-cocking his fiance in an Atlantic City elevator before that video appeared on the Internet on Monday?

title: S. Truett Cathy, Chick-fil-A Founder, Dies at 93
description: When he introduced himself, S. Truett Cathy often played down his job.

title: Zac Posen: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Washington: Closings and Layoffs for Megachurch
description: An evangelical megachurch based in the Seattle area has announced that it is closing several campuses and laying off staff members because criticism of the churchs founding pastor has caused a drop in attendance and contributions. The megachurch, Mars Hill Church, said it would merge three campuses in Seattle and end its affiliation with one in Phoenix; abandon a plan to open a campus in Los Angeles; and prepare to close a campus in Huntington Beach, Calif., unless fund-raising there improved. It also said it was laying off a significant but unspecified number of employees. The church has been hurt by criticism of its senior pastor, Mark Driscoll, a prominent speaker and author who has come under fire for his management style, which some found to be inappropriately bullying. Mr. Driscoll is on a voluntary leave while a church panel reviews complaints against him.

title: For Opening Ceremony, an Operatic Curtain Raiser
description: What was it Shakespeare said? All the worlds a runway, and all the men and women merely players?

title: Ebola Cases Reported Up Sharply in Liberia
description: The World Health Organization issued a dire Ebola warning on Monday concerning Liberia, saying that the number of afflicted patients was increasing exponentially, that nearly all the country has confirmed cases and that all new treatment facilities were overwhelmed, pointing to a large but previously invisible caseload.

title: Christie Unilaterally Lifts Sports-Betting Prohibition
description: In his most aggressive gambit yet to bring sports betting to the aid of New Jerseys ailing casino industry, Gov. Chris Christie issued a directive on Monday saying that the state would not prosecute casinos and racetracks for accepting wagers on most athletic contests.

title: Google Is Target of European Backlash on U.S. Tech Dominance
description: BRUSSELS  A top German official called for Google to be broken up. A French minister pronounced the company a threat to his countrys sovereignty. A European publishing executive likened it to a Wagnerian dragon.

title: Respiratory Virus Sickens Children in the Midwest
description: A virus that causes severe respiratory illness has sickened dozens of children in Illinois and Missouri and may be fueling outbreaks in at least 10 other states, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Monday.

title: Off the Runway: Day Five
Alibaba Begins Wooing Wall Street
description: About 15 years ago, Jack Ma traveled to Silicon Valley to raise a few million dollars for his newborn company, the Alibaba Group. Few at the time showed any willingness to hand over the cash.

title: Magda Olivero, Frenzy-Inspiring Soprano, Dies at 104
description: Magda Olivero, an Italian soprano who for decades whipped audiences around the world into a frenzy of adulation that was operatic even by operatic standards  despite the fact that by her own ready admission she did not possess an especially lovely voice  died on Monday in Milan. She was 104.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 4
description: Parties for Diane von Furstenberg and Opening Ceremony. See more photos.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 3
They Built It. People Came. Now They Go.
description: ZUMPANGO, Mexico  In an enormous housing development on the edge of this scrappy commuter town, Lorena Serranos 11-foot-wide shoe box of a home is flanked by abandoned houses. The neighborhood has two schools, a few bodegas and a small community center that offers zumba classes.

title: As Obama Makes Case, Congress Is Divided on Campaign Against Militants
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Tuesday will begin laying out his case for an expanded military campaign against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria when he faces congressional leaders who are averse to taking an election-year stand but are being pushed by lawmakers who want a say in matters of war.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 8, 2014
Becoming a Real Person
description: This summer, The New Republic published the most read article in that magazines history. It was an essay by William Deresiewicz, drawn from his new book, Excellent Sheep: The Miseducation of the American Elite and the Way to a Meaningful Life.

title: Hawks Owner Had His Struggles With Two Atlanta Sports Franchises
description: In the late 1970s, frustrated with his job editing an energy-industry newsletter in Washington, Bruce Levenson set out on his own, joining with a colleague to publish the Oil Express out of warehouse space atop the Capitol Hill liquor store that Levensons father owned.

title: When Yes Means Yes
description: The California Legislature recently approved a bill that would require colleges receiving state-financed student aid to change the definition of consent in their sexual assault policies, replacing the traditional no means no standard with affirmative consent, known colloquially as yes means yes. The burden would rest on the student initiating sex to obtain a yes, rather than on the intended partner to convey a no. Gov. Jerry Brown has until the end of September to sign the bill, which he should.

title: Advocates Voice Dismay Over Delay on Immigration
description: For Seleste Wisniewski, a mother of four in Ohio, President Obamas decision to delay executive action on immigration until after the midterm elections in November was an especially disappointing blow. It means that her Mexican husband is likely to be deported in the coming days.

title: Obsolete Zero Tolerance on Pot
description: Even marijuana companies dont want their employees stoned on the job. But in states that have legalized marijuana for recreational or medical use, many employers have retained or imposed no tolerance policies, penalizing workers for off-premise activity that is perfectly legal.

title: Confronting the ISIS Threat
description: President Obama said on Sunday that now is the time to start going on some offense against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, or ISIS, the Sunni extremist group that is overrunning northern Iraq and has a stronghold in Syria. That would be a serious escalation of the American role there.

title: U.S. Delegation Is to Visit Moscow to Review Claims of a Missile Violation
description: WASHINGTON  With the prospects for future cooperation on arms control hanging in the balance, the Obama administration is sending a team of senior officials to Moscow this week to try to resolve American allegations that Russia has violated a landmark nuclear accord.

title: After 18th Slam, a Relieved Serena Williams Looks to No. 19
description: Serena Williams saved her up-and-down year by winning the United States Open, her 18th Grand Slam singles title, but she still had work to do after match point.

title: Remembering 9/11 by Celebrating the Tenacity of a Tree That Survived
description: THE National September 11 Memorial and Museum in New York is commemorating the 13th anniversary of the 2001 terrorist attacks with a new video narrated by Whoopi Goldberg, and a Twitter-enabled fund-raising campaign.

title: A President Whose Assurances Have Come Back to Haunt Him
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama addresses the nation on Wednesday to explain his plan to defeat Islamic extremists in Iraq and Syria, it is a fair bet he will not call them the JV team.

title: Inversion Delusion
description: On Monday, the Tax Policy Center in Washington held a panel discussion on the subject of corporate inversions  the practice of taking over a small company in someplace like Ireland or the Netherlands, and then using that takeover to relocate to the foreign country for tax reasons. One of the panelists was John Samuels, the chief tax lawyer for General Electric.

title: Drought-Plagued Phoenix Is Swamped by Rain
description: The good news is that Phoenix, in the midst of another very dry year, got some rain.

title: As Sweden Nears Vote, Center-Right Is Trailing
description: GOTHENBURG, Sweden  The Swedish government ought to be riding high.

description: Here are recommendations in some primary races in todays election. The polls in New York City will be open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m.

title: Electricity Source
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  You might not be aware of this, but this month is the 54th anniversary of the moment at which working your core became a thing. More familiarly, CHUBBY CHECKERs hit The Twist reached No. 1 on the 1960 Billboard Hot 100 chart during the week of Sept. 19.

title: Patrik Ervell: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Climate Change Threatens to Disrupt the Ranges of Birds
description: More than half of the approximately 650 bird species in North America could be severely affected by climate change, scientists from the National Audubon Society predicted in a study released Monday.

title: Climate Change Will Disrupt Half of North Americas Bird Species, Study Says
description: The Baltimore oriole will probably no longer live in Maryland, the common loon might leave Minnesota, and the trumpeter swan could be entirely gone.

title: Somalia: Rebels Kill at Least 12 in Attack on Convoy
description: At least 12 people were killed and more than 27 were wounded on Monday when suicide bombers attacked a convoy carrying African Union troops and Somali officials south of the capital, officials and witnesses said. The convoy was traveling to Afgooye, about 18 miles south of Mogadishu, the capital, when it was attacked near the Calamada area, above, said Abdulkadir Mohamed Nur Siidii, a regional governor, who was riding in the convoy. One bomber detonated his explosives near a minibus, killing 12 civilians, and the other hit a vehicle in the convoy, officials and witnesses said. Two foreign military advisers and two African peacekeepers were among the wounded, the governor said, but civilians bore the brunt of the attack. The Islamist militant group known as the Shabab claimed responsibility for the attack. The leader of the Shabab, Ahmed Abdi Godane, was killed in a recent American airstrike, and the group has vowed to avenge his death.

title: Shifting Polls in Scotland Send Investors Rushing for Shelter
description: Scotland, home to just five million people, has never weighed on the minds of currency traders and market investors the way that Russia or China or the eurozone has  until now.

title: Federal Reserve Signals Intent to Pressure Largest Banks to Slim Down
description: The Federal Reserve, mindful that some banks are still so big that their failure could weigh on the wider economy, said on Monday that it planned to increase the pressure on large financial firms to shrink.

title: Storm Triggers Flash Floods in Arizona
description: Scenes of the severe rainfall and flooding that caused power outages and school closures in Arizona on Monday.

title: Rag & Bone: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Support in Coca-Cola Vote Depends on How the Math Is Done
description: In the spring, in the face of increasing questions about Coca-Colas proposed new compensation plan, the chairwoman of the companys compensation committee, Maria Elena Lagomasino, declared at Cokes annual meeting, We are pleased that we are seeing broad-based investor support for this plan.

title: Giants Shiny New Look Has a Rusty Old Feel
description: DETROIT  Season-opening games can be symbolic and motivational. For the Giants, the idea was to use their visit to Ford Field to prove that this revamped team was new and different.

title: Seven Broadway Theaters Will Dim Lights for Joan Rivers
description: Seven of Broadways 40 theaters will dim their marquee lights at 6:45 p.m. Tuesday to honor Joan Rivers, following an outcry among some theater producers and others that Ms. Rivers  a Tony Award nominee for best actress in 1994  deserved the tribute.

title: Floress Sacrifice Fly Caps Mets Ninth-Inning Rally
description: It took six pitches for the Mets to flip what looked to be another dismal loss into a late win over the Colorado Rockies at Citi Field on Monday night.

description: ALBANY  Air shows. Food banks. Himalayan salt sanctuaries.

title: A Rich Plan in New Yorks Casino Race Is No Sure Thing for Cuomo
description: TUXEDO, N.Y.  As New York State considers a roulette wheels worth of options for how it should enter the Las Vegas-style casino business, none is as audacious as the proposal of a Malaysian conglomerate called Genting Group.

title: Obama Hosts Foreign Policy Experts, Laying Groundwork for Speech on ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  In an effort to win over elite opinion before a speech to the nation this week on Iraq and Syria, President Obama played host at a White House dinner on Monday evening for a bipartisan group of prominent foreign policy experts.

title: Two Die in Murder-Suicide on Queens Street, Police Say
description: A man killed a woman and then shot himself on a busy street in Flushing, Queens, on Monday after they had an argument, the police said.

title: Where Nishikori Learned to Play, Support in Grand Proportions
description: MATSUE, Japan  The residents of this town poured in by the hundreds in the predawn hours, filling the main auditorium at the Shimane Prefectural Convention Center to watch on a huge screen as their native son took a shot at winning the United States Open.

title: Juniors, Legendary Restaurant, Is to Stay in Brooklyn
description: Juniors Restaurant has earned a lot of superlatives since it opened in Downtown Brooklyn on Election Day in 1950, among them the one that adorns every orange takeout box: The Best Cheesecake in N.Y.  New York Magazine (a distinction that dates to 1973, but still).

title: Councilman to Propose Bill to Regulate Costumed Characters Soliciting in Times Square
description: Over the vocal objections of several Elmos, a few Mickey Mouses and a Buzz Lightyear, a member of the City Council announced legislation on Monday to regulate Times Squares ubiquitous costumed characters and their occasionally aggressive solicitations.

title: The Timess Baghdad Bureau Chief Answers Questions on Iraq
description: Tim Arango, The New York Timess Baghdad bureau chief since 2010, answered questions on the popular Ask Me Anything section of the social site Reddit. Mr. Arangos recent coverage has focused on the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, or ISIS, as the Sunni militant group has seized territory across the region. He reported last week on the only known survivor of an ISIS massacre that took place in June.

title: David Carr Interviews Dean Baquet
description: Four months ago, Dean Baquet became executive editor after the dismissal of Jill Abramson. Last week, he was interviewed by David Carr, a media columnist, before an audience of Times Premier subscribers and their guests in the Times building.
