title: M.L.B.s Schedule Will Begin Later Than Usual in 2015
description: Major League Baseball will avoid some of the unfriendly weather of early spring by not beginning the 2015 season until Sunday night, April 5, with the more traditional opening day following on Monday.

title: Whats On TV Tuesday
description: 9 P.M. (13) ROBIN WILLIAMS REMEMBERED: A PIONEERS OF TELEVISION SPECIAL Pam Dawber, Henry Winkler, Yakov Smirnoff, Louie Anderson, Paul Rodriguez, Penny Marshall and Whoopi Goldberg, among others, pay tribute to Williams (above right, with Mr. Winkler), who died on Aug. 11. This hourlong special chronicles his life through film clips of significant moments in his career, his last full-length television interview and one with his mentor Jonathan Winters.

title: Packers May Be Less Forgiving of Jets Miscues
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The Jets have played only one game, so that is all they have to go on. They reviewed video of this game. They discussed this game. They corrected the mistakes they made in this game.

description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, September 9, 2014
description: We are afraid of Google.

title: Trial of Chinese Human Rights Campaigner Is to Begin
description: HONG KONG  The trial of Yang Maodong, a human rights activist accused of assembling a crowd to disrupt public order, will begin in southern China this week, his lawyer and his sister said on Tuesday. They said Mr. Yang, who has long been at the forefront of contentious causes, would fight the charge but acknowledged that he was likely to be convicted and imprisoned.

title: Test Yourself | Texting Anxiety Caused by Little Bubbles
description: Below are six paragraphs from the Aug. 29 essay about texting, Bubbles Carry a Lot of Weight.

title: Malaysian Jet Over Ukraine Was Downed by High-Energy Objects, Dutch Investigators Say
description: BRUSSELS  Eight weeks after a Malaysia Airlines plane disintegrated over eastern Ukraine, killing all 298 people aboard and triggering a frenzy of East-West finger-pointing, investigators, in their first account of the calamity on Tuesday, released evidence consistent with an attack by a surface-to-air missile but shed no clear light on who was responsible.

title: 6 Qs About the News | When Worker Bees Get a Promotion
description: In the ScienceTake video When Worker Bees Get a Promotion, James Gorman explains new discoveries about bee behavior.

title: Are Subprime Mortgages Coming Back?
description: Ali and Mariluci Sleiman wanted to buy a house. The couple, who run a day care service inside their first-floor rental apartment, had outgrown their space in Taunton, a small city in southern Massachusetts. They also wanted to avoid answering to a landlord who might complain about 10 little kids running around all day. They were desperate to buy a home, Ali told me. And with good credit and $46,000 in joint income, they hoped they wouldnt have a hard time getting a loan. So they were disappointed when the bank rejected their application, and then when a local credit union did too.

title: Do Sports Teams Have a Responsibility to Hold Players to a Standard for Their Personal Conduct?
description: The Baltimore Ravens dropped the star running back Ray Rice from the team after TMZ published a graphic video Monday of him punching his former fiance, who is now his wife. Before the video had emerged, the N.F.L. had only suspended Rice in July for two games  a decision that drew immediate criticism from commentators to players to womens advocates.

title: Near Death, and Overmedicated
description: How sick and disabled, how far into advanced dementia, how close to death do elderly nursing home patients have to be before their physicians stop prescribing drugs that can cause uncomfortable side effects but show scant evidence of helping them?

title: How Much of the Worst Summer of News Ever Can You Take?
description: In case youve been living under a rock, this summer has been full of catastrophic news. Since June, Boko Haram has continued to kidnap girls and women in northeastern Nigeria, Ukrainian separatists shot down Malaysia Flight 17, the death toll in Syria surpassed 190,000 and thousands of children from Central America trekked to the UnitedStates border to flee unprecedented violence.

title: A Witness to AIDS in South Africa
description: At the turn of the millennium, when the AIDS epidemic raged unchecked through South Africa with devastating consequences, the rural areas were worst hit. In the mens ward of the impoverished Hlabisa Hospital in rural KwaZulu-Natal, patients shared mattresses on the floor, the terminally ill were sent home to die because of nonexistent facilities and unclaimed corpses were buried in unadorned mass graves on the outskirts of town.

title: Chinese State Broadcaster Gets Its American Rices Confused
description: China Central Television mistakenly used images of Condoleezza Rice, the former United States secretary of state who left office in 2009, in a report on Sunday about the national security adviser Susan E. Rices visit to Beijing, which continued on Tuesday. The state-run broadcaster quickly corrected the gaffe, however. A day later, it posted on its website a version of the English-language report complete with images of the Obama administration official, according to The South China Morning Post. (The correct Rice is pictured below.)

title: Rakuten of Japan to Buy Ebates, a U.S. Rebate Site, for $1 Billion
description: The Japanese e-commerce giant Rakuten has its eye on America.

title: New York Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 6

title: Man Booker Prize Shortlist Announced
description: LONDON  The American authors Joshua Ferris and Karen Joy Fowler are among the six writers selected for the shortlist of the 2014 Man Booker Prize for Fiction, announced on Tuesday. Also on the shortlist are three British writers  Howard Jacobson, Neel Mukherjee and Ali Smith  and the Australian Richard Flanagan. The winner of the prize, worth around $80,000 and widely considered the most prestigious literary award in Britain, will be announced on Oct.14.

title: BGC Partners Makes $675 Million Counteroffer for GFI Group
description: A bidding war is breaking out for the GFI Group, a New York brokerage and clearing firm, as its rival BGC Partners said on Tuesday that it had offered about $675 million in cash for the firm.

title: Karzai Appeals for Afghan Unity, but Ceremony Collapses in Discord
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzai on Tuesday pleaded for national unity and a speedy settlement to Afghanistans political crisis, but the event at which he spoke was marred by hooting and catcalls that brought it to an early end.

title: When Employees Knock Their Bosses on Social Media
description: Editors Note: Adriana Gardella will be reporting periodically on legal issues affecting small businesses. If you know of an issue or case that you would like to call to her attention, you can email her at adriana.gardella@nytimes.com.

description: Welcome to our first news quiz of the academic year, this one covering two weeks of headlines.

description: Plans to target ISIS in Syria may end up helping President Assad.

title: What a Republican Edge in Alaska Could Mean
description: We know very little about what voters are thinking in Alaska. There havent been many polls, and the few polls we have are from partisan firms or those using new methods. Alaska is the only state where there has not been a single traditional live-interview poll so far this year.

title: What You Dont Know About Rob Portman Probably Wont Hurt Him
description: Mentioning the name of Rob Portman, the Ohio senator, as a potential Republican nominee in 2016 gets this reaction, especially from Republicans: Really?

title: Morning Agenda: Feds Diet Plan for Banks
description: The Federal Reserve said on Monday that it planned to increase the pressure on large financial institutions to slim down, DealBooks Peter Eavis writes. In testimony he will give before the Senate Banking Committee on Tuesday, Daniel K. Tarullo, the Fed governor who oversees regulatory policies, signaled the central banks plan to propose special capital requirements for the largest banks that will be even higher than those demanded under international banking regulations.

title: Before Pearl Harbor, Emperor Warned Against War
description: MATSUE, Japan  Before Japans attack on Pearl Harbor, Emperor Hirohito criticized plans to go to war with the United States as self-destructive and opposed an alliance with Nazi Germany, though he did little to stop the war that Japan waged in his name, according to the long-awaited official history of his reign released on Tuesday.

title: When Spell-Check Cant Help
description: Another batch of sound-alike mix-ups  all of which weve seen before. Put them on your watch list.

title: A Smartwatch, iPhone 6 and More: Highlights and Analysis From Apples Keynote
description: Apple on Tuesday announced two new versions of the iPhone, the 6 and the 6 Plus, both with bigger screens than their predecessors. It also introduced a payments system that integrates with its smartphones.

title: In Queens, a Triple Killing Shows Signs of Financial Strife
description: In a short note written in Korean to a relative, Jong Lee complained of having too many problems in his life. The note did not elaborate on the nature of his problems, but those who knew the Queens man were aware of serious financial setbacks for his family, according to a police official who viewed a New York Police Department translation of the document.

title: Primaries in Northeast Set the Stage for the Fall
description: BOSTON  Gina M. Raimondo, the Democratic treasurer of Rhode Island, who risked her political future by overhauling the states troubled pension system and alienating its powerful labor unions, won a convincing victory on Tuesday to become her partys nominee for governor.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

description: President Obama is expected on Wednesday to present his argument for airstrikes against ISIS in Syria, but past statements may hurt his appeal to the public.

title: Thousands of Migrants Forced to Leave Israel, Rights Group Says
description: JERUSALEM  Thousands of Sudanese migrants to Israel and hundreds of Eritreans have returned to their home countries this year as a result of an Israeli policy that amounts to unlawful coercion, Human Rights Watch said Tuesday. The group said the migrants had been left few other options even though they were at risk of imprisonment or abuse at the hands of repressive governments back home, and despite protections Israel is obligated to provide under international treaties.

title: Scale of Flooding Hinders Relief Efforts in India and Pakistan
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  After nearly a week of incessant rains and flooding that have left hundreds of people dead in Pakistan and the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir, rescue operations have been strained by the scale of the disaster and a collapse of communications networks in some areas.

title: All American
description: With the passage of time and a sleeker cut, the leather jacket  that perennial symbol of small-town misspent youth  has grown up.

title: 1889: Italy to Expel Hungarian
description: TURIN  It is announced on good authority that, at the request of the German Government, Signor Crispi has decided to expel Louis Kossuth, the Hungarian patriot, from Italy. The reasons upon which the request is founded are the visit of 800 Hungarians to Kossuth, and the speech the latter made against the policy of the Tisza Ministry. Not long after this the hero of the insurrection of 1848 said that it was greatly to be regretted that Hungary and Italy had placed themselves in a position which might force them into a war with France. This naturally gave great offence at Berlin and Vienna, and the German Foreign Office sent a note to Rome to the effect that the toleration of such language was incompatible with the conventions of the Triple Alliance.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 10, 1889

title: Toronto Festival 2014: Ingredients of an Oscar Winner?
description: TORONTOHow to describe The Imitation Game, Harvey Weinsteins latest play in the annual Academy Awards game?

title: At the Helm of Military Mission in Iraq, an Invisible General

In fact, he folded the tent there at the end of 2011 when the Obama administration failed to reach a deal with Baghdad to keep a small military contingent and ended an eight-year war unceremoniously.

title: Zac Posen: Seams, Shoulders and Sway
description: A fashion designer who names several garments in his collection for the sculptor Constantin Brancusi is displaying some nerve, but then Zac Posen has never been known for the modesty of his associations.

title: 1914: Belgians Flood Battlefield
description: ANTWERP It is possible now to realize what took place on Saturday and on Sunday [Sept. 6] in the combat at Termonde. There were about 7,000 Belgians, and they had to retire after a stiff fight. Having been reinforced, they returned to the fray, and the Germans had to retire whence they had come. Then the defenders flooded the country by opening the dykes, and the retreating Teutons were caught.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 10, 1914

title: After Ferguson Unrest, Senate Reviews Use of Military-Style Gear by Police

title: Can a Book Ever Change a Readers Life for the Worse?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. The book that changed my life is usually taken to mean for the better. This week, Leslie Jamison and Francine Prose discuss whether a book can ever transform a readers life for the worse.

title: Barnes & Noble Revenue Is Off, but Loss Narrows
description: Barnes & Noble reported a smaller first-quarter loss on Tuesday thanks to cost-cutting, but the struggling retailer, the countrys biggest bookseller, could not stave off a 7 percent decline in sales.

description: WASHINGTON  Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky likes to note that he didnt have a foreign policy three and a half years ago, when he was a full-time ophthalmologist.

title: Punishments for Insider Trading Are Growing Stiffer
description: The nine-year prison term given to Mathew Martoma is only the latest in a string of sentences that is starting to make the punishment for insider trading rival that for crimes like robbery and assault. It raises the question of why sentences for insider trading are reaching levels once considered impossible for something that was not even prosecuted until the late 1970s.

title: N.F.L. Continues to Face Questions Over Video of Ray Rice
description: The N.F.L. remained on the defensive Tuesday as questions mounted over its handling of the domestic abuse case involving one of its star running backs, Ray Rice.

title: Readers Protest Hate Speech in Comments Section on Down Syndrome
description: It started with the biologist Richard Dawkins, who on Twitter last month suggested that women have a moral obligation to abort their fetuses after they get a Down syndrome diagnosis. Responding to a question from a pregnant woman, he wrote: Abort it and try again. It would be immoral to bring it into the world if you have the choice, he wrote on Twitter. He said that he based this on his belief that suffering should be reduced whenever possible.

title: Weaving a Tale of Love and Death in London
description: LONDON  A few years ago, the British novelist Sarah Waters was playing around with ideas for her next book when she remembered a notorious 1920s trial she had once read about. Known popularly as the Thompson-Bywaters case, it featured a penny dreadfuls worth of combustible ingredients: an unexciting husband, a faithless wife, her much younger lover and a cache of racy, damning love letters.

title: A Star-Studded Album to Honor Paul McCartney
description: Tribute albums have become a sub-industry of the pop music world and collectors who snap them up, either because they are fans of the musician being honored or because they include covers by musicians they like, have come to be wary of them: many are nearly useless, some are must-haves.

title: Making New Friends: In Praise of Name Tags
description: This is a not-so-serious ode on a not-so-serious subject: the name tag. Oh, how I adore that little scrap of stick-on paper or the clip-on plastic that makes being new in social situations so much less stressful.

title: Inez and Vinoodh Guest-Edit the Latest Issue of Aperture Magazine
description: Yes, it is possible for even the most die-hard followers of fashion to become weary of the subject  especially in the full throes of the spring shows, just after the September issues have thumped weightily to the newsstands. Here, then, for Fashion Week-weary eyes, is something new, through the lens of something old: the restlessly innovative husband-and-wife photographer-collaborators Inez van Lamsweerde and Vinoodh Matadin have guest-edited the fall issue of Aperture magazine, which is dedicated to Fashion  quotation marks intentional.

title: Ignoring the Warnings for a Honeymoon in Mexico
description: They told us to not go to Mexico. Too dangerous: drugs, machine guns and black-masked kidnappers. But it was January, the dead of Montana winter, and we unbolted the back seat of the station wagon and transformed it into a camper, a mattress in back, curtains over the windows, surfboards on the roof.

title: Restaurant Report: Guzina Oaxaca in Mexico City
description: For the past 18 years, the chef Alejandro Ruz has built Casa Oaxaca into one of the most popular restaurants in Oaxaca City, drawing in customers with his chic interpretations of traditional classics. Now hes hoping to do the same in Mexicos capital, where Oaxacan food  despite its reputation as a culturally rich, complex cuisine  is still rare as an upscale dining option.

description: Nine Off-Broadway theater works from recent seasons, including the Public Theaters presentation of Richard Nelsons cycle The Apple Family Plays, will get a much wider audience this fall on New York City public television station WNET/Channel 13.

description: Local 802 of the American Federation of Musicians, which represents the players in the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra, announced on Tuesday that its members had ratified the labor agreement that the union negotiated with the Metropolitan Opera last month.

title: How Unemployment Insurance Helps Prevent Foreclosures
description: An updated tally by Moodys Analytics shows that 6.5 million homeowners have lost their homes in the housing bust so far. And for most of them, the proximate cause of foreclosure was unemployment. Losing a job meant losing the income to pay the mortgage, while depressed house values meant that struggling homeowners could not tap their equity to help cover their monthly expenses or sell at a price high enough to pay off their mortgage.

title: In A.F.C. East, Also-Rans Get Jump on Longtime Power

title: Food News Around New York
description: To Feast: Spoons of the Elite Will Stir Same Pot

title: Violence Against Children: Difficult and Heartbreaking to Report
description: In May, authorities found Maya Ranot, a 12-year-old girl, in a pool of blood in her Queens kitchen, her wrist cut to the bone. Allegations later surfaced that Maya had been locked up, starved and beaten at various times between December 2012 and last May in what one news outlet called a house of horrors. The Queens district attorney announced abuse charges against Mayas father and stepmother in August. The stepmother was accused of slashing Mayas wrist with a broken metal broom handle.

title: Broadway Theaters Will Dim Lights for Joan Rivers After All
description: Broadway industry leaders reversed themselves on Tuesday and decided to dim the lights on their 40 theater marquees in honor of Joan Rivers, after an outcry from theater producers and artists like Audra McDonald and Harvey Fierstein that Ms. Rivers deserved the tribute.

title: Molly Wood on Phablets
description: Times technology columnist Molly Wood explains why Apple would benefit from offering a phone with a bigger screen.

title: Rise in Drug Use Is Found in Pilots Killed in Crashes
description: Pilots killed in airplane crashes in 2012 tested positive for drugs four times more often than those killed in 1990, according to a study by the National Transportation Safety Board, although drawing a causal link between drugs and crashes was difficult.

title: Toronto Festival 2014: Keira Knightley and Laggies
description: The actress Keira Knightley has two films at the Toronto International Film Festival, appearing both in the period drama The Imitation Game with Benedict Cumberbatch, and starring in Laggies, a Lynn Shelton comedy. In this video, she discusses the film about a young woman at a crossroads, and the friendship she develops with a teenager (Chlo Grace Moretz).

title: Have Apple Questions? We Have Answers.
description: For weeks, there have been rumors and speculation about Apples product announcements on Tuesday. Now that the company has announced its new iPhone 6 and 6 Plus, as well as its new payments system, we can get some answers.

title: Buy Condo, Then Add Parking Spot for $1 Million
description: What will $1 million buy in New York City? A diamond-encrusted Cartier mens watch. A small fleet of 2014 Bentley Continentals. Or maybe your very own parking spot in SoHo.

title: Rodarte: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Apples Live-Streaming Is Terrible
description: Finally, Apples product announcements have arrived. But for anyone wanting to watch the live-streaming, well, its extremely awkward.

title: Take-Private Deals Are Nearly Extinct on Wall Street
description: The private equity firms of Wall Street have all but stopped taking companies private.

title: An Apartment in the Marais, With Complications and Family Secrets
description: Perky music and a suave, light-footed entrance by Kevin Kline as an American in Paris give the early scenes of My Old Lady the feel of a Franco-American comedy in the vein of Cdric Klapischs recent Chinese Puzzle. But the 75-year-old playwright Israel Horovitzs screen adaptation of his own 2002 production is not what it initially appears to be.

title: Ex-Player Charged in Sale of Pills to Derek Boogaard
description: Two weeks before he died of an overdose in 2011, Derek Boogaard of the Rangers was excused from his substance-abuse rehabilitation in California and returned to New York. He drove to Long Island, as he had done many times in the months before, and paid a man for illegally obtained prescription painkillers. This time, rather than cash, Boogaard paid with a personal check.

title: Hawke, Gere to Be Honored at New York Film Festival
description: The Film Society of Lincoln Center will honor Ethan Hawke and Richard Gere in separate tributes as part of the New York Film Festival. Each will be the subject of one of the festivals An Evening With programs  Mr. Hawke on Sept. 30, Mr. Gere on Oct. 8. The An Evening With galas are meant to recognize the work of individuals who have made significant artistic contributions to film culture, the society said.

title: Libyan Refugees Stream to Tunisia for Care, and Tell of a Home That Is Torn Apart
description: SFAX, Tunisia  Libyans seeking medical care and a refuge from war are filling the private clinics in this coastal Tunisian city for the second time in three years, bringing with them fresh accounts of the violence racking their country.

title: Hopes for a Strong El Nio Fade in California
description: Long-term weather forecasters say it is now unlikely that a strong El Nio will develop this fall, dimming hopes in California for heavy rains that might bring relief from a severe drought.

title: How It Happens | El Nio
description: The weather phenomenon known as El Nio can cause dramatic effects around the world. Henry Fountain explains where it comes from.

title: The Trick to Those Piercing Eyes (and Brows) at Rodarte
description: The makeup artist James Kaliardos has lent his face-painting skills to the Rodarte designers Kate and Laura Mulleavy for so many seasons now that he jokes, we almost have a psychic connection. And backstage at Rodartes spring/summer 2015 fashion show today, the runway look he created was evidence of that bond. On the eyes, he buffed a dark pink-brown tone from the new Nars St-Paul-De-Vence Duo Eyeshadow palette over the lid, pulling the shade around the outer corners in a downward arc. Its inspired by how Laura does her makeup, Kaliardos noted of the quirky technique. She does this thing where she drags down the corner of her eye shadow, and I thought, Thats kinda cool.' Underneath, he traced a thin line of Nars Larger Than Life Long-Wear Eyeliner in Rue Bonaparte to lift up the eyes and dusted on a gold metallic shade for a little glitz. But the real attention-getter: the faux piercings that half the models wore on their brows. Theyre just cool facial accessories, Kaliardos said of the silver rings adhered with glue. The model Kristina Petrosiute appreciated the (temporary) shock value. I took a photo and sent it to my boyfriend, she said. He was like, You look weird! But I like it! For Xiao Wen Ju, the experience might even lead to some real piercings. The eyebrow is not my style, but maybe I would do the lip, she said. I think the lip is really sexy.

title: The Risk in the General Mills Deal for Annies
description: General Mills risks smothering its latest acquisition target.

title: Wheelies: The Sonata Star Power Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: The Promise of Smoother Waters
description: You can count on one hand the chefs in New York who serve bluefish. Narrow the list to those with the confidence to serve it raw, and youre probably down to one finger and one name: Dave Pasternack.

title: Michael Schumacher Moved Home to Continue Rehabilitation
description: The family of Michael Schumacher, the 45-year-old former Formula One champion, said Tuesday that he had been moved from a hospital in Lausanne, Switzerland, to the family estate 25 miles away on Lake Geneva. They also said that efforts to rehabilitate him after the severe brain injuries he suffered while skiing in France nine months ago will continue from now on from home.

title: In Nashville, Cooking and the Kings of Leon
description: In Nashville, it can be difficult to focus on anything but music, but this month the Kings of Leon, Nashville musicians themselves, are helping put the spotlight on the citys culinary and cocktail scene at the second annual Music City Food and Wine Festival.

title: Senator McCaskills Opening Statement
description: Senator Claire McCaskill of Missouri spoke Tuesday at a hearing by the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs on local police militarization.

title: A Simple Dump-It Meal for a Busy Tuesday
description: Busy parents. Active kids. Families that arrive home every evening, starved. This week, in the series Dinner: The Boot Camp, Jenny Rosenstrach takes a recipe for chaos and coaches one family, and all of us, in the planning and preparation needed to turn it into a pleasant nightly meal. Find all the Boot Camp recipes here.

title: Narrow Health Networks: Maybe Theyre Not So Bad
description: Lots of people shopping in the new health care marketplaces this year picked health plans that limited their choice of doctors and hospitals. The plans were popular because they tended to cost less than more conventional plans that covered nearly every health care provider in a region.

title: New Restaurants for the Beekman Hotel
description: Headliner

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 5
description: Parties for Tods store, Calvin Kleins Reveal perfume and InStyles 20th anniversary.

title: The Sex Abuse Tangle
description: My Sunday column dealt with the extremely grim subject of the recent revelations about rape and official indifference in the English city of Rotherham, where Pakistani gangs groomed and sexually assaulted hundred and hundreds of (mostly white) girls and young women while social workers and cops seemed to look the other way. My piece tried to contextualize the grievous failure of the English authorities by linking the disasterto other high-profile cases of sexual abuse in Roman Catholicism, of course, but also in New Yorks private schools, at Joe Paternos Penn State, in Hollywood, elsewhere and after the column appeared I noticed a few readers and Twitterers suggesting that as a Catholic I have an ulterior motive in generalizing about sex abuse, because generalizations are a good way to evade or minimize the particular sins of my own church.

title: Mining the Depths of Loss, Faith and Mortality
description: Lord of the Torrent, King of the Sudden Impulse, Emperor of the Impetuous, Clown of God. The poet Edward Hirschs son, Gabriel, was a handful, and the author and others had many private names for him.

title: The Pros and Cons of Avoiding Credit Cards
description: Millennials are far more likely than older adults to make do without credit cards.

title: Linen Makes a Comeback at New York Fashion Week
description: Flax isnt usually thought of as a high-fashion fabric: The wrinkle-prone textile works well for lived-in bedding and loose, low-key layers for weekend jaunts around Brooklyn. But thanks to a few of New Yorks finest  Victoria Beckham, The Row and Theory  linen has a new lease on life. Victoria Beckham showed a series of mid calf-length belted coats, sleeveless tops and slit skirts in the material. The Rows ethereal spring collection opened with basket-weave linen dresses that coiled around the body like snakes. And in Theorys finely executed minimalist collection, a linen sleeveless trench worn over trousers looked less shabby, more chic.

title: Diesel Black Gold: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Aides to Ayatollah Khamenei Tweet From His Hospital Room
description: As Irans supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, recovers from prostate surgery, his social-media team has been unusually busy, sharing images and video clips on his Twitter feed that show visitors from across the Islamic Republics political spectrum flocking to his hospital room to pay their respects.

title: Introducing Apple Watch
description: Timothy D. Cook, Apples chief executive, introduced a smartwatch, a wearable device that combines health and fitness tracking with communications.

title: Lack of Sleep Is Ruled Factor in 2013 UPS Plane Crash
description: WASHINGTON  Short of sleep, confused about their altitude and relying on inaccurate weather information, the crew members of a UPS cargo plane trying to land at the airport in Birmingham, Ala., omitted several crucial steps that might have kept them from flying their aircraft into the ground in August 2013, investigators of the National Transportation Safety Board said Tuesday.

title: The iPhone 6 Goes Big, as Apple Aims Small With a Smartwatch
description: CUPERTINO, Calif.  After three years as chief executive of Apple, Timothy D. Cook is starting to crystallize his vision for the company.

title: New York Fashion Week: Rodarte Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: In Letter to Botox Maker, Ackman Attacks Board Inaction on Merger Talks
description: William A. Ackman, the billionaire hedge fund manager, has a penchant for writing scathing letters to those who cross him. But since directing his firm, Pershing Square Capital Management, to partner with Valeant Pharmaceuticals on a joint bid for Allergan in April, Mr. Ackman has been relatively restrained.

title: Dreaming of Fashion (Literally)
description: Jan Erickson was inspired to create Janska, a line of comfortable fleece apparel, after a 2002 dream. Shes committed to making the clothing in the United States.

title: Other Wireless Events Struggle to Compete With Apple
description: Today, most of the tech world is focused on Apples foray into larger-screened phones and wearable devices. But why read about that when you can read this post about everything else?

title: A Summer Job Isnt What It Used to Be
description: Once upon a time, hard-working high school students who took a summer job or worked part-time during the school year got an edge over their unemployed peers. Not only did they earn some pocket money which many students saved for college but they were also likely to see increased earning potential long after they graduated.

title: Marcel Dzama, Kim Gordon and Tim Kingsbury of Arcade Fire on Their Offbeat Short Film
description: The Canadian-born artist Marcel Dzama is known for his Dadaist multidisciplinary work  drawings, puppets, dioramas  and his collaborations on standout music videos. He was an art director on The Suburbs, the inventive Arcade Fire short film, and co-directed the spooky No One Does It Like You for Department of Eagles.

title: U2 Releases New Album for Free on Apples iTunes
description: With virtually no advance notice, U2 has released Songs of Innocence, its first album since No Line on the Horizon in 2009. Like Beyonc and Radiohead before them, U2 skipped the elaborate promotional buildup that usually precedes a long-awaited album release. Instead, at 2:55 p.m. Eastern time Apple announced that the album was being given free to every iTunes store customer in 119 countries through Oct. 13. It includes 11 songs and a digital booklet with liner notes by Bono, U2s singer.

title: Fantasy Football: Waiver Wire Picks for Week 2
description: Today we celebrate a day that will live forever in fantasy football infamy. Two years ago, there were quite a few fantasy owners scrambling to pick up a little known receiver on the Dallas Cowboys who had just racked up 114 receiving yards and 2 touchdowns against the Giants.

title: A Closer Look at the Ebola Epidemic in the Context of Ecological Health
description: The Ebola epidemic continues to rage in West Africa, and while it is very unlikely to reach pandemic scale (see The Economist), the outbreak provides a reminder of the linkages between disrupted ecosystems and human illness.

title: Richard W. Davidson
description: Mr. Davidson, 54, is the president and chief executive of Century 21 Real Estate, one of the worlds largest real estate franchisers, with 6,900 offices and 102,000 sales associates in 75 countries and territories.

title: Pegula, Owner of Sabres, to Acquire Bills
description: After a five-month search, Terry Pegula and his family have won the bidding to buy the Buffalo Bills, which were owned by the teams founder, Ralph C. Wilson Jr., until his death in March.

title: What to Make of Wendy Daviss Abortion Revelation
description: It is too early to say whether Wendy Daviss revelation of her own abortion will help, hinder or have no effect on her underdog campaign to become the first Democratic governor of Texas in two decades.

title: Most People Think Theyre Special, but These Think Theyre Divine
description: Peter, Paul and John look down from the stained-glass windows onto 3 Christs, a play staged in the sanctuary of Judson Memorial Church. And boy, have these saints got some preaching to do.

title: A Jet Flies, With Its Problems Never Far Behind
description: Al Jazeera networks documentary division may not yet get a lot of attention in the United States, but Broken Dreams: The Boeing 787 will certainly raise eyebrows. Any time you catch employees of an airplane manufacturer saying they wouldnt want to fly on the companys newest jet, youre bound to make a few waves.

title: Maja Solomon Transforms at Vera Wang
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Maja Solomon before (left) and after (right) makeup by Lucia Pieroni and hair by Paul Hanlon.

title: Giving Voice to the Silent Faces of Couture
description: Clothes may make the man, but does that apply to supermodels? On Monday, at Milk Studios in Chelsea, seven former European supermodels paraded in the most basic of outfits: black turtlenecks, black tights, black heels. Some added white shirts or smocks, but they all wore two most unusual accessories: a headset microphone and a battery pack.

title: Beyond Salmon Burgers
description: HALIBUT COVE, ALASKA  Marian Beck needed a third hand.

title: F.C.C. Chairman Says Wireless Broadband Could Get Stricter Oversight
description: The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission warned the wireless phone industry on Tuesday that the commission was seriously considering subjecting mobile carriers to the same net neutrality regulations as providers of wired Internet service.

title: Cheney Urges House G.O.P. to Abandon Isolationism
description: WASHINGTON  On the eve of President Obamas address to the nation about plans for an escalation of military action in Iraq, former Vice President Dick Cheney came to Capitol Hill on Tuesday to urge House Republicans to embrace a strong military and reject a rising isolationism in his party, but did not discuss the specifics of confronting the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: New York Fashion Week: Diesel Black Gold Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Columbine Goldsmith.

title: A Pursuit That Leaps, Crashes and Swings
description: By the time we hear the words Being careful in an action enterprise is really frowned upon at Streb, theyre pretty much redundant. Weve already seen their speaker, Elizabeth Streb, an intense dancer and choreographer in her 60s, guide her troupe through moves that would give a mixed-martial-arts champion pause.

title: Answers to Questions About Apples Announcements, Including the Watch and iPhone 6
description: Updated | There had been weeks of rumors and speculation about what Apple would announce. On Tuesday, we got a glimpse of the companys new offerings, which included two bigger versions of the iPhone, as well as a smartwatch, dubbed Apple Watch.

title: New Emblem of an Elemental Conflict: Seized West Bank Land
description: WADI FUKIN, West Bank  At the edge of this small Palestinian village, an asphalt road turns into a dirt path that winds through a fertile valley where natural springs irrigate lush plots planted with a rich ratatouille of vegetables, as well as orchards and vines. Goats graze on the steep, rocky slopes, some bare and rugged, others planted with olive and almond trees and pines.

title: Restaurant Story
description: A chat with Tom Sellers, the chef at Restaurant Story in London.

title: What Were Reading
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an email. Sign up

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Mercedes Introduces the 2016 AMG GT
description: Mercedes-Benz announced details about its 2016 AMG GT this week. The cars proportions  long snout, low roof and wide track  make it clear that the GT is a sports car. In case there is any doubt, a powerful twin-turbo V8 hammers the point home. The surprise? Mercedes calls the trunk practical.

title: Does the Apple Watch Look Good On? Assessing From a Fashion Point of View
description: And so it has finally arrived: the long-awaited, much-anticipated Apple Watch. Dont call it an iWatch; this is a new era, people. OMG! OMG! OMG! And all that.

title: Russias Next Land Grab
description: WASHINGTON  UKRAINE isnt the only place where Russia is stirring up trouble. Since the Soviet Union broke up in 1991, Moscow has routinely supported secessionists in bordering states, to coerce those states into accepting its dictates. Its latest such effort is unfolding in the South Caucasus.

title: A Star From Winnetka Blows Into Town
description: When Christine Ebersole was a child growing up in Winnetka, Ill., she recalled on Monday evening, she considered running away from home in the middle of winter because she didnt want to continue piano lessons. In her fantasy, she would swim across Lake Michigan and find a new family with a fairer sense of justice. She never got farther than the back door.

title: Ren Redzepi on Tortillas
description: In the test kitchen of Noma, the celebrated chef and his pastry chef, Rosio Snchez, demonstrate the difficulties of making the Mexican staple.

title: With Apple Watch, a Naming Tradition Ends
description: For 16 years, Apple has bestowed the prefix i on the names of most of its groundbreaking products, from the iMac to the iPad.

title: Sophie Hannah Talks About Rebooting Agatha Christies Poirot
description: Literary reboots can be tricky. Many, like William Boyds James Bond novel and Joanna Trollopes modern take on Jane Austens Sense and Sensibility, have received lukewarm reviews. Some are met with indignation bordering on outrage. Worse than bad fan fiction was what one reviewer called Sebastian Faulkss attempt to channel P.G. Wodehouse in a new Jeeves and Wooster novel.

title: The Push to Keep Scotland in the Fold
description: GLASGOW  With nine days left before Scotland votes on whether to become independent, Britains leaders went into overdrive on Tuesday with efforts to keep the country intact.

title: Pictures of the Day: Australia and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Australia, India, Yemen and California.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 5
description: There was no sign of fatigue as Fashion Week entered its fifth night of partying. See more photos in the slideshow.

title: Marc by Marc Jacobs: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Phone Giants Said to Be Near Joint Bid for Telecom Italias Brazil Unit
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Amrica Mvil of Mexico, Oi of Brazil and Telefnica of Spain are coming together on a joint offer to buy Telecom Italias Brazil operations, TIM Participaes, a person with close knowledge of the negotiations said on Tuesday.

title: Night of Free-Flowing Verse, Booze and Elusive Connections on Dublin Bar Stools
description: The 1st Irish Theater Festival begins this season with Dylan Coburn Grays Boys and Girls at the 59E59 Theaters, a florid account of a night in Dublin. Ribald, lyrical and brisk (at 50 minutes), Boys and Girls, a Dublin Fringe Festival hit, renders in pungent language the contemporary adolescent and postadolescent experience in urban Ireland.

title: Raver-Style Knotted Mohawks at Marc by Marc Jacobs
description: Guests at todays Marc by Marc Jacobs show were greeted with a tower of speakers and colorful lights that immediately read rave. And the parade of styles that followed  clubgoer clothes, latex layering pieces  continued with the theme. The beauty, meanwhile, was a throwback to the 90s-era versions of Gwen Stefani and Bjork, especially the models faux Mohawks made of little hair knots.

title: Mostly White Forces in Mostly Black Towns: Police Struggle for Racial Diversity
description: MAPLE HEIGHTS, Ohio  The population of this working-class Cleveland suburb has gone from nearly all white to two-thirds black since its mayor declared more than 35 years ago that he did not know what a minority is. But its police and fire departments have not kept pace: The Maple Heights police force today still has only two black officers out of 35; the fire department is 100 percent white.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 3
description: Parties for Band of Outsiders and Prabal Gurung. See more photos.

title: Discussing Online Right to Be Forgotten, Google Takes European Privacy Tour to Spain
description: As Google seeks expert advice on how to carry out its right to be forgotten court order in Europe, the company went to Spain on Tuesday, where the whole thing started.

title: Facing Up to Threats of Nature
description: PHILADELPHIA  Weather has become unusually localized in this city. On a recent evening, there wasnt a cloud in the sky. And yet it was raining hard, though only on a few isolated individuals in an alley near City Hall.

title: Trump Entertainment Set to Close Taj Mahal Casino in Atlantic City
description: The second poker chip dropped for Trump Entertainment Resorts on Tuesday, when the company filed for bankruptcy protection and threatened to close the Trump Taj Mahal Casino Resort in Atlantic City by Thanksgiving if it failed to cut expenses drastically.

title: Off the Runway: Day 5
description: Last touches are put on a look for the Theory presentation on West 14th Street on the fifth day of New York Fashion Week. See more photos in slideshow.

title: Theyre a Bit Stiff, but Very Talkative
description: LONDON  Queen Victoria was minding her own business, towering over Blackfriars Bridge in her usual way on a recent afternoon here, when a passer-by, a young woman visiting from South Korea, roused her to speak. The woman had just swiped her smartphone over a plaque at the bottom of Victorias statue, causing the phone to ring and prompting the former queen to speak.

title: Off the Runway: Day 1
description: Lincoln Center is once again filled with action on the first day of New York Fashion Week. See more photos in slideshow.

title: Off the Runway: Day 2
description: A racquet becomes a microphone as models entertain themselves with their props, waiting for the  Moi show to begin on the second day of New York Fashion Week. See more photos in slideshow.

title: Brooklyn Museums Longtime Director Plans to Retire
description: After 17 often tumultuous years as director of the Brooklyn Museum, Arnold L. Lehman announced on Tuesday that he is planning to retire around June of next year.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Carl Icahns Firm Makes a Fat-Finger Error in S.E.C. Filing
description: Automated news headlines briefly flashed that Carl C. Icahn had raised his stake in Gannett, the media company, to nearly 9 percent from 6.6 percent.

title: Off the Runway: Day 6
description: Scenes from J. Crew, Badgley Mischka, Tory Burch and Vera Wang on the sixth day of New York Fashion Week.

title: The Makeup of the F.E.C.
CVS Ends Tobacco Sales
description: To the Editor:

title: A Haven for Luxury Shoes Emerges on Madison Avenue
description: Paul Wilson, the shoemaker at the John Lobb store on Madison Avenue, helps men order bespoke shoes and boots, made from leather and exotic skins like lizard and crocodile.

title: Dennis Hopper Day Descends On Taos, N.M.
description: Marin Hopper, the daughter of the legendary actor, and the founder of the handbag line Hayward, shares her account of the first annual event, which featured a group motorcycle ride along the route of Easy Rider. The photographer Lisa Eisner captured the festivities as they unfolded.

title: Destiny in Taos
description: In the late 1960s at the height of his career, Dennis Hopper left Hollywood for artistic bohemia in New Mexico. His daughter looks back on a man in search of free expression and a more contemplative way of life.

title: Requiring Consent to Sex on Campus
description: To the Editor:

title: Rural Capitals, Big-Time Problems
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  WHILE the threat of another default still looms in Argentina, the country has made headlines for another reason: A growing number of its leaders, including President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner, are starting to line up behind a proposal to move the capital from Buenos Aires to the much smaller (and reportedly sleepy) city of Santiago del Estero, in the middle-north of the country.

title: Budget-Friendly Seattle, From Meals to Massages
description: My friend Doug and I approached the ticket counter at the Seattle Art Museum, where suggested admission is $19.50. Is it true we can actually pay whatever we want to get in? I asked. Like, 1 cent? It was, the man said, so long as we didnt want to see the special exhibitions. And so in tandem we each plunked down a penny. The man did not flinch  or maybe flinched just a little  and printed out our tickets.

title: A Complicated Optimist
description: My father, who died last week at 91, had a complex life that typified that of Jewish men of his generation. But of course when you know someone well, you see just how unusual that life is. Or was.

title: Vietnams Photographic History, Told by the Winners
description: An exhibit shows how North Vietnamese photographers documented their countrys bloody war, volunteering to risk their lives.

title: Cynthia Rowley: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Profile | Studio Job
description: Job Smeets and Nynke Tynagel talk about their collection of curated objects for Chamber boutique on Manhattans West Side.

title: American Horror Story
description: Like the smattering of other Americans who still pay close attention to the wearying spectacle of our countrys politics, I worry about what will happen on Nov. 4, the day of the midterm elections.

title: Wages for Housework
Sophie Theallet: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Ovadia & Sons: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Irans Talks With Russia May Strike at Sanctions
description: Iran sent new signals on Tuesday that it was seeking to subvert the Western sanctions on its contentious nuclear energy program, adding uncertainties in advance of another round of negotiations next week in New York before the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Serena Williams Takes a Swing at Designing
description: It was on the official calendar, but it didnt look like your normal New York Fashion Week show. There was only one black car idling on West 46th Street. There were no street-style photographers outside the site. There was a red carpet.

title: For U2 and Apple, a Shrewd Marketing Partnership
description: U2 may be giving a new album away, but it is still getting paid.

title: Trojan Teams Up With MTV Again to Promote Condom Use, and the Brand
description: LIKE a couple seeking to spend more time together, the Trojan condom brand and the MTV cable channel are extending a partnership with a campaign, created internally at MTV, that will run online as well as on MTV and several channels that are MTV siblings under the Viacom umbrella.

title: Looking Beyond China, Some Companies Shift Personnel
description: SINGAPORE  General Motors moved the headquarters of its international division here from Shanghai last month. Archer Daniels Midland, the agribusiness giant, is gradually doing the same with its Asia and Pacific operations. Other multinationals, like IBM, have shifted staff members here from China for a few functions, like treasury operations.

title: Lt. Gov. Lavon L. Heidemann of Nebraska Steps Down
description: Nebraskas lieutenant governor, Lavon L. Heidemann, resigned Tuesday amid domestic abuse allegations. But because the deadline for being dropped from the ballot has passed, his name might still be listed as a candidate in November.

title: Ukraine Town Bears Scars of Russian Offensive That Turned Tide in Conflict
description: ILOVAISK, Ukraine  Burned-out tanks, troop carriers and trucks still lie strewn on the roads and fields all around this town. The body of a Ukrainian soldier hangs doubled over an electric wire, flung up like a doll when his tank exploded. The charred corpse of another soldier lies inside the hull of the tank, a third putrifying torso is tangled in machinery on the road.

title: Foundation Sends Kin of 9/11 Victims to College
description: Sean Booker was a Xerox technician on the 93rd floor of the World Trade Centers north tower. The Newark resident was at work when American Airlines Flight 11 crashed into the building on Sept. 11, 2001.

title: Theory: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Canada Chases Down an Arctic Mystery, and Some See a Political Strategy
description: OTTAWA  Some Canadians, particularly Prime Minister Stephen Harper, have long been taken with the story of the disastrous attempt by the British explorer Sir John Franklin to sail and map the Northwest Passage. So it was not surprising that Mr. Harper took it upon himself to announce on Tuesday that the sixth attempt by Canadas government to locate wreckage from Franklins doomed voyage had been successful.

title: An American Reporters Detention in Iran
description: More than seven weeks ago, Iranian authorities detained Jason Rezaian, The Washington Posts correspondent in Tehran, and his wife, the Iranian journalist Yeganeh Salehi. Government officials have refused to say where they are being held or why. Their continued detention is as mystifying as it is outrageous.

title: Fiji Government Says Its Golan Heights Peacekeepers Will Be Released Soon
description: Fiji said Wednesday that its 45-member United Nations peacekeeping contingent in the Golan Heights, seized by the Syrian branch of Al Qaeda nearly two weeks ago, would be released soon.

title: Tanaka Could Make a Return Before Season Ends
description: Even as the Yankees season has dwindled to its final few weeks and the postseason has become a remote hope, Masahiro Tanaka is racing to return before it all ends, if only to show that he can.

title: At Surgery Clinic, Rush to Save Joan Riverss Life
description: The call came in to 911 one second before 9:40 a.m. on Thursday, Aug. 28, from the staff at a clinic on East 93rd Street in Manhattan  a patient in cardiac arrest. The call was coded as Segment 1, the highest-level priority handled by 911, according to two New York City officials.

title: Minecraft Is Expected to Be Acquired by Microsoft
description: Updated, 9:08 p.m. | Microsoft is in advanced talks to acquire the maker of the game Minecraft for more than $2 billion, people briefed on the discussions said on Tuesday. The move was intended to ensure that one of the most popular games was available for the computing giants family of devices.

title: A Jolt of Caffeine Is Much Needed: J. Crew, Phillip Lim, Rag & Bone and Tory Burch
description: Sleep. Sleep of the evening, beautiful sleep. With apologies to the Mock Turtle of Alice in Wonderland, this is what most participants are craving by the midpoint of this elaborately constructed house of cards called New York Fashion Week.

title: New York Fashion Week Social Media Roundup, Day 6
description: On Monday night, fashion devotees put on brave faces and headed into Central Park after dark. It was a bold move; bolder still was the Polo Ralph Lauren show, which took them there in the first place and featured holograms rather than flesh-and-blood models.

title: Amid Intensifying Requests, American Military Aid to Ukraine Stalls
description: WASHINGTON  Despite appeals from the Ukrainian armed forces, the United States has so far provided only a modest package of nonlethal assistance to the Kiev government, and much of it has yet to arrive.

title: Arthur Gelb, Former Times Editor, Is Recalled as Kinetic and Filled With Wonder
description: And remember, theres a great deal of interest in this story, Arthur Gelb often said as he sent reporters out on assignments for The New York Times, where he was a high-ranking editor for more than 30 years.

title: It Takes a Mentor
description: With millions of students returning to school  both K-12 and college  this is a good time to review the intriguing results of some research that Gallup did over the past year, exploring the linkages between education and long-term success in the workplace. That is: What are the things that happen at a college or technical school that, more than anything else, produce engaged employees on a fulfilling career track? According to Brandon Busteed, the executive director of Gallups education division, two things stand out. Successful students had one or more teachers who were mentors and took a real interest in their aspirations, and they had an internship related to what they were learning in school.

title: Penn State Faithful Rejoice After Penalties Are Lifted
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  Coach James Franklin found out the news the same way many of his players and many Penn State students had: via Twitter.

title: Violence Erupts in Yemen Capital After Weeks of Rallies
description: MUKALLA, Yemen  Pro-government forces in the capital opened fire on Tuesday at thousands of demonstrators from the Shiite religious minority, killing six and injuring dozens, officials and witnesses said.

title: On the Runways to Other Worlds: Donna Karan, Maria Cornejo, Rodarte, Thom Browne, Vera Wang
description: Fashion can often seem like an alternative cosmos, or a trip through the looking glass  say, when you are standing in Central Park and a three-story hologram of a runway appears, as it did Monday at the Ralph Lauren Polo show. Or when a Mad Hatters garden party is held, complete with girls dressed as shuttlecocks and badminton rackets and daisy chains, as it was at Thom Browne.

title: Pakistan: Troops Fend Off Militant Attack in Karachi
description: The Pakistani Navy said it repelled a terrorist attack over the weekend after a six-hour exchange of fire at a naval dockyard in the southern port city of Karachi. Two militants were killed and four were arrested when they tried to attack, a navy spokesman said. A junior ranking officer was killed, while an officer and six sailors were wounded in the clashon Saturdaynight, the spokesman said.The Taliban claimed responsibilityon Tuesday, according to the BBC. A Taliban attack on Karachis international airport in June prompted a military offensive against militants in the North Waziristan tribal region. Theattack on the dockyard isthe second on a military facility since the offensive began.

title: Hopes for Iraqs New Government
description: The Iraqi Parliament put in place an important building block of an anti-ISIS strategy on Monday when it approved, in record time, a new power-sharing government led by Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi. Harder work lies ahead as Mr. Abadi, a member of the Shiite majority, tries to manage sectarian rivals in his cabinet and unify a fractured country, all while working with the United States to eliminate a mortal threat from marauding Sunni militants who occupy a huge swath of northern Iraq.

title: Fighting Back on Toll Fees for Rental Cars
description: Now that many tollbooths are no longer taking actual, physical money, some of the countrys biggest rental car companies have made a hearty business out of paying the tolls themselves. And oh, yes: Theres a service fee for that. This summer, a couple from California visiting New York hired a car from Dollar Rent A Car. They discovered that $4.88 in tolls for twice crossing the Henry Hudson Bridge  where it is impossible to pay with cash  had become a $34.88 charge from Dollar.

title: With Apple Pay, a Push Into Mobile Payments
description: Tech evangelists have predicted for years a world in which people paid for retail goods with the wave of a smartphone, or the push of a smartphone button. For nearly as long, this so-called mobile wallet has yet to catch on.

title: Another Broken Promise on Immigration
description: America cannot wait forever, said President Obama in June, when he denounced congressional paralysis on immigration reform and declared that he would soon act on his own to fix the problem. He promised to move by the end of the summer, presumably to suspend the deportations of many unauthorized immigrants  perhaps millions, though there is no way to know how many until a plan is unveiled.

title: Megachurch With a Beat Lures a Young Flock
description: LOS ANGELES  A toned and sunburned 32-year-old Australian with the letters F-A-I-T-H tattooed onto his biceps strode onto the stage of a former burlesque theater here and shouted across a sea of upstretched hands and uplifted smartphones: Lets win this city together!

title: With iPhone 6 and Smartwatch, Apple Is Back and Better Than Ever
description: Four times before in its history, at media events planned with military precision, Apple introduced a new invention that radically altered how the technology industry conceived of its future. The company hopes it did that again for a fifth time on Tuesday by unveiling the Apple Watch, a stylish smartwatch that is the companys first advance into a new product category since it created the iPad in 2010.

title: Fed Proposes New Rule, and Wall St. Banks Feel the Pressure
description: Wall Street banks scrambled on Tuesday to determine how they might have to adjust their business models to comply with newly proposed rules that could push the banks to downsize.

title: McEnroes Successor at U.S.T.A. Needs to Hit the Court Running
description: The French Open was in full swing this past spring, and Patrick McEnroe was reflecting on his six years as head of player development at the United States Tennis Association.

title: Oscar de la Renta: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: A Step Toward Fairness in Ferguson
description: The racially torn city of Ferguson, Mo., took an important step on Monday when the City Council announced proposals aimed at remaking its troubled court system and creating a civilian review board for the Police Department.

title: $500 Million Stock Fraud Alleged in Brooklyn Court
description: The undercover F.B.I. agent was explicit about his desire to break the law as he spoke to executives in Belize: Im a U.S. citizen, he said, and a stock promoter. I want to open an offshore account that will let me conceal from the Internal Revenue Service and the Securities and Exchange Commission stock ownership and money transfers.

title: Longtime Rivals Look to Team Up to Confront ISIS
description: BAGHDAD  As the United States and its allies look to fight the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, longtime adversaries with a common fear of the radical movement are scrambling to see if they can cooperate to defeat the rising threat.

title: Pledging to Shield the N.F.L.s Brand at All Costs
description: Had N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell watchedthe chilling Ray Rice elevator video through the lens of a father whose daughter was being beaten or a brother whose sister was knocked cold or a son whose mother was dragged and dropped outside an elevator,his actions surely would have been swift,severe and, most likely, permanent.

title: Detroit Clears Crucial Hurdle on Bankruptcy
description: The fiercest opponent to Detroits blueprint for erasing its debts and investing in city services has reached an agreement in principle with city officials, court documents filed Tuesday evening showed, clearing the way to end the citys court fight over its future and emerge from bankruptcy far more quickly and smoothly than expected.

title: Pakistan: 24 Killed When Mosque Roof Collapses
description: At least 24 people were killed and seven injured when the roof of a mosque in the eastern city of Lahore collapsed Tuesday. The mosque, in the Darghawala neighborhood, caved in when noon prayer had just begun. Muhamad Usman,who ledthe rescue operation, said that all the victims were believed to have been found but that the search would continue.

title: Gaza: Arrests Suggest Disagreement on Truce Details
description: The Israeli military arrested four fishermen early Tuesday in what Palestinian officials said was a violation of the cease-fire agreement signed last month, but that the Israelis contended was an enforcement of their restriction of fishing to within six nautical miles of the Gaza coast. Nezar Ayash of the Gaza fishermens union said four men were arrested less than one mile off the coast near the northern town of Beit Lahiya. He said two fishermen were arrested in a similar incident last Wednesday. The Egyptian-brokered cease-fire announced on Aug. 26 restored a 2012 agreement that the fishing zone be doubled to six nautical miles from three. A spokeswoman for the Israeli military said the four men had deviated from the permitted fishing zone and were over six miles away from the shore.

title: Prospect Park Alliance Gets New President
description: The Prospect Park Alliance, the nonprofit group that raises money for and oversees the daily operation of Brooklyns most visited park, has appointed a former New York City parks official as its new president.

title: 5 Children Found Dead in Alabama After Search
description: ATLANTA  A South Carolina man led the authorities on Tuesday to the bodies of his five children in rural Alabama, ending a six-day search that had stretched across the South, law enforcement officials said.

title: Gerald Wilson, Versatile Jazz Arranger, Is Dead at 96
description: Gerald Wilson, whose eight-decade career as a jazz composer, arranger, big-band leader and trumpeter spanned generations, styles and geography, died on Monday in Los Angeles. He was 96.

title: Celebrity Gossip Website Extends Its Reach With Scoops on Stars From a Different Field
description: Last November, TMZ broke the news that the Heisman Trophy candidate Jameis Winston was being investigated by the Tallahassee Police Department over an allegation that he had sexually abused a fellow student at Florida State University.

title: Tantalizingly Close to Art World Fame, Then Plunging Into Obscurity
description: Near the exit to the theater on Sunday, an usher stood with a stack of booklets, free for the taking: colorful little catalogs for an exhibition by the 20th-century German abstract painter Rudolf Bauer, whose life we had just seen dramatized in Lauren Gundersons play Bauer.

title: Lets Shake!
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Do you ever feel jaded as a solver? Feel like youve seen em all?

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 9, 2014
Narciso Rodriguez: Spring 2015 RTW
description: NEW YORK

title: Blast Decimates Leadership of Syrian Rebel Group
description: BEIRUT  An explosion tore through a secret meeting of one of Syrias strongest and most enduring rebel groups on Tuesday, killing a dozen of its top leaders, including its head, and striking another blow against the forces seeking to topple President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Our Reluctant National Security President
description: David Brooks: Gail, Id like to start by asking you about embarrassing omissions. Are there books you havent read or places you havent been that you really should have in your cultural repertoire?

title: Witness Details a Sham in a Deal With Rowland
description: NEW HAVEN  In three days on the stand, Brian Foley, the governments star witness in a corruption case against John G. Rowland, the former governor of Connecticut, repeatedly told the court that he had taken pains not to put anything in writing that might expose the $5,000-a-month consulting contract he had engineered with Mr. Rowland as a sham.

title: Cuomo Defeats Teachout, Liberal Rival, in the Democratic Primary
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York claimed the Democratic nomination for a second term on Tuesday, but at a considerable price: A liberal challenger with little money or name recognition, Zephyr Teachout, was on track to receive about a third of the vote, a signal of the potent dissatisfaction with Mr. Cuomo in his partys left wing.

title: Seeing Abuse, and a Pattern Too Familiar
description: Until recently, Janay Palmer Rice was a little-known figure, the 26-year-old partner of Ray Rice, the star running back for the Baltimore Ravens. But after Mr. Rices contract was terminated by his team on Monday, she became the most famous battered wife in the country, a fierce defender of her husband and, to domestic violence experts and survivors, an extraordinarily public example of the complex psychology of women abused by men.

title: Marvin Barnes, Enigmatic Basketball Player, Dies at 62
description: Marvin Barnes, one of basketballs most talented and defiantly self-indulgent players, whose career dissolved in a haze of drugs and alcohol, died on Monday in Providence, R.I. He was 62.

title: Change Has Been Bad for Giants So Far
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  In the wake of the Giants 21-point loss on their opening night, Coach Tom Coughlin had a telling appraisal.

title: Who Needs a Smoke-Filled Room?
description: Tax-exempt social welfare organizations, the new political weapons of choice, are widening the gap between the rich people who control campaign financing and the economically anxious voters targeted by their ads.

title: Mildred Friedman, 85, Dies; Curator Elevated Design and Architecture
description: Mildred Friedman, a curator at the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis in the 1970s and 80s who helped both the museum and the contemporary design and architecture it celebrated become objects of international acclaim, died on Sept. 3 in Manhattan. She was 85.

title: Missing Key Players, Yankees Drop Second Straight
description: The memo went out from Major League Baseball to all teams on Tuesday. It was a complicated note to clarify a complicated rule, and a few hours later it was put to the test.

title: In Atlanta, Debating Race and Sports
description: ATLANTA  James Reed, a 27-year-old African-American sports fan, has all kinds of issues with the assertions that Bruce Levenson, the leader of the ownership group for this citys N.B.A. franchise, has made about the team and its followers.

title: Elie Tahari: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Bothersome Shoulder Ends David Wrights Season
description: The Mets season had reached the point, in the second week of September, when it seemed they were most concerned about preparing for the next year. They wanted to cultivate their young talent, keep everyone healthy, and then, they hoped, win.

title: Federal Report Describes Trouble for Some Birds
description: A day after the National Audubon Society released a report saying that about half of North Americas 650 bird species will be threatened by climate change, a report released Tuesday by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service and other federal agencies concluded that nearly one-third of American birds are in trouble. The State of the Birds, a comprehensive study by nearly two dozen government agencies and conservation groups that tracks species loss and the effectiveness of conservation efforts, found species in moderate to steep decline across habitats and ecosystems. But it also highlighted that conservation projects could be successful, as with wetland species, like mallards and blue-winged teals, which saw a 37 percent bump in population since 1968. Conservation in one part of the country is not enough, said Daniel M. Ashe, director of the Fish and Wildlife Service. We have to see the larger picture of conservation.

title: Dean Baquet on Israel Coverage, Innovation and the Web
description: Last week, David Carr, a media columnist, interviewed Dean Baquet, the executive editor, before a gathering of Times Premier subscribers in the Times building. Afterward, Mr. Baquet answered questions from the audience. Below are some highlights from that part of the event and here are excerpts from the interview.

title: A Curatorial Cavern
description: The Argentine-born curator Juan Garcia Mosqueda opens a unique boutique on the West Side, filled with limited-edition and rare vintage objects.

title: The Curated Boutique Kiosk Rises Again in NoHo
description: Location, location, location: its the mantra of success for retailers, and few understand it better than the cult New York design shop Kiosk. After losing its second-floor digs on Spring Street in SoHo to impending demolition earlier this year, then doing a stint in a Union Square office building, its setting up a new temporary storefront in NoHo this Friday through February 1. (The Union Square location will remain open as the companys outlet shop.)

title: Drink Soda? Take 12,000 Steps
description: People who consume the sweetener fructose  which is most people nowadays  risk developing a variety of health problems. But the risk drops substantially if those people get up and move around, even if they dont formally exercise, two new studies found.

title: Word of the Day | indemnify
description: indemnify \in-dem-n-fi\ verb

title: Outrage and Calls for Change Follow Ferguson Officials Into Council Meeting
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The first Ferguson City Council meeting since the police killing of Michael Brown one month ago erupted on Tuesday into an outpouring of grievances  accusations of racism, police harassment and government incompetence  as hundreds of residents made angry appeals for change.

title: Democrats Reject Indicted State Senator in Queens but Renominate One in Brooklyn
description: With full control of the New York State Legislature within reach in November, Democrats on Tuesday expelled one indicted lawmaker, held fast to another and reaffirmed their support for an embattled Bronx power broker at the heart of much of the partys recent turmoil.

title: Rule Amended for Plate Collisions
description: CHICAGO  With the postseason just three weeks away, baseball has urged umpires to apply common sense to the rule on home plate collisions that has confounded players and fans all season.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 9 P.M. (13) VACCINES  CALLING THE SHOTS In 2000, measles was declared to have been eliminated in the United States. But in July, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported 566 cases so far this year. Nova investigates the return of diseases preventable by vaccines, among them measles, mumps and whooping cough, which were largely wiped out in the United States a generation ago; the science of immunization; and, for the 10 percent of parents who choose to delay or skip their childrens shots, the risks of opting out, to them and to society. Above, a scene from the program.

title: Watchdog Says V.A. Officials Lied
description: WASHINGTON  Administrators at 13 health care facilities run by the Department of Veterans Affairs have lied to investigators looking into the extent of waiting-list manipulation and other improprieties, the departments acting inspector general said in Senate testimony on Tuesday.

title: Dollar Generals Planned Hostile Bid for Family Dollar Roils Retail Waters
description: The three-way tug of war being hashed out in the discount retail industry just got a little bit more contentious.

title: On New Album, Rock Veterans Revisit Youth
description: Memories are a blast on Songs of Innocence, the album that U2 released on Tuesday afternoon as a worldwide giveaway. With a title that echoes William Blake, the album is a blast of discoveries, hopes, losses, fears and newfound resolve in lyrics that are openly autobiographical. Its also a blast of unapologetic arena rock and cathedral-scale production, equally gigantic and detailed, in the music that carries them.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, September 10, 2014
description: Theyre telling me in 40 years they cant find any African-American policemen?

title: Corrections: September 10, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Saudi Arabia Will Grant U.S. Request for Anti-ISIS Training Program
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Saudi Arabia has agreed to an American request to provide a base to train moderate Syrian opposition fighters, American officials saidon Wednesday.

title: Emilio Botn, Who Built Up Santander Bank, Dies at 79
description: Updated, 8:27 p.m. | Emilio Botn, who transformed Banco Santander from a regional, family-controlled bank into one of Europes largest financial institutions, died on Tuesday at his home outside Madrid. He was 79.

title: Rival British Leaders Campaign in Unity Against Independence for Scotland
description: EDINBURGH  Combining emotional appeals with hardheaded warnings, British political leaders swept through Scotland on Wednesday in an effort to head off the increasingly real prospect that Britain could be dismembered, with both the Conservative prime minister, David Cameron, and the opposition Labour Party leader, Ed Miliband, stressing that a vote for Scottish independence would be irreversible.

title: Test Yourself | A New Dinosaur
description: Below are six paragraphs from the Sept. 4 article Argentine Dinosaur Was an Estimated 130,000 Pounds, and Still Growing.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Damaged Buildings and Psyches Challenge Schools in Gaza
description: In the article Damaged Buildings and Psyches Challenge Schools in Gaza, Jodi Rudoren writes about the challenges of educating a generation that has survived three wars in six years.

title: Philippine Bill Would Give Muslims Autonomy
description: MANILA  President Benigno S. Aquino III on Wednesday submitted a draft law to the Philippine Congress that would create a self-governed, predominantly Muslim autonomous region in the countrys south, a major step in peace talks meant to end more than four decades of fighting with Muslim rebels.

title: Congratulations! You Fooled Facebook (Maybe)
description: Its perhaps no surprise that, as distrust of Facebooks algorithm has grown in recent months, so has the popularity of attempts to circumvent it. The tricks users found may not work forever, but some say their value is in what they reveal about the inner workings of the site.

title: Vietnams Photographic History, Told by the Winners
description: Correction appended.

title: What New Technologies or Tech Toys Are You Most Excited About?
description: Apple held a much-anticipated keynote on Tuesday, introducing its new smartwatch as well as the iPhone 6. If you had the money, would you want these new devices?

title: South African Gold Miner to Spin Off International Operations
description: LONDON  AngloGold Ashanti, one of the worlds largest gold miners, said on Wednesday that it planned to spin off its international mining operations into a new entity listed in London and to raise $2.1 billion in capital.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Rocket Internet Seeks to Raise About $967 Million in I.P.O.
description: The German technology giant Rocket Internet said on Wednesday that it was planning an initial public offering that could value the company at more than 4 billion euros, or about $5 billion.

title: South Side Salute to Konerko
description: CHICAGO  From a distance it is a blue speck in a sea of forest green at U.S. Cellular Field. Up close, near the left-field bullpen, the fourth seat in the seventh row of Section 159 is not much to see. It is an original model from this park, its color faded, its armrests lower than those of its neighbors. It sits a little more upright, too, and its back has no cup holder.

title: Airplane Crew May Face Increased Melanoma Risk
description: Airline pilots and crews may be at increased risk for melanoma, a new review has found.

title: New York Today: Easy Act to Follow
description: Good morning on this fine Wednesday.

title: Daily Report: Apple Shows It Can Still Innovate
description: Any question about how well Tim Cook, Apples chief executive, is managing the reins of the worlds most valuable company will most likely be put to rest after Tuesdays profusion of product announcements at the Flint Center in Cupertino, Calif., where Steve Jobs first showed off the Macintosh in 1984, Farhad Manjoo reports.

title: Fixes for Japans Economy
