description: The news that the Japanese economy had shrunk by 7.1 percent in the second quarter this year from the previous three-month period suggests that the countrys hard-earned recovery is in danger of stalling unless the government changes its flawed policies.

title: Story of Lost Love Emerges Amid China-Japan Tensions
description: The story of a Chinese veterans love for a Japanese woman he met shortly after World War II and his quest nearly 70 years later to learn what happened to her has been widely circulating on Chinese websites in recent days.

title: New York Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 7
description: Are you still with us? Good!

title: Teaching World War I With The New York Times
description: This summer marked the 100th anniversary of the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife by a Serbian nationalist  the catalyst that sent Europe into a spiral of war and destruction for the next four and a half years.

title: Intel Shares More of Its Extreme Makeover
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In the fast-moving technology business, it doesnt pay to get sentimental. Still, not long ago, Intel had a much easier time telling people how to get rich.

title: A Small Clothing Maker Tries to Keep Sewing in the U.S.
description: Earlier this year, Jan Erickson stood on the floor of her small sewing factory in Colorado Springs and watched as a Spanish-speaking management consultant persuaded her sewers to move their work stations normally spread out in straight rows, like desks in a classroom into whats known as a cellular layout.

title: Can We Have a Fact-Based Conversation About End-of-Life Planning?
description: Dealing with health care needs at the end of life is a difficult but unavoidable issue in an aging society with rising health care costs like ours. After a failed attempt to deal with the issue as part of the Affordable Care Act, it may again be returning to the policy agenda. Can we avoid another catastrophic bout of misinformation?

title: London Stock Exchange Shareholders Approve Deal for Russell Investments
description: LONDON  The London Stock Exchange said on Wednesday that its shareholders had voted overwhelmingly in favor of its acquisition of Russell Investments, the owner of the Russell 2000 stock market index.

title: Morning Agenda: Dollar General Goes Hostile
description: Dollar General said on Wednesday that it was taking its $9.1 billion offer for Family Dollar directly to shareholders, DealBooks David Gelles writes. The move could further complicate Family Dollars deal agreement to sell itself to Dollar Tree for $8.5 billion. In a statement, Dollar General said it was offering to acquire all of Family Dollars shares for $80 each. That is the same bid that Family Dollar rejected last week, contending that the deal it agreed to with Dollar Tree had a better chance of passing muster with antitrust regulators. A hostile bid is likely to, at the very least, delay any deal between Family Dollar and Dollar Tree.

title: Proenza Schouler Spring 2015 Collection at New York Womens Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Proenza Schouler at New York Fashion Week.

title: A Downton Darling Turned Mr. Hyde
description: I was not your obvious choice for that kind of role, Dan Stevens said, discussing his part as a crewcutted homicidal maniac in the forthcoming horror-adventure movie The Guest.

title: The Making of Lena Dunhams Bust
description: For its annual Culture Issue, The New York Times Magazine commissioned the artist Victoria Diehl to turn Lena Dunham into high art.

title: Lena Dunham Is Not Done Confessing
description: On a recent afternoon in Brooklyn, Lena Dunham and her sister, Grace, met up at a local hangout. Grace was nursing a sprained ankle she sustained a few nights earlier, after, by her account, tripping into a pothole while running out of a queer-poetry reading. Dunham was concerned about the injury but also enchanted by the phrase, and had been repeating it to people everywhere she went over the last several days.

title: Nations Called Lax in Returning Art Looted From Jews
description: The Italian government has long used impassioned pleas, considerable research and international public pressure to support its demands, which were often successful, for the repatriation of its art and antiquities patrimony lost through looting. But in a report published Wednesday, Italy is identified as one of the countries doing the least to research or identify items that may been looted from Jews during World War II.

title: David Moffitt Leaves Mead Park to Join J.C. Flowers
description: David Moffitt, a founding principal at the hedge fund Mead Park Management, will join the buyout firm J.C. Flowers & Company as it expands into the business of buying loans.

title: Jean-Claude Juncker Names European Commissioners
description: BRUSSELS  Jean-Claude Juncker, the incoming president of the European Unions executive branch, nominated his team on Wednesday, which will face challenges including reviving the flagging euro-area economy, curbing reliance on Russian energy and controlling migration into the bloc.

title: Ferrari Chairman to Step Down; Marchionne to Take His Place
description: PARIS  The chairman of Ferrari said on Wednesday that he was stepping down after 23 years with the Italian sports car maker, making way for Sergio Marchionne, the chief of the parent group Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, to assume the top spot.

title: At Least 65 Militants Killed in Airstrikes, Pakistan Says
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Sixty-five militants were killed when Pakistani jets bombed in the North Waziristan tribal region along the Pakistan-Afghan border, a senior Pakistani security official said.

title: Stood Up? A Good Cabby Can Help
description: Dear Diary:

title: In Srinagar, Floodwaters Recede, but Anger Remains
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  As people waited here for rescue on rooftops and balconies, fear was giving way on Wednesday to anger and resentment over what some saw as a slow response to flooding that began last week and has left hundreds dead in northern India and eastern Pakistan.

title: Three Years After Fukushima, Japan Approves a Nuclear Plant
description: TOKYO  For the first time since the Fukushima disaster three and a half years ago, Japans new nuclear regulatory agency declared Wednesday that an atomic power plant was safe to operate, in a widely watched move that brings Japan a step closer to restarting its idled nuclear industry.

title: Chinese Drug Company Wins Approval to Make Generic Version of Viagra
description: A Chinese pharmaceutical company has received the green light from Chinas State Food and Drug Administration to become the countrys first official producer of a homegrown version of Viagra, Pfizers famous erectile dysfunction drug.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Why Pistorius Fascinates
description: Oscar Pistorius has been found guilty of culpable homicide in the killing of his girlfriend. A look back at what South Africans have called their trial of the century.

title: Most Russian Forces Now Out of Ukraine, Kiev Says
description: KIEV, Ukraine  President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine said on Wednesday that the bulk of Russian forces had withdrawn from Ukrainian territory, a move that he said heightened the chances for a lasting cease-fire in the southeast.

title: On Facebook, Nobody Knows Youre a Voter. Well, Almost Nobody.
description: Your Facebook profile doesnt have boxes to check which political party you belong to or whether you voted in the last election. But political organizations who already know that can now deliver Facebook ads to fit your political preferences.

title: How Do You View Narendra Modis Visit to the U.S.?
description: The Times wants to hear from Indians living in the United States on what this visit means to them.

title: Latest Good News in Health Spending: Employer Premiums
description: Were in the midst of a rare slowdown in the growth of health spending. That slowdown just hit the employer health insurance market.

title: 1889: Another Whitechapel Mystery
description: LONDON  London in general and Whitechapel in particular were thrown into a feverish state of excitement this morning [Sept. 10] by the news that Jack the Ripper had murdered and mutilated his ninth victim. Both murder and mutilation were reported to be, and indeed proved to be, more horrible than in any one of the eight cases preceding. The quick and close review of facts by the police department led to the conclusion late this afternoon that the remains found did not represent Jack the Rippers handiwork, and this may or may not be true.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 11, 1889

title: Those Mysterious Deadly Virus Headlines? Dont Panic. Do Watch That Cold, and Wash Your Hands.
description: With reports of a respiratory illness that can require hospitalization and even intensive care affecting children across the Midwest and West, and breathless headlines like Potentially Deadly Mystery Virus and Rare, potentially deadly Enterovirus hits thousands of kids, parents might be inclined to circle the wagons, or at the very least whip out the hand sanitizer. (One exaggerated report, which I wont link to, read: Enterovirus starts with wheezing and coughing, but within hours, kids stop breathing altogether.)

title: A 9/11 Shrine Where Families Mourned for Years, Now Open to Others
description: ALBANY  Twenty stories above ground zero, its existence and whereabouts known only to those who needed it, the Family Room served for a dozen years as a most private sanctuary from a most public horror.

title: Can Humans Get Used to Having a Two-Way Relationship with Earths Climate?
description: Earlier this summer, I was invited to write an essay on humanitys troubled relationship with the changing atmosphere for a special issue of Audubon Magazine centered on the Audubon Societys comprehensive new report on birds in a changing climate.

title: Apple Pay Tries to Solve a Problem That Really Isnt a Problem
description: I recently bought a cup of coffee, but I did not have any cash handy. I used a credit card, and the result was a veritable dystopia that will surely haunt my sleep forever.

title: Yanks and Mets on Equal Footing in Long-Shot Chase for Playoffs
description: The Yankees have kept their heads above .500 this season, and the Mets, as is often the case, have not. And yet, entering Wednesdays games, the Mets were as close to a wild-card playoff spot as the Yankees.

title: Xiao Wen Ju Transforms Backstage at Rodarte
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Xiao Wen Ju before (left) and after (right) makeup by James Kaliardos and hair by Odile Gilbert.

title: Group Urges Action Against Sexual Harassment on University Campuses
description: On the annual occasion in China for recognizing teachers contributions to society, a group of professors and students have called on Chinese education officials and university administrators to take more vigorous action against sexual harassment on university campuses.

title: Sign of the Times | Fall Mens 2014
description: T highlights the gender-bending trends from the Fall 2014 mens wear collections.

title: Interview: Lone Scherfig
description: The director discusses her drama The Riot Club, about a secret, misbehaving group of Oxford students.

title: After Resisting Their Overtures, Chiquita Agrees to Talk With Brazilian Bidders
description: Chiquita Brands International, which until very recently was looking to acquire an Irish rival, is now thinking about selling itself.

title: France Wont Meet Budget Deficit Target Until 2017, Government Warns
description: PARIS  Frances economic recovery will be much more fragile this year than originally thought, and the government will not be able to meet targets for reducing the deficit for at least another two years in the face of sputtering growth, the French Finance Ministry announced on Wednesday.

title: Film About Exiles Is Banned in Singapore
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  A documentary about the lives of Singaporean exiles has been banned in Singapore on the grounds that it undermines national security.

title: Readers Best Shots of the Supermoon
description: Maybe you happened to have looked up into the night sky this week. And maybe you noticed that the moon looks a bit bigger and a little brighter than normal. Your eyes arent playing tricks on you. The third supermoon since July is visible this week. A supermoon occurs when the moon is full at its closest approach to Earth. It appears about 30 percent brighter than average.

title: Folk Tales for a New Age
description: The most emotionally satisfying folk tales, for me, are the ones made up from scratch by a living author. Sometimes its fun to play cultural anthropologist, but sometimes, a tendril of my attention will drift away upon hearing the name Baba Yaga, say, or Rumpelstiltskin. Those stories contain some timeless, universal themes growing up and finding ones place in the world, figuring out when someone is trying to rip you off  but theyve also been concocted to address concerns born of a specific time and place, and not this one.

title: Today in Small Business: Internet Slowdown
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Cold Spring Harbor: Natural Beauty, Good Schools
description: In January 2012, with three children and no backyard, Andrew and Kate Walton left Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, for a house on three acres in the historic waterfront hamlet of Cold Spring Harbor in the northwest corner of Suffolk County.

title: Dick Cheney and Other Republicans Throw Stones at Obama From Glass House
description: Since he left the vice presidency six years ago, Dick Cheney has made a second career of criticizing President Obama, usually for his record on terrorism. Mr. Cheney was at it again on Tuesday, using a meeting with House Republicans to skewer Mr. Obama and promote his only remedy for foreign policy problems: War.

title: Judge Agrees to Delay Detroit Bankruptcy Trial
description: A federal judge agreed on Wednesday to delay Detroits bankruptcy trial to give the city and its fiercest opponent a chance to finish a major settlement that could speed an end to the citys court fight over its future.

title: Toronto Festival 2014: Lone Scherfig on The Riot Club
description: TORONTO  Boys behaving badly only begins to describe a secret society of Oxford students in The Riot Club, a new drama directed by Lone Scherfig. The film is based on the play Posh, by Laura Wade, and follows the members of a dining club who have a dinner party that gets considerably out of hand. In this video, Ms. Scherfig discusses the film and how class conflicts and elitism give way to egregious acts.

title: 1906: The Yankees Take the Field
description: This feature looks at the first time famous names or terms appeared in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: Training Dogs to Sniff Out Cancer
description: PHILADELPHIA  McBaine, a bouncy black and white springer spaniel, perks up and begins his hunt at the Penn Vet Working Dog Center. His nose skims 12 tiny arms that protrude from the edges of a table-size wheel, each holding samples of blood plasma, only one of which is spiked with a drop of cancerous tissue.

title: What You Get For... $1,500,000
description: DURANGO, COLO.

title: Time to Ban Middle School?
description: The sheer unpleasantness of middle school hasbecome something of a clich; middle school dance now stands as a shorthand for any socially awkward experience. And yet, for many of us, middle school is terrible, a time when childhood is sort of over but even the mixed blessings of adolescence have yet to fully present themselves. Now experts are beginning to propose a solution to the problem of middle school: abolish it.

title: House Hunting in ... Hong Kong
description: A ONE-BEDROOM APARTMENT WITH HARBOR VIEWS IN HONG KONG

title: Even More On Scotland
description: Im going on Channel 4 in a couple of hours, and doing more homework. One thing that is likely to come up is the fact that some reputable economists (pdf) have concluded that Scotland-on-the-pound would be OK. Whats my answer?

title: In Search of the Perfect Taco
description: Ren Redzepi ignited an international culinary revolution with Noma, his restaurant focused on wildly innovative Nordic cuisine. Now, believing that Mexican food is the next big thing, the Scandinavian wunderkind eats his way across the country to deconstruct its secrets.

title: Google Buys Lift Labs in Further Biotech Push
description: A person could be forgiven for thinking that Google is a biotech company.

title: A Simple Equation: More Education = More Income
description: Imagine if the United States government taxed the nations one-percenters so that their post-tax share of the nations income remained at 10 percent, roughly where it was in 1979. If the excess money were distributed equally among the rest of the population, in 2012 every family below that very top tier would have gotten a $7,105 check.

title: Cuomo Says Hes Fine With 60% in Primary and Looks to General Election
description: BUFFALO  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo does not see the primary result on Tuesday as anything resembling a rebuke.

title: HPV Vaccine Program in Australia Shows Success
description: In 2007, Australia began providing the human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine free to girls 12 to 18 in a school-based program. Now researchers have calculated the effect on the incidence of genital warts in women 15 to 27.

title: Release of iPhone 6 Delayed in China
description: BEIJING  Apple is facing a potential setback in China, one of its biggest and fastest-growing markets, after the much-anticipated introductions here of the new iPhone models were delayed.

title: Think Mick Jagger Is a Fossil? So Do Some Scientists
description: If the name had not been bestowed by a couple of fans, Mick Jagger might have cause to take umbrage: a newly discovered extinct swamp creature has been named Jaggermeryx naida  Jaggers water nymph  in the singers honor. Two of the scientists who published a study on the animal and its discovery in this months issue of the Journal of Paleontology, Ellen Miller, of Wake Forest University and Gregg Gunnell, of Duke University, said that the animals mouth structure is what brought Mr. Jagger to mind. Mr. Gunnell, in a statement, described the structure as probably a highly innervated muzzle with mobile and tactile lips.

title: Central Bankers Find Bubbles, but Are Cautious on Deflating Them
description: Central bankers have been attacked, justifiably, for having done little to quash the greatcreditbubble that led to the 2008 financial crisis.

title: Israel, Facing Criticism, to Investigate Possible Military Misconduct in Gaza
description: TEL AVIV  Israel on Wednesday announced it had begun criminal investigations into five instances of possible military misconduct in the 50-day Gaza war, an implicit acknowledgment of sensitivity to the widespread criticism, even among allies like the United States, that Israeli forces had used excessive firepower in a number of highly publicized assaults in the Palestinian territory.

title: Uncertain About Hiring, Some Companies Try Test Drives
description: Hiring and retaining employees is a struggle for all sorts of companies, but at smaller ones the stakes can be especially high.

title: Chlorine Used as Weapon in Syria War, Group Says
description: GENEVA  A toxic chemical, probably chlorine, was used as a weapon to attack Syrian villages in April, an international watchdog agency confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Fiji, in Clarification, Says Peacekeepers Remain Held in Golan Heights
description: Fiji on Wednesday dialed back its assertion that 45 of its peacekeepers in the Golan Heights, captured by Syrian militants nearly two weeks ago, were about to be released.

title: Obama, in Speech on ISIS, Promises Sustained Effort to Rout Militants
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday authorized a major expansion of the military campaign against rampaging Sunni militants in the Middle East, including American airstrikes in Syria and the deployment of 475 more military advisers to Iraq. But he sought to dispel fears that the United States was embarking on a repeat of the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.

title: A Slower-Paced, but Still Easy, Wednesday Meal
description: Busy parents. Active kids. Families that arrive home every evening, starved. This week, in the series Dinner: The Boot Camp, Jenny Rosenstrach takes a recipe for chaos and coaches one family, and all of us, in the planning and preparation needed to turn it into a pleasant nightly meal. Find all the Boot Camp recipes here.Tuesday Recap

title: Deezer Enters U.S. Market With High-Fidelity Music Service
description: The streaming music market keeps getting more crowded.

title: Revisiting a Hurricane
description: Fifty years ago this week, Hurricane Dora, a Category 4 storm, caused severe damage in Florida and Georgia.

title: Wolf Hall and Its Sequel Aiming for Broadway After London Success
description: Broadway and London producers are in talks about a New York run of the hit British play Wolf Hall and its sequel Bring Up the Bodies, based on the historical novels by Hilary Mantel about Henry VIII and his adviser Thomas Cromwell, according to theater executives with knowledge of the discussions. No deals have been finalized, but the veteran Broadway producers Jeffrey Richards and Jerry Frankel are aiming to mount the plays in the spring, possibly at the Winter Garden Theater, said the executives, who spoke on condition of anonymity because the talks are confidential.

title: Diva to Die for Shakes It Anew
description: Donna Summer, Gloria Gaynor, Evelyn (Champagne) King, Vicki Sue Robinson, Amii Stewart: the disco era was prime time for divas of pop. But perhaps the flashiest disco diva of them all was actually a man who, aptly enough for a diva of any era, went by a single name. I speak, of course, of Sylvester, the flamboyant androgyne whose life has now become fodder for the latest jukebox musical to splash down onstage. Mighty Real: A Fabulous Sylvester Musical is the brainchild of Anthony Wayne (Pippin, Priscilla, Queen of the Desert), who wrote the book, directs with Kendrell Bowman and struts the stage of the Theater at St. Clements in the title role. As with many another musical drawing on chart hits, the show will weave Sylvesters finest booty shakers  You Make Me Feel (Mighty Real), Do Ya Wanna Funk, Dance (Disco Heat)  into his life story. And lets not forget this bonus: The show will feature Anastacia McCleskey and Jacqueline B. Arnold as the Weather Girls. Can we hope for a singalong? (Opens Sunday, 423 West 46th Street, Clinton, 866-811-4111, fabuloussylvester.com.)

title: Live From New York: First Hosts for 40th Year
description: Heading into a season that will include a gala prime-time celebration of its 40th year on the air, Saturday Night Live will have its season premiere on Sept. 27, NBC announced Wednesday.

title: Oscar Pistorius Murder Trial Verdict Is Due
description: LONDON  More than 18 months after he shot and killed his glamorous girlfriend, Oscar Pistorius, a onetime track star on a gilded trajectory of triumph and success, is set to face judgment on Thursday when the judge in his trial on murder and firearms charges pronounces her verdict.

title: Chef Danny Bowien on the Five Lessons Hes Learned About Mexican Food
description: The man behind the acclaimed Mission Chinese Food restaurants in San Francisco and New York has a cameo in Jeff Gordiniers story In Search of the Perfect Taco in Ts Mens Style Issue  a culinary odyssey in which the writer traveled with the Danish chef Ren Redzepi to discover Mexicos many delicious dishes. Danny Bowien, of course, has gotten into Mexican food in a major way recently since opening Mission Cantina, in which hes sought to put his own spin on that national cuisine in the same way that he did with Sichuan food at Mission Chinese. Here, Bowien reveals what hes learned about Mexican cooking in the last year.

title: CartoDB, Interactive Mapping Start-Up, Raises $7 Million
description: When violent protests erupted in Ferguson, Mo., last month, tens of thousands of people took to Twitter to voice their anger under the hashtag #Ferguson.

title: Chef Ren Redzepi on the Best Places to Eat in Mexico
description: For In Search of the Perfect Taco in Ts Fall Mens Style issue, Jeff Gordinier traveled to Mexico with the renowned Danish chef Ren Redzepi to explore the nations complex, misunderstood cuisine. Here, in his own words, are Redzepis greatest moments of gastronomic delight south of the border, which awakened him to the wonders of Mexican food.

title: E.U. Antitrust Enforcer Will Be Margrethe Vestager
description: BRUSSELS  The nominee to be the next enforcer of the European Unions far-reaching antitrust laws is Margrethe Vestager, a former Danish finance minister who would need to handle delicate investigations into powerful companies including the American technology giant Google and the Russian energy titan Gazprom.

title: New York to Help Arts Groups Prepare for Emergencies
description: To help arts organizations cope with another potential Hurricane Sandy, New York City on Wednesday announced it was creating a response and recovery network to reduce redundant communications, pool available resources and share best practices about emergency preparedness.

title: Fashion Rocks Red Carpet
description: Last night, some of fashion and musics biggest personalities walked the red carpet to celebrate the marriage between the two disciplines at the Fashion Rocks event at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn.

title: A Makeover for a Lisbon Food Market
description: The recently renovated Mercado da Ribeira in Lisbon, situated near the Tagus River since 1892, already qualifies as a major food destination.

title: Netflix and Other Big Websites Protest Proposed Net Neutrality Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Dozens of websites joined a symbolic protest Wednesday against the Federal Communications Commissions proposed rules governing net neutrality, which opponents say would result in Internet traffic being divided among fast lanes for companies that can afford them and slow lanes for everyone else.

title: Botns Swashbuckling Style Hid a Cautious Streak
description: Emilio Botn transformed Banco Santander from a regional Spanish lender into a global giant. He was a merger mastermind who usually got the upper hand. With slicked-back hair and red tie, he flew in a private jet, conferring with presidents and prime ministers as easily as bankers and chief executives. Yet unlike many of his peers during European bankings boom years, Mr. Botn also had a cautious streak. It is that, rather than his swashbuckling style, that allowed him to keep his grip on Santander until his death at the age of 79.

title: Five Ballet Companies Join for Live Streaming World Ballet Day
description: LONDON  In an unprecedented bout of internationalism, five of the worlds major ballet companies will participate in a 20-hour-long live streaming event that will give ballet fans worldwide an intensive behind-the-scenes look at company classes, rehearsals and coaching.

title: A Little Clarity in Arkansas as Tom Cotton Opens a Lead
description: There has always been something slightly peculiar about the Republican Partys designation as the favorite to win the Senate this November. Among the competitive races, it hasnt had a clear lead in the six states where it needs to win, and it has enjoyed a significant advantage in only three Democratic-held states: in South Dakota, Montana and West Virginia.

title: Classical Playlist: Strauss, Bartok, John Dowland and More
description: RICHARD STRAUSS: ElektraStaatskapelle Dresden; Christian Thielemann, conductor; Evelyn Herlitzius; Anne Schwanewilms; Waltraud Meier; Ren Pape(Deutsche Grammophon)This seething reading of Strausss most astringent score, recorded live at the Berlin Philharmonie earlier this year, brings together as near an ideal cast of soloists as one could dream of. Evelyn Herlitzius, who triumphed in Patrice Chreaus production of Elektra at the Aix-en-Provence festival last year, reprises the title role with chilling intensity. Waltraud Meier as her mother, Klytmnestra, and Anne Schwanewilms as her sister Chrysothemis are impressive, too. Christian Thielemann stirs up a storm of brilliant colors in the orchestra. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

title: A Fractured Life, a Failed Marriage and 5 Small Bodies in Alabama
description: LEXINGTON, S.C.  The small sign posted above the doorway of the mobile home seemed starkly at odds with the collection of toys a few feet away: Is there life after death? Trespass here and find out.

title: Wheelies: The Russian Shutdown Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Putin Says Russia Will Keep Building Military Power
description: MOSCOW  Russia will continue to build up its military might with large-scale weapons purchases in order to meet any threat, particularly from the United States and NATO, President Vladimir V. Putin said on Wednesday.

title: Rosa Parks Collection Going to Library of Congress
description: The Library of Congress will be the temporary home of a collection of more than 1,500 items relating to the civil rights activist Rosa Parks and recently purchased by the philanthropist Howard G. Buffett.

title: Kerry Pledges to Help Iraq Overcome ISIS
description: Secretary of State John Kerry arrived in Baghdad Wednesday to pledge the United Statess support in defeating the terrorist group the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: 1964: Palestine Exile Regime Planned
description: ALEXANDRIA, U.A.R.  Arab summit leaders today [Sept. 10] decided to create a Palestine government-in-exile and liberation army from among the refugees who left Israel during the 1948 war. Informed sources said Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Iraq and Kuwait pledged $30.8 million for the upkeep of the army. U.A.R. President Gamal Abdel Nasser said he would place the Sinai peninsula and the Gaza strip at the disposal of the Palestine organization. He indicated this meant the organization would be allowed to establish headquarters and training facilities in these areas but did not mean Egypt was ceding the territory.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 11, 1964

title: What Does the Apple Watch Mean for Travelers?
description: Updated, March 9, 2015, 1:52 p.m. | Apples new smartwatch can track your heart rate, pay for your Chicken McNuggets and give you turn-by-turn directions by sending vibrations to your wrist. You can even buy one in 18-karat gold. The device, the details of which will be revealed today during an Apple press conference, is the latest in slick, wearable technology, a growing category that includes Google Glass, Jawbones Up fitness tracker and Liquid Images goggle-cameras.

title: Michael Kors: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: In Ray Rice Case, N.F.L. Sees Only What It Wants to See
description: Roger Goodell, the commissioner of the N.F.L., took a seat with CBS This Morning to explain once again how very little he knew about the circumstances in which Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice knocked out his then-fiance.

title: Hugo Bosss Spring 2015 Collection at New York Fashion Week
description: The live stream of the latest womens collection from Hugo Boss at New York Fashion Week has ended.

title: Photographers Facing Danger and Death
description: At the photo festival in Perpignan, concerns over the slow death of traditional media were overtaken by anger and sadness over the violent deaths of photographers overseas.

title: From Kurdistan to Texas, Scots Spur Separatists
description: STEENOKKERZEEL, Belgium  For Kurt Ryon, the mayor of Steenokkerzeel, a Flemish village 10 miles northeast of Brussels, watching the Scottish independence campaign in the final days before the referendum is like watching a good soccer match. They were losing for the first half and most of the second half, he said, but now were in the 85th minute and they could be winning.

title: What Obama Faces in a Campaign Against ISIS
description: President Obama will use a prime-time address on Wednesday evening to explain to Americans his strategy for confronting the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the Sunni militant group. Here is a look at some of the questions that may be addressed in the speech.

title: Do You Hire Employees on a Trial Basis?
description: Weve just published a small-business guide about business owners who test-drive prospective employees before hiring them.

title: Under Cover: On Turning Lena Dunham Into a Neoclassical Bust
description: Once we settled on Lena Dunham as the cover subject for this weeks Culture Issue, the question was how to capture her quirky spirit as actor, writer and director. Jake Silverstein, the magazines editor, wanted to evoke classical art. The magazines design director, Gail Bichler, suggested turning Dunham into a sculpture, and Joanna Milter, deputy photo editor, had an idea for the artist to take that on: Victoria Diehl, a Spanish photographer who creates haunting hybrids of flesh and stone by melding images of human models and classical marble statues. Diehl had been on Milters radar since they met a few years ago at Photo Espaa, an international photography festival. Last month, Diehl flew in from La Corua, Spain, to photograph Dunham at Industria Superstudio in Manhattans meatpacking district, and then spent the next few weeks back in Spain composing the photo illustration above. Recently, Diehl talked about what it took to turn Dunham into marble.

title: Apples Recipe for Emptying Pockets and Wallets
description: Apple has cooked up a recipe for emptying pockets and wallets.

title: Off the Runway: Day 6
description: Many hands help to make the do, backstage at the Badgley Mischka show at Lincoln Center on the sixth day of New York Fashion Week. See more photos in slideshow.

title: Family of Rikers Inmate Sues New York City Over His Death
description: The night Bradley Ballard died, he lay naked on the floor of his cell in a mental health observation unit at Rikers Island, weak and covered with feces. He had not been given medication for his schizophrenia and diabetes. And, unbeknown to guards, he had tied a rubber band around his genitals, causing them to become badly infected, New York City investigators later concluded.

title: At Michael Kors, Spotting Springs Most Wearable Hairstyle: Braids
description: Im not sure if shes a girl who just got out of a car or a tornado in the Midwest, joked the hairstylist Orlando Pita of the inspiration behind the blustery braids he created for the Michael Kors spring/summer 2015 fashion show this morning. The look is very disheveled, very earthy and sensual. And super low-maintenance, as the plaits didnt require much prep work. Its the first show of the day, so the girls are coming in with really clean hair, Pita noted. To build a tiny bit of grip and texture, he applied his Lift & Plump Volumizing Spray Mist followed by Schwarzkopf Osis+ Dust It mattifying powder, then started loosely braiding strands at the collarbone. The hair drapes over the shoulders so it seems like thats the length of the models hair, Pita explained. Next, he blasted on dry shampoo and pulled out layers around the face, curling them with an iron for a messy, windswept feel. The looks easy sophistication appealed to the model Maggie Rizer, who had just flown in from San Francisco, where she lives with her two toddler sons. I love it, she said of the unkempt braid. Its how my hair looks most of the time, only Orlando does it better!

title: Roger Goodell Asks Former F.B.I. Director to Investigate Ray Rice Incident
description: Two days after a graphic video surfaced showing the star running back Ray Rice knocking out his fiance, N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell continued to scramble to get ahead of the brewing controversy about whether he had seen the video before suspending the player for two games.

title: Like Father, Like Daughter at Banco Santander
description: MADRID  Banco Santander decided on Wednesday to keep its leadership in the family by appointing Ana Patricia Botn as executive chairwoman to succeed her father, Emilio Botn, who died the night before.

title: Nomination of Cecilia Malmstrom as E.U. Trade Envoy Signals Interest in U.S. Talks
description: PARIS  The selection of Cecilia Malmstrom on Wednesday to be Europes new trade chief suggests that Jean-Claude Juncker, the president-elect of the European Commission, is eager to restart stalled talks with the United States on the creation of a trade partnership.

title: Melissa Auf der Maur Hosts Musical Festivals and Flea Markets in the Hudson Valley
description: The proposed Marina Abramovic Institute has helped burnish the ongoing, artistic renaissance of Hudson, New York, but Melissa Auf der Maur got there first. In 2008, a gabled, 19th-century warehouse caught the attention of the former bassist of Smashing Pumpkins and Hole, who, along with her husband, the filmmaker Tony Stone, became, as she puts it, the spaces creative directors, janitors and secretaries. From spring to fall, they host concerts, film festivals, art exhibitions, flea markets and the extremely popular Ramp Fest, held in celebration of the forageable green onion. The building is a symbol of the region, Auf der Maur says of Basilica Hudson, diverse, richly historic, magical, confusing.

title: Dia Art Foundation Appoints a Tate Modern Curator as Its Director
description: The Dia Art Foundation, which turned 40 this year and is struggling to re-establish its presence in a Manhattan much more crowded and expensive than the one in which it was founded, announced Wednesday that it had chosen Jessica Morgan, a curator at the Tate Modern in London, to be its new director.

title: Highlights From Obamas Speech on ISIS
description: President Obama used a prime-time address on Wednesday evening to explain to Americans his strategy for confronting the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the Sunni militant group. Times journalists provided analysis during and after the speech.

title: Jeremy Scott: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Photographers Facing Danger and Death
description: Though the conversation at the Visa Pour lImage festival in Perpignan, France, often turned to the lack of editorial assignments and support for news photographers, last weeks dominant theme was not the slow death of big media.

title: Gates Foundation Pledges $50 Million to Fight Ebola
description: The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation on Wednesday committed $50 million to the fight against Ebola in West Africa, the largest sum it has ever committed to one outbreak.

title: 36 Hours in Cartagena
description: Lining the ancient walls of Cartagena, Colombia, travelers find traditional food, beautiful beaches and a nightlife that heats up long after the sun goes down.

title: 36 Hours in Cartagena, Colombia
description: From afar, Cartagenas skyline is deceptive. Its white towers rise above the Caribbean from a peninsula of tan sand and concrete, making it look like a bigger, beachier metropolis than it is. But with fewer than a million people, Cartagena is a sliver of the size of Rio de Janeiro or Los Angeles. One might expect the crisp new skyscrapers in Bocagrande to be in the midst of a vital, cosmopolitan downtown. Instead, Cartagenas character  its lush plazas, fruit vendors and street art  is contained in two small, impossibly photogenic neighborhoods: the walled Old City and the rising barrio Getseman. There, in the birthplace of Gabriel Garca Mrquezs magical realism, are the citys most refined restaurants, its museums and balconies that spill over with flowering bougainvillea. But even in its most energetic quarters, Cartagena is not so much a place to do, as a place to be.

title: Hotel Review: Click Clack Hotel in Bogot, Colombia
description: Rates

title: No Comment Necessary: Mike Tyson Endorses Rob Ford
description: Mike Tyson, the former heavyweight champion and convicted felon, has endorsed Rob Ford, the crack-smoking mayor of Toronto who is seeking re-election.

title: Lawsuit Filed by Bradley Ballards Mother
description: The level of abuse, indifference and misconduct at the heart of this case is stunning and unconscionable, reads the preliminary statement.

title: A Yalies Promising Future Competed With a Darker Side
description: Jeff Hobbs and Robert Peace were roommates throughout their four years at Yale, class of 2002. Their friendship got off to a slightly bumpy start. Mr. Hobbs, a wealthy, second-generation Yalie who grew up in a house with a pool, had the impression that his future roommate came from a similar background, perhaps because Rob Peace had gone to a prep school and played water polo. But Rob was a black kid from a ghetto called Illtown, just outside Newark. And when they compared their fathers occupations, Jeff said surgeon. Rob said inmate, tactfully leaving out convicted murderer.

title: What Janay Rice Wants
description: On Monday, TMZ released a silent three-minute video showing the (now former) Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice assaulting Janay Palmer, his fiance at the time, in the elevator of an Atlantic City hotel in February. Previously released footageshowed Mr. Rice dragging an unconscious Ms. Palmer out of the elevator, a revelation that cost Mr. Rice a two-game suspension.

title: Interview: David Thorpe
description: The Brooklyn filmmaker discusses his documentary Do I Sound Gay?, about his quest to better understand his voice.

title: Delpozo: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Banging Out an Armistice on Keyboards
description: There were no speeches, or stagy hugs, or arms lifted in reconciliation. Not even a handshake. Still, on Tuesday night at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, two pioneers of Minimalism, the composers Philip Glass and Steve Reich, both 77, put aside a personal and professional feud that lasted more than 40 years and, for the first time since the early 70s, performed together as they had in their early days so often and so momentously.

title: Andris Nelsons Gets Ready to Lead the Boston Symphony
description: He was a terror at Tanglewood, the summer home of the Boston Symphony Orchestra, careening around the campus in a staff golf cart, his gangly 6-foot-2 frame spilling out of the drivers seat. Andris Nelsons, the 35-year-old Latvian conductor who this month became the venerable orchestras music director, and who doesnt even drive a car, had come upon a new toy.

title: Toronto Festival 2014: David Thorpe and Do I Sound Gay?
description: TORONTO  The Brooklyn filmmaker David Thorpe has been self-conscious about his voice for years. But a trip to Fire Island surrounded by men sounding much like him led him to make the documentary Do I Sound Gay?

title: Maroon 5 Hits No. 1
description: This week on the music charts, Maroon 5 opens with the No. 1 album and Meghan Trainors ode to a healthy-size derriere is the new No. 1 single.

title: In Florida, a Starring Role for Dolphins
description: Anticipating waves of visitors with the Friday release of Dolphin Tale 2, several Gulf Coast hotels from Clearwater to St. Pete Beach in Florida are offering themed packages that include tickets to the Clearwater Marine Aquarium, home of the films stars, dolphins Winter and Hope.

title: New Safety Rules Weighed for Magnets
description: Late last summer, the worried mother of Annaka Chaffin, a 19-month-old from Columbus, Ohio, took her daughter to a hospital. The girl showed signs of a stomach bug, and after an exam, the hospital staff determined that she was probably suffering from a virus and sent her home.

title: Jonathan Hill of Britain Nominated to Key E.U. Post Overseeing Financial Sector
description: LONDON  In an unexpected appointment that delighted the British government and the City of London alike, a Briton was nominated on Wednesday to a crucial financial leadership post in the European Union.

title: New York Fashion Week: Michael Kors Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Nina Westervelt.

title: Birmingham Courts Democrats and Waves Off Skeptics
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  When Mayor William A. Bell Sr. of Birmingham visited Washington this year, he took along what some of his fellow Democrats believed was a preposterous idea: Hold the 2016 Democratic National Convention in the largest city of one of the countrys most conservative states.

title: No Winner Yet, but Afghan Presidential Candidate Still Outlines New Government
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan presidential candidate Ashraf Ghani, sounding secure in the prospect of victory, began outlining his plans for a new government Wednesday in a speech to supporters.

title: Goldman Hired to Manage $2 Billion of New York Public Pension Fund
description: Goldman Sachs got its largest-ever assignment to manage money for New York States largest pension fund.

title: A Football Team Abandons Racism
description: The football team at Coachella Valley High School in Thermal, Calif., has jumped off to two victories this season without the sideline benefit of its traditional mascot: A papier mch-headed Arab with the glare of a playful villain, who drummed up spirit with the help of a belly-dancing co-ed. Hes gone, for good.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and More
description: Photos from Ukraine, Pakistan, India and Washington.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 6
description: Parties for Phillip Lim, Interview magazine and Fashion Rocks.

title: Using Your Phone to See Paris in a Whole New Light
description: PARIS is my favorite city, and this time of year is my favorite time to be there. Exploring the ancient city is easier than ever, with the help of apps.

title: App Smart | Guides to Visiting Paris
description: Kit Eaton reviews three apps that will help you better navigate Paris, from its transit system to the Louvre.

title: Fantasy Football: Week 2 Matchup Breakdown
description: Were guessing that not many fantasy football owners had Titans quarterback Jake Locker in their lineups in Week 1, but he was in full command against the Kansas City Chiefs, compiling 266 yards, two touchdowns and a 111.4 quarterback rating. Up next is a vulnerable Cowboys secondary, which was the second-best fantasy matchup for the position in 2013 and allowed 21 fantasy points to Colin Kaepernick in Week 1. With two great weapons in Kendall Wright and Justin Hunter, Lockers health may be the only thing keeping him from a breakout season, and hes still available to add in many leagues.

title: Funny, Kooky and Short on the Net
description: Epic Rap Battles of History, a hip-hop parody in which Shakespeare and Dr. Seuss (among other pairs) battle in rhyme, is one of those seemingly ubiquitous online videos that you might have clicked on and thought: Thats a funny diversion.

title: 2 Senators Introduce New Anti-Inversion Bill
description: Senators Charles E. Schumer, Democrat of New York, and Richard Durbin, Democrat of Illinois, are the latest politicians to take aim at inversions.

title: PGA Tour Has Its Schedule, and Players Have Theirs
description: ATLANTA  The PGA Tour has become such a ceaseless march that the winner of the FedEx Cup ought to be awarded a gold-plated treadmill. The new season will start three weeks after this one officially concludes Sunday at East Lake Golf Club.

title: Gingham Checks In on the New York Runways
description: After making a brief appearance last season at Cline, gingham has infiltrated the spring/summer 2015 New York runways. While the traditional colored checks seen at several shows reflect springs flora and fauna, were partial to these graphic black-and-white offerings. At Altuzarra, which opened with a series of effortless gingham dresses and separates, the black and white skirt suit was a standout. Oscar de la Renta showed a bigger check in the form of a midriff-baring two-piece skirt and top set  a refreshing new silhouette for cocktail dressing. Finally, at Diane von Furstenberg, two differently sized checks were fused together in a tank dress with a fluid, floor-grazing chiffon skirt.

title: Sunnis in Iraq Often See Their Government as the Bigger Threat
description: BAGHDAD  A group of Iraqi Sunni refugees had found shelter in an abandoned school, two families to a room, after fleeing fighters from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria. They were gathered in the schools courtyard last week when the Iraqi Air Force bombed them.

title: Dollar General Brings In a Familiar Face to Aid in Its Hostile Bid for Family Dollar
description: To help with its $9.1 billion hostile bid for Family Dollar, Dollar General has enlisted an old friend: its former owner.

title: Carolina Herrera: Pursuing Elegance
description: Carolina Herrera, a fashion designer, reveals the process behind her spring 2015 collection, which is fully produced out of her atelier in New York Citys garment district.

title: Vanessa Hudgens to Star in Gigi at the Kennedy Center
description: Vanessa Hudgens, who made her name as Gabriella Montez in the Disney Channels High School Musical, is to play the title role in a new staging of Lerner and Loewes classic musical Gigi thats intended for Broadway, a spokesman for the production announced on Wednesday.

title: Katlin Aas Transforms at Michael Kors
description: (function($) {var data = chameleonData[0];var beforeAfterContainer = $('#nytmm_beforeAfter_wrapper319 .nytmm_beforeAfter_container');var options = {leftImage: data.images.left.leftImage,rightImage: data.images.right.rightImage,showFooter: data.footer.showFooter,leftCredit: data.images.left.leftCredit,rightCredit: data.images.right.rightCredit,caption: data.footer.caption,startPoint: data.images.startPoint,showButton: data.footer.button.showButton,leftButtonText: data.footer.button.leftButtonText,rightButtonText: data.footer.button.rightButtonText}beforeAfterContainer.BeforeAfter(options);})(jQuery||NYTD.jQuery);

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: A Deal From the Cavendish Tournament in Monaco
description: The ladies pairs at the Cavendish tournament in Monaco last week attracted 20 entries. After playing 95 boards, five against each of the other pairs, the field was divided in two, giving an A final and a B final. These also consisted of five boards against each pair.

title: Stevie Wonder to Tour, Playing Songs in the Key of Life
description: Coming to a lucky series of fewer than a dozen cities this fall: a rare tour by Stevie Wonder, who will perform his landmark 1976 album Songs in the Key of Life.

title: Down a Rabbit Hole, Where Everything Makes Complete Sense
description: In Christopher Wheeldons Alices Adventures in Wonderland, Alice doesnt rush down the rabbit hole rashly, burning with curiosity. In this balletic adaptation of Lewis Carrolls books, the heroine is dragged into her adventures. And her smiling passivity is only the worst of many things that go wrong in this cleverly constructed, scenically opulent, commercially successful 2011 production.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 6
description: Fashion Week parties hit a groove on Tuesday night with pop-music-heavy parties for Phillip Lim, Interview magazine and the Fashion Rocks concert. See more photos in slideshow.

title: Versifying Above the Footlights
description: In a shoe box cafe on a West Village side street, Craig Grant, known as muMs, had his back to the room. Then a young barista came to clear a cup away, Mr. Grant turned his head, and she stopped in her tracks. Youre Poet, she said, suddenly flustered, and he smiled and stuck his hand out to shake.

title: The Making of Carolina Herreras Fashion Show
description: At a little before 10 a.m. on Monday, the fifth day of New York Fashion Week, the backstage area at Lincoln Center was mobbed. Cameramen, designers, makeup artists and photographers were elbowing one another out of the way. The fashion executives Marc Puig and Ralph Toledano, each in expensively tailored suits, were chatting casually among the chaos. A few feet away, a member of Carolina Herreras atelier was steaming an enormous gown. And now it was showtime.

title: Short-Seller Carson Block Says Hes Wary of Alibaba
description: Updated, 6:22 p.m. | In the world of the short-seller Carson Block, any Chinese company could be a fraud. Even Alibaba.

title: Domestic Violence in The Times: From Civil Unrest to Spouse Abuse
description: The attention this week to the domestic abuse case involving Ray Rice, a star running back who was fired by the N.F.L.'s Baltimore Ravens, reinforces a fairly recent trend: an increase in the phrase domestic violence in publications, including The New York Times.

title: Hugo Boss: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: JDS Uniphase to Split Into 2 Companies
description: Updated, 7:11 p.m. | JDS Uniphase, a maker of fiber optic networking equipment whose share price has languished in recent years, said on Wednesday that it would split into two publicly traded companies in an effort to promote growth.

title: Coleman Recalls Inflatable Swimming Tubes From Walmart
description: The Coleman Company, a manufacturer of camping and other outdoor equipment, has agreed to take more than 20,000 of its inflatable rubber tubes off the shelves at Walmart.

title: Jean-Claude Juncker Seeks to Streamline Brussels Bureaucracy
description: BRUSSELS  Jean-Claude Juncker, the incoming president of the European Unions executive branch, sought to make his mark on Brussels on Wednesday, nominating a slate of new commissioners. But he also reduced their autonomy by adding a layer of oversight.

title: Tough-Yet-Summery Sandals at Michael Kors
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: After the Fashion, the Festivities
description: Anyone who skipped through the countless fashion parties this past week can attest that the nightly spectacle has become as important for branding as the actual fashion shows.

title: Back to School, to New Marching Orders
description: School was back in session across China last week, and in addition to the chaos seen in many countries  excitement over new friends and bags, horror at school lunches and having to wake up early  there were some uniquely Chinese elements.

title: Coinbase Extends Bitcoin Access to International Customers
description: Coinbase is taking its Bitcoin services to Europe in a move that could help expand the virtual currencys reach.

title: For Spring/Summer 2015, a Return to the Summer of Love
description: The 60s and 70s have been recurring themes on this seasons New York runways  most prominently at Tommy Hilfiger, who presented a literal ode to the rock music of that era. Standing out among the Sergeant Pepper looks were the ethereal, floor-grazing maxi dresses that closed the show. Translucent, long-sleeved frocks fit for flower children were also seen at Zimmermann, where different sheer prints were paneled together with romantic ruffles. Finally, at Vera Wang, the mostly black collection switched its tune when the model Daphne Groeneveld glided by in a pleated, floor-length chiffon gown with a micro-floral pattern.

title: Ignore Endorsements From Politicians
description: Tim Wu, who had hoped to be lieutenant governor New York, did surprisingly well in Tuesdays primary for a candidate with no money and little name recognition among ordinary voters. He won 40.1 percent of the vote, and 27 of the states 62 counties.

title: Who Needs Art? Theres Plumbing
description: It tickles Alexander Melamid, a 69-year-old conceptual artist and provocateur, that his Chelsea landlord has printed his name on the buildings tenant listing board as Melamids Healing Shrine. But so much amuses Mr. Melamid, a Russian-born painter with a ready cackle and a fondness for bear hugs, whose past provocations have included deep-frying photographs of artists like Andy Warhol, Picasso and Marcel Duchamp. It has long been Mr. Melamids mission to poke fun at the art world. His Art Healing Ministry, an ongoing project, proposes that certain extractions and gadgets involving the emanations of Great Works  Raphael, say, or Botticelli  could be cures for a grab-bag of ailments: bulimia, acne, anxiety.

title: Outdoor Heirlooms: Dining Tables
description: When youre buying a table that you intend to put outdoors, the obvious thing to consider is what its made of  even if you live somewhere thats temperate year-round. Jonathan Olivares, an industrial designer in Los Angeles, for example, said he sticks to metals, woods, sometimes marble, stone and concrete.

title: Do I Need to Stage My Balcony Before Showings?
description: Q. Do I need to stage my balcony before showings?

title: The Elastic Interior
description: Its a common enough dream for those who live in cramped urban spaces: Suddenly you notice a door you never realized was there and beyond it a room you didnt know you had  or maybe an entire wing of your home, just waiting to be occupied.

title: Preparing for Obamas Speech
description: Tonight President Obama addresses the nation on the threat of the Islamist State in Iraq and Syria. Times editors learned about the address Monday morning, and editors in New York and Washington, along with eight reporters, have been gearing up for coverage. They met Monday to discuss what to cover and how. Susan Chira, assistant managing editor, supplies an inside look at how the conversation and coverage took shape.

title: Tell Us About Your Companys Wellness Program
description: Does your company have a wellness program? The Timess Health desk would like to hear about it for future reporting on this topic. Your responses will not be published, but a Times reporter or editor may follow up with you directly to learn more about your story.

title: For Many Iranians, the Evidence Is Clear: ISIS Is an American Invention
description: TEHRAN  Iranians are as obsessed as Americans these days with the black-clad gangs roaming Iraq and Syria and killing Shiites and other infidels in the name of Sunni Islam. At the supermarket, in a shared taxi or at a family gathering, conversations often turn to the mysterious group, the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, and how it came to be.

title: What Makes a Nail Polish Worth $50?
description: Not long ago, Federica di Martino, a young actress visiting New York from Rome, sauntered into Christian Louboutins West Village boutique and slipped on a pair of six-inch stilettos. Perched on those heels, she was a knockout. But could she walk? Sure, she said, laughing as she leaned against the front door for support. I can make it from here to the opposite end of the store.

title: 35 Arrested as Missouri Police Block Protest on Highway Over Teenagers Shooting
description: BERKELEY, Mo.  Demonstrators hoping to block Interstate 70 here on Wednesday to protest the fatal shooting of Michael Brown a month ago were barred by the police from entering the highway. The authorities said 35 people had been arrested, most for unlawful assembly but four for assaulting officers.

title: Steve Jobs Was a Low-Tech Parent
description: When Steve Jobs was running Apple, he was known to call journalists to either pat them on the back for a recent article or, more often than not, explain how they got it wrong. I was on the receiving end of a few of those calls. But nothing shocked me more than something Mr. Jobs said to me in late 2010 after he had finished chewing me out for something I had written about an iPad shortcoming.

title: To Build a Fire Pit
description: Heres what youll need.

title: Normcore Locks at Hugo Boss
description: The beauty looks seen at this New York Fashion Week have been romantic, fun and experimental (especially Rodartes pierced brows and Marc by Marc Jacobss Bjork-ish buns). For most of us mere mortals, though, spring is really about fresh, glowing skin and effortless locks. At todays Hugo Boss show, Jason Wus minimalist collection was complemented by the models clean, dewy makeup: nude lips, a barely-there dusting of taupe shadow. And on day seven of shows, there was something undeniably palate-cleansing about the Abbey Lees perfectly tame, freshly combed blonde hair, parted down the middle like a schoolgirls.

title: Discounts at Minam, Artek, Michael McHale and Company C
description: Lostine wool throws are 50 percent off at Minam, while supplies last (originally $288 each, now $144); 215- 825-7276, minam.com.

title: Beer With Its Own Accommodations
description: This summer, Dogfish Head, the craft brewer, opened the Dogfish Inn in the historic beach town of Lewes, Del., roughly 10 miles from the brewery. Designed by Studio Tack of Brooklyn, the rugged-good-looks hotel offers 16 rooms with wide balconies, custom-designed Woolrich blankets (handy in the off season), Tivoli radios, barware dedicated to beer drinking and artwork that pays tribute to one of the few remaining floating lighthouses in the United States (its docked a few hundred feet from the building). Almost needless to say, dogs are welcome, but call if yours weighs more than 80 pounds. We get about 1,000 people a week who visit our brewery, said Sam Calagione, an owner. But now we get to hang out with them for 24 hours or more, rather than just an hour. Its a natural extension of the Dogfish community. Information: 302-644-8292 or dogfishinn.com.

title: Baptism by Fire Pit
description: In the 13 years weve owned our home, my wife and I have built three fire pits. The first was a rock ring in the woods, where we sat on boulders and invited armies of mosquitoes to mainline our blood while we pretended not to notice.

title: Metal Makes a Connection in Lighting and Furniture
description: Gabriel Kakon and Scott Richler have collaborated for a decade designing furniture and lighting; in 2012 they introduced their signature collection under the name Gabriel Scott. Now the Montreal natives (and brothers-in-law) are opening a New York showroom in the Brewster Carriage House, where coaches were once made. There they will show their new Harlow lighting collection of mold-blown, gem-shaped glass elements connected by metal prongs (a pendant starts at $2,950), and Prong tables with Italian marble tops on spiky metal legs (from $2,150). Other pieces on display include the Welles, a modular light system made of suspended clusters of blackened polyhedrons with metal interiors ($750 per polyhedron). Open Monday to Friday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; weekends by appointment, 372 Broome Street (Mott Street). Information: 212-837-2923 or gabriel-scott.com.

title: Viacom Agrees to Offer 22 Networks on Internet-Enabled Sony Devices Later This Year
description: More choice is on the way for television viewers beyond paying for traditional cable and satellite packages.

title: New York Fashion Week: Delpozo Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Industrial, but With a Softer Side
description: Roman and Williams has added lighting to its R. W. Atlas housewares for Waterworks with two collections, Spunflower and Cupper. Robin Standefer, a founder of Roman and Williams, described the burnished nickel and brass lights as fairly muscular and sturdy, but with a fine tactility. In all, there are two pendants, two sconces and a chandelier, any of which can be described as industrial. But a closer look reveals some frills. The Spunflower pendant, for instance, has three tiers of milky white glass crowned with a rim of metal with tiny perforations. Ms. Standefer said these dots would temper any harshness. The quality of illumination in industrial fixtures is often pure, tough and authentic, she added, but a light still has to be soft and beautiful. Prices range from $1,200 to $3,500. The Cupper ceiling-mounted four-light pendant, shown, is $3,500. Information: 800-899-6757 or waterworks.com.

title: Swimming Holes for City Folk
description: City waterfronts where swimming is banned have become pet peeves for Jane Withers, a London design consultant and a founder of Wonderwater, an environmental advocacy group. Urban Plunge, an exhibition that she curated at the Roca London Gallery, shows how natural bodies of water in metropolises have become primed for public dipping. Marshy basking spots for Londoners are being created in the Thames; Copenhagen already allows bathing in its harbor and the Manhattan coastline could soon have a floating cross-shaped swimming hole called +POOL. Amphitheaters, zigzagging boardwalks, and artificial hummocks surround the swimming areas, so bathers are not left vulnerable in open water. I like the idea of these semi-wild experiences, Ms. Withers said. The show opens to coincide with the London Design Festival, Sept. 13 to 21, but runs through Jan. 10, 2015. Information: 44-20-7610-9503 or rocalondongallery.com.

title: The Dutch Are Back in Town
description: On Sept. 24, in an avant-garde condo tower that butts up against the High Line, an unusual gallery called Chamber will open in Chelsea. Like a 17th-century cabinet of curiosities, it will be filled with the eclectic treasures of intrepid explorers.

title: The Attack on ISIS Expands to Syria
description: By the time President Obama announced the authorization of airstrikes in Syria Wednesday night, he clearly felt that he had little choice militarily or politically. For three years he resisted American military involvement in Syria, where the Assad government and rebel forces are engaged in a bloody civil war.

title: Locations of Presidential TV Speeches Can Give Signals
description: When the current Oval Office was built under Franklin Roosevelts supervision in 1934, featuring an Art Deco design that was fashionable at that moment, F.D.R. had no expectation that it would turn out to be a television theater for the president (his single TV appearance was giving a speech opening the New York Worlds Fair in Flushing Meadows, Queens, in 1939). But thats what it turned out to be.

title: Dressing for New York City Fall Weekends
description: Anyone who has brunched in Brooklyn knows that New York is a city that dresses on the weekend. The look, relaxed but put together, is quirkier than your office-appropriate work wear, but polished enough for an unexpected encounter with the boss. To make a casual style statement this fall, start with great separates: a pair of shorts, a classic peacoat. Top it off with fun accessories, and youre ready to see and be seen.

title: Anna Wintours Celebrity Extends to Theater
description: The legend seems to grow larger every season. Outside Jason Wus fashion show in SoHo last Friday and the Diane von Furstenberg show on Sunday, two artists were selling a giant portrait of Anna Wintour. The asking price? $10,000.

title: Detroits Bankruptcy Deal Hinges on 2 Banks
description: Syncora Guarantee, Detroits most vociferous adversary in bankruptcy, is close to a breakthrough settlement with the city, but before it can close the deal it must resolve a related dispute with two big banks, Bank of America and UBS.

title: Smells Like 90s Spirit
description: From the East Village to Brooklyn, vintage clothing shops are riding the wave of 90s nostalgia.

title: Facing ISIS and Evil in Iraq
description: Spurred by scenes of northern Iraqs refugee crisis, Lynsey Addario soon found the story had become about the battle with violent Islamic fundamentalists.

title: ISIS Goals and Tactics Worldwide
description: Some background on goals, tactics and the potential long-term threat to the United States from the militant group known as the Islamic State.

title: Off the Runway: Day 7
description: Scenes from Michael Kors and Bibhu Mohapatra on the seventh day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Macworld to End Its Print Edition and Lay Off Many of Its Employees
description: Macworld, a monthly technology magazine devoted to Apple products, laid much of its staff off on Wednesday and will stop publishing a print edition.

title: A Chance at Anonymity, if Not a View
description: Is it lonely at the top? Not if you ask Melanie Woods, who, gazing from her Alpine perch at the rear of the Alexander Wang show on Saturday, found the ether as heady as the view. Ms. Woods, 31, a medical clinic coordinator visiting Manhattan from Memphis, chortled as she confided that she had scored her much-coveted ticket from a friend who works at Topshop. Im so excited by the models and the scene, she said. Everything is so rich. It gives me a rush.

title: Ways to Look at a College Education
Foreign Support for Research and Advocacy
Mideast Terrorism: The Qatar Governments View
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Movie Ticket Sales Slumped This Summer
description: To the Editor:

title: New York Fashion Week: Hugo Boss Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Andreas Joseph.

title: Peru Investigates the Killing of an Environmental Advocate
description: LIMA, Peru  The authorities here are investigating the killing of an environmental advocate and indigenous leader who died along with three other men in a remote region of the Amazon jungle that he had sought to protect from illegal logging.

title: Lured Back by a Cease-Fire in Ukraine, but Not Feeling at Home Yet
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  The bus station is bustling once again, with families unloading children, pets and bulging bags while waiting for connecting routes. Many are returning to Donetsk and surrounding areas after escaping the intense bombardment of the last few months, prompted by the announcement of a cease-fire but also by more prosaic things, like retrieving warm clothes and the return to school.

title: Guilty Plea by American on Attempt to Help ISIS
description: A 19-year-old Colorado woman pleaded guilty on Wednesday to conspiring to help the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the Sunni militant group, after she was caught trying to travel to Syria, federal prosecutors said.

title: Anna Sui: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Keeping Things Casual: Lacoste, Hood By Air, Public School
description: I have a suit, yes, a couple of suits, Tim Coppens said before his mens wear show last weekend. I appreciate the construction aspect of a suit, and suiting is needed for certain ceremonial things.

title: Breaking My A.L.S. Promise
description: CHICAGO  Like most people, I was impressed and amused by the A.L.S. ice bucket challenge  that so many people got involved and that both funds and awareness were raised. But I was also conflicted.

title: The Models Were a Mirage
description: Sometimes fashion is all about timing. When the schedule for New York Fashion Week was completed a few weeks ago, one show that had been added to the roster  Polo for Women, to be held in Central Park  looked as if it might be problematic for some attendees.

title: Israeli Officer Charged in Assault
description: JERUSALEM  A border police officer has been charged with assault after he was filmed beating a Palestinian-American teenager on the edges of a violent riot in East Jerusalem in July, the Israeli Ministry of Justice said Wednesday in a statement.

title: Mocking ISIS in Beirut
description: As fear of militants from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria rises in the United States after the beheading of two American journalists, and President Obama lines up support for the use of force against ISIS, the backlash against the movement has already begun in the Arab world.

title: Why Doesnt the Apple Watch Have Wireless Charging? Because It Probably Wouldnt Work Very Well.
description: The Apple Watch will not allow for wireless charging. To charge the device, youve got to connect it to a charging cable.

title: Stop the Anti-Obamacare Shenanigans
description: SO far, opponents of the Affordable Care Act have lost every major battle to repeal or invalidate it. Some of them are now urging the courts to interpret the health reform law in a way that would guarantee its failure. This is a significant threat  potentially as grave as the previous main legal challenge to the law, which the Supreme Court rejected, 5 to 4, in 2012. If the new effort succeeds, it would create total chaos.

title: The Digital Wallet Revolution
description: THIS week Apple announced two new pieces of hardware, the iPhone 6 and a smartwatch. But as flashy as they are, neither item is as groundbreaking as a piece of software that will accompany them: a digital wallet, allowing users to eschew cash and credit cards for a quick swipe of their device at the register.

title: A View of Ground Zero
description: A panoramic view of the progress at the new World Trade Center site exactly 13 years after the Sept. 11 attacks.

title: T-Mobiles Latest Freebies Revolve Around Wi-Fi
description: Over the last year and a half, T-Mobile has luredmillions of customers to its network with the help of giveaways, like unlimited music streaming and free international roaming.

title: A Video Series Turns a Spotlight on Local Artists
description: AN online documentary about Porridge Papers, a company in Lincoln, Neb., that makes the type of deckle-edged recycled paper found in art supply and stationary stores, includes a field-trip visit by schoolchildren to the small mill and print shop.

title: Human Rights Abuses Reported in Junta-Ruled Thailand
description: BANGKOK  In the wake of the coup that overthrew the democratically elected government of Thailand in May, at least one activist says she was tortured while in custody, some 60 civilians face trials in military courts, and dissent and freedom of expression have been sharply restricted, according to a report by Amnesty International.

title: Ex-Mets Executive Sues Jeff Wilpon, Citing Discrimination Over Pregnancy
description: Leigh Castergine, a former top ticket-sales executive for the Mets, filed suit in federal court in Brooklyn on Tuesday, accusing the team and its chief operating officer, Jeff Wilpon, of discriminating against her for being pregnant without being married.

title: Going After the Abusers
With Apple Pay and Smartwatch, a Privacy Challenge
description: No one has considered Apple a serious data company, until now.

title: Cereals Begin to Lose Their Snap, Crackle and Pop
description: Cereal, that bedrock of the American breakfast, has lost some of its snap, crackle and pop.

title: Mayor Agrees to Accommodate 4 Larger or New Charter Schools
description: Mayor Bill de Blasios administration, which spent the winter in a bruising fight with charter school advocates, said on Wednesday that it would find space in public school buildings for four charter schools that want to open or expand next year.

title: Mexico: Discovery of Coca Plants Puzzles Authorities
description: The authorities discovered and destroyed more than 1,600 coca plants this week near the Guatemala border, the first such find in Mexico in recent memory. Coca, from which cocaine is produced, is grown and processed primarily in Peru and Colombia, because the climate and soil are thought to be ideal there. Traffickers based in Mexico control much of the flow of the drug to the United States and around the world. But the authorities, drawn Monday to the hidden farm by a tip, were not sure if the coca plants were an experiment or a sign that drug lords are developing fields closer to their markets.

title: An Eye in the Sky, Accessible to the Hobbyist
description: Look to the sky and say Cheese!

title: Elizabeth and James: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Astorino, Cuomos Opponent, Wants Voters to Know the Race Isnt Over
description: Andrew M. Cuomo is hoping this years campaign for governor effectively ended on Tuesday.

title: Alibaba Is Bringing Luxury, Fast, to Chinas Middle Class
description: On a cold day in April, a group of New Zealand fishermen set out to harvest 50,000 large oysters from the waters of the South Pacific.

title: Modified Training for Children Stirs New Debates
description: At 9 years old, J. C. Roddick, the nephew of Andy Roddick, was forging a path of his own in tennis. After years of showing promise in lessons at home in San Antonio, where he used a traditional racket, court and balls, he entered a local United States Tennis Association tournament in January 2012.

title: Hashtag Nation: How About Subways?
description: On to the next is a fashion week mantra, so perhaps its no surprise that traffic was a frequent gripe as the fashion flock traveled to shows. Happily for observers, all the waiting provided ample time for trendspotting and witty observations, which front row editors and bloggers dutifully shared on Twitter.

title: As Old (and New) as Time: Michael Kors, Oscar de la Renta and More
description: It happened just before Marc by Marc Jacobs: the big style innovation the world was waiting for, the accessory that was to be a game changer, the most anticipated debut of the season, the Apple Watch, finally appeared.

title: Reed Krakoff: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Shia LaBeouf Pleads Guilty for Outburst
description: The actor Shia LaBeouf pleaded guilty to disorderly conduct on Wednesday in connection with a drunken outburst at a performance of the musical Cabaret this summer.

title: An Amendment to Cut Political Cash
description: There are 48 Democratic senators sponsoring a constitutional amendment to restore congressional control to campaign spending that is expected to come up for a vote later this week. They are not under the illusion that it will become the 28th Amendment soon, if ever. But their willingness to undertake a long and difficult effort shows the importance they attach to restoring fairness to American politics by reducing the influence of big money.

title: Senate Hearing to Examine N.H.T.S.A.S. Recall Response
description: A Senate hearing examining the federal agency that oversees car safety will feature testimony from government officials, safety advocates and a representative from the automobile industry.The hearing, chaired by Senator Claire McCaskill, Democrat of Missouri, is planned for Tuesday, and will delve into the National Highway Traffic Safety Administrations implementation and enforcement of vehicle safety laws, as well as the agencys handling of the crisis that has engulfed General Motors. The company has recalled more than 29 million cars since January and failed for more than a decade to report to regulators and the public a defective ignition that has been linked to 13 deaths.

title: Microsoft Sees More Than Fun in a Game Like Minecraft
description: Parents like Minecraft because it can be a creative outlet for their children. Teachers like the game because it can bring lessons to life. And Microsoft likes the game so much that the tech giant wants to buy Minecrafts parent company for more than $2 billion.

title: Spring Collections or Spring Break: Jeremy Scott and Marc by Marc Jacobs
