description: Youth is wasted on the young, but fashion has a way of yanking it back. Guests at the Marc by Marc Jacobs show arrived at a rave temple, with enormous black speakers stacked like altars and bathed in neon glow. The Marc by Marc designers, Katie Hillier and Luella Bartley, dont frequent raves as they once did while growing up in England in the 1980s and 90s, circa raves first go-round.

title: Prosecutors Are Pushing Prison Time for DSouza
description: Saying that Dinesh DSouza had not yet accepted responsibility for his crime, prosecutors asked a federal judge in Manhattan on Wednesday to sentence the best-selling conservative author and filmmaker to 10 to 16 months in prison for violating campaign finance laws.

title: 10 of the Gallerist David Kordanskys Top Cultural Influences
description: As Jonathan Griffin writes in The New Dealer in Ts Mens Style Issue, the gallerist David Kordansky has for more than a decade championed the work of emerging artists (both young and old) with uncommon zeal. As he christens his new 12,000-square-foot space in Los Angeles, Kordansky shares with T some of his cultural touchstones  including several artists he doesnt represent but admires nonetheless.

title: The New Dealer
description: David Kordansky might not be the biggest player in the L.A. gallery scene, but his manic enthusiasm and seemingly genuine determination to draw attention to underappreciated artists make him the most interesting by far.

title: Group of Ex-Players Asks Court to Intervene in N.F.L. Concussion Case Settlement
description: PHILADELPHIA  The winding three-year legal battle against the N.F.L. over its handling of concussions took an unusual turn Wednesday when seven former players argued that a federal appeals court should intervene in a proposed settlement before it is made final.

title: Los Angeles Sees Raids Over Ties to Cartels
description: LOS ANGELES  Federal agents conducted a series of raids on Wednesday morning across this citys fashion district, sweeping more than 70 locations, arresting nine people, and seizing at least $65 million in cash and assets from organizations with ties to Mexican cartels, law enforcement officials said.

title: New York Fashion Week Social Media Roundup, Day 7
description: Wednesday morning began with a packed crowd for Michael Kors, who showed on-trend looks (gingham and midriffs, anyone?) and titillated his viewers with a few daring, not-safe-for-work moments of transparency. This restraint was followed by a much showier, kitschier lineup at Jeremy Scotts show, where Miley Cyrus and her tongue made numerous appearances. The pop singer was there to debut her Dirty Hippie collection of sparkly, colorful, toylike jewelry.

title: New Drug to Treat Obesity Gains Approval by F.D.A.
description: Can the third time be the charm for weight loss pills?

title: New Military Campaign Extends a Legacy of War
description: WASHINGTON  In ordering a sustained military campaign against Islamic extremists in Syria and Iraq, President Obama on Wednesday night effectively set a new course for the remainder of his presidency and may have ensured that he would pass his successor a volatile and incomplete war, much as his predecessor left one for him.

title: California Bill Sets Sights on Curbing Campus Sexual Assaults
description: LOS ANGELES  California is poised to become the first state to require all colleges that receive state funds to strengthen their policies on sexual assault by mandating that students give active consent to one another before all sexual activity, either by saying yes to a spoken query or by signaling assent in a nonverbal way.

title: Grandma Never Knit Like This
description: Forget the studies purporting to show that knitting can ease the somatic nervous system, reduce blood pressure, relax muscles and improve brain power while staving off dementia and reducing stress. Never mind the homely communitarianism of the all-male knitting circles that have popped up lately in bars and bookshops and under the trees in Bryant Park. Put aside the thrifty virtuousness of D.I.Y.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 10, 2014
Josh Bennetts List of Five
description: Josh Bennett knits. A 33-year-old New Yorker, his pneumatic physique and unorthodox knitwear creations for designers like Tommy Hilfiger, the Project Runway winner Irina Shabayeva and Michael Bastian have earned him the industry nickname the Knituation.

title: Dee Milliner Returns to Jets in Time for Encounter With Aaron Rodgers
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Rex Ryan and John Idzik stood beside the aerial lift separating the Jets two practice fields and fixed their gaze on the player wearing a green jersey, No. 27. There was Dee Milliner, in a helmet and shoulder pads, doing all the things that cornerbacks  healthy cornerbacks  are supposed to do.

title: In Court, Mother Is Called Calm at Time of Sons Death
description: Whatever drove Gigi Jordan to kill her 8-year-old son in 2010, the prosecution said on Wednesday that she was methodical and brutal in carrying out the crime: She pushed a poisonous mixture down the childs throat with a syringe, bruising his face, then coolly wrote a letter to her financial adviser as the boy lay dying.

title: Store Openings, New Collections and Sales Starting Sept. 11
description: Opening and Events

title: A Man With a Plan
description: Its a tough time to be a concerned citizen. The truth of the matter is, the job has always been messy.

title: Critique From an Obama Fan
description: Im probably one of the few Americans left with some sympathy for President Obamas foreign policy, and even I have to admit that his Syria policy has been a mess.

title: Speech Excerpt: Obama on ISIS Strategy
description: The president said the United States would lead a coalition against ISIS and laid out the four parts of the strategy.

title: After Losing to Cuomo, Teachout Returns to a Law School Lectern
description: Zephyr Teachout leaned on a wood lectern on Wednesday night as she cracked a joke about her unlikely bid for the Democratic nomination for governor of New York. Nearby, photographers jostled to get the best shot.

title: Struggling to Gauge ISIS Threat, Even as U.S. Prepares to Act
description: WASHINGTON  The violent ambitions of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria have been condemned across the world: in Europe and the Middle East, by Sunni nations and Shiite ones, and by sworn enemies like Israel and Iran. Pope Francis joined the call for ISIS to be stopped.

title: Mets Shift Daniel Murphy to Third, Giving Rookie a Shot at Second
description: Daniel Murphy, the Mets only All-Star this season, was out on the field alone Wednesday afternoon, taking ground balls at a position he had not regularly played in three years. After one throw, he held his follow-through, his wrist bent, not unlike a jump shooter.

title: Weaving Their Tapestry of Murder and Mayhem
description: He is a dashing man, charming us in scraps of old home movies and the stories his son tells. The New York director Rubn Polendo has made a theater piece examining his violence-ridden hometown, Ciudad Jurez, Mexico, and this man, who still lives there, is his father. Mijo, Mr. Polendos father tells him, all this is very real. Its sad, and its difficult. And its not a story, or a play, or a myth. Its the life of a city.

title: This Love Dares to Speak Its Name, Explicitly
description: In one of the sharpest scenes in Bootycandy, Robert OHaras searing and sensationally funny comedy about the sometimes poisonous attitude toward homosexuality in black culture, an adolescent boy hesitantly tells his mother and stepfather that a man tried to follow him home from the library.

title: Change of Heart
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  O.K., heres the thing: I watched a lot of people solve this puzzle  or try to solve it  at Lollapuzzoola last month, and the results made even the judges grading the puzzles weep. So if youre still wondering what just happened to you, this is the guy (below right) you should be mad at. And yes, I totally get the irony of my having taken his photograph with a lit light bulb over his head. Only someone as devious  sorry, I meant only someone as creative as Mr. Blindauer could have come up with a puzzle like this.

title: The Cost of War
description: Here we go again.

title: Proenza Schouler: Spring 2015 RTW
description: new york

title: Online Petitions Proposed to Offer New Yorkers a New Way to Speak Out
description: Since introducing a petition site in 2011 and promising to respond to any request that received enough signatures, the White House has been compelled to release its beer recipe, inform Texas that it would not be permitted to secede and weigh the merits of a Death Star for national defense.

title: Rob Ford, Toronto Mayor, in Hospital With an Abdominal Tumor
description: OTTAWA  After more than a year of political turmoil punctuated by his admission of crack cocaine use and drunken escapades, Mayor Rob Ford of Toronto was admitted to a hospital on Wednesday after learning that he had an abdominal tumor.

title: Defaced World War I Memorial in Brooklyn Is Rebuilt
description: First, in 1970, the honor rolls were stolen  bronze plaques listing the 106 fallen World War I soldiers from the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood in Brooklyn. Then, in 2000, a thief swiped the allegorical bronze figure at the center of the memorial.

title: Obamas Full Speech About ISIS
description: The president revealed the plan from the United States and its allies to combat the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: Stabbing With Syringe in Nigeria Raises Concerns of Ebola as Weapon
description: A federal air marshal was stabbed with a syringe at the airport in Lagos, Nigeria, on Sunday, an incident that is raising concerns about whether the deadly Ebola virus could be harvested from the widespread outbreak in West Africa and used as a bioweapon.

title: Ex-Consultant Found Guilty of Fraud Tied to Lawmaker
description: A day after State Senator John L. Sampson survived a heated primary in Brooklyn, one of his former consultants was convicted on federal corruption charges of conspiring with Mr. Sampson to steal $100,000 from the New York Democratic Senate Campaign Committee in an invoicing scheme.

title: Carson Palmer, Like Eli Manning, Experienced the Jolt of a New System
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Arizona Cardinals quarterback Carson Palmer understands the growing pains that his Giants counterpart Eli Manning is enduring as he struggles to adapt to a new offense.

title: Fantasy Football: Picks for Week 2
description: In a new weekly video series about fantasy football, The Times assesses the fantasy points allowed per game for various positions. For Week 2, players may want to look at quarterbacks.

title: Bob Suter, Defenseman for Miracle on Ice, Dies at 57
description: Bob Suter, a defenseman who recovered from a broken ankle to help the Miracle on Ice United States hockey team win the Olympic gold medal in 1980, died on Tuesday in Madison, Wis. He was 57.

title: Herbert Lottman, American Biographer of French Figures, Dies at 87
description: Herbert R. Lottman, an American who fell in love with Paris as a young man and stayed to write detailed, influential biographies of giants of French culture, commerce and politics, died on Aug. 27 at his home there. He was 87.

title: Transcript of Obamas Remarks on the Fight Against ISIS
description: My fellow Americans, tonight I want to speak to you about what the United States will do with our friends and allies to degrade and ultimately destroy the terrorist group known as ISIL.

title: White House Invites Congress to Approve ISIS Strikes, but Says It Isnt Necessary
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said Wednesday that it needed no new approval from Congress to launch an open-ended air war in both Syria and Iraq against the group known as ISIS because the campaign is covered by the existing authorization to use military force against the perpetrators of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks  that is, Al Qaeda.

title: Klea McKennas Series of Photos Created by Nature
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Go Slow Lara
description: The model Lara Stone whiles away the afternoon in the new oversize mens coats.

title: Word of the Day | pre-empt
description: Heading

title: Meet Our Guest Pinner: Soo Joo Park, Todays Model
description: Youve seen her before: 5-foot-10, frosty blond hair, an almond-shaped face with an icy, lingering gaze.

title: The Race for New York Bragging Rights Is Close
description: Of all the metrics conveying the Yankees status at any given point this season, perhaps the most sobering came Tuesday. It was not just that the Yankees fell to five and a half games out of a playoff position with 20 games to play, or that their run differential dipped again.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 9 P.M. (American Heroes) THE HORNETS NEST (2014) The father-and-son journalists Mike and Carlos Boettcher tell the story of Operation Strong Eagle III in 2011, intended to oust Taliban forces from a part of Kunar Province in Afghanistan, and the single-day strike that turned into nine days of intense combat, killing six American soldiers. (Above, a memorial service.) Mike Boettcher knew those men, puts faces to their names, Daniel M. Gold wrote in The New York Times about this documentary, directed by David Salzberg and Christian Tureaud. As he says, every soldiers story is different, and they all bear telling.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, September 11, 2014
description: This is a core principle of my presidency: If you threaten America, you will find no safe haven.

title: Corrections: September 11, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Tianhe Chemicals Issues Rebuttal to Short-Seller Report
description: HONG KONG  The head of a Chinese chemical company that was called a fraud last week in a short-selling research report responded on Thursdayto what he called falsified information and blatantly untrue statements.

title: Oscar Pistorius Not Guilty of Murder; Still Faces Lesser Homicide Charge
description: PRETORIA, South Africa  The Olympic athlete Oscar Pistorius was declared not guilty of murder on Thursday when the judge in his case said she accepted the main argument in his defense: that he believed he was firing at an intruder rather than at his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp, when he killed her in a burst of gunfire through his bathroom door last year.

title: Test Yourself | Bicycling to 9,500 Feet Above Sea Level
description: Below are seven paragraphs from the Sept. 7 article To Ride Again Another Day in Colorado.

title: Air France-KLM Restructuring Puts New Focus on Its Low-Cost Airline
description: PARIS  After almost three years of belt-tightening, Air France-KLM embarked on a new phase of transformation on Thursday, announcing an ambitious plan to shift a large part of its European operations to a low-cost subsidiary and raise its game against fast-growing Persian Gulf rivals.

title: In Singapore, a Bit of Britain
description: Eden Hall, the official residence of High Commissioner Antony Phillipson, is both a family residence and a statement of Britains commitment to Singapore.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Foundation Sends Kin of 9/11 Victims to College
description: In the article Foundation Sends Kin of 9/11 Victims to College, Edna Ishayik writes about the children and spouses supported by the Families of Freedom Scholarship Fund.

title: Austrian Court Unblocks Assets of Former U.S. Ambassadors Wife
description: BERLIN  A Vienna court has unfrozen assets belonging to the wife of Zalmay Khalilzad, a former United States ambassador reportedly under investigation by the Justice Department on suspicion of tax evasion and money laundering, according to a statement from the couple and their lawyer on Thursday.

title: The Death of Adulthood in American Culture
description: Sometime this spring, during the first half of the final season of Mad Men, the popular pastime of watching the show  recapping episodes, tripping over spoilers, trading notes on the flawless production design, quibbling about historical details and debating big themes  segued into a parlor game of reading signs of its heros almost universally anticipated demise. Maybe the 5 oclock shadow of mortality was on Don Draper (fig. 1) from the start. Maybe the plummeting graphics of the opening titles implied a literal as well as a moral fall. Maybe the notable deaths in previous seasons (fictional characters like Miss Blankenship, Lane Pryce and Bert Cooper, as well as figures like Marilyn Monroe and Medgar Evers) were premonitions of Dons own departure. In any case, fans and critics settled in for a vigil. It was not a matter of whether, but of how and when.

title: When Laughter Is Bad for Your Bank Account
description: Much coverage of money and happiness has focused on whether the former leads to the latter. But a new studysuggests we might want to turn the question around: Could feeling good make you lose money?

title: Facing ISIS and Evil in Iraq
description: Sometimes when I am photographing a major news event, I am suddenly overwhelmed by helplessness. One day I am at home, watching dramatic images of Iraqi Yazidis fleeing for their lives being aired nonstop on 24-hour news channels. Days later, I am there, staring at tens of thousands of displaced Iraqis and feeling a 35-millimeter frame cannot capture the scope of devastation and heartbreak before me.

title: Are Parents Violating Their Childrens Privacy When They Share Photos and Videos of Them Online?
description: Parents seem to love posting videos and photos of their children online, sometimes for the whole world to see on YouTube and Facebook. But are children going to grow up regretting being a viral star? Should they somehow have a say in the matter?

title: R.B.S. and Lloyds Bank Say Theyll Move if Scotland Votes for Independence
description: Updated, 11:46 a.m. | LONDON  After months of trying to stay above the fray, two of Britains largest banks, Lloyds Banking Group and the Royal Bank of Scotland, said they would shift their bases to England if Scotland votes for independence next week.

title: In China, a Search for Oscar Contenders
description: Updated, 12:59 a.m. ET| The question that hounds every major Chinese film director was asked of Jiang Wen at a news conference earlier this month in Beijing. Mr. Jiang and his business associates had organized the event to generate buzz over the upcoming Gone with the Bullets, a gangster film set in 1920s Shanghai that is a follow-up to Let the Bullets Fly, the top earner in the Chinese film industry four years ago.

title: Journalists in China Describe Extortion
description: HONG KONG  Journalists who worked for a business news website under investigation in Shanghai have described a scheme of extorting Chinese companies, which were pressed to pay in return for the production of flattering articles or the burying of damaging ones, according to reports in the state-run news media.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: The City Remembers
description: Good morning on this cloudy Thursday.

title: When Election Polls Dont Tell the Whole Story
description: Its after Labor Day, and a batch of new polls on this years midterm elections is released every day. Despite this torrent of polling data, our forecasting model  which currently gives Republicans a 60 perccent chance of winning control in the Senate  stubbornly refuses to believe that polls tell the whole story.

title: New York Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 8
description: If youve made it this far, congratulations: Weve reached the final day of Fashion Week. Unless, of course, youre an editor, stylist or retailer embarking on the full international circuit. In that case, gird yourself: Your flight to London leaves imminently, and the circus travels on.

title: Do Workplace Wellness Programs Work? Usually Not
description: Most news coverage of the new Kaiser Family Foundation annual survey on employer-sponsored health plans has focused on the fact that growth in premiums in 2013 was as low as it has ever been in the 16 years of the survey. But buried in the details of the report are some interesting insights into how employers think about controlling health care costs. One example is that theyre very fond of workplace wellness programs. This is surprising, because while such programs sound great, research shows they rarely work as advertised.

title: Kerry Seeks Arab Consensus in Campaign Against ISIS
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia  Arab nations vowed on Thursday to do their share to confront and ultimately destroy the Sunni extremist group known as the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria. The promise came after the nations foreign ministers met here behind closed doors with Secretary of State John Kerry.

title: Daily Report: In Popular Games Like Minecraft, Tech Titans See Potential Beyond Fun
description: Parents like Minecraft because it can be a creative outlet for their children, Nick Wingfield reports. Teachers like the game because it can bring lessons to life. And Microsoft likes the game so much that it wants to buy Minecrafts parent company for more than $2 billion.

title: Apples Smart Smartwatch Play: Let Developers Find the Killer App
description: When Apple unveiled the Apple Watch in Cupertino on Tuesday, the company left a few questions unanswered.

title: Heres How to Keep Competitors From Poaching Your Employees
description: If there were any doubt about what is the hottest and most important issue to fast-growth entrepreneurs, we now know what it is. Hands down, it is the poaching of each others employees.

title: 1939: Convict Who Fled Returns
description: LILLE  An escaped French convict, who fled the Guiana penal colony in South America 13 years ago, returned to France today [Sept. 11] to take his place in the ranks of the French Army. An acquaintance of the fugitive named Jean Pouille recognized him as he entered barracks here to sign up. During a violent argument in 1919, the convict killed a friend with a knife for voicing unpatriotic sentiments. Condemned to Guiana for 20 years, he escaped in 1926 to Brazil. In 1930, homesick, he went to Belgium, married, and settled in Antwerp and later in Ransart. This morning he arrived in Lille from Ransart and applied for enlistment.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 12, 1939

title: CME Group Names Head of London Derivatives Business
description: LONDON  The CME Group said on Thursday that it had hired the former head of NYSE Euronexts operations in Amsterdam as the chief executive of its London derivatives business, which had its debut this year.

title: Morning Agenda: Alibabas Key to Success
description: As the Alibaba Group prepares to go public, the Chinese company remains committed to making global e-commerce available to Chinas expanding middle class, DealBooks David Gelles writes. The degree to which Alibaba can deliver on this promise will help determine how much the company is ultimately worth and to what extent it can open up the enormous Chinese market to both global retailers and small businesses in search of growth, he writes.

title: North Korea Returns a Defector to the South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea returned a South Korean man on Thursday who had defected to the North, in the first such repatriation since October.

title: Quiet Bartenders Secret
description: Bob Saginowski, the hero and sometime voice-over narrator of The Drop, is a Brooklyn bartender. Not the currently fashionable kind  a liberal arts graduate with an armful of tattoos and a carefully cultivated beard who plies artisanal bitters and obscure craft beers  but a more traditional variety. He pours shots and brews to working stiffs in Giants jackets at a roughed-up establishment in a hipster-free, ungentrified and somewhat mythical stretch of the borough.

title: Far From Home, Party Officials Feel the Stress, Study Finds
description: One of the Chinese Communist Partys practices to curb corruption  assigning officials to positions far from their home base  has inflicted emotional hardships and actually contributed to misdeeds, according to a new study.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: The House, in Rare Unity With Obama, Will Leave the Trail for an ISIS Vote
description: WASHINGTON  In a rare show of unity with President Obama, House Republican leaders will summon their fractious members back to the Capitol a day early next week to push through legislation to authorize the military to train Syrian rebels for the fight against Islamist militants.

title: Church Is More Informal, Like Society, Study Finds
description: Religious institutions often see themselves as countercultural  outposts in an increasingly secular society that challenge the culture with views and practices that are no longer mainstream.

title: Judge Delivers Oscar Pistorius Verdict
description: Oscar Pistorius, the South African track star, has been cleared of all murder charges over the killing of his girlfriend. The trials judge will rule later on charges of culpable homicide.

title: Signs of Hope in Chinese Attitudes Toward Japan
description: Two years ago this week, protesters marched outside the Japanese Embassy in Beijing denouncing Japans nationalization of uninhabited islands in the East China Sea claimed by both China and Japan. In other Chinese cities, looters stormed Japanese businesses and owners of Japanese cars were attacked.

title: Qaeda Group Has Released 45 Members of U.N. Force
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Forty-five members of a United Nations peacekeeping force who had been held captive for two weeks by an affiliate of Al Qaeda in southern Syria were released on Thursday in good condition, the United Nations said.

title: Throwback Thursday | Liberty and the World Trade Center, 1983
description: On that day  the Sept. 11 that requires no year  the sun set on crushed buildings in a reimagined world. It set on a recontoured skyline and a haunted city. The equations of life no longer worked. Thats the way it seemed.

title: Prospect of U.S. Attacks Captivates Syrians
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The prospect of the first American attacks on Syrian soil during three years of brutal civil war captivated Syrians on Thursday, prompting intense debate over whether airstrikes on the extremist Islamic State in Iraq and Syria would help or harm President Bashar al-Assad, his armed Syrian opponents and war-weary civilians.

title: Former South Korean Spy Chief Convicted in Online Campaign Against Liberals
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A former South Korean intelligence chief accused of directing agents who posted online criticisms of liberal candidates during the 2012 presidential election campaign was convicted Thursday of violating a law that banned the spy agency from involvement in domestic politics.

title: Sara Paretsky: By the Book
description: The author of the V. I. Warshawski novels, most recently Critical Mass, was hugely influenced by A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man: I felt as though Id fallen into words and wanted to drown in them.

title: A Conversation Spoken in Paint
description: Critics think they have the last word, but sometimes art keeps talking. In 2008, while organizing the Jewish Museums boisterous survey of Abstract Expressionism, Action/Abstraction: Pollock, de Kooning and American Art, 1940-1976, the curator, Norman L. Kleeblatt, noticed that two paintings  Lee Krasners Untitled (1948) and Norman Lewiss Twilight Sounds (1947)  seemed to be speaking to each other. He had the good sense to listen and, later, to orchestrate a deeper conversation. The result is From the Margins: Lee Krasner and Norman Lewis, 1945-1952, a nuanced, sensitive and profound exhibition.

title: Are You Crafty?
description: Sorority members invest many hours in crafting, making gift baskets, baking personalized treats, decking out rooms. Share your handmade creations with Education Life. Selected readers photos will be published.

title: Was Warning in Antidepressants Article Too Conclusive?
description: Updated, Monday, 10:42 a.m.

title: 36 Horas en Cartagena
description: Alrededor de las paredes antiguas de Cartagena se encuentra comida tradicional, hermosas playas y una vida nocturna ms caliente que el sol Caribe.

title: Scot Backing Independence Says Rivals Use Bullying
description: EDINBURGH  With tension rising a week before Scots vote on independence, Alex Salmond, the leader of the yes campaign, accused opponents on Thursday of bullying and subterfuge, and he demanded an official inquiry into disclosures that the Royal Bank of Scotland would shift its registered office to England in the event of a Scottish breakaway.

title: On 9/11 Anniversary, Looking Back and Ahead
description: The morning after President Obama stood before a national audience to announce a new campaign against Islamist terrorism in the Middle East, Jordan Thompson stood before television cameras in Lower Manhattan for a few moments and read a short list of names.

title: RadioShack Bankruptcy Filing Could Be Near
description: RadioShack, the struggling electronics retailer that is quickly running out of cash, said on Thursday that it might have to file for bankruptcy protection, or even liquidate, if it cannot arrange a lifeline.

title: China Fines Volkswagen and Chrysler for Antitrust Violations
description: HONG KONG  Chinese regulators fined Volkswagen and Chrysler for violating antitrust laws, announcing on Thursday the first monetary penalties against large multinational carmakers swept up in a broad investigation.

title: U.S. and Europe Back New Economic Sanctions Against Russia
description: BRUSSELS  The United States and Europe agreed on Thursday to place additional economic sanctions on Russia over its role in promoting separatist warfare in eastern Ukraine despite a fragile new cease-fire that went into effect last week.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | The Drop
description: Michael R. Roskam discusses a sequence from his film.

title: Toronto 2014: Michael R. Roskam Narrates a Scene From The Drop
description: TORONTO In the thriller The Drop, Tom Hardy plays a Brooklyn bartender with secrets. The film is adapted by Dennis Lehane from his short story Animal Rescue. In this video, the director Michael R. Roskam narrates a sequence from the film that reveals a little more to this bartender than meets the eye.

title: A Hurricane in 1964, and What Came After
description: The Times has converted all of its 1964 issues into a digitized, searchable format. Each week, The Upshot will unearth an item from 50 years ago and put it in the light of today. Hurricane Lashes 2 Florida Cities appeared on Sept. 10 and can be seen in its original format on TimesMachine.

title: On a Day Devoted to Past Events, Focus on New Terror Link
description: WASHINGTON  The morning after committing the nation to an expanded military campaign against Islamist terrorism, President Obama honored the victims of the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks as the White House argued that he had the right to wage his new fight under the same legal authority he used to hunt down Osama bin Laden and Al Qaeda.

title: When Sorrow Is Deeper Than Love
description: The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby, written and directed by Ned Benson, is a strikingly ambitious debut feature. Shot in and around New York, it sets out to chronicle the end of a marriage in all its emotional complexity.

title: ZZ Top Cancels Tour After Dusty Hills Injury
description: When ZZ Top canceled several concerts in late August after the bands bassist, Dusty Hill, injured his hip in a fall on the bands tour bus, the bearded Texas bluesmen said that they expected to return to touring on Sept. 25. But Mr. Hill, 65, has not fully recovered, and on Thursday the bands spokesman said that the rest of the autumn tour  27 dates, through Nov. 1  would be canceled. He said that the band would continue touring in early 2015, and that many of the dates would probably be rescheduled.

title: The Void Beckons: Its Time to Leap
description: Bird People begins with a series of calm aerial views of human beings in transit: crossing the terminal concourse at Charles de Gaulle Airport, filing through the turnstiles at the nearby commuter rail station, dozing and daydreaming on the train. The images add up to an affecting composite picture of a familiar modern paradox. We never seem more alone, more adrift from one another, than when we are bustling along in impromptu crowds, migratory flocks of isolated souls.

title: Thursday Dinner, Faster Than Delivery
description: Busy parents. Active kids. Families that arrive home every evening, starved. This week, in the series Dinner: The Boot Camp, Jenny Rosenstrach takes a recipe for chaos and coaches one family, and all of us, in the planning and preparation needed to turn it into a pleasant nightly meal. Find all the Boot Camp recipes here.

title: 1964: Independence Threat Dropped
description: LONDON  Southern Rhodesias threat to defy the British government and declare itself independent has been chucked out the window for the time being, Rhodesian Prime Minister Ian Smith said today [Sept. 11]. But he is hopeful, he said, that Britain will grant independence before the end of the year. After a week of talks here, Mr. Smith and British Prime Minister Sir Alec Douglas-Home agreed in a communiqu that independence should come only when a majority of Rhodesians  black and white  show their approval of the present constitution.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 12, 1964

title: What Does It Mean to Be Scottish?
description: Next week, the people of Scotland will decide whether they want to remain withBritainor become an independent state. Until recently, polls steadily showed that the unionist option was winning over the independence one, but a poll released Sunday showed 51 percent favoring independence and 49 percent keeping the status quo results that came as a surprise in the British Isles.

title: How to Get to Manhattan? Save, Save, Save
description: After her 2011 graduation from Binghamton University in upstate New York, Anne Gole returned home to Tenafly, N.J.

title: Under That Hood by JD & the Straight Shot
description: A cut from Where Ive Been, the latest album by James L. Dolans blues band.

title: Psychedelic Pastels Pop Up on the New York Runways
description: A palette of pale, powdery hues is sweeping the spring/summer 2015 shows. Mara Hoffman, usually known for her saturated brights, went with softer tones this season for her signature geometric prints, such as a gridlike pattern seen on a plunge-front maxidress. Thom Brownes predictably whimsical show featured a three-piece suit with a psychedelic swirl motif topped by a matching Stephen Jones hat. And the opening series of looks at Marc by Marc Jacobss rave-inspired presentation came in sorbet shades  lemon yellow, peach, sky blue  which popped against the neon-lit black backdrop.

title: Eastman Chemical to Buy Taminco for $1.7 Billion
description: The Eastman Chemical Company agreed on Thursday to buy the Taminco Corporation, a maker of specialized chemicals, for $1.7 billion in cash, becoming the third owner of the company in the last three years.

title: Soccer Fans Supply Strong Voice in Scottish Independence Debate
description: GLASGOW  In this city defined by the rivalry between its two biggest soccer clubs  Celtic and Rangers  there were no team colors on display Sunday night as fans filtered into a gloomy pub to watch Scotland play Germany in its first qualifying game for the 2016 European Championship. There is, however, more than soccer to talk about at the moment.

title: Republicans Lead Most Governors Races, but Margins Are Small
description: Republicans hold a narrow but broad advantage across this years governors contests, according to the newest round of data from The New York Times/CBS News/YouGov online panel of more than 100,000 respondents. They hold at least a nominal lead in 22 of this years 35 governors races.

title: Excerpt: Death Spa
description: Hank Cheyne plays the victim in this scene from Michael Fischas horror film, released in 1989, about a fitness center haunted by an evil spirit. The film is on Blu-ray, DVD and VHS from Gorgon Video.

title: Return of the Boxes That Ate Your Brain!
description: The man looks too calm for someone getting an ax plunged into his shoulder. And the lady with crazy eyes might want to wipe the trickle of blood oozing from her mouth. Or maybe she likes it? Such is life on the cover of a Gorgon video box.

title: The West Point Sisters
description: So far, Amy and Andrew Efaw have sent three daughters to West Point, from which they themselves graduated in 1989. Alexandra, the oldest daughter and a recent graduate who was featured in this past weekends magazine, was thought to be, by her mothers admission, not West Point material. But that daughter, who goes by Alix, instead extended the family connection to the military academy. Once Alix got in, it became more attainable, Amy says. The others thought, Well, if Alix can get in. . . .  Two more Efaw siblings are still in high school  Aimee, who goes by Kat, in eighth grade and Andrew in 10th  and, says Alix, I could totally see my kids coming to West Point and it kind of repeating itself.

title: How How It Happens Happens
description: How It Happens is a series of explainer videos that provide simple descriptions of the science behind headline-making stories. Henry Fountain, a science reporter, works with Aaron Byrd, in the video department, to create these animated videos. Henry explained the process for how these videos are made.

title: New York Fashion Week: Proenza Schouler Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: A Wider War, A Weaker Case
description: To date, Americas military re-engagement in Iraq which officially began a month ago, when the president decided to support Kurdish forces in their battle with ISIS, and to hold outacarrot of military support to the central governmentin Baghdad in return for the defenestration of Nouri Al-Maliki has goneabout as well ascould be reasonably expected.

title: New York Commemorates a Somber Date
description: The city paused to honor the dead and pay tribute to the first responders on the 13th anniversary of the Sept. 11 attacks.

title: When the Problem is Priorities, Dont Blame Cooking
description: This week on Motherlode, has amounted to an embracing and a celebration of family dinners.

title: A Kiss, a Sigh ... and a Postage Stamp
description: What makes a great love letter?

title: David Mitchell Coming to New York for Bone Clocks Tour
description: The British novelist David Mitchell, whose intricately structured, innovative novels have won him a huge audience, and whose just-published The Bone Clocks, was one of the most anticipated novels of the year, clearly has mixed feelings about celebrity. He lives in a small village in Ireland, and recently said in an interview in The New York Times, I live in faint dread of people coming to find me.

title: Japanese Newspaper Retracts Fukushima Disaster Report and Fires Editor
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  The Asahi Shimbun, Japans second-largest daily newspaper, retracted an influential news report on the Fukushima nuclear disaster on Thursday after weeks of criticism from other news organizations.

title: U2s Songs of Innocence: Gift or Spam?
description: Ben Ratliff and Jon Pareles discuss the new U2 album, released this week for free in iTunes.

title: Hitting Hollywood With Wit and Hankie
description: BURBANK, Calif.  Most of the show folk milling around the Warner Bros. lot here are surprisingly dull. You see a lot of self-important hiding behind sunglasses and we-take-this-stuff-seriously haircuts.

title: Today in Small Business: For New S.B.A. Chief, the Honeymoon May Be Over
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Q. and A. With Bill Cowher
description: There were seven head coaching hires in the N.F.L. for the 2014 season. Bill Cowher was not among them. But he is fine to continue as a studio analyst for CBS Sports on The N.F.L. Today.

title: Ralph Lauren: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: Mining for Antibiotics, Right Under Our Noses
description: Microorganisms are the best chemists on the planet, declared Michael A. Fischbach, a chemist himself at the University of California, San Francisco.

title: Dying of Ebola at the Hospital Door
description: Monrovia, the Liberian capital, is facing a widespread Ebola epidemic, and as the number of infected grows faster than hospital capacity, some patients wait outside near death.

title: A Mystery of Chinatown
description: Its easier to stumble on Taste of Northern China than to find it. The address is 88 East Broadway, but the storefront is around the corner, on Forsyth Street, with a mysterious 106 above the door (a suite number, it turns out). The name Taste of Northern China appears on the menu but not on the sign out front, or at least not in English  the Chinese characters translate roughly as Northern Delicacies, with the not-so-helpful English addendum China Local Cuisine.

title: Popcast: U2s Songs of Innocence: Gift or Spam?
description: This week on Popcast: Jon Pareles on the U2 album you most likely own, like it or not.

title: Toyota Recalls 130,000 Tundra Pickups for Air Bag Defect
description: Toyota is recalling about 130,000 Tundra pickup trucks from the 2014 model year because the air bags may not function properly, the automaker said in a news release Thursday.

title: Creating the J. Mendel Beauty Look for Spring 2015
description: I like to be inspired by art, but this was really hands-on, says Gilles Mendel, the creative director of J. Mendel. For his spring/summer 2015 collection, Mendel collaborated with the New York-based painter and visual artist Enoc Perez to create a series of graphic prints. I started with three or four of his paintings, then found ways to transform them in my own way by changing the color palettes and molding the canvas to the shape of a woman, Mendel explains. It was sort of a puzzle to figure out. It wasnt the first time the duo had teamed up  last winter they released a book of collages  and in some ways, this collection continued the dialogue. I sliced and collaged his prints, using these extraordinary fabrics, to create unexpected moments that arent entirely Enoc or me. Its really a combination of both, the designer contends. On the runway, Mendel wanted an equally dynamic beauty look. The collection is really precise, slick and constructed, so I think the hair and makeup has to feel the same way, he says.

title: Transformative Travel, 4 Ways
description: Latin America has long attracted travelers seeking personal transformation. In the 1950s and 60s, the region  with its frenetic cities, uncertain politics, ancient cultures and wild landscapes  served as a sort of screen on which many young writers and artists projected their angst and aspirations. My last chance to do something big and bad ... " is how an unknown Hunter S. Thompson viewed his own chaotic journey across South America in the early 60s.

title: ISIS Fight Raises Fears That Efforts to Curb Iran Will Slip
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas decision to engage in a lengthy battle to defeat the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria reorders the global priorities of his final years in office. The mystery is whether it will deprive him of the legacy he had once hoped would define his second term, or enhance it instead.

title: Boutique Hotels Get a French Design Touch
description: For fashion- and design-oriented travelers seeking a touch of French style, the hotel brand Sofitels rapidly expanding Sofitel So luxury boutique hotels and resorts combine Gallic style with local culture.

title: The Aftermath
description: Read all recent entries and our updated submissions guidelines. Reach us via email diary@nytimes.com or follow @NYTMetro on Twitter using the hashtag #MetDiary.

title: Calvin Kleins Spring 2015 Collection at New York Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Calvin Klein at New York Fashion Week.

title: Back From the Brink, Poetry Group Makes Cash Prizes Bigger Thanks to a Grant
description: The National Poetry Series has upgraded the prize available to the winners of its annual Open Competition for unpublished books of poetry. The series also announced the first five winners of the beefed-up award.

title: Deal Reached on Gaza Reconstruction, Palestinian Leader Says
description: JERUSALEM  President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority said Thursday night that he had reached an agreement with Israel and the United Nations to allow imports of reconstruction materials into the Gaza Strip, apparently bypassing Hamas to fulfill a key tenet of the cease-fire agreement that halted hostilities on Aug. 26.

title: In a Study, Text Messages Add Up to a Balance Sheet of Everyday Morality
description: Committing a small act of kindness, like holding the door for a harried stranger, often prompts the recipient to extend a hand to others, but it comes at a cost, psychologists have long argued. People who have done the good deed are primed to commit a rude one later on, as if drawing on moral credit from their previous act.

title: A Lost-and-Found Nomad Helps Solve the Mystery of a Swimming Dinosaur
description: The first bones came in a cardboard box. Nizar Ibrahim, a paleontologist, was in the Moroccan oasis town of Erfoud at the edge of the Sahara, returning from a dinosaur dig in the sands. Inside the box, brought to him by a nomad, were sediment-encrusted pieces more intriguing than anything he had found himself, including a blade-shaped bone with a reddish streak running through the cross section. He took the bones to a university in Casablanca.

title: Heidi Chronicles to Return to Broadway in February With Elisabeth Moss
description: A Broadway revival of Wendy Wassersteins play The Heidi Chronicles will begin performances in February with Elisabeth Moss (Mad Men) in the title role and, as the two men in her life, Jason Biggs (the American Pie movies) and Bryce Pinkham (A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder), the producers announced on Thursday. The director will be Pam MacKinnon, who won a Tony Award last year for staging the revival of Whos Afraid of Virginia Woolf?, while the actress Tracee Chimo (Bad Jews) will play several supporting roles.

title: Ebola Cases Rise Rapidly in Congo
description: The number of Ebola cases in the Democratic Republic of Congo doubled over the past week to 62, the World Health Organization reported Thursday, and more than half the afflicted patients have died.

title: How the Colts Hurt Themselves
description: Everything seemed to be going well for the Colts in the first minutes against the Broncos on Sunday. The Colts received the opening kickoff and needed only five plays to take the ball to the Broncos 36-yard line. Then the evils of fourth-down decision-making changed the game.

title: New York Fashion Week Parties: Night 7
description: New York Fashion Week parties for Victorias Secret models and Jeremy Scott.

title: New York Fashion Week: Ralph Lauren Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Obamas Remarks on 9/11 Anniversary
description: The president commemorated the 13th anniversary of the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks at a ceremony at the Pentagon.

title: In the Emergency Room, a Hidden Ailment
description: Many seniors who seek care in emergency departments may be malnourished, a small study by researchers at the University of North Carolina suggests. The study is among the first to attempt to document the extent of this problem.

title: Wheelies: The Renegade Ready Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Pandora Signs Music Rights Deal With BMG
description: The latest step in the music industrys slow-motion revolution over licensing came on Thursday, when Pandora Media announced that it had struck a direct deal for music rights with BMG, the worlds fourth-largest music publisher.

title: An Herms Timepiece Without an Hour Hand
description: In this weekly series, the mens fashion editors of T invite creative personalities to put their own aesthetic spin on a new watch. Here, the illustrator Christopher David Ryan captures a timepiece from Herms.

title: Two Sides Sounding at BEAT Festival in Brooklyn
description: The Miser is not the first chap to wonder whether festivals have gotten rather out of hand. A more is more aesthetic seems to prevail  whether in size, sponsorship, controversy, or celebrity  and the Miser is becoming less and less inclined to indulge.

title: Steelers (1-0) at Ravens (0-1)
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, CBS

title: Dying of Ebola at the Hospital Door
description: Monrovia, Liberia, is the first major metropolitan area to face an Ebola outbreak, and many of the infected there are left to die at the gates of overcrowded hospitals.

title: Weekend Entertainments from the Archives of The New York Times
description: 65 YEARS AGO

title: Making Do With Little, Yet Making Art
description: ALUMBRONES

title: Casting the Glow of Tiffany Far and Wide
description: Museum holdings of Tiffany glass, which are rarely returned to the market, are in flux this year.

title: 60s Soul Claims Young Hearts ... and Feet
description: BELTING out his chipper catalog of 60s soul tracks, wiggling his hips and waving his arms euphorically, Paul Sindab looked every inch the suave soul veteran during his set at the Dig Deeper concert series in Brooklyn. He even deployed a few James Brown-worthy stage theatrics: To kick off his most recognizable hit, Do Whatcha Wanna Do, Mr. Sindab, 72, whipped off his spectacles and hurled them offstage in a devil-may-care flourish, the audience cheering on his gleeful abandon.

title: A Son Comes Home: Cue the Father Clash
description: THE FRONTIER

title: Weary of War, but Favoring Airstrike Plan
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.  A few months ago, Kevin Kinard, a 55-year-old utility worker here, had barely heard of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria. But when the Sunni militant group beheaded a second American journalist, Mr. Kinard clicked on an Internet video of the execution  and lost sleep for two nights.

title: Google Acquires Online Poll Company Polar
description: In a move that could shore up the dire shortage of opinions on the Internet, Google has acquired Polar, an online poll company. The deal was announced on Polars website and through Googles social network, Google Plus.

title: Losing Is the Real Victory for One Family
description: THE QUITTER

title: Unanswered Questions in R.B.S.-Lloyds Moving Plans
description: Scotlands largest banks have moved to head off a crisis. The Royal Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Banking Group say they will shift their Edinburgh-based operations to London, should the Scots vote for independence on Sept. 18. Thats a step toward financial stability  but not if youre a Scottish consumer.

title: The Fashion Secrets of Kate Lanphear, Ts Outgoing Womens Style Director
description: Today, it was announced that Ts womens style director, Kate Lanphear, will become the next editor-in-chief of Maxim magazine. Beyond her vast and varied contributions to the world of T, Lanphear has also drawn a global following for her distinctive rock-inspired look  a look that made her one of the original stars of the street-style world and continues to exert influence today.

title: Staging Shakespeare in a Pit, and Other Dubious Calls
description: Donald Antrim is, after Thomas Pynchon, American literatures presiding weirdo. Hes a trickster. His books are short, vivid, drastic and surreal, so much so that reading them is like driving 90 miles an hour while in third gear, in the back seat of a jalopy the author has stolen, while he disposes of his drugs by throwing them out the window.

title: Mississippi Sounds Live on in New Musicians
description: TAKE ME TO THE RIVER

title: Want an Abortion in Missouri? Wait 72 Hours.
description: Missouris Republican-controlled state Legislature on Wednesday imposed a 72-hour waiting period for women seeking an abortion, overriding a veto of the measure in July by the states Democratic governor, Jay Nixon.

title: Capturing Apartheids Daily Indignity
description: Artists will stop making art about race when racism ends. I wont be here when that happens, and you wont either. But in the early 1960s, a brash, South African photographer in his 20s named Ernest Cole thought he just might be, once his pictures of his racially sundered homeland got out into the world. By the time he died in New York, homeless and street-stunned, some two decades later, he probably knew better.

title: Reacting to Obamas ISIS Speech
Jobless Rate May Be a Flawed Indicator for Fed Policy
description: The United States job market has been improving. But is it close to being good?

title: World Leaders React to Obamas Speech
description: Across the globe, countries responded to President Obamas plan for the United States and its allies to combat the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: Mememe Blogging
description: More of my Business Insider interview, this time about monetary policy, here.

title: J. Mendel: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: HP Is Committed to the Cloud, Even if It Kills
description: For what probably amounts to a relatively small amount of money, Hewlett-Packard just made a big bet.

title: Gems Among the Ruins
description: The Governors Island Art Fair is not your average art fair. Now in its seventh year, its a scrappy, low-budget event organized by a group of artists operating under the name 4 Heads. Works by 100 artists are displayed not in corporate white booths but in the rooms of four late-19th-century brick houses on Colonels Row where Army officers used to live. Each artist was given a room to use.

title: And They Had Such Chemistry
description: HONEYMOON

title: Introducing a New Crowdsourced Feature: NYTLNreads
description: Are your students or other young people you know reading The Times?

title: Sobbing and Electricity: Sarah Lyall Awaits the Final Pistorius Verdict in Pretoria
description: Sarah Lyall is covering the verdict in the Oscar Pistorius case. While awaiting the final verdict in Pretoria, she reflected on the South African justice system and provided a sense of the scene inside and outside the courtroom.

title: As the World Turns
description: If you want to understand the point of Henry Kissinger, play this mind game: Imagine that the nonagenarian had run American foreign policy since Sept. 11, 2001, instead of two groups that had spent much of the previous quarter-century condemning him. First came the democracy-touting neoconservatives, who saw his realpolitik as appeasement, and now liberal Democrats, who insist nation-building must begin at home  and therefore hate foreign entanglements, let alone grand strategies.

title: Elusive Peace
description: (This book was selected as one of The New York Times Book Reviews 10 Best Books of 2014. For the rest of the list, click here.)

title: Global Warning
description: In 1989, Francis Fukuyama published an essay in The National Interest entitled The End of History? that thrust him into the center of public debate. Although often misunderstood and maligned, its central argument was straightforward and sensible: With the collapse of Communism, liberal democracy stood alone as the only form of government compatible with socio-economic modernity. Over the years since, Fukuyama has continued to argue the case, and has now summed up his efforts with a two-volume magnum opus that chronicles global political development from prehistory to the present. A quarter-century on, he remains convinced that no other political system is viable in the long run, but concludes his survey with a sobering twist: Liberal democracys future is cloudy, but that is because of its own internal problems, not competition from any external opponent.

title: Curses! Over and Over Again
description: SWEARNET

title: Calvin Klein Collection: Spring 2015 RTW
description: New York

title: For the Joy of Worship, However Arduous
description: Pan Nalins Faith Connections is not the first documentary to take a camera on a pilgrimage to the Kumbh Mela festival in India. Mr. Nalin applies an on-the-ground approach, mainly looking at holy men and lost boys at the gathering. But he lets the sprawl slacken his overlong films grasp and, strangely, underplays the nuances of the events spiritual aspects.

title: The Dirty Details of War
description: An occasional column on reprints of vintage comics.

title: 2001 | The World Trade Center Just Blew Up
description: David W. Dunlap is a Metro reporter and writes the Building Blocks column. He has worked at The Times for 39 years.

title: Are Biblical Epics Epically Racist?
description: Whitewashing the Bible is nothing new. It has beena mainstay of Western culture for centuries  from pallid Byzantine icons to Leonardo da Vincis lily-white Madonna of the Rocks to Charlton Hestons rolesin The Ten Commandments and Ben-Hur.

title: New York Fashion Week: Calvin Klein Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Columbine Goldsmith.

description: Art

title: Like Tweedledum and Tweedledee, Only Theyre Angsty
description: As The Skeleton Twins deftly glides between drama and comedy, it peels away layers of personal history in the lives of its troubled main characters, twin siblings estranged for a decade who share an eerie emotional synchronicity. At the very moment Maggie Dean (Kristen Wiig), a dental hygienist in upstate New York, is about to gulp a lethal fistful of sleeping pills, she receives a call informing her that her brother, Milo (Bill Hader), a failed actor in Hollywood, is in the hospital after slashing his wrists.

title: Small Businesses See Only a Small Increase in Health Premiums
description: The warnings this time last year were dire and widespread: Small businesses would face a double-digit rise in health care costs in 2014. But as it turned out, premiums for small businesses barely budged. According to the Kaiser Family Foundations 2014 Employee Health Benefits Survey, small-group health insurance premiums for individual coverage grew by just 1 percent this year, the slowest rate of growth since 2008. Family plans increased by 2 percent.

title: Spare Times for Sept. 12-18
description: Harlem International Film Festival (through Sunday) Life in Harlem, elsewhere in New York and around the globe is the focus of this festival  the ninth  which began this week and will continue at two Manhattan locations: Maysles Cinema, 343 Lenox Avenue, at 127th Street, Harlem; and Columbia University, Dodge Hall, Broadway and 116th Street, Morningside Heights. Included are features, shorts, animated films and documentaries, with many followed by discussions.

title: Movie Listings for Sept. 12-18
description: Movies

title: Comedy Listings for Sept. 12-18
description: Comedy

title: Jazz Listings for Sept. 12-18
description: Jazz

title: Their Own Imaginary Keynes (Wonkish)
description: Lars Syll approvingly quotes Hyman Minsky denouncing IS-LM analysis as an obfuscation of Keynes; Brad DeLong disagrees. As you might guess, so do I.

title: Spare Times: For Children, for Sept. 12-18
description: Daisy: A Hen

title: Fantasy Football: Week 2 Player Tiers
description: In this statistical model, I apply a clustering algorithm called the Gaussian mixture model to an aggregation of expert ranking data provided by Fantasypros.com. The algorithm finds natural tiers and clusters within the data. The charts that result visualize the tiers and help you decide your starting lineup each week.

title: Hertz Offers Icahn 3 Board Seats to Stave Off Fight
description: Many investors had expected that Carl C. Icahns emergence as an investor in Hertz Global Holdings presaged a nasty corporate fight.

title: Lonely Sea Mammal Seeks Tank Mate
description: DOLPHIN TALE 2

title: The Big Leagues
description: On the road with N.B.A. rookies Marcus Smart of the Boston Celtics, Doug McDermott of the Chicago Bulls and Joel Embiid of the Philadelphia 76ers.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: The Big Leagues
description: A killer three-pointer no longer cuts it in the world of pro basketball. To succeed as a multimillion-dollar brand, an athlete needs business savvy, fashion know-how and good table manners. Welcome to the N.B.A.s other training camp.

title: Draghi Says Government Spending Could Help Eurozone Economy
description: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, on Thursday stepped up pressure on countries like Italy to improve the climate for business. But he also said there was room for governments to use public spending to reinvigorate the stalled eurozone economy.

title: Metropolitan Opera Changes $25 Tickets Program
Sucked Into a Sinister Maw
description: AT THE DEVILS DOOR

title: New Eni Chief Investigated Over Nigeria Purchase
description: LONDON  The Italian oil giant Eni confirmed on Thursday that its recently appointed chief executive and one of his key lieutenants were under investigation in Milan. Prosecutors there have opened an international bribery investigation over the companys acquisition of an offshore oil block in Nigeria.

title: If Driving Past Zombies, Dont Stop
description: When it comes to fiction, the Syfy channel lives a double life. Its series are mostly straightforward, reasonably serious genre entertainment, sometimes high in their class, despite low budgets and expectations (Battlestar Galactica, Continuum). Its original films, on the other hand, are gleefully and notoriously schlocky, a living museum of B-movie practice and an invitation to communal pleasure: Heres a joke. Be in on it.

title: Who Said Massive and Foreboding Cant Be Enjoyable?
description: The program notes might have scared anyone away. Max Reger is frequently described as one of the most difficult composers in the whole classical canon, they began, going on to call Regers musical language disorienting and complex, his harmonic and textural juxtapositions jarring and his music in general something at once massive and foreboding, all in the first paragraph.

title: The Median Is the Message
description: IF Con Ed were in the market for a mascot, this could be it.

title: Searching for the Object of a Mailmans Longing
description: FINDING FANNY

title: Fantasies From Pandoras Shoe Box
description: For me, the high point of the recent Emmy Awards broadcast was the sight of Sarah Silverman gathering up the voluminous skirts of her stunning dark-green gown and, in bare feet, dashing up to the stage, taking the steps two at a time. There, she accepted a writing award for her HBO comedy special We Are Miracles, her physical exuberance having already conveyed her excitement and even gratitude.

title: Mired in an Abyss of Despair in Taipei
description: The point of no return in Stray Dogs, Tsai Ming-liangs glum, humorless exercise in Asian miserablism, is an 11-minute scene of a homeless man smothering and devouring a cabbage with a face painted on it.

title: Theater Listings for Sept. 12-18
description: Theater

title: A Well-Behaved Bistro Classic for Chardonnay
description: Raised in Australias cooler microclimates, these well-behaved chardonnays do not make stringent demands on the palate, the budget or the menu. The characteristic that defines them might be described as a certain racy tartness. They should not be bullied by whats served alongside.

title: Where Were Getting the Money to Fight ISIS
description: So far, the American military crackdown on fighters from the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria has been relatively cheap.

title: Wine, Olive Oil and the Good Life in Uruguay
description: Our first lunch was laid out like a last supper. There, in the middle of a vineyard, underneath a billowing white cotton tent, a long wooden table had been set up, every inch of it covered with platters of food. There was the stuff you might expect at a picnic: bread, homemade and chewy; wedges of various cheeses arranged on wooden cutting boards; paper-thin slivers of prosciutto and salami. Then there were the local specialties  bowls of creamy spinach dip, stacks of freshly baked empanadas, stuffed with tuna and still steaming. And finally the wine, bottles of the heavy stuff this area was famous for and what brought us here in the first place.

title: In Buenos Aires, a Secret World of Dining
description: The entrance to the white colonial apartment building in the Villa Crespo area of Buenos Aires is fairly typical of four-story apartment buildings in the affluent neighborhood: marble-rich entranceway, elevator, winding staircase, the reverential hush that accompanies centuries-old palazzos. The building is, by any measure, an apartment building  that is, except for the second floor. Thats where a friend and I found Paladar, a dining room ablaze in flattering lighting. And, at the very Argentine dining hour of 11 p.m., it was packed. Half a dozen tables were full of chattering couples eating salads, sipping wine and apparently totally oblivious to the only two Americans in the place.

title: Photos of the Day: New York and More
description: Photos from New York, Washington, Pennsylvania and South Africa.

title: Love and Neuroses in Mamaroneck
description: Weve seen riffs before on imaginary or literary characters come to life, in films like Ruby Sparks, Stranger Than Fiction and Fight Club. More recently, The One I Love used the notion of a married couples idealized doppelgngers to make points about unrealistic expectations of a spouse. Add to these The Man on Her Mind, a glib, glossy take on a play by Alan Hruska performed at the Charing Cross Theater in London in 2012.

title: Putting a New-Journalism Pioneer Into Perspective
description: SMILING THROUGH THE APOCALYPSE

title: A Slow Flow From Down Under
description: Mention Australian chardonnays to a group of American wine fanatics and one result might be a resounding silence punctuated by feigned snoring. I know what theyre thinking and I understand completely. But its time to take another look at Australian chardonnays, and at Aussie wines in general.

title: Roxy Paine: Denuded Lens
description: Roxy Paine is known for technically ambitious sculptures, like trees made of stainless-steel tubes, and computer-controlled machines that produce globby plastic sculptures. Lately he has taken to woodworking, creating realistic objects that look as if they had been transformed by a Midas with a wooden touch.

title: Ranjani Shettar: Night skies and daydreams
description: One of Ranjani Shettars diaphanous, constellation-like sculptures of hand-molded wax beads and cotton thread, installed at the entrance to On Line: Drawing Through the Twentieth Century, at the Museum of Modern Art, made a stellar introduction to that 2010 show. A new, similar piece, called Tuntoroo, fills a room at Talwar Gallery. And here, in a way that wasnt obvious at MoMA, light plays a big role in the work, as patterns of shadows cast on the wall compound its intricacy and emphasize its apparent fragility.

title: A Weakness for Cops, a Crime to Solve
description: Not everything in a movie needs to make sense, but when almost nothing does, its a problem. Even so, what the publicity notes are pleased to call a disconcerting narrative structure is far from the only issue with Archaeology of a Woman, Sharon Greytaks confounding blend of long-ago murder and present-day dementia.

title: Lily van der Stokker: Huh
description: The cartoonish verve of Lily van der Stokkers irrepressible installations, which consist of walls and objects painted light, feminine shades, can sometimes disguise the originality and sharpness of her art. With subtle plays of cryptic phrases, color and forms, her best efforts appear adamantly cute until they start filling up with mixed signals of longing, conflict and repressed urges. Huh, her current piece, meditates on the illusion of equality between the sexes, and also in relationships between artists, regardless of their sex.

title: Dubuffet/Barcel'
description: This pairing of the postwar Art Brut leader Jean Dubuffet and the contemporary Spanish painter Miquel Barcel is predictably unbalanced but nonetheless stimulating. It includes a fantastic selection of Dubuffets from the 1940s and 50s, among them his richly marbled Texturologies and earthy portrait heads  all of which make for an excellent prologue to the Museum of Modern Arts fall exhibition Jean Dubuffet: Soul of the Underground.

title: From Money, but So Much More Than That
description: The tobacco millionaire Morris Schinasi had three daughters. There they are, in Peter Sanderss sassy documentary Altina, in their 1920s cloches and fur-collared coats in front of the family mansion at 107th and Riverside in Manhattan. Two went on to conventional heiress lives, and then there was Altina.

title: Carlos Ginzburg: The Forgotten Vintage
description: The early days of Conceptual Art seem long ago and far away. But you get a sense of the movements mix of politics, perversity and humor in this survey of early work by Carlos Ginzburg, an artist and theoretician  were the two ever really separable in Conceptualism?  who was born in Argentina in 1946 and has lived in Paris since 1972.

title: A Spy Shaped by Manipulation and Shame
description: The emotional core of The Green Prince, Nadav Schirmans gripping documentary thriller, is the deepening relationship of Mosab Hassan Yousef, a Palestinian recruited as a spy by the Shin Bet, Israels internal security agency, and his Israeli handler. Mr. Yousef, whose memoir, Son of Hamas, inspired the film, wasnt a Palestinian fighter infused with jihadist fervor. But because his father, Hassan Yousef, was a founder of Hamas, he was a prize catch for the Israeli agency, which manipulated him with diabolical efficiency to glean vital intelligence. In turn, he was protected from exposure.

title: Now 11 Is the New 14, and the New 8
description: Sometimes the simplest of ideas can prove surprisingly engaging, and not so simple after all. A case in point is I Am Eleven, a charming documentary by Genevieve Bailey built of interviews with 11-year-olds in 15 countries.

title: Follow That Whale
description: Swords flash, whales splash, and flames erupt in Lee Seok-hoons new film, The Pirates. Besides joining some high-profile South Korean period pictures, this middling movie is also evidently an attempt to tap the appeal of the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise. But the slapdash adventures here lack compelling performers and bound merrily along without distinction.

title: Governments Threat of Daily Fine for Yahoo Shows Aggressive Push for Data
description: The federal government was so determined to collect the Internet communications of foreign Yahoo customers in 2008 that it threatened the company with fines of $250,000 a day if it did not immediately comply with a secret court order to turn over the data.

title: Louisianas Stillborn Constitution
description: On Christmas Eve 1863, Abraham Lincoln wrote to Maj. Gen. Nathaniel Banks in New Orleans to reassure him that he was master in regard to re-organizing a State government for Louisiana and in regard to the military matters of the Department. Frustrated at the slow pace of Bankss reorganization efforts, the anxious president also entreated his commander of the Department of the Gulf to give us a free-state re-organization of Louisiana, in the shortest possible time.

title: Marc Jacobss Spring 2015 Collection for New York Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Marc Jacobs at New York Fashion Week.

title: Cities Compete to Be the Arena for Global Legal Disputes
description: The 48-mile Panama Canal expansion is an engineering marvel that promises to speed up international commerce and may be a boon for global ports. It is also one that involves lots of disputes over cost overruns and construction delays, and pushed completion beyond the canals 100th anniversary last month.

title: Small Military Hospitals
description: To the Editor:

title: Marijuana and Football
description: To the Editor:

title: Voting for a Higher Ideal
description: To the Editor:

title: For More Policewomen
description: To the Editor:

title: Clean Energy and Jobs
description: To the Editor:

title: Sure Enough for the Two of Us
description: I love love, our boss said to Sam and me. But you have to keep it out of the office, O.K.?

title: On the Sidelines, Subtle but Stylish
description: Parked on a ledge outside the Alexander Wang show at Pier 94, near Midtowns western rim, Thia Lauraine was a picture of simplicity. Wearing a black silk tank dress that spilled to her ankles, Ms. Lauraine, an assistant to the street photographer Scott Schuman, said, This is about as minimal as I can get.

title: New York Commemorates 9/11 Anniversary
description: The city paused to honor the dead and pay tribute to the first responders on the 13th anniversary of the attacks.

title: What Were Afraid to Say About Ebola
description: MINNEAPOLIS  THE Ebola epidemic in West Africa has the potential to alter history as much as any plague has ever done.

title: Slicked-Back Buns at Calvin Klein
description: Francisco Costas spring/summer 2015 collection for Calvin Klein was minimalism at its finest  which is to say, far more complex than it might have appeared from afar. The same can be said for the models hair. The slicked-back, carefully composed twists offered a polished new interpretation of the classic greasy-hair-day bun  a runway look that just about anyone can pull off at home.

title: Aquifer Is No Quick Fix for Central Texas Thirst
description: As drought continues to grip Central Texas, those looking to provide water to the regions fast-growing cities and suburbs see a solution in a relatively untapped aquifer.

title: Events in New Jersey for Sept. 14-20, 2014
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: U.T. Is Poised to Collaborate With Mexico on Research Projects
description: Randall Charbeneau, an assistant vice chancellor for research at the University of Texas System, was surprised to learn that the system did not have an agreement with Mexico to foster student and faculty exchanges and research collaboration.

title: Video Nation
description: The barbarians in Iraq and Syria had been beheading innocents, raping girls and slaughtering infidels well before a single awful video appeared of an American journalist being executed by a masked fanatic. The world shrugged.

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks forthe most interesting things to doaround the state this week.

title: Housing Costs After Retirement
description: Paying off the mortgage isnt the priority it once was, and for many households, it isnt even a possibility. But a new report from Harvard Universitys Joint Center for Housing Studies reaffirms the common belief that retirees who own their homes outright are considerably better off than those carrying mortgages or paying rent.

title: Events on Long Island for Sept. 14-20, 2014
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Oh, Read the Blog
description: Our son, who is in his 20s, posts online about major events in his life. But my husband and I dont want to be part of his general audience on social media. We dont read his blog or follow him on Twitter or Facebook. So, we are often the last to know about important events in his life because social media is his primary means of communicating with us. How should we let him know that we want to hear his news personally and directly from him?

title: Georgia OKeeffe Museum to Auction 3 Paintings
description: When you take a flower in your hand and really look at it, its your world for the moment, Georgia OKeeffe once said. I want to give that world to someone else.

title: An Election in Search of a Mandate
description: Ted Cruz had a mandate.

title: Events in Westchester for Sept. 14-20, 2014
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Connecticut for Sept. 14-20, 2014
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: For a Week, Anyway, Rihanna Wears the Crown
description: Like prom season, every New York Fashion Week has a reigning queen. This time around, Rihanna rules.

title: In Iran, Mothers Dream of Missing Sons
description: In visions and doorways, Iranian mothers hold out hope their sons will one day return three decades after going missing in war.

title: Obamas Betrayal of the Constitution
description: BERLIN  PRESIDENT OBAMAs declaration of war against the terrorist group known as the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria marks a decisive break in the American constitutional tradition. Nothing attempted by his predecessor, George W. Bush, remotely compares in imperial hubris.

title: An Untapped Force in the Fight for Literacy
description: People disagree, quite strenuously, on the best curriculum for teaching children to read. But all participants in the reading wars agree on some other things: Early reading is crucial  a child who does not read proficiently by third grade will probably fall further and further behind each year. American schools are failing: two out of three fourth graders dont read at grade level.

title: Shark Tank Companion to Be Unveiled by ABC
description: Shark Tank has become a reliably popular show on one of televisions least popular nights, Fridays  so naturally, ABC wants even more of it.

title: Spate of Suicides by Chinese Officials Tied to Drive Against Graft
description: XIAOGAN, China  Li Haihuas rise from poor farming boy to one of the most powerful officials in this city of one million people took decades, but his demise took seconds.

title: How to Diversify Teaching
With Gas Cut Off, Ukraine Looks West
description: UZHGOROD, Ukraine  Keeping Ukraine warm keeps Andriy Kobolev up at night.

title: Off the Runway: Day 8
description: Scenes from Ralph Lauren and Dorin Negrau on the last day of New York Fashion Week.

title: The Inflation Cult
description: Wish Id said that! Earlier this week, Jesse Eisinger of ProPublica, writing on The Timess DealBook blog, compared people who keep predicting runaway inflation to true believers whose faith in a predicted apocalypse persists even after it fails to materialize. Indeed.

title: A Velvety Mary Jane at Marc Jacobs
