title: Rob Ford, Toronto Mayor, Withdraws Re-election Bid
description: OTTAWA  While in a hospital for the treatment of a tumor, Mayor Rob Ford of Toronto withdrew his bid for re-election Friday afternoon. Minutes later, a representative of Doug Ford, the mayors brother and a City Council member, formally registered him as a mayoral candidate.

title: Separated by Decades, Reunited in Tears
description: When Lynne Kornreich met Richard Goldberg, they were both 17, and it was the 60s, but not the Swinging Sixties. She was a waitress and he was a busboy at the Sinclair Hotel in Bethlehem, N.H., which was the sort of resort one would have found in that era in the Catskills  where Melba toast and cottage cheese were once popular mainstays, and everyone ate as if it were the last meal.

title: Argentina Rediscovers Its African Roots
description: The chapel in the small lakeside resort community of Chascoms is at best underwhelming. Its whitewashed brick exterior is partly obstructed by a tangle of vines and bushes, and its dim, one-room interior is no more majestic than its facade. Wooden pews and an uneven dirt floor are scarcely illuminated by sunlight from a single window. The gray, cracked, dusty walls are adorned with crosses, photos, icons  things people leave to mark their pilgrimage. A low front altar is layered with thick candle wax, flowers and a pantheon of black saints, Madonnas and African deities like the sea goddess Yemanja of the Yoruba religion.

title: Surveying So Paulos Music Scene With Cu
description: About 15 years ago, when the Brazilian singer Cu returned home to So Paulo after a year of soaking up New York Citys indie rock, jazz and hip-hop sounds, she decided she wanted to add songwriter to her job description.

title: Three Sides of Ecuador
description: Two and a half hours and still no sign of llamas. We should have been winding our way through lush forests and mountain lakes instead of the never-ending banana plantations we continued to see outside our rented four-wheel drive. It was time to turn our dying iPhones navigation system back on and confirm the inevitable. Somewhere between sprawling Guayaquil and the quaint cobblestone streets of Cuenca my husband and I had made a wrong turn. And now, on the second leg of our Ecuadorean road trip, with my mother consoling our hungry 4-year-old in the back seat, we had a decision to make: Do we turn back and take the well-trodden route through Cajas National Park we had originally planned to drive, or push onward, not knowing what the road conditions might be ahead, how long our journey would take or if our daughter would nap along the way?

title: Accord Calls for Jury Pool of 2,000 in Boston Bombing Trial
description: BOSTON  The prosecution and the defense in the trial over the Boston Marathon bombings have agreed to an elaborate process by which a jury may be selected to hear the case against the defendant, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev.

title: Rift Emerges Before Vote in Sweden as Immigration Tests a Tradition of Openness
description: TROLLHATTAN, Sweden  Refugees from Syria and Iraq are pouring into Sweden at a record pace, placing strains on welfare, schools and housing. With national elections imminent, the center-right government is watching some of its supporters desert it for a populist, anti-immigrant alternative.

title: Democrats Are Seeing More Daylight in Path to Senate Control
description: A few months ago, the Democratic path to a Senate majority looked long and arduous. It has started to look easier.

title: New York Fashion Week Street Style
description: Here are our highlights from show-goers style.

title: Shoefie Mania During New York Fashion Week
description: Shoefies (sometimes also referred to as selfeet) have become a growing form of downward selfie for the Instagram set among the shoe-gazing and footwear-obsessed  and perhaps those too shy for a full-on self-portrait.

title: Readers Respond: Wary Support for Obamas ISIS Strategy
description: President Obamas plan to conduct air strikes in Syria was met with measured praise and continued skepticism in reader responses to Op-Ed columnists and an editorial on the presidents speech.

title: Hey, Mr. D.J.
description: On the banks of the Bronx River, the music rises as the sun sets. Its an old-school evening, and the D.J. digs deep in the crates and blasts Tito Puentes Ran Kan Kan, moments later following with the Moments Girls. The French version, no less.

title: 2015 Dodge Challenger
description: After outliving its sell-by date, the biggest pony car gets a redo and an infernal new edition.

title: 2015 Dodge Challenger R/T Scat Pack
description: A retro Dodge updates the art of shredding tires.

title: Now in Mild, Spicy or Thermonuclear
description: SANTA BARBARA, CALIF.  As cars age, the market usually ignores them. Theres nothing new, nothing fresh, nothing exciting about a car that looks like one more goose in the flock of off-lease geese that have migrated to the used ponds. Entering its eighth year, the Dodge Challenger should be a dead duck.

title: Wu-Tang Clan Joins a Tribute to The Source in Brooklyn
description: The Source, a music and culture magazine that has been an important voice in the development and chronicling of hip-hop, is celebrating its 25th anniversary with Source360, a concert at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn, which the magazine says will be an annual event.

title: Off Broadway Run of American Psycho Is Dead
description: The highly anticipated Off Broadway production of the musical American Psycho has been canceled after the shows commercial backers pulled the rights from Second Stage Theater, its artistic director, Carole Rothman, said on Friday. No explanation was given; the commercial backers at Act 4 Entertainment, who were teaming up with Second Stage to develop the show in hopes of an eventual transfer to Broadway, did not immediately return phone calls.

title: The Optical Illusion on the Walls at Thomas Taits Spring 2015 Presentation
description: I love a fashion show, says the Canadian-born, London-based fashion designer Thomas Tait. Some people question the need for them, but there is something that happens at a fashion show that can never be replicated in any other way. With Mondays spring/summer 2015 runway, his first since winning the LVMH Young Fashion Designer Prize in May, Tait will prove that point. Attendees will file into a derelict warehouse in central London to watch Taits presentation against a backdrop transformed by the French visual artist and photographer Georges Rousse. Known for his large-scale installations that seem to float in space like an optical illusion, Rousse created various graphic treatments on the walls and pillars, seen for the first time here, which spell out dchir (ripped) in one room. Spoiler alert: his color palette, electric reds and midnight blues, comes from Taits collection.

title: Answers to Questions About New York
description: Q. Would you know who posed for the giant Camel billboard in 1940s Times Square that showed the man blowing big smoke rings?

title: Frozen Finds a Theme Park Home at Epcot
description: LOS ANGELES  Walt Disney World is ripping out one of its biggest cult hits in the name of Elsa and Anna.

title: A Cross-Dresser Turned Inside Out
description: In Marissa Perels More Than Just a Piece of Sky, a bedroom becomes a yeshiva that in turn becomes a planet where a sense of difference creates new ways of seeing oneself and others. Ms. Perel, a multidisciplinary artist whose works often combine choreography and performance art, has turned for source material to Yentl, a 1983 movie directed by and starring Barbra Streisand that was inspired by a story from Isaac Bashevis Singer.

title: Swimming in High School, Drowning in Life
description: The two girls dont know the protocol for sitting on someones stomach for medical reasons. So they improvise, awkwardly and goofily, with one planting her rump on the midsection of the other, which leads to both of them convulsing into giggles. The girl being sat upon laughs so hard that she wets herself.

title: Sweet and Spicy Roast Chicken
description: Melissa Clark roasts juicy chicken thighs with carrots, onions and dates for a twist on a classic dish for the Jewish holidays.

title: On the Market in the Region
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: A New Track and a New Tack
description: The band was warming up when the lead singer arrived at a Midtown studio shortly after 4 p.m. Monday.

title: House Tour | John Richardson
description: The art historian John Richardson shows writer Ian Buruma his Connecticut estate and cautions against too much tasteful decorating.

title: Straight From the Source
description: Mary Wilson is only the second owner of her 1964 Dodge Custom 880 convertible. The first: Anna Thomson Dodge, whose husband, Horace E. Dodge, was one of the founders of the Dodge Brothers.

title: For a Holiday, Sweet Kisses Spice
description: Every Rosh Hashana, Jews smear honey on sliced apples and thick pieces of challah with the idea that a sweet New Years meal will usher in a sweet new year. Its a symbolic ritual Ive never questioned, since its also a tasty one. And who wouldnt want to hedge their bets in such a pleasant way?

title: A Violent Tale Induces a Familiar Flinch
description: With less than 24 hours notice, Screen Gems announced that it would cancel Wednesdays press screenings for No Good Deed. Officially, this unusual step was intended to help the studio protect a plot twist. This twist, it turns out, hardly warrants any fuss or curiosity.

title: Subway Tunnel to Open, Storm Repairs Finished
description: Subway service through a storm-damaged tunnel between Brooklyn and Manhattan is set to resume in time for the commute on Monday morning, according to the Metropolitan Transportation Authoritys website.

title: Square to Raise $100 Million at a $6 Billion Valuation
description: Square, the San Francisco e-commerce start-up, plans to raise at least $100 million in a new round of venture capital funding, according to a person briefed on the investment.

title: The Assault Weapon Myth
description: OVER the past two decades, the majority of Americans in a country deeply divided over gun control have coalesced behind a single proposition: The sale of assault weapons should be banned.

title: Emma Stones Peekaboo Chlo Dress
description: The Star: Emma Stone

title: Tougher Than They Look
description: Resilience, the subject of a large-scale study published recently in The Gerontologist, reminds me of what a Supreme Court justice once said of pornography: Its hard to define, but we know it when we see it.

title: Formative Lessons in the Hudson River School
description: In 1844, Frederic Edwin Church left his parents home in Hartford, Conn., to spend two years in Catskill, N.Y., as the pupil of Thomas Cole. At 18, Church had already demonstrated skills as a draftsman and was enthusiastic about accompanying Cole on sketching outings in the Hudson Valley. Cole was 43, an established landscape painter who championed the majesty of the American wilderness. Not only was their time together formative for Church, who became one of the most acclaimed artists of the 19th century, but it also cemented what would later be called the Hudson River School, the countrys first cohesive art movement.

title: After Breach, JPMorgan Still Seeks to Determine Extent of Attack
description: The headache caused by the attack on JPMorgan Chases computer network this summer may not go away anytime soon.

title: Europeans Bracing for Netflix
description: PARIS  With Netflix poised to make its debut in six European countries next week, the expansion of that online streaming giants international territory is stirring a mix of anticipation, anxiety and House of Cards-style political intrigue.

title: Anniversary Dinners for Relais & Chteaux
description: Relais & Chteaux, a network of more than 500 luxury hotels and restaurants around the world, is celebrating its 60th anniversary with a series of more than 30 dinners throughout North America and the Caribbean.

title: Melding Voice and Piano in Psychedelic Mysticism
description: The soprano Dawn Upshaw turned her back to the audience and leaned over the uncovered strings of a grand piano at the beginning of the second half of Thursday evenings concert at the Harvey Theater at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. Steadying herself on the instruments frame with her hands, she bent over deeply and began to sing  cooing, pleading, beseeching sounds that grew more frantic and shrill until they sounded like curses and incantations. Refracted by the pianos strings, echoes floated up from the instrument and hovered about her like an iridescent aura.

title: Learning How to Exert Self-Control
description: PARIS  NOT many Ivy League professors are associated with a type of candy. But Walter Mischel, a professor of psychology at Columbia, doesnt mind being one of them.

title: Immutable Truths in Shifting Octaves
description: The bass-baritone voice of the jazz singer Andy Bey is elemental and complicated, a purr and a pushed-out moan, a compound of tones from different parts of his body.

title: Irans Participation in Meeting to Aid Iraq Is Not Appropriate, Says Kerry
description: ANKARA, Turkey  Secretary of State John Kerry said on Friday that it would not be appropriate for Iran to attend an international conference on the security crisis in Iraq that is to be held in Paris next week because of what he called the role that Irans paramilitary Quds Force is playing in the fighting in neighboring Syria.

title: Met Opera Cuts 22 Nonunion Jobs, Mainly Through Layoffs
description: The Metropolitan Opera, which promised to match the pay cuts that its major unions agreed to last month with equivalent cuts to its nonunion payroll, said on Friday afternoon that it was eliminating 22 of its 254 administrative positions, mostly through layoffs.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Carnegie Hall Makes Room for Future Stars
description: The old joke held that the way to get to Carnegie Hall was to practice, practice, practice. Now musicians will have more places to practice once they get there: The scaffolding that has shrouded Carnegie for four years is coming down this week to reveal the halls new education wing, with new practice rooms, and a roof garden more than a century in the making.

title: White House Photo Ops, Old School
description: Geoffrey C. Ward had to cut away from watching a presidential news conference to talk to a reporter about The Roosevelts: An Intimate History, the new Ken Burns documentary series he wrote.

title: A Family Sedan for the Speedway
description: Its wheelbase is 4.2 inches longer and it has two additional doors, but the Dodge Charger sedan is virtually a mechanical twin of the Challenger coupe. So it was straightforward enough to move the parts that turn a Challenger into a Hellcat over to the Charger. The 2015 Charger Hellcat, which arrives this fall at an expected price above $60,000, will be powered by the same supercharged 707-horsepower Hemi V8 found in the Challenger Hellcat.

title: 4G Wireless in the Car: Speeding With Impunity
description: Its not considered perverse to desire a vehicle that can go twice the legal speed limit. Do buyers want cars with faster Internet connections as well?

title: An Original Dodge, Direct From the Founders Family
description: GROSSE POINTE SHORES, MICH.  A price guide for collector cars might tell you how much an all-original, option-packed, low-mileage 1964 Dodge Custom 880 convertible should sell for. What that book cannot tell you is the value added by the provenance of a particular car  its history of ownership and experiences.

title: Sting of Guzzler Tax, Frozen for Decades, Fades
description: Even the fastest, most powerful new cars can be classified as fuel-sipping stewards of the environment  by the federal governments measure, anyway.

title: Readers Respond: Becoming a Real Person
description: Have elite universities been so pared down to career academies that their future graduates wont be titans, but zombies?

title: Miley Cyrus, the Drag Queen Artist Milk and Other Faces from New York Fashion Week
description: The illustrator Damien Florbert Cuypers shares his impressions of the fashion set around New York City this week.

title: The Way to Beat Poverty
description: AS our children were growing up, one of their playmates was a girl named Jessica. Our kids would disappear with Jessica to make forts, build a treehouse and share dreams. We were always concerned because  theres no polite way to say this  Jessica was a mess.

title: Palins Said to Be Involved in Brawl at Party in Alaska
description: ANCHORAGE  It began as a birthday party that drew local snowmobile racers, construction workers and other longtime Alaskans last Saturday night. It turned into a brawl with members of Sarah Palins family in the center of it, according to witnesses at the party.

title: Nazi Saboteurs in the Amagansett Sands
description: It could have been just another quiet evening in Amagansett, but that changed dramatically after a 21-year-old Coast Guard seaman stumbled upon four suspicious-looking men hanging out on a beach during his regular late-night patrol.

title: Pictures of the Day: South Africa and Elsewhere
description: Photos from South Africa, Pakistan, Srinagar and Liberia.

title: Pearls Spotted All Over New York Fashion Week
description: Today marks the start of London Fashion Week, but editors cant stop talking about the pearl trend from New York. Rodarte sent a model in a glistening dress with a net skirt and a pearl embellishment walking through its fantastical set of fluorescent lights and shattered Swarovski crystals. Adam Selman, who designed the infamous sheer dress Rihanna wore to the CFDA Awards, added the gemstone to many of the pieces in his rather sporty collection, like a boxy chambray top and shorts with a floating seam connected by pearls. And Joseph Altuzarras typically sexy, sharp collection included black dresses with pearls dangling from the trim.

title: Chameleon and Lion Sample Songbook
description: Tony Bennett was waiting, in a Brioni tuxedo and an uncertain silence, onstage at Frederick P. Rose Hall in Manhattan. Moments earlier, hed been singing the Tin Pan Alley tune Goody Goody, while Lady Gaga  polymorphic pop star, supersize cult hero and, for the moment, his co-headliner  muttered coquettish protestations from an enormous rocking chair, cartoon-chic in a pink cocktail dress, a wide-brim black hat and satiny opera gloves.

title: For a Big Break, a Break From Ballet
description: One morning this month, Megan Fairchild and her blue-ribbon ballet technique were the center of attention at a packed New York rehearsal. So far, so ordinary for a principal dancer with New York City Ballet  except that the rehearsal was taking place near Times Square and was open to the press. It was at the Lyric Theater, where Ms. Fairchild is to make her Broadway debut in a revival of On the Town that starts previews on Saturday.

title: HSBC to Pay $550 Million to End Mortgage-Related Suit
description: HSBC agreed on Friday to pay $550 million to settle a lawsuit filed in 2011 by the Federal Housing Finance Agency, the federal regulator that oversees the governments two mortgage finance companies, over troubled mortgage-backed securities sold in the lead-up to the financial crisis.

title: What Were Reading
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an email. Sign up

title: The Weekly Wrap
description: This weeks Insider highlights:

title: Eternal Lovers, Chasing Their Happiness in a Harsh World
description: In Dances Patrelle, a company led by the artistic director Francis Patrelle, a much-adored teacher, ballet is a circle of life. The cast of his Romeo & Juliet, currently enjoying a revival at the Kaye Playhouse at Hunter College, pairs professional dancers  and not-too-shabby ones at that  with students. But a choreographer needs to be more than a nurturing spirit, and Mr. Patrelles long-winded Romeo, performed on Thursday, is not nearly as enduring as Shakespeares.

title: Owner of Dozens of Newspapers Seeks Buyers
description: Digital First Media, a struggling collection of 76 daily newspapers including The San Jose Mercury News, The Los Angeles Daily News, The Denver Post and The St. Paul Pioneer Press, has put itself up for sale.

title: A Drink Before the Scottish Independence Vote
description: Will five million Scots vote to secede from Britain and form their own independent state? Or will 300 years of shared history and the likely turmoil of a transition lead them to stick with the union? Polls leading up to next weeks election have pointed to a close vote.

title: Richard Schechners Imagining O
description: Imagining O meshes Shakespeare and Story of O at the Alexander Kasser Theater in Montclair, N.J.

title: Ophelia and Friends, Dominated but in Control
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  Tall and imposing in a long, strapless dress, a young man in a feathered mask towered behind the avant-garde director Richard Schechner, who was threatening his audience on Wednesday night. His exhilarating and erotic new production, Imagining O, was about to start.

title: Cries of Gloom, Resignation and Heartbreak, Plus Faith
description: Bunji Garlin

title: A Deal From the Cavendish Tournament
description: The diagramed deal was my favorite from the Cavendish tournament in Monte Carlo last week. It was declared by Andrea Manno, a young Italian who lives in Palermo.

title: Hurtling Bodies, Frozen in Time
description: Stills, a series of harrowing, six-and-a-half-foot-tall photographs depicting bodies falling from buildings  often frozen in midair  was first created by the artist Sarah Charlesworth in 1980. Charlesworth, who died last year, was part of the so-called Pictures Generation, that group of artists who emerged in the 1970s and 80s whose works often used existing images or carefully staged tableaus.

title: A Visceral Fusion of Film and Music
description: For the second year, the New York Philharmonic eases back into a new season with The Art of the Score: Film Week at the Philharmonic. The fun begins with a program dedicated to the often-sensuous scores from Cinecitt, with La Dolce Vita: The Music of Italian Cinema. On Tuesday and Wednesday, the Philharmonics music director, Alan Gilbert, conducts excerpts from the soundtracks to classics like La Dolce Vita, The Leopard and LEclisse. The violinist Joshua Bell, the soprano Rene Fleming and the singer-songwriter Josh Groban join in. (7:30 p.m., Avery Fisher Hall, nyphil.org.)

title: Past and Present, Dolefully United
description: The dead stay dead, but moneys real, says a character in Good Men, Good Women, a 1995 film by the great Taiwanese director Hou Hsiao-hsien. Except in Good Men, the dead are like the past, tethered to the present in mournful, rapt communion. Audiences in the United States dont get many opportunities to see Mr. Hous movies on the big screen, which makes the Museum of the Moving Images retrospective Also Like Life: The Films of Hou Hsiao-hsien (through Oct. 17), essential viewing.

title: Frights That Tickle the Funny Bone
description: Tim and Eric, those early adapters of the short satirical video, are still around, and in the Thursday-into-Friday Adult Swim block, they serve up a pretty amusing new series, a Twilight Zone with a deadpan sense of humor.

title: A Familys Rough Ride Through an American Era
description: The Roosevelts: An Intimate History, Ken Burnss seven-part documentary about (sorry, Adamses, Kennedys, Clintons and Bushes) the most important political bloodline in American history, may constitute more than you really want to know about Theodore, Franklin and Eleanor. But look at it this way: If you commit to the whole series, which begins on Sunday on PBS, youll also be getting, at no extra charge, a survey of an amazingly transformative half-century that made the United States what it is today.

title: Adapting Listerine to a Global Market
description: MORRIS PLAINS, N.J.  Walking into the Listerine stink lab is like stepping into a gigantic human mouth.

title: Letter from Israels Unit 8200
description: In a letter sent to commanders and the prime minister, 43 veteran officers of a vaunted intelligence unit said they would refuse required reserve duty.

title: Prizes Without Passion
description: It is hard to pinpoint the moment when the Academy Awards became more important than the movies. Im exaggerating  maybe. The truth is that even those of us who loathe this race can find it tough to resist. Thats why, at the Toronto International Film Festival, after watching Benedict Cumberbatch play Alan Turing in The Imitation Game, I found myself pulled into the Oscar guessing game, as helpless as an addict trying and failing to go clean.

title: N.F.L. Rocked Again as Adrian Peterson Faces a Child Abuse Charge
description: A warrant for the arrest of Adrian Peterson, one of the National Football Leagues top stars, was issued Friday after he was charged in a child abuse investigation in Texas, the latest criminal case to rock the countrys most popular sport.

title: A Week of Dan Barbers Aprons
description: Worn by the chef from July 29 to Aug. 4 while cooking at his two restaurants, Blue Hill in Manhattan and Blue Hill at Stone Barns in Pocantico Hills, N.Y.

title: Fed Rallies New Team to Forestall Next Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  Stanley Fischer, vice chairman of the Federal Reserve, will lead a new internal committee focused on threats to financial stability, the Fed said on Friday.

title: G.M. Stops Some Corvette Sales Over Air Bags
description: General Motors has told car dealers to stop delivery of certain 2015 Chevrolet Corvettes because they may have faulty air bags and parking brake cables. The automaker will fix drivers side air bags in about 2,000 Corvettes because they could separate from their steering wheels. Another 800 Corvettes, most of which are at dealerships, are being held back from buyers because they may have been built with defective rear parking brake cables, increasing the risk that parked cars could roll away. Automotive News reported that G.M. was issuing two additional recalls for the vehicles, according to the stop-sales orders sent to dealers, but neither has been publicly announced. Alan Adler, a G.M. spokesman, would not confirm them.

title: Nevada Woos Tesla Plant in Tax Deal, but Economic Benefits Prompt Debate
description: When Nevada lured Tesla Motors to the Reno area to build a giant battery factory, a triumphant governor, Brian Sandoval, proclaimed that every dollar his state was spending in tax incentives and other subsidies would yield $80 in economic activity.

title: The Process Behind the Painting
description: It has been over a hundred years since abstraction was adopted in Western painting, and were still trying to make sense of it. Despite the rather clunky subtitle and the fact that the exhibition is drawn from a single collection, Rothko to Richter: Mark-Making in Abstract Painting from the Collection of Preston H. Haskell offers an excellent, compact survey of some of the key arguments.

title: The G.O.P.s Edge in House Elections
description: To the Editor:

title: Coals Price Tag, in Toxic Emissions and Disease
description: To the Editor:

title: J.W. Anderson on His 10 Most Prized Possessions
description: In the six years since founding his label J.W. Anderson, the Northern Irish designer Jonathan Anderson has emerged asone offashions leading lights. His cerebral collections  the newest of which will debut at London Fashion Week tomorrow  were recently anointed by an investment from LVMH. And his new role as the creative director of the venerable Spanish house Loewe has granted him membership to fashions most elite club: the small set of designers responsible for not one, but two, labels (Karl Lagerfeld, Alexander Wang).

title: Nutrition for the Elderly
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,331 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Access to College
description: To the Editor:

title: On Long Island, a Worthy Plan for Coastal Flooding
description: To the Editor:

title: This Is What an Abortion Looks Like
description: DENTON, Tex.  I MET Wendy Davis, the Texas state senator and Democratic candidate for governor, for the first time last week, and I told her how much it meant to me that she wasnt afraid to talk about abortion. But we need a much larger conversation about abortion  one that also includes, without prejudice, the stories unlikely to generate much sympathy. Stories like mine.

title: Detained, Beaten and Tortured by Separatists in Donetsk Ordeal
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  FOR months as this region slipped deeper into war, with armed gunmen on patrol and artillery shells slamming into the regional capital daily, Aleksandr and his wife, Olga, had learned to take precautions. With people disappearing from the streets every week, they usually went everywhere together, and when apart kept in constant touch by cellphone.

title: This Art Is Indeed Long (66 Feet). And Very Heavy (About 12 Tons).
description: Brooke Kamin Rapaport, the curator who shepherded an art world set piece in Madison Square Park on Friday, called what was being installed the great levitating sculpture.

title: New York Fashion Week Isnt All About the Clothes: Best of the After-Parties
description: Here are our highlights from the parties at New York Fashion Week.

title: Years of Single-Minded Devotion Begin to Pay Off
description: ATLANTA  Chris Kirk was celebrating a baseball title with his teammates when he startled his father, who was also his coach, by saying: Dad, this is the coolest thing ever. Its a good time to end my baseball career.

title: Where a Sip of Whisky Usually Cures All, a Secession Vote Proves Bitter
description: ISLAY, Scotland  On Islay, an island with a population of around 3,000, disagreements have never run deep. The last big dispute goes back more than two decades; it involved the conservation of an indigenous butterfly.

title: Inmates Death in Overheated Rikers Cell Is Ruled Accidental
description: The death of a mentally ill veteran in an overheated cell at Rikers Island this year was accidental, the New York City medical examiners office ruled on Friday in a case that drew scrutiny to abusive conditions at the jail complex.

title: Mistrust Lingers as Ferguson Takes New Tack on Fines
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  There were lots of jitters at the Ferguson police clerks window this week, as steady streams of drivers with unpaid traffic tickets and pending arrest warrants turned themselves in as part of a new city initiative to repair its frayed relationship with black residents.

title: The Top 10 Moments from Spring/Summer 2015 New York Fashion Week
description: Ts senior market editor rounds up the most memorable happenings both on and off the runways.

title: Embrace of Social Media Aids Flood Victims in Kashmir
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  Early this week, as the flooding in Kashmir was entering a new and terrifying phase, the Indian Armys public information office received a call from Raheel Khursheed, a former journalist and digital obsessive who serves as the director of news, politics and government at Twitter India. He had a proposal.

title: Doctor Who Worked on Joan Rivers Steps Down From Post at Medical Clinic
description: The doctor who performed an endoscopy on Joan Rivers before she went into cardiac arrest has stepped down as medical director of the Manhattan clinic where she was treated and he is no longer doing procedures there, the clinic announced on Friday.

title: Social Worker Spreads a Message of Acceptance to Mormons With Gay Children
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Late on election night in 2008, Caitlin Ryan sat in her apartment here, cat in her lap, computer at her side, watching the results on television. Sometime after Barack Obama was declared president, briefly lifting her mood, she saw the news she had been dreading: Proposition 8 was going to win, striking down same-sex marriage in California.

title: Saturdays College Football Games to Watch
description: 6 GEORGIA

title: Friday Night Music: Cheryl Wheeler
description: For some reason Ive been taking a music trip down memory lane, back to the late 80s, when I was listening a lot to several singer-songwriters  Suzanne Vega, Shawn Colvin, Patty Griffin, and Cheryl Wheeler; this song is as gorgeous as I remembered:

title: The New Look
description: While many men care about what they wear  the style, cut, fabric and even maker of their clothing  few would claim to be followers of mens fashion, a term that seems like an oxymoron to most. Yet todays slimmer jackets, tighter shirts and straighter-legged pants  even your naked ankles  are the distinct sartorial fallout of the designs that trekked down the runways of New York and Paris over a decade ago. Think trickle-down economics, but for fashion. You could likely trace the ancestral lineage of the clothes in your closet to their radical progenitors: Raf Simons, Hedi Slimane for Dior Homme or Thom Browne.

title: New Sanctions to Stall Exxons Arctic Oil Plans
description: LONDON  Exxon Mobils ambitions in Russia appear to have been dashed, at least until the Ukraine crisis is resolved.

title: Professors Angry Tweets on Gaza Cost Him a Job
description: The trustees of the University of Illinois voted on Thursday to block the appointment of Steven Salaita, a Palestinian-American professor who had been offered a tenured position last year, following a campaign by pro-Israel students, faculty members and donors who contended that his Twitter comments on the bombardment of Gaza this summer were anti-Semitic.

title: When Fighting Fires Becomes Something Else
description: Firefighters from two houses in SoHo, Engine 55 and Ladder Company 20, rushed to Henry Street in Chinatown one June morning two years ago. Smoke filled a ground-floor apartment.

title: Both Sides Cite Urgency in Court Appeal of a Texas Law on Abortion Clinics
description: NEW ORLEANS  In March, a federal appeals court here gave Texas Republicans and anti-abortion groups a major victory in their legal battle to enforce the tough new abortion law that the Legislature passed last year, upholding one contested part of it as constitutional.

title: Government Push for Yahoos User Data Set Stage for Broad Surveillance
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Its hard to fathom after a year of revelations about widespread government surveillance of Internet users, but in 2007, the governments authority to demand such data from technology companies without a search warrant was very much in doubt.

title: The Man in the Middle for the Nittany Lions
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  At 6 a.m., Penn States campus is quiet, other than sleepy students staggering out of the library and a few joggers. The stoplights are not activated yet, so James Franklin can drive from his house to the Lasch Football Building in about four minutes.

title: Ex-President of Haiti Put Under House Arrest
description: The deteriorating political climate in Haiti took an unusual and confusing turn this week when Jean-Bertrand Aristide, the twice-exiled former president of Haiti, was ordered by a court not to leave his home as part of a corruption investigation.

title: Ohio: Answers Sought in Prison Break
description: T. J. Lane, a 19-year-old serving life in prison for killing three students in a school cafeteria in 2012, was transferred with two other inmates to a maximum-security prison on Friday after briefly escaping a lower-security site, the Ohio Department of Rehabilitation and Correction said. They were moved to the Ohio State Penitentiary in Youngstown, a day after they climbed a fence and escaped a prison in Lima, setting off a nine-hour search. The agency said it was investigating details, including a report that guards warned prison officials about an escape plot, and a panel is expected to make recommendations about improving prison procedures.

title: Plea Deal for Ex-Police Officer in Huge Disability Scheme
description: A retired police officer, described by prosecutors as a ringleader in a huge scheme to defraud the Social Security Administration, pleaded guilty on Friday and agreed to testify against his former colleagues in return for a reduced sentence.

title: Dont Throw the Bums Out
description: MADISON, Wis.  WHEN Mark Twain snarled that politicians were dust-licking pimps, millions of furious Gilded Age citizens agreed. Millions more would today. There is a bipartisan consensus that our leaders are fools, a collective feeling in a long tradition of grumbling about American politicians. The problem, as Twains generation discovered, is that blaming all politicians makes it harder to throw out the real bums.

title: The Homework Squabbles
description: Homework has a branding problem. Or, to be a little less pointy-headed about it, everybody hates homework.

title: Barbra Streisand, a Voice to Be Reckoned With
description: Barbra Streisand is very excited about the new iPhone. She thinks The Goldfinch is good, but not quite the masterpiece its being hailed as. She cant get enough of The Americans, is ambivalent about Boyhood, and thinks there are too many action movies these days, although she enjoyed Guardians of the Galaxy.

title: Bob Crewe, Songwriter for Frankie Valli and Four Seasons, Dies at 83
description: Bob Crewe, who helped create a parade of indelible pop music hits, most notably for Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons, including Sherry, Walk Like a Man, Rag Doll and Mr. Vallis soaring anthem of adoration Cant Take My Eyes Off You, died on Thursday in Scarborough, Me. He was 83.

title: At SoulCycle Tribeca, The Spinning Stops; Panic Ensues
description: In an email last week, Monet Berger received some upsetting news. I nearly cried when I read it, Ms. Berger said. My heart sank.

title: Inside the T Mens Fall Fashion Issue
description: Ts fall mens fashion issue celebrates guys who pursue their passions. On the cover is the young English actor Jack OConnell, whose electric performances and rough-and-tumble ways have him perched on the cusp of stardom  if he can only keep it together long enough to reach the potential that many, like his Unbroken director Angelina Jolie, see in him. Ren Redzepi, owner of one of the worlds top-ranked restaurant, Noma, is a closet taco fanatic, so Jeff Gordinier follows the Scandinavian chef to Mexico in search of bold new flavors and, possibly, the next big thing in food. We travel to the rural Connecticut estate of the Picasso biographer John Richardson, which deftly mixes high and low, refined and roguish, the tasteful and the gaudy. Elsewhere, T pays a visit to the NBAs finishing school for rookies, where draftees receive advice on fashion, sex and table manners, and are taught to repeat the mantra I dont want to go broke; Marin Hopper remembers the way her father, the actor Dennis Hopper, found spiritual reckoning  and plenty of good parties  in Taos, N. M.; Alex Fury sounds off on a mens wear moment that is, at long last, challenging notions about sexuality, power and gender politics; and Jody Rosen travels to a sprawling forensics lab in hippie Oregon to investigate the $19 billion trade in illegal wildlife, which has ties to the Russian mob and Islamic extremists. See all stories from the issue >>

title: Atlanta Hawks G.M. Danny Ferry Takes Leave Over Racial Remarks
description: ATLANTA  Before this week, General Manager Danny Ferry was widely appreciated for restoring hope among Atlanta Hawks followers with a makeover of the roster and coaching staff in only two seasons on the job.

title: Rainbow Sheens and a Tip Draw a Focus to Dumping in Newtown Creek
description: Whoever was dumping oil into Newtown Creek this summer may have assumed that nobody would notice, given that the murky waterway between Brooklyn and Queens had been forsaken for so long.

title: Candidates Playing Possum
description: Election season! Tension mounts! Longtime public servants are aware that the least little slip and they could be out the door. Forced, like ousted House Majority Leader Eric Cantor, to labor in the sweatshops of the investment banking industry.

title: Lawmaker Assails Foreign Donations to Think Tanks
description: WASHINGTON  Prominent Washington think tanks that routinely provide Congress with policy advice should refrain from taking foreign government donations, particularly from nations like Qatar that have been associated with financing extremist groups, a senior House lawmaker wrote this week in a letter to the president of the Brookings Institution.

title: U.S. Scientists See Long Fight Against Ebola
description: The deadly Ebola outbreak sweeping across three countries in West Africa is likely to last 12 to 18 months more, much longer than anticipated, and could infect hundreds of thousands of people before it is brought under control, say scientists mapping its spread for the federal government.

title: N.F.L. Stands By Its Leader
description: In 2006, the year Roger Goodell was named commissioner of the National Football League, the Washington Redskins were the most valuable team in football, according to Forbes magazine, with a valuation of $1.4 billion. Washingtons revenue that year was $303 million, with profits of more than $108 million. In second place came the New England Patriots, valued by Forbes at $1.18 billion, followed by the Dallas Cowboys at $1.17 billion.

title: Liberian President Pleads With Obama for Assistance in Combating Ebola
description: WASHINGTON  The president of Liberia, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, has implored President Obama for help in managing her countrys rapidly expanding Ebola crisis and has warned that without American assistance the disease could send Liberia into the civil chaos that enveloped the country for two decades.

title: A Showdown on the Pay Gap
description: Closing the persistent wage gap between men and women is important, not only as a matter of fairness but as a matter of rudimentary family economics: Women are the primary or co-breadwinner in more than 60 percent of American families. That makes it all the more urgent to address the conspicuous discrepancy that sees a woman working full-time making 77 cents on average against $1 for a man working full-time.

title: Ray Rice Case Draws Attention to a Crime Often Obscured
description: ATLANTIC CITY  To many who viewed the video of the N.F.L. star Ray Rice assaulting his fiance in the elevator of a casino here, the contrast between the viciousness of his attack and the leniency of his legal punishment was both baffling and infuriating.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 12, 2014
Mr. Bratton Reverses to Go Forward
description: Police Commissioner William Bratton appeared before the New York City Council on Monday and gave a master class in the art of defusing conflict and the deft reversal. Sitting before Council members who have sharply criticized the Police Departments focus on petty offenders, the broken windows strategy that many say culminated in the brutal arrest that killed Eric Garner on Staten Island in July, Mr. Bratton more or less ceded the point.

title: Obama Sees Iraq Resolution as a Legal Basis for Airstrikes, Official Says
description: WASHINGTON  The White House believes that Congresss 2002 authorization of the Iraq war  and not just the 2001 authorization to fight Al Qaeda  provides a legal justification for President Obamas air campaign against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the Obama administration said Friday.

title: A Twitter Triumph
description: Michael Kors is fashions $1 billion man, and hes apparently its social media king as well.

title: The Sluggish Fight Against Ebola
description: Efforts by the United States, other nations and international organizations to curb the widening epidemic of Ebola in West Africa are falling short  too little help arriving too late. The World Health Organization estimates that as many as 20,000 people could be infected over the course of the outbreak. President Obama has called the epidemic a national security priority and pledged to use American military assets to help the beleaguered countries, primarily Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone, to bring the epidemic under control. The Agency for International Development and the Defense Department are already rushing personnel and supplies to the scene.

title: Federal Appeals Court Permits Wisconsin Voter ID Law
description: CHICAGO  A federal appeals court on Friday permitted Wisconsin to restore a requirement that voters provide photo identification before casting their ballots, allowing the long-debated state law to take effect in time for a hard-fought election on Nov. 4.

title: Andr Balazs, the Man Who Holds the Keys
description: LONDON  In a low-ceilinged room in the basement of the Chiltern Firehouse hotel, down the hall from the restrooms and smoking alcove, 12 reservationists work the phones full time, mainly saying no.

title: They Move Like Jagger, if the Musics Right
description: Karl Lagerfeld refers to it as runway glue  when the music feels sluggish and drags down the mood of the collection and models. The right music, on the other hand, does more than just elevate spirits; it transports the audience.

title: Mark Sanford Announces a Breakup on Facebook
description: Representative Mark Sanford, whose extramarital affair destroyed his marriage, roiled South Carolina politics and gave new meaning to the phrase hiking the Appalachian Trail, turned to Facebook on Friday to announce the breakup of his engagement to the Argentine woman he once called his soul mate.

title: Veiled Criticism for France as Ministers Stress Eurozone Stability
description: MILAN  The rule book for the stability of the euro came under strain Friday at a meeting of finance ministers after France warned this past week that it would miss its deficit target again.

title: Two Testify That Mother Was Coherent After Killing
description: A police officer and a paramedic testified on Friday that when they entered the hotel room of a woman accused of murdering her son, she was awake and coherent, on the floor next to a bed where her 8-year-old son lay dead.

title: A Sampling of New York Fashion Week Playlists
description: Sebastien Perrin, Brad Walsh, Javier Peral and Gillian Sagansky talk about the songs that set the stage for new designs. Here is a sampling:

title: Donald Sinden, British Actor of Stage and Screen for 60 Years, Dies at 90
description: Donald Sinden, a British actor whose versatility and deep, resonant voicekept him steadily employed on stage, screen and television for more than 60 years, died on Friday at his home in Kent, England. He was 90.

title: Facing Perilous Fights, Obama Turns to History and Donors
description: BALTIMORE  Peering at an aging manuscript  with the ramparts of Fort McHenry, its ever-present American flag, and the gleaming waters of Chesapeake Bay just outside  President Obama came here Friday to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the British bombardment that inspired the lyrics to The Star-Spangled Banner.

title: N.F.L. Players Union Agrees to New Drug Policies
description: After years of bickering, the N.F.L. Players Association unanimously approved new policies on substance abuse and performance-enhancing drugs on Friday, paving the way for an overhaul of a program that dates to 2006.

title: Latest Development: A Role on Broadway
description: Michael Cera visited the Plaza Hotel for the first time last week.

title: The Mechanics of Homework
description: The homework wars among education wonks, teachers and parents dont, as my friend and colleague Bruce Feiler writes in The Homework Squabbles, his This Life column for Sunday Styles, matter much on the scale at which most families are dealing with homework. To us, the question of how valuable homework is has to be set aside daily in the name of the backpacks, folders, binders and worksheets full of the stuff that our children actually bring home. And its worth noting that this idea of too much homework as a national problem is a myth. Instead, homework is something of an ironic twist in the American inequality story, with the more pressing problem being with the children who have too little rather than those who have too much.

title: Simone Rocha, Born to Fashion, Makes Her Own Mark
description: Simone Rocha attended her first fashion show at the ripe age of zero, and followed up the experience no less often than every six months ever since.

title: Paper Job
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  I chose the headline for todays post because it made me mist up a bit. Cluing COLUMNIST as Paper job is very clever, but a reminder for those of us who make a living writing that the print side of publishing is on its knees, if were going to be charitable. Whether it can be saved or whether it will stick around as an archaic reminder of the golden days of publishing is a question I will leave for better minds than mine.

title: Clinton Silent on 2016 Bid as Campaign-Style Actions Begin to Speak Volumes
description: She is building stamina through tough new workouts with a personal trainer and yoga. She is talking about how to address income inequality without alienating corporate America. And she is reviewing whos who in the Democratic Party in Iowa, a crucial early voting state in the presidential cycle.

title: Cosimo Matassa, Whose Studio Created a Rock n Roll Sound, Dies at 88
description: Cosimo Matassa, whose used-record business in New Orleans led him to sell new records, which led him to open a tiny studio that helped jump-start rock n roll by recording early hits by the likes of Fats Domino and Little Richard, died on Thursday in New Orleans. He was 88.

title: Witness Says She Was Told to Make It Seem as if Rowland Was Tied to Company
description: NEW HAVEN  Ann Collette was not used to getting calls late on a Sunday night from her boss at Apple Rehab, she told a rapt courtroom on Friday, but there was an urgency to his request one weekend in April 2012.

title: South Carolina Child Welfare Agency Faced Scrutiny Before 5 Siblings Deaths
description: ATLANTA  The state child welfare agency that investigated whether a South Carolina father was capable of caring for his five children before he allegedly killed them and dumped their bodies in rural Alabama has itself been under scrutiny in recent months, facing allegations of botching similar cases that resulted in child deaths.

title: Riva Castleman, Curator Who Promoted Printmaking, Dies at 84
description: Riva Castleman, an art historian and curator who built the worlds pre-eminent collection of modern and contemporary prints at the Museum of Modern Art in New York, died on Sept. 4 in Bridgewater, Conn. She was 84.

title: Twitter Erupts as Nicki Minajs Offer to School Is Declined
description: All sorts of things can ruin a principals day. A misbehaving student. A fire in the cafeteria kitchen. A teacher having a meltdown.

title: Charges Brought Against Four Day Care Operators
description: At one day care center in Brooklyn, there was spoiled milk in the refrigerator and rat droppings strewed across the floor. At two others, employees working under false identities fled when investigators arrived.

title: The Knick Recap: Signs of Progress, Amid All That Blood
description: Season 1, Episode 5,  They Capture the Heat

title: In Ferguson, a Stack of Warrants
description: Amid reform in Ferguson, Mo., a neighbor of Michael Browns family tried to clear various warrants for his arrest so he could participate in civil disobedience.

title: 13 Years After 9/11, the War on Terror Has a New Focus
description: The anniversaries of 9/11 mount, yet every year on that date we recall with extraordinary clarity where we were on that terrible day, what we felt, how we gradually absorbed the enormity of the horror that had been visited upon us.

title: Evening Hours | Water Colors
description: A hologram display at Central Park highlights a week of shows and galas.

title: A Complete Guide to This Years London Design Festival
description: The Brits are in a reflective mood, and not just because of the Scottish referendum on independence. A series of installations created for the London Design Festival, which begins Saturday, aim to provoke onlookers to reexamine their surroundings.

title: N.F.L. Actuarial Reports
description: Actuarial tables and reports prepared for the N.F.L. and for the plaintiffs in a lawsuit against the league over health issues that are the results of head injuries sustained while playing.

title: Bill Cunningham | New York Fashion Week
description: Though much of the designers offerings for spring 2015 were special-occasion clothes, their audience spoke loudly that the shirt, should triumph.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) DALLAS BUYERS CLUB (2013) A fiercely gaunt Matthew McConaughey, in an Oscar-winning role, portrays Ron Woodroof, a Texas electrician and rodeo rider who, after learning in 1985 that he is H.I.V. -positive, decides to treat himself by hunting down medication not then legal in the United States. Eventually, he begins a subscription service, selling contraband medicines for a monthly fee. Jared Leto (above left, with Mr. McConaughey), in another Oscar-winning performance, plays the transgendered Rayon, who becomes Rons business partner. And Jennifer Garner is the doctor who, after initially opposing the plan, turns into an ally. What is largely missing from this drama, directed by Jean-Marc Valle and inspired by real events, is the sense that Rons efforts are part of a larger movement, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. Rons bravery and determination are entirely credible, thanks to Mr. McConaugheys disciplined, high-spirited performance and the filmmakers interest in the complexity of the character. But his actions unfold in something of a vacuum. He added, There is warmth and intelligence here, and undeniable sincerity, but also a determination, in the face of much painful and fascinating history, to play it safe.

title: Corrections: September 13, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, September 13, 2014
description: We hope were wrong.

title: Police Armored Vehicle Is Unwelcome in California College Town
description: DAVIS, Calif.  The police department of this modest college town is among the latest California beneficiaries of surplus military equipment: a $700,000 armored car that is the perfect vehicle, the police chief told the City Council, to perform rescues of victims and potential victims during active shooter incidents.

title: London Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 2
description: Wait, you askwhat happened to Day 1?

title: Muslim Brotherhood Says Qatar Ousted Its Members
description: BAGHDAD  An Egyptian leader of the Muslim Brotherhood said Saturday that several of the groups prominent members had been asked to leave Qatar, in an apparent concession to a campaign by other Persian Gulf monarchies to pressure Qatar away from its support for the group.

title: Toward a Childproof Internet
description: Parents can childproof their homes by covering the electric sockets, adding parental controls on the cable box and putting a padlock on the liquor cabinet.

title: Analytics: How Readers Responded to Our Article About Abortion by Mail
description: The following graphic appears on the Reply All page in the Sept. 14 issue of the magazine.

title: Emilia Wickstead: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Bill Cunningham | New York Fashion Week
description: There are holes for the head, the arms and the legs. But it is what the designers create around those holes that mesmerizes the audience. The New York spring fashion collections ended Thursday night. Though much of the designers offerings were special-occasion clothes, their audience spoke loudly that the shirt, in all its manifestations, should triumph. Donna Karan showed a spectacular cocktail shirtdress. Ralph Lauren dramatized it for an evening gala. The newest development is the exaggerated cuff, often covering the hand, which Michael Kors dramatized. Jenna Lyons, the designer for J. Crew, polished it all off with the proportion and balance of the shirt to the rest of the ensemble. Even the daily look of the top French Vogue editors was plaid or denim shirts with faded jeans. If women of the 21st century are to compete in business with men, they cannot continue to dress as decorative symbols of a husbands success. How they dress for private events is todays art of fashion.

title: From White Knight to Thief
description: In August 1941, Richard Whitney, the former financier and New York Stock Exchange president, emerged from prison at Sing Sing, on parole after serving three years of a five- to 10-year sentence for grand larceny.

title: Cars to Park and Hills to Climb
description: Sarah Edwards, 39, is a district manager for Towne Park, a national company that manages valet parking and other hospitality services for hotels, health care facilities and other businesses.

title: Jeers and Cheers Over Tax Inversions
description: General Electric began selling toasters to Americans 109 years ago but that homey relationship is ending. Last Monday, G.E. said it was selling its entire appliance division to a foreign company, Electrolux of Sweden, for $3.3 billion.

title: Susan Story of American Water: A Job Description Is Just the Start
description: This interview with  Susan Story, chief executive of American Water, the utility company, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Looking Another Culture in the Eye
description: I was born and raised in Minnesota, but as an adult I have mostly lived in Europe and Africa. I teach cross-cultural management at the international business school Insead, near Paris. For the last 15 years, Ive studied how people in different parts of the world build trust, communicate, make decisions and perceive situations differently, especially in the workplace.

title: Caesars Debt: A Game of Dealers Choice
description: The house always wins. Thats worth remembering when youre in a casino. It also seems to be true for some people who hold Caesars Entertainment debt.

title: If a Company Wont Talk, Its Former Employees Will
description: Email haggler@nytimes.com. Keep it brief and family-friendly, include your hometown and go easy on the caps-lock key. Letters may be edited for clarity and length.

title: Sibling: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Smartphones: The Corporate Personality Test
description: It was a big week for smartphones. Apple unveiled two new iPhones  as well as a new smartwatch, which you can think of as a phone for your wrist. Amazon slashed the price of its new phone, and Microsoft, searching for new applications and content for its own struggling mobile platform, sought to acquire the company behind the blockbuster game Minecraft. What can we glean about these three companies  and a fourth, Samsung  from their smartphones?

title: Battle of the Marne Was Foreseen as Decisive
description: On September 6, the General Commander-in-Chief of the French Armies, General Joffre addressed the following order of the dayto his troops :

title: Why the Economic Gender Gap Will Eventually Close
description: Debates over the supposed differences between men and women are a staple of pop culture. But two new books offer an economic look at the evidence, giving support to both pessimistic and optimistic perspectives on the direction of gender relations and the prospects for more fairness and equality.

title: Bracing for Change on Scotlands Border, Whatever the Referendum Result
description: BERWICK-UPON-TWEED, England  This is Englands northernmost town, and it has changed hands between the Scots and the English more than a dozen times in the last 1,400 years. It hasnt been a true border outpost since the unification of the two countries more than 300 years ago, but it may soon become one again.

title: Battling a Neighbors Runoff
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Phoebe English, Londons Newest Designer to Watch, on Her Hometown Haunts
description: Bulletproof vests, smashed cliffs, bleak winter beaches and Victorian mirrors are just a few of the references the British fashion designer Phoebe English draws on in her work. Since graduating three years ago from the masters program atCentral Saint Martins, where she studied under the legendary professor Louise Wilson, the young designer has sought to translate abstract ideas into wearable garments, allowing a certain haunting rawness to linger on the surface. Her collections  which Dover Street Market has carried since her debut in 2011  feature details such as exposed net pockets, unfinished hems and fabrics that appear turned inside-out. For spring/summer 2015, which she will present today, English collaborated with the London-based print designer and illustrator Helen Bullock and played with the idea of shedding skin, doubles and built-up surfaces, she says.

title: Acapulco Tries a Rewind to Its Jet Set Days
description: A new 814-room hotel inAcapulco, a historic coastal resort beset by bad publicity stemming fromMexicos drug wars, is the latest sign of a comeback for the city.

title: How Likely Is It That Birth Control Could Let You Down?
description: Charts of probabilities of unintended pregnancy while using different contraception methods, for up to 10 years.

title: Beyond Marriage
description: MARRIAGE is disappearing. More than 40 percent of new mothers are unmarried. Many young adults drift into parenthood unintentionally. They may be cohabiting at the time of their childs birth, but about half of these couples will have split up by the time their child is 5 years old. College-educated young adults are still marrying before having children and planning their families more intentionally. The rest of America, about two-thirds of the population, is not.

title: Hunter Original: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: After Penn State Scandal, Reshaping a Fathers Legacy
description: Enough has been written about the Penn State child sexual abuse scandal to fill a shelf at a library in State College. But Jay Paterno, a son of the football coach Joe Paterno, may be trying to get the final word on his fathers role.

title: Variety: A Psychological Diagramless
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Thank goodness for the EGO, or at least Freuds conception of it. Without it, we would be uncontrollable lizard brains, seeking only to fill the ids wants, needs and desires. The EGO part of the personality, Freud maintained, was what separated us from the animals.

title: Air France-KLM Warns of Flight Cancellations as a Strike Looms
description: PARIS  Air France-KLM warned on Saturday that it was preparing to cancel around 60 percent of its scheduled flights on Monday because of a dispute with pilots, a move that has the potential to disrupt the travel plans of tens of thousands of passengers.

title: At Oregon, the Mascot Looks Awfully Familiar
description: EUGENE, Ore.  The Oregon Duck  the Duck  was onstage, sitting between four men in suits while wearing a jaunty hat, a neckerchief and no pants. The Duck poured Froot Loops and milk and a pound of sugar into a bowl, then pretended to eat it. Crystals of sugar cascaded because, of course, the Duck has no lips.

title: Unique Mix of Coaches Strives for One Voice
description: MADRID  A few days before the United States mens basketball team gathered last summer for a training camp in Las Vegas, the coaches of the team  Mike Krzyzewski and the assistants Jim Boeheim, Tom Thibodeau and Monty Williams  met to discuss, among other things, a seemingly innocuous topic that, in reality, was critical: language.

title: After a Hall of Fame Induction, a Caddie Is Intent on Laying It Up
description: ATLANTA  The newest member of the Caddie Hall of Fame is Steve Williams, or as his presenter at last weeks ceremony, Steve Sands of the Golf Channel, called him, Stevie.

title: What Were They Thinking? Ugly Video, Blind Justice
description: Say this for Ray Rice: His left cross was of professional quality, a short, explosive punch. And his fiances head snapped back as if shed been shot.

title: J.W. Anderson: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Struggling to Starve ISIS of Oil Revenue, U.S. Seeks Assistance From Turkey
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is struggling to cut off the millions of dollars in oil revenue that has made the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria one of the wealthiest terror groups in history, but so far has been unable to persuade Turkey, the NATO ally where much of the oil is traded on the black market, to crack down on an extensive sales network.

title: Putin Intent on Taking All of Ukraine, Premier Says
description: MOSCOW  A week into a fragile cease-fire between government troops and pro-Russian rebels in Ukraine, that countrys prime minister offered a pessimistic assessment of its chances of holding and said President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia intends eventually to conquer all of Ukraine.

title: Trying to Hit the Brake on Texting While Driving
description: People know they shouldnt text and drive. Overwhelmingly, they tell pollsters that doing so is unacceptable and dangerous, and yet they do it anyway. They cant resist. So safety advocates and public officials have called for a technological solution that does an end run around free will and prevents people from texting in the first place.

title: A Texting Drivers Education
description: On Sept. 22, 2006, Reggie Shaw, 19, climbed into his sport utility vehicle to head to a painting job. He picked up a Pepsi at the local gas station and started over the mountain pass between Tremonton, Utah, his hometown, and Logan, the big city to the east, near the Idaho border.

title: Recapturing a Game and Days Gone By
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  A mild night here in summer can feel like a little miracle. A great gift, Ann Keith called it as she sat watching baseball in her hometown for the first time in 20 years. She wore a hot pink jacket for comfort, not style.

title: New York Fashion Week Street Style
description: Here are our highlights from New York Fashion Week. Check out NYTimesFashion on Instagram for more.

title: That Applause at Camden Yards? Its for the Thorn in Baltimores Side
description: BALTIMORE  Something felt wrong, very wrong, Friday at Camden Yards as the Orioles and the Yankees opened a weekend series.

title: Best of the New York Fashion Week After-Parties
description: Here are our highlights from the parties at New York Fashion Week.

title: Fruits of the Wine-Dark Sea
description: A recent visit to Nissos, a Greek restaurant that opened in Syosset in June, emphasized why I wait at least a month to review a new place. Friends who were there earlier this summer described the service as comical; now adjectives like attentive, concerned, smooth and speedy apply.

title: The Mets Face a Vista of Empty Seats and a Lawsuit
description: Citi Field was so empty as the Mets took the field Thursday night, it looked as if every spectator could have fit comfortably in the lower bowl. Even then, people would have had room to spread out. When Curtis Granderson casually tossed a ball into the stands, it landed rows from the nearest fan.

title: Honoring a Teacher Who Fought for Equality
description: Visitors to the small Prudence Crandall Museum in Canterbury come ready to learn about an unfamiliar local contribution to the struggle for American civil rights, or to have one they already know reinforced for them.

title: Oakland Stumbles Toward a Playoff Berth
description: Jon Lester pulled on his cowboy boots in the visitors clubhouse in Chicago on Tuesday after a victory over the White Sox. Lester pitches for the Oakland Athletics, but his boots still bear the B Strong logo from Boston, where he led the Red Sox to the World Series title last October.

title: Running or Receiving, Jets Chris Johnson Simply Wants to Touch the Ball
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Upon meeting Chris Johnson at the 2008 N.F.L. scouting combine, Anthony Lynn did what he always does when setting his eyes on a running back for the first time: he looked at Johnsons legs. Those legs were spindly and thin, not unlike the rest of him, and Lynn questioned whether Johnsons body could hold up for a full season.

title: Soul, Plus Kitchen
description: Music venues can be trying places for those who love good food. If they offer anything beyond overpriced drinks, it is often not more than stale nuts and pretzels, or from a full menu, tired salads and anonymous brown meats.

title: Bracing for Scotlands Referendum
description: As Scotland prepares for its referendum on independence, many English and Scots that live in border towns feel an acute uncertainty that could remain no matter which way the vote goes.

title: London Fashion Week: J.W. Anderson Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: In Jordan, Ever Younger Syrian Brides
description: MAFRAQ, Jordan  The bride-to-be was so young and shy, she spent her engagement party cloaked in a hooded robe that swallowed her slim figure but could not quite hide the ruffled pink dress her fiancs family had rented for her.

title: On the Field, the Babble Is Usually Towering
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  About 125 times during a typical N.F.L. game, an official retrieves the football at the end of a play and places it on the turf for the next play. It is meant to signal a resumption of the action.

title: Should Fin Whales Be a Source of Wonder or Meat?
description: Here are two very different views of humans relationship with the worlds second biggest animal, the fin whale. Above is a special moment during a whale-watching excursion in Canadian waters (which I wrote about here). Below is an image of one of more than 100 fin whales slaughtered this year by a business in Iceland that, according to a new report by conservationists, is exporting most of the meat to Japan.

title: In English Town, Worry Over Scottish Referendum
description: Englands northernmost town, Berwick-upon-Tweed, has changed hands between the Scots and the English more than a dozen times in the last 1,400 years and could become a true border town once again.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Sept. 14
description: The reaction to President Obamas speech on Wednesday vowing to degrade and ultimately destroy the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militant group is still reverberating throughout the country.

title: Were All Nerds Now
description: IN 2005, Randall Munroe, a young NASA robotics expert, posted to the web a comic about the mystical number pi. Among the infinite string of digits were letters that spelled out, Help Im trapped in a universe factory.

title: 2114: A Library Project
description: The hope that creative work survives its creator is usually empty. Shakespeare boasted that his sonnets would outlast monuments and the memory of princes, and they have. But its rare for an artist to keep audiences interested over generations. Most creative endeavors are ravaged by what Shakespeare called sluttish time. Even the list of Nobel laureates in literature is filled with now-unfamiliar names.

title: Throw the Bums Out
description: WASHINGTON  WHEN Roger Goodell was growing up here, he had the best possible example of moral leadership. His father, a moderate New York Republican appointed by Gov. Nelson Rockefeller to Bobby Kennedys Senate seat after the assassination, risked his career to come out against the Vietnam War.

title: Should We All Take a Bit of Lithium?
description: THE idea of putting a mind-altering drug in the drinking water is the stuff of sci-fi, terrorist plots and totalitarian governments. Considering the outcry that occurred when putting fluoride in the water was first proposed, one can only imagine the furor that would ensue if such a thing were ever suggested.

title: Lil Buck
description: Charles Riley, known as Lil Buck, is a dancer who specializes in jookin, a type of street dance in Memphis, his hometown. He is probably best known for a viral video of him performing an interpretive dance to Camille Saint-Sanss The Swan, accompanied by Yo-Yo Ma.

title: The Economics of Scotlands Choice
description: The supporters of Scottish independence in Thursdays referendum argue that breaking away from Britain will give Scotland the powers it needs to build a more prosperous country and a fairer society. Indeed, separation from Britain would allow the Scottish government, which is generally more liberal on economic and public policies, to set its own course for a society closer to that of a Scandinavian country.

title: Jobs With Nonprofits
description: Readers respond to a letter urging college graduates to consider work in the public sector.

title: Whats Their Plan?
description: THERE are three things in life that you should never do ambivalently: get married, buy a house or go to war. Alas, were about to do No. 3. Should we?

title: The Lighthouse Keepers
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  LIGHTHOUSES are symbols of our most isolated stretches of coastline, a reminder that such places exist not just in our past, but in our present. They are attracters of ghost stories, smugglers tales and shipwrecks. There is something mysterious about a lighthouse, and in our modern age, when so much of the world is overmapped, so severely known, that mystery abides.

title: The Middle Easts Friendless Christians
description: WHEN the long, grim history of Christianitys disappearance from the Middle East is written, Ted Cruzs performance last week at a conference organized to highlight the persecution of his co-religionists will merit at most a footnote. But sometimes a footnote can help illuminate a tragedys unhappy whole.

title: Are Liberal Jewish Voters a Thing of the Past?
description: FOR generations, American Jews, and particularly Jewish New Yorkers, have largely been identified as ardent liberals.

title: A Risky Bet on Syrian Rebels
description: President Obamas new strategy for routing ISIS, the extremist Sunni group that controls large areas of Iraq and Syria, rests substantially and precariously on having rebels in Syria fight ISIS, even as they battle the forces of the Syrian president, Bashar al-Assad. The plan is full of hope and fraught with obstacles.

title: Foles and Philadelphia Are Primed to Exploit Indianapolis
description: Jason Sablich and Justin Sablich highlight players for fans and fantasy owners to watch. They will answer lineup questions on Twitter, @5thDown-Fantasy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: A Monet of Ones Own
description: I SLIPPED away from work on a recent Monday to take my two nieces to the Garry Winogrand photography exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. I doubt theres a better way to play hooky in New York right now.

title: Behind the Minimalist Hair and Makeup at J.W. Anderson
description: Were really trying to amplify a no-makeup state  with no mascara and no eyelash curling either, said the New Zealand-born, New York-based makeup artist Aaron De Mey backstage at J.W. Anderson this afternoon. Crafting such a pure look called for enhanced skin preparation involving exfoliation around the nose and on the lips and an application ofM.A.C Lightful Softening Lotionto intensely hydrate the skin. Im keeping it elevated, aristocratic  and taking the sex out of it, essentially, explained De Mey. No shine, but instead a matte fragility.M.A.Cs Mixing Medium Mattewas pressed onto the skin with the index finger, patted lightly around the cheek and nose and swept softly over the forehead and chin. De Mey also usedM.A.C Select Cover-Upconcealer under the eyes, softly blending it with a tapered brush. The girls feel like themselves as Im retaining the natural rosy color in their cheeks, he explained, which adds to the look of aristocratic purity.

title: Leadership Team Overseeing Portuguese Bank Resigns
description: The good bank created after the bailout of the Portuguese lender Banco Esprito Santo last month was dealt a setback on Saturday when the three-person management team selected to turn around its business abruptly resigned.

title: House of Holland: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Jets (1-0) at Packers (0-1)
description: 4:25 p.m. Eastern, CBS

title: Cardinals (1-0) at Giants (0-1)
description: 1 p.m. Eastern, Fox

title: Useless Creatures
description: This article contains no useful information. Zero. Nada. Nothing. If usefulness is your criterion for reading, thank you very much for your time and goodbye, we have nothing more to say. The truth is that I am bored to tears by usefulness. I am bored, more precisely, of pretending usefulness is the thing that really matters.

title: Paths to War, Then and Now, Haunt Obama
description: WASHINGTON  Just hours before announcing an escalated campaign against Islamic extremists last week, President Obama privately reflected on another time when a president weighed military action in the Middle East  the frenzied weeks leading up to the American invasion of Iraq a decade ago.

title: Vikings Adrian Peterson Booked on Charge of Child Abuse
description: Adrian Peterson, the star Minnesota Vikings running back charged with child abuse, surrendered to Montgomery County, Tex., authorities early Saturday morning and was freed on $15,000 bond.

title: State Police Officer Dies in Pennsylvania Ambush
description: Law enforcement officers from three states were searching on Saturday for a suspect or suspects who ambushed two troopers at a state police barracks in northeastern Pennsylvania, killing one and wounding the other.

title: Beijing Hosts Debut of Formula E as Engines Whir Rather Than Roar
description: BEIJING  The worlds first fully electric motor racing series, featuring battery-powered racecars that can accelerate from 0 to 60 miles per hour in three seconds, opened here Saturday.

title: The Flavors of the World Piled on a Bun
description: As a lifelong hot dog connoisseur, I enjoy my tubular meats unadorned. It took me almost two decades to put anything but mustard on my Rutts Hut ripper. Regional variations like the salad-topped Chicago dog are curiosities to me.

title: 2 Bystanders Injured in Manhattan in Off-Duty Officers Tussle for Gun
description: An off-duty New York State narcotics investigator was arrested on Friday night after his gun discharged during a struggle with an acquaintance, the police said, injuring two bystanders and sending pedestrians running for cover.

title: Artfully Collaged Coifs at Phoebe English
