description: At the up-and-comerPhoebe Englishs spring/summer 2015 show today, the coifs were as artfully constructed as the clothes, which featured colorful brushstrokes and handcrafted netting. The hair had a similarly bricolaged feeling: The sides of each models head were smeared with glittery gel, low buns were threaded through with woven string and copper wire, anda Lucite piece rested atop each crown like a vertebral column. The effect was something like what an art student might dream up for a particularly festive party.

title: Barbecue, Jambalaya and Points in Between
description: Pigs, and plenty of them, adorn the space at When Pigs Fly South. Theres a chubby one hanging just above the entrance, and another two, with wings, mounted on the wall inside. Others are on the counter, where food orders are placed, and still more rest on windowsills around the one-room dining area.

title: Return to Iowa Offers Clinton a Chance to Help Democrats, Including Herself
description: DES MOINES  Hillary Rodham Clinton will wade back into Iowa and the unique brand of retail politics that so confounded her during the 2008 campaign on Sunday, taking her first steps back toward the presidential stage in the state that did so much to doom her White House ambitions.

title: Yankees Halt Orioles to Show Theyre Not Dead Yet
description: BALTIMORE  Despite the emotional toll of Fridays doubleheader sweep at the hands of the Baltimore Orioles, the Yankees were still alive on Saturday in the chase for one of the two wild-card spots in the American League, at least technically.

title: Marchesa: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Formula E, Carbon Free
description: The first carbon free, fully-electric racing championship is held in Beijing.

title: Womens Champion Builds War Chest for Title Defense
description: Hou Yifan of China won her third straight Grand Prix series title last week at a tournament in the United Arab Emirates. The victory could be an insurance policy in her push to repeat as the womens world champion. It helped her just last year in recapturing the title.

title: Celebrity Spoonerisms
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  OH HAPPY DAY, Patrick Blindauer is back. Have no fear, hes relatively harmless this time, and there is absolutely no truth whatsoever to the rumor that he is using Tony Orbach as a human shield just to be on the safe side.

title: Back to the Slums of His Youth, to Defuse the Ebola Time Bomb
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  The girl in the pink shirt lay motionless on a sidewalk, flat on her stomach, an orange drink next to her, unfinished. People gathered on the other side of the street, careful to keep their distance.

title: ISIS Video Shows Execution of David Cawthorne Haines, British Aid Worker
description: The Islamic State in Iraq and Syria released a video Saturday of the third beheading of a foreign hostage, a British aid worker. The execution was a clear message to Britain, a vital ally of the United States as it builds an international coalition to target the militant group, which has made stunning advances across Syria and northern Iraq in recent months.

title: J.W. Anderson Reworks the Wallaby
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Rashi Fein, Economist Who Urged Medicare, Dies at 88
description: Rashi Fein, an influential economist who strove to bring ethical and humanitarian perspectives to the nations health care system and helped lay the intellectual groundwork for Medicare in the 1960s, died on Monday in Boston. He was 88.

title: North Korea Says Reports of Abuse Are Produced by Political Racket
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea, a country widely condemned for egregious rights violations, issued its own report on Saturday on the state of human rights in the country, disputing outside criticism and suggesting that accusations of abuses are politically motivated.

title: With Governors Indictment, Scrutiny of Grand Jury System
description: AUSTIN  The indictment of Gov. Rick Perry by a Travis County grand jury has put the spotlight on the states quirky system that gives judges a choice in how to seat a grand jury.

title: Willing to Sue When Cause Is Yours
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for the Tribune.

title: Texas Group Uses Health Care Issue to Get Hispanics to the Polls
description: SAN ANTONIO  When Armando Rodriguez opened the front door of his home here on the citys west side, Chris Ornelas of the Texas Organizing Project met him with one question.

title: Afghanistan Boldly Raises Its Colors, as Never Before
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  To find a flag as big as the one hoisted over Kabuls historic Wazir Akbar Khan hill on Wednesday, you would have to go pretty far  possibly as far as a Walmart parking lot somewhere in the Great Plains.

title: An Unconventional Crooner Finally Finds Her Place
description: The morning that the music video for her new song Rainy Day Woman premiered online, Kat Edmonson had a revelation in the shower of her Brooklyn apartment.

title: Mark Sanfords Breakup Post Caught His Fiance Off Guard
description: Representative Mark Sanford of South Carolina surprised the political world on Friday with his announcement that he was ending his engagement to the woman with whom he had an extramarital affair, the revelation of which stunted his rising-star career five years ago.

title: Malaysia Risks Enraging China by Inviting U.S. Spy Flights
description: BEIJING  Malaysias reported invitation to the United States to fly spy planes out of East Malaysia on the southern rim of the South China Sea seems likely to intensify Chinas anger at American surveillance of the strategic waterway and its disputed islands, analysts say.

title: Building Legacy, Obama Reshapes Appellate Bench
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats have reversed the partisan imbalance on the federal appeals courts that long favored conservatives, a little-noticed shift with far-reaching consequences for the law and President Obamas legacy.

title: Tug of War for Bishops Body, or Its Parts, Delays Sainthood
description: The Roman Catholic Diocese of Peoria, Ill., has already constructed a museum in honor of Archbishop Fulton J. Sheen, a native son whose Emmy-winning television show during the 1950s brought Catholicism to the American living room. It has documented several potential miracles by him and compiled a dossier on his good works for the Vatican.

title: Kerry Scours Mideast for Aid in ISIS Fight
description: CAIRO  Secretary of State John Kerry received broad assurances but no public commitments from Egypt on Saturday as he continued his tour of the Middle East to try to assemble a coalition behind an American campaign against the extremist group known as the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: Germanys Offshore Wind Push
description: The small German island of Heligoland, a popular tourist destination, is undergoing dramatic change as the wind industry takes over.

title: Germanys Grass-Roots Energy Revolution
description: A visit to the Aller-Leine-Tal, one of many energy cooperatives that have contributed to the success so far of Germanys Energiewende, or energy transition.

title: Anthro 101: Intro to Flirting
description: The seasonal agony known as going back to school isnt usually a sexy process, but every now and then, in between buying textbooks and arranging class schedules, scholars catch one anothers eyes. The following poems about the erotic aspects of the start of the academic year were all found this week in the Missed Connections section of newyork.craigslist.org. They are printed verbatim with only line and stanza breaks added; their titles are their subject headings.

title: London Fashion Week: House of Holland Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: Sun and Wind Alter Global Landscape, Leaving Utilities Behind
description: HELIGOLAND, Germany  Of all the developed nations, few have pushed harder than Germany to find a solution to global warming. And towering symbols of that drive are appearing in the middle of the North Sea.

title: Cuomo and de Blasio Attend Feast of San Gennaro
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio both enjoyed an Italian sausage at the Feast of San Gennaro in Little Italy on Saturday.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 13, 2014
Rutgerss Big Ten Opener Is a Party, but Only Penn State Can Celebrate
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J.  For the week leading up to this, probably the biggest game for Rutgers in eight years, Coach Kyle Flood refused to refer to Saturdays opponent by name.

title: Billy Horschel Faces Off With Rory McIlroy at the Tour Championship
description: ATLANTA  After their third round at the Tour Championship, Rory McIlroy shook Billy Horschels hand and said, See you tomorrow.

title: At Sputtering Ferrari, Shake-Up at the Top Could Change Tradition
description: At the Ferrari headquarters in Maranello, Italy, a few miles outside Modena, there is muchto remind a visitor of the guiding principle set down by the companys founder, Enzo Ferrari, in the years after World War II. Ferrari decreed that the main business of his company would be racing, primarily in Formula One, and that success on the track would trump all else,including building and selling the production cars that have become icons of style and performance over the past60 years.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, September 14, 2014
description: I am convinced that wind and sun will be the central sources of energy, not only in Germany but worldwide. The question is: How can we turn the energy transition into a success story?

title: Frank Torre, Inspiration to a Yankees Manager, Dies at 82
description: Frank Torre, an older brother of Joe Torres, played first base for seven seasons in the major leagues and hit two home runs for the Milwaukee Braves when they defeated the Yankees for the 1957 World Series title.

title: A Mens Wear Revolution
description: The questions of power, sexuality and gender being raised by mens fashion right now are far more interesting than whether guys will actually wear skirts or off-the-shoulder shirts.

title: Frdric Malle, Master Perfumer
description: Creating fragrances through collaboration and strict attention to detail, the perfumer is building a brand as layered and intriguing as his own personal influences.

The event was led by the grooms father, who became a Universal Life Minister for the occasion, at Ruschmeyers, a hotel and restaurant in Montauk, N.Y.

title: Moira Weigel, Benjamin Tarnoff
description: Moira Gallagher Weigel, a daughter of Kathleen Gallagher Weigel and William H. Weigel of Brooklyn, was married Saturday to Benjamin Falco Tarnoff, a son of K. Mathea Falco and Peter Tarnoff of San Francisco. The Rev. Mark J. Lane performed the ceremony at the Oratory Church of St. Boniface, a Roman Catholic church in Brooklyn, with the Rev. Dennis M. Corrado, another Roman Catholic priest and the provost of the church, taking part.

title: N.F.L. Players Union Seeks Final Drug Agreement
description: A day after player representatives approved a sweeping overhaul of the N.F.L. protocols on drugs and performance-enhancing substances, the players union said it hoped to have a final agreement, including information on players who might get reduced suspensions, very soon. After the unions vote to approve the plan on Friday, the league said there were still significant unresolved issues without specifying what those issues were. On Saturday, George Atallah, a spokesman for the union, said the vote had authorized union negotiators to finalize full policies with the N.F.L. as soon as possible.

title: Floyd Mayweather Jr. Remains Unbeaten With Decision Over Marcos Maidana
description: LAS VEGAS  In the lead-up to Saturday nights welterweight rematch between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Marcos Maidana, Floyd Mayweather Sr. was vocal about his preference that his son not fight the 31-year-old Argentine contender. The two had met on May 3, in a contest that Mayweather Sr. said Maidana had fought unfairly.

title: Corrections: September 14, 2014
description: SPORTS

title: London Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 3
description: Not for nothing has this city significantly improved its coffee offerings. The fashion shows Sunday begin at a brisk, penitent 9 a.m. with Preen by Thornton Bregazzi (not one guy, but the surnames of a married couple who began their business in a Portobello Road boutique, Biba-style). Thats regardless of what fringe-tangling debaucheries might have occurred at the Marchesa after-party last night. Fortunately, a pallid, bleary and unshowered look is perfectly O.K. in London; indeed, one might argue it confers a certain intellectual credibility.

title: Preen: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: In Southern China, Residents Wary of the Government Protest a Plan to Burn Waste
description: HONG KONG  Residents of a county in southern China thronged the streets in protest over the weekend to oppose a proposed garbage incineration plant, defying government warnings and police detentions. The protest was the latest of a succession of demonstrations against waste-disposal projects by pollution-weary Chinese citizens.

title: Matthew Todd Miller Sentenced to 6 Years of Hard Labor in North Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The Supreme Court in North Korea on Sunday sentenced one of the three Americans known to be held in the country to six years of hard labor for committing hostile acts against the North.

title: Richard Nicoll: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Marios Schwab: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Just a Stepmother Sending a Son to College Without Tears
description: Three weeks ago, my husband and I dropped our oldest off at college. After days of packing, we crammed the items necessary for dorm life into the car for the four-hour drive to campus, and left the rest behind. When I closed the door on his empty room, I did not shed a single tear.

title: In Ray Rice Scandal, TMZ Scores on a Fumble
description: The N.F.L., arguably the three most powerful letters in branding, bumped into three other letters  TMZ  and was thrown for a huge loss.

title: Arab Nations Offer to Fight ISIS From Air
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said Sunday that several Arab nations had offered to join in airstrikes against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, but any sustained military campaign does not appear imminent, and is likely to require an even more significant commitment from other nations and fighting forces in the region.

title: 1914: M. Henri Pol Will Go On Caring for Paris Sparrows
description: Still here? Of course, Im still here! exclaimed M. Henri Pol, as with a wide sweep of the arm he scattered a generous handful of carefully-prepared bread pellets over the gravel path in the Tuileries Gardens. Its quite natural. I dont see that there is any reason for congratulating me. These Parisian birds are unhappy enough already, continued M. Pol, preparing more bread. Nobody worries about them in the gardens, and they are growing thin and worrying because they no longer see the children playing. This is not the time to leave them, for what would become of them if the Germans came into Paris? So I must stop here with them. In 70 I already passed through the upheaval of a war. But in those days I was of an age when I could shoulder a rifle, and I did not know my birds. I would have you believe that then I did not throw my powder to the sparrows. To-day, alas, I am good for nothing but to be a bird-charmer. Yet, you know, each one does what he can, and, although I am not well off, these little birdies will be assured of bread.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 15, 1914

title: What Moving the Capital Would Mean for Argentina
description: Its been a rough year for Argentina. Another economic default looms on the heels of its second sovereign debt crisis in 13 years. Inflation rates are now second highest in the world, after Venezuela. And as if things couldnt possibly get worse, the national soccer team lost (by a hair) in the World Cup final against Germany earlier this summer.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (13) THE ROOSEVELTS: AN INTIMATE

title: A Vital Center for a Bronx Community Closes
description: Mariana Lopez came to this country from Cuba in 2008, possessing few things besides one: an intense desire to get ahead. With no friends or family, she settled into an apartment near Yankee Stadium, waitressed in a restaurant at night and wondered how to fit into this fabled land.

title: No Good Deed Tops Weekend Box Office
description: The low-budget thriller No Good Deed opened to a solid $24.5 million in ticket sales at North American theaters over the weekend, according to Rentrak, which compiles box-office data. Starring Idris Elba and Taraji P. Henson, No Good Deed (Sony) cost less than $14 million to make.

title: Health Law Has Caveat on Renewal of Coverage
description: WASHINGTON  Millions of consumers will soon receive notices from health insurance companies stating that their coverage is being automatically renewed for 2015, along with the financial assistance they received this year from the federal government.

title: Reprisals for Israeli Soldiers Refusing to Spy
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli military on Sunday threatened disciplinary action against a group of veterans and active reservists of a secretive military intelligence unit who declared that they would no longer participate in surveillance activities against the Palestinians.

title: London Fashion Week: On and Off the Runway
description: Huge bows, digital backdrops and floral motifs were all part of the scene for spring 2015.

title: Choose Your Own Rhythm
description: Every year, it seems, the BEAT Festival expands to encompass a larger swath of Brooklyn. The third edition of this 10-day, mostly outdoor extravaganza (the name stands for Brooklyn Emerging Artists in Theater) stretches from Downtown Brooklyn to East New York to Sunset Park, including music, theater and dance in an array of public spaces: a farmers market, Green-Wood Cemetery, Barclays Center plaza.

title: At Marios Schwab, Margaret Howell and Preen: The Search: New Parts to Reveal
description: LONDON  Self-exposure, and how to mete it out, whether in dress or personal publicity, seems to be an issue on many designers minds this season.

title: Paul Smith: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Vivienne Westwood Red Label: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: When Novels Were Bad For You
description: When people bemoan the alleged ill effects of reading online, they often hold up reading a good novel as the more wholesome alternative. But a few hundred years ago, novels were the suspect medium, accused of leading people astray and ruining them for real life.

title: Democratic Mash-Up in the Park
description: Democracy is better when everybody has a stake in culture, Oskar Eustis, the artistic director of the Public Theater, said from the stage of the Delacorte Theater in Central Park on Friday night. From 1962 to 1980, the Delacorte wasnt just about Shakespeare, but also a destination for dance. For the second year in a row, City Center teamed up with the Public to bring the Fall for Dance Festival to the Delacorte for two free performances. (Because of the weather, Saturday evenings show was held on Sunday.)

title: Wild Words, Brain Worms, and Civility
description: Noah Smith writes that one should not be rude about people you disagree with, because they might turn out to be right. Indeed; what possible purpose can be served by, say, referring to Austrian economics as a brain worm? Oh, wait.

title: Cameron Announces Response Plan to Beheading of British Aid Worker
description: LONDON  Following an emergency meeting on Sunday with Britains top security and military officials to form a response to the beheading of a British aid worker by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, Prime Minister David Cameron laid out a plan to support American military action in those two countries but made no commitment to a more vigorous military role.

title: Flyaway Locks at Marios Schwab
description: At his spring/summer 2015 presentation today, Marios Schwab showed a parade of angular shapes: wrap skirts, slit-front tunics, strategic slices at the shoulders of shirtdresses. The hair, too, was deliberately askew. The center-parted coifs, some worn down and others pulled into loose ponytails, featured purposefully pulled-out strands that formed diagonal lines as the models walked. Flyaways have never looked so good.

title: Handling of Ray Rice Case Puts Roger Goodell Under Heightened Level of Scrutiny
description: Linda Snchez stood among her fellow members of Congress as she watched Roger Goodell enter the hearing room. It was October 2009, evidence of football damaging brains had been mounting for three years, and the House Judiciary Committee  along with many football fans  awaited what Goodell would say under oath about a subject shaking his sport.

title: 1964: Director, a Success Both Sides of the Curtain
description: LONDON  Roman Polanski, a pocket-sized, playful Puck of a youthful Pole, is bringing off the very neat feat of becoming a successful movie director in his native Communist homeland and in the highly competitive circles of the capitalist West movie world. His first feature film, Knife in the Water, shot in Warsaw, won him a prize at the Venice Film Festival two years ago and put him on the cover of an issue of Time magazine devoted to international moviemaking.

title: Penn State Follows the Lead of Christian Hackenberg, Its Teenage Quarterback
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J.  The quarterback walked into the interview room appearing to be significantly taller than his listed height of 6 feet 4 inches. The mind wasnt playing tricks because Christian Hackenberg, a 19-year-old sophomore who behaves like the adult of the revitalized Penn State football program, seemed to grow in the past week as he embodied a rare heartening narrative in the increasingly toxic world of football.

title: Mary Katrantzou: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: The Secrets to the Soft Waves and Glowing Skin at Mary Katrantzou
description: Backstage at Mary Katrantzous spring/summer 2015 show today, the talk was of tectonic plates, the beginning of the world and not-quite-a-mermaid influences. To capture the designers earthly vision, the hairstylist Syd Hayes perfected a long wave with a pronounced bend in the front for additional shape. It feels to me like shes by the sea, he said. The hair is natural and clean, but theres a bit of oil and movement. Hayes first prepped the hair with LOreal Elnett Heat Protect Styling Spray Volume, then used a large barrel curler to create the soft, just woken-up waves. There are no party curls here, he said. I want the hair to look as if its dried naturally. He thenfinished with Elvive Smooth-Silk Intense Anti-Frizz Serum through the ends for definition and shine.

title: European Finance Ministers Support Investment Program
description: MILAN  European Union finance ministers endorsed plans over the weekend to leverage hundreds of billions of euros to finance new infrastructure projects and spur demand as part of efforts to avoid a period of Japanese-style economic stagnation across the region.

title: David Koma: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: London Fashion Week: Mary Katrantzou Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: A 60s Femme Fatale of Rock Reincarnated
description: The dark eyes, peering from just under a fringe of blond bangs, wander the room before seeming to fix on some odd vision. The mind, too, tends to flit freely, moving from cogent reminiscence to random non sequitur like a needle skipping across a record. And the voice, a husky, German-accented drawl that seems to sigh with every syllable, suggests some serious inner disengagement with the world, or maybe just disgust with it.

title: Despite Cease-Fire, Fighting Escalates in Eastern Ukraine City
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Heavy fighting broke out Sunday between Ukrainian and rebel forces on the north side of Donetsk, killing at least six people in one of the most serious clashes since the 10-day-old cease-fire came into force. The airport, where Ukrainian troops are almost surrounded, was on fire, billowing black smoke, and a house and a city market burned just off the main boulevard inside the city.

title: A Federal Reserve Meeting, and Scotlands Moment of Truth
description: TOP AUTO SAFETY OFFICIALS TO TESTIFY BEFORE SENATE

title: Back to School in Gaza After Wars Devastation
description: Hundreds of thousands of Gaza children made a delayed return to school after a 50-day war with Israel.

title: In This Horror Film, Blood Is All Too Real
description: One year ago, gunmen from the Shabab militant group in Somalia laid siege to the Westgate shopping mall in Nairobi, Kenya. Armed with AK-47s and grenades, they stalked their victims from a gourmet burger restaurant at the entrance to the vegetable aisle of a grocery store at the back.

title: Cast Adrift in a Realm of Choices
description: In many Ian McEwan novels, there is a moment of crisis or extremity that shatters his characters lives, reveals the innermost workings of their hearts or triggers a reassessment of everything theyve believed.

title: France vs. U.S. at a World Mind Games Womens Final
description: SportAccord has started the World Mind Games Online Tournament, in which anyone may compete in bridge, go and chess. It will run from Monday to Nov. 15. Full details are at www.onlinewmg.com.

title: Offense Makes Strides, but Giants Pay for Turnovers and Special-Teams Play
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  At home, playing against a backup quarterback and leading in a game for the first time this season, the Giants finally felt comfortable.

title: Sharon Jones to Join Label Mates at the Apollo
description: The fiery soul singer Sharon Jones was added to the Apollo Theaters fall-winter lineup, organizers announced on Sunday. Ms. Jones will star alongside her band, the Dap-Kings, and the singer Charles Bradley during a three-night revue that is to feature many other musicians on the Daptone Records label. The extended concert, Daptone Super Soul Revue, is scheduled for Dec. 4-6 and is to be recorded live for an album. Ms. Jones, above, is familiar to the Apollo stage, but other Daptone acts, like Antibalas and the Budos Band, will be making their Apollo debuts. The album will place Daptone musicians in a long line of celebrated artists with live Apollo albums, including James Brown, B. B. King and Hall & Oates. Additionally, Harry Belafonte and the former New York City Mayor David N. Dinkins were added to an October panel discussion of the connection between Harlem and South Africa. The previously announced season lineup includes a celebration of New Orleans jazz, a tribute concert to Bob Marley and the holiday show Ellington at Christmas.

title: Amy Winehouse Statue Is Unveiled in London
description: A statue of the British singer Amy Winehouse was unveiled on Sunday in London on what would have been her 31st birthday. The bronze work, above, was created by the London sculptor Scott Eaton and features Winehouses signature beehive hairstyle, a hand on one hip and stilettos on her feet. Mr. Eaton said the statue was meant to capture Winehouses attitude and strength but also give subtle hints of insecurity, the BBC reported. The statue was placed in Camden, the neighborhood where Winehouse lived before her death in July 2011 at 27. Now Amy will oversee the comings and goings of her hometown forever, her father, Mitch Winehouse, told the BBC. Amy Winehouse won six Grammys in her brief career. She had publicly struggled with alcohol and drug addiction before dying at her home of accidental alcohol poisoning.

title: NPR Adds to Live Shows, With Almost 24 Planned
description: NPR, following the lead of other news and radio organizations, is widely expanding its live stage shows, with a slate of nearly two dozen events planned nationwide in the coming months.

title: Shakespeare, in Mandarin
description: How do you say All the worlds a stage in Mandarin? The British government will donate 1.5 million pounds ($2.44 million) to the Royal Shakespeare Company to translate all of Shakespeares works into that language for the first time. The grant, announced by the Department of Culture, Media and Sport, will finance a company tour of China in 2016 and allow for select Chinese dramatic works to be translated into English. In bringing Shakespeares canon of plays to readers, directors and actors in China, the government hopes to forge stronger links with China, according to a statement by Sajid Javid, the British culture secretary. Sharing the very best of our respective cultures is a brilliant way to make this happen, he said. The translations continue a Shakespeare-centered cultural exchange between the two nations: In 2012, Chinas National Theater performed for the first time at the Globe Theater in London, putting on Richard III in Mandarin. The British government will donate an additional 300,000, or about $488,000, to support exchanges between China and the British Museum. The Royal Shakespeare Company tour will coincide with the 400th anniversary of Shakespeares death.

title: One Generation of Composers, Three Orchestral Suites
description: The ability of occasion and setting to enhance the power of a musical experience has been demonstrated many times, seldom more clearly, for many New Yorkers, than on Sept. 11, 2011. For the 10th anniversary of the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, Trinity Wall Street presented a solid day of concerts alternating between Trinity Church and St. Pauls Chapel, several blocks to the north.

title: Enemies Beyond the Ends of the Earth
description: Peter Dinklage, the Game of Thrones star, narrates much of the action in the new science-fiction video game Destiny in a tone that alternates between boredom and bewilderment. Concerns about his performance emerged this summer when devoted players checked out early, unfinished versions of the game. One much-derided and flatly delivered line became an Internet meme and was scrubbed from the games official release this month: That wizard came from the moon.

title: Jonathan Saunders: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Toronto Film Festival Winners Announced
description: Winners of the 2014 Toronto International Film Festival were announced on Sunday, with The Imitation Game taking the Grolsch Peoples Choice Award, the events most prestigious prize. The film, directed by Morten Tyldum, stars Benedict Cumberbatch (Star Trek: Into Darkness, Sherlock) as Alan Turing, the brilliant mathematician who helped the British government crack the Enigma code used by the Germans during World War II and was later persecuted for being gay. (Six decades later, he was given a royal pardon.)

title: Fallen Brazilian Mogul Eike Batista Accused of Insider Trading
description: The fortunes of Brazilian businessman Eike Batista took another hit over the weekend, as the Rio de Janeiro public prosecutors office accused him of manipulating the share price of his now-bankrupt petroleum company, OGX, and engaging in insider trading.

title: Trading Parking Lots for Affordable Housing
description: What is the solution to affordable housing in New York?

title: Commanding the Stage With Words and Dancing Feet
description: Ushers at the Brooklyn Academy of Music fought a brief, losing battle against concertgoers surging into the aisle to dance when the Senegalese singer and bandleader Youssou NDour performed there on Friday night. All the better: Mr. NDour  a superstar across Africa and the French-speaking world since the 1980s, a 2012 presidential candidate in Senegal and the winner of the 2013 Polar Music Prize  leads one of Africas greatest and most nimble bands, Le Super toile. With the audience on its feet, the synergy between performers and listeners only grew.

title: Like Handel and Bach, a Pair of Contemporaries
description: Phasing, the signature technique of Steve Reichs early music, involves rhythms that begin in sync and gradually shift just far enough from each other to create blossoming landscapes of patterns and tensions. Eventually, even if just in passing, synchronicity returns and resolution occurs.

title: United States Wins FIBA World Cup Title in a Rout of Serbia
description: MADRID  Kenneth Faried preened from atop a folding chair. Anthony Davis grabbed the assistant coach Monty Williams in a bear hug. James Harden leapt onto DeMarcus Cousinss back. The names may have been considerably different from those at the London Olympics, but the outcome for the United States national basketball team was the same: another championship.

title: This Is Your Music on Lots of Caffeine
description: Like being locked in overnight at a Starbucks. Thats how the composer John Adams described a program on Friday, one of two given by the chamber band Alarm Will Sound at Nonesuch Records 50th anniversary celebrations, part of the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Next Wave Festival.

title: Scandal Inspires Clothing Line at The Limited
description: DURING New York Fashion Week, which ended on Thursday, there was considerable discussion of designs and designers to die for. Beginning on Monday, the womens apparel retailer The Limited is hoping to stimulate conversations, both actual and virtual, about dresses to double-cross for, skirts to skulk around in and suits to back-stab for.

title: Q. and A.: Yong Zhao on Education and Authoritarianism in China
description: Yong Zhao, a professor of education at the University of Oregon, has come far. Born in what he calls one of the most ordinary villages in China, he is now an authority on Chinese and American education and the author of Whos Afraid of the Big Bad Dragon: Why China Has the Best (and Worst) Education System in the World, being published this week.

title: He Loves Me, He Loves Me Not
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Ah, thats nice. Andrea Carla Michaelss puzzles are some of my favorite early-week grids, because they fall so nicely  smooth, with mostly instant recognition of the answers. Lively. I solve online, smiling, and my fingers dont stop typing until I receive the congratulations message. Thats a satisfying Monday puzzle. It makes you feel like a crossword master of the universe.

title: Tricked-Out Chelsea Boots at Jonathan Saunders
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Music Emanating From a Factory Is Hardly Machine-Made
description: HUDSON, N.Y.  The Basilica Soundscape festival of music and other things, in an old train-wheel factory by the river here, declared itself sold out Friday and Saturday at around 1,000 people per night. Those people had each paid $35 a ticket, which is probably underselling the pleasure of taking a short and pleasant train ride and standing in an old train-wheel factory by the river.

title: Anti-Euro Party Wins More Seats in Germanys State Legislatures
description: BERLIN  An upstart party that is skeptical of the common European currency, and often strikes a radical tone, won seats in two more state legislatures in eastern Germany on Sunday, gathering momentum it hopes to use to further its platform.

title: Museum to Hone Image of the P.R. Profession
description: Shelley Spector, a longtime public relations executive, acknowledges the stereotype of members of her profession as a thorn in the side of reporters, clogging voice mail and email inboxes with endless and often misdirected pitches on behalf of clients.

title: London Fashion Week: Jonathan Saunders Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: A Blurry Picture in Afghanistan
description: A double-vision of the countrys future.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: Scots Must Vote Nae
description: GLASGOW  To most Americans, Scotland means golf, whisky and  if they go there  steady drizzle. Even to the millions of Americans whose surnames testify to their Scottish or Scotch-Irish ancestry, the idea that Scotland might be about to become an independent country is baffling.

title: Treasury Auctions for the Week of Sept. 15
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Drones and the Democracy Disconnect
description: With President Obamas announcement that we will open a new battlefront in yet another Middle Eastern country  in Syria, against ISIS (the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria)  there is widespread acknowledgement that it will be a protracted, complex, perhaps even messy campaign, with many unforeseeable consequences along the way. The president has said we will put no boots on the ground in Syria; he is wary of simply flooding allies on the ground with arms, for fear that they will fall into the wrong hands  as they already have. Obama wants to strike against ISIS in a part of Syria that is currently outside the authority of the Syrian government, which the president has accused of war crimes, and is thus, in our eyes, a legal no-mans land. He has also made clear that he is ready to go it alone in directing attacks on ISIS  he has asked for Congresss support, but is not seeking their authorization. All these signs point to drones playing a prominent role in this new war in Syria.

title: How to Get It Wrong
description: Last week I participated in a conference organized by Rethinking Economics, a student-run group hoping to promote, you guessed it, a rethinking of economics. And Mammon knows that economics needs rethinking in the wake of a disastrous crisis, a crisis that was neither predicted nor prevented.

title: Election Victories Strengthen Putins Grip Around Russia and Crimea
description: MOSCOW  Candidates loyal to President Vladimir V. Putin appeared to be headed to overwhelming victories on Sunday in regional and local elections across Russia, according to preliminary results, including in Crimea, and the special district of Sevastopol, where the first voting was taking place since Russias invasion and annexation of the peninsula last spring.

title: The Problems With the Death Penalty
A Premature Call for Mass Cancer Screening in Women
description: To the Editor:

title: Difference in Teaching Boys
description: To the Editor:

title: Divorce and Parenthood
description: To the Editor:

title: Doctors Under Stress
description: To the Editor:

title: A Porpoise Is Ensnared by Criminals and Nets
description: SAN FELIPE, Mexico  It is a rare moment when scientists can point to an animal at the edge of extinction and predict when it might disappear forever. But it is happening here, under the golden waters of the desert-rimmed sea, where a small porpoise has almost vanished.

title: Ray Rice and His Rage
description: The sordid Ray Rice scandal has opened a much-needed dialogue about domestic violence.

title: Germans Rally to Protest Anti-Semitism Over Gaza War
description: BERLIN  Thousands of Germans, many wrapped in Israeli flags, gathered at Berlins historic Brandenburg Gate on Sunday for a rally against anti-Semitism, which has flared up in Europe following Israels invasion of Gaza.

title: Frank Bruni: By the Book
description: In a new Insider feature, Pamela Paul, the editor of The New York Times Book Review, extends the By the Book column to Times writers and editors.

title: Fewer New Yorkers Getting the Benefit of Being Hired, and Fired, at a Young Age
description: At first, I tried to ignore the unsettling signs that my job was in danger: the gentle prodding from my bosses, who suggested that I needed to broaden my responsibilities; the effusive praise for a charming, newly hired colleague, who was shaking things up with his get-up-and-go.

title: No Answers After Win, Only More Questions
description: LAS VEGAS  His walk into the postfight news conference was slow and deliberate. He wore black sweats and dark sunglasses, attire that seemed to fit his mood. He had won the fight, as expected. But this time, he did not appear to want to celebrate.

title: Coming to the Rescue for Riders Who Drop Treasures on the Tracks
description: The requests trickle through the bowels of the New York City subway system, funneled to workers more accustomed to calls about tunnel fires or ceiling leaks.

title: 342,000 Swings Later, Derek Jeter Calls It a Career
description: The Times, with an assist from Jeter, has tried to calculate the number of times he has swung a bat in his professional career  in practice and in games.

title: IAC, Owner of Match and Tinder, Makes Moves in Online Dating
description: IAC/InterActiveCorp has always had a thing for online dating. But now things are getting really serious.

title: Joe Sample, Crusaders Pianist Who Went Electric, Dies at 75
description: Joe Sample, who became a jazz star in the 1960s as the pianist with the Jazz Crusaders and an even bigger star a decade later when he began playing electric keyboards and the group simplified its name to the Crusaders, died on Friday in Houston. He was 75.

title: $100,000 Reward for Missing Jennies
description: Working swiftly and silently, someone cut the rope securing the leg of the display case and inched it forward. A sheet of protective glass was slid back, and four rare stamps were plucked from their display frame.

title: Holder Says Private Suit Risks State Secrets
description: WASHINGTON  In his first year in office, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. put new limits on when the government could dismiss lawsuits in the name of protecting national security. Now, in what he has said is likely his final year, Mr. Holder has claimed broad authority to do just that in a case unlike any other.

title: Syrian Leaders See Opportunities and Risks in U.S. Striking ISIS on Their Soil
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The fortunes of President Bashar al-Assad have suffered over the past two months, with battlefield setbacks and new signs of doubt emerging within his political base, as the civil war in Syria drags on with no end in sight.

title: In Weddings, Pope Francis Looks Past Tradition
description: ROME  Cautioning that marriage is not a television show but a symbol of real life with joys and difficulties, Pope Francis married 20 couples from the Diocese of Rome on Sunday, some of them less than paragons of traditional Catholic values.

title: Gambling on the Games
description: The gambling industry in New Jersey is in deep trouble. Five of Atlantic Citys major casinos are closing or threatening to close before the end of the year. Thousands of workers have been laid off, and more layoffs are expected, as competing casinos spring up in neighboring states like Pennsylvania and New York. New Jerseys unemployment rate is 6.5 percent, higher than the national rate.

title: Judge to Examine Circumstances of Suspects Confession in Patz Case
description: Sometime on the afternoon of May 23, 2012, Pedro Hernandez confessed to one of New Yorks most infamous unsolved crimes of the 20th century  the disappearance of Etan Patz.

title: A Bigger Midterm Election Turnout
description: Staying home on Election Day carries a heavy cost.

title: Libyan Parliament Fires Central Bank Chairman
description: BAGHDAD  Libyas newly elected Parliament voted on Sunday to fire the chairman of the central bank, setting off a struggle for control of the countrys wealth and vast oil reserves.

title: In Florida Student Assaults, an Added Burden on Accusers
description: After downing a double dose of NyQuil to fight a cold, the young woman woke in a mans dormitory room with a vague memory of someone being on top of her, but no recollection of sexual contact. Three days later she found a condom in her vagina. She repeatedly confronted the man, who insisted that nothing had happened, and his roommate, who had told her he saw them having sex, then said he was joking.

title: Behind Roger Federer, Switzerland Closes In on an Elusive Title
description: GENEVA  For 11 years, the Davis Cup semifinals have been a painful memory for Roger Federer. In September 2003, the Swiss team traveled to Melbourne to face Australia in a confrontation loaded with emotional significance for Federer, the recently crowned Wimbledon champion.

title: Better News on Insurance Premiums
description: The rate of growth on premiums for employer-based health coverage in the first five months of this year was one of the lowest in 16 years. Despite longstanding concerns that employer-sponsored coverage might become too costly to sustain, that market seems to have stabilized for now.

title: A Fly Trapped in an A.T.M.
description: Dear Diary:

title: Pocketing Profits or Reinvesting Them
Alibabas Link to Elite Military Family Is Etched in Stone
description: HONG KONG  Perched on a steep hillside in Changshou township lies the modest family tomb of a military dynasty, overgrown with tall grass and lined with cheap white tiles.

title: Cameron Under Pressure as Scotland Vote Nears
description: LONDON  With opinion polls on Thursdays Scottish independence vote too close to call, Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain faces the risk this week of becoming the leader who presided over the breakup of the United Kingdom. And that is only one of his immediate problems.

title: Jets Build an 18-Point First-Half Lead, Which Aaron Rodgers Duly Vaporizes
description: GREEN BAY, Wis.  It got quiet at Lambeau Field after the Jets third touchdown of the first half on Sunday, so quiet that the strains of a J-E-T-S chant could be heard from the upper reaches of the old stadium. But late in the fourth quarter, after the sunlight faded and the Packers had taken the lead, there was nothing but noise, a din that swallowed up the Jets as they pursued a tying touchdown.

title: Sweden Takes a Left Turn After 8 Years of Rightist Rule
description: GOTHENBURG, Sweden  After eight years of a tax-cutting, free-market government, Sweden was poised on Sunday night to turn toward the center left, as a loose coalition of left-leaning parties won a slim but clear lead in parliamentary elections.

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, September 15, 2014
description: If you have a property crime, they dont say: Would you like me to dust for fingerprints? Would you like me to canvass the area for witnesses?

title: Bill and Hillary Clinton Sell Their Brand of Sizzle at a Steak Fry in Iowa
description: INDIANOLA, Iowa  It was a preview of coming distractions.

title: With Tech Taking Over in Schools, Worries Rise
description: At a New York state elementary school, teachers can use a behavior-monitoring app to compile information on which children have positive attitudes and which act out. In Georgia, some high school cafeterias are using a biometric identification system to let students pay for lunch by scanning the palms of their hands at the checkout line. And across the country, school sports teams are using social media sites for athletes to exchange contact information and game locations.

title: Future Is Assured in Buffalo, and the Present Is Also Looking Bright
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  They were in a mood to celebrate Sunday morning at the Ketchup Ceremony, a condiment baptism held for 20 years in a parking lot outside Ralph Wilson Stadium before Buffalo Bills home games.

title: In Pursuit of Casinos, Its Worst Foot Forward
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y.  Broad grassy lots are all that remain of most of the shipyards and factories that once gave this city on the Hudson River its muscle and identity.

title: This Isnt Churchill Downs, and Those Arent Horses
description: HAMMOND, Wis.  In Spain, they run bulls. In Kentucky, thoroughbreds. But here in Americas Dairyland, llamas are the four-legged athletes of choice.

title: In Israels Hamas Fight, Evacuation Orders and Then Rubble
description: When residents of Zafer Tower No. 4 in Gaza City received evacuation orders on Saturday, Aug. 23, they never expected the entire building to be destroyed.

title: Boardwalk Empire Recap: Happy Days Arent Here
description: Season 5, Episode 2: The Good Listener

title: Lost Homes and Dreams at Tower Israel Leveled
description: GAZA CITY  The men of Zafer Tower No. 4 sit in the shade across the street from the wreckage.

title: In Latest Volley Against Amazon, Hachettes Writers Target Its Board
description: Amazon is at war with Hachette, and it sometimes seems as if it has always been that way.

title: The Magic in Apples Devices? The Heart
description: During the last seismic Apple announcement, in 2010, I was at the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts in San Francisco as Steve Jobs unveiled the iPad, a device he said was so singular it would create its own landing strip.

title: Conservative Experiment Faces Revolt in Reliably Red Kansas
description: HUTCHINSON, Kan.  In his 40 years living in Kansas, Konrad Hastings cannot remember voting for a Democrat. He is the type who agonizes over big purchases, trying to save as much money as possible. He is against stricter gun laws, opposes abortion in most cases and prefers less government involvement in his life.

title: Andy Stapp, Who Tried to Unionize the Military, Dies at 70
description: Andy Stapp, who expressed his opposition to the Vietnam War by joining the Army and proceeding to do a very unmilitary thing  form a union among soldiers that demanded, among other things, the right to elect officers and reject what they viewed as illegal orders  died on Sept. 3 in Manhattan. He was 70.

title: Two Men Are Rescued After Mishap in Lower Bay
description: It was meant to be a short ride on a brisk Saturday night. Two men, one water scooter and a setting sun, observed from the choppy channel waves against the city skyline.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 14, 2014
Disney Infinity Game Studio Hires a Top Player to Create Toy Box Levels
description: LOS ANGELES  To stoke interest in the second edition of its Infinity video game, the Walt Disney Company turned to Iron Man, Captain America, the Incredible Hulk and ... a middle school teacher from North Carolina.

title: Derek Jeter Has 2,734 Games Played and 3,450 Hits. Swings? Heres a Ballpark Guess.
description: Several Yankees players were in the batting cages at spring training when one of them wondered how many swings Derek Jeter had taken in his professional career  not only in regular major league games, but also during spring training games, All-Star Games, minor league games, off-season training and during his thousands of batting practices.

title: Searching for the Crashless Car
description: How did cars become computers on wheels, so automated that some are about to start driving themselves? The story begins 45 years ago with a quest to make cars safer and the battle over the air bag.

title: Lessons From the Past for a Future in Smart Cars
description: Cars today come packed with so much software that they are routinely described as computers on wheels. Computers are prone to occasional glitches, are they not? One can imagine a latter-day Ralph Nader at some point taking on the modern auto industry with a jeremiad about the potential perils of microchipped cars, maybe in a book titled Unsafe at Any Click.

title: Defying Unions, Democrat Gina M. Raimondo Vies to Become Rhode Islands First Female Governor
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  As a high school senior in the late 1980s, Gina M. Raimondo was thrilled to learn she had been accepted at Harvard, but she was also daunted.

title: Corrections: September 15, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Seeking Cash for Bigger Bets, Ackman Nears Public Offering of a Fund
description: Updated, 9:44 a.m. | Tapping into a surge of demand for activist hedge funds, the investor William A. Ackman has set in motion plans to raise billions of dollars outside the United States.

title: Masters of Sex Recap:  I Will Fix You
description: Season 2, Episode 10: Below the Belt

title: In Harlem, Tenants See a Campaign to Oust Them
description: Keith L. T. Wright, 59, has lived in the Riverton complex, a middle-class bastion in Harlem between 135th and 138th Streets, east of Fifth Avenue, for his whole life.

title: Mistakes Doom Giants in Loss to the Cardinals
description: Arizona defeated the Giants, 25-14, on Sunday, helped by a punt return for a touchdown by Ted Ginn Jr., and miscues by the Giants.

title: Fan Reaction to the Ray Rice Video
description: Sports columnist William C. Rhoden talks to football fans outside MetLife Stadium about the scandal surrounding Ray Rice and the N.F.L.

title: Django Unchained Actress Accuses Los Angeles Police of Mistreatment
description: The Los Angeles Police Department is investigating a black actresss claim that she was treated unfairly by police officers who detained her after she was seen kissing her white boyfriend in a car, and a claim by the boyfriend, a celebrity chef, that racial profiling played a role.

title: Regulator Slow to Respond to Deadly Vehicle Defects
description: General Motors published an article in February on its Chevrolet website trumpeting an achievement certain to help sell a lot of cars.

title: To N.F.L. Fans, the Sports Troubles Vanish Between the Lines
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, NJ.  On a gorgeous day outside MetLife Stadium, George Fitzgerald, a Giants fans of 32 years standing, tossed around a football with his brothers and son.

title: Line by Line, E-Books Turn Poet-Friendly
description: When John Ashbery, the Pulitzer Prize-winning poet, first learned that the digital editions of his poetry looked nothing like the print version, he was stunned. There were no line breaks, and the stanzas had been jammed together into a block of text that looked like prose. The careful architecture of his poems had been leveled.

title: With Early Ryder Picks, Tom Watson Misses a Mark
description: ATLANTA  If Tom Watson wanted a week off for his United States team members between the Tour Championship and the Ryder Cup, so be it. In return, Watson should have been obliged to hold off on naming his captains picks until after the last putt dropped Sunday at East Lake Golf Club.

title: London Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 4
description: One of the nicest things about this citys fashion week is that unlike in other cities, where the fashion week is usually at least seven days, bookended by little previews and after-spasms, this one is a whirlwind five. So here we are in the home stretch.

title: Select Drugs Cause Most Childhood Poisonings
description: Almost all prescription medicines in the United States come in bottles with child-resistant caps. Still, more than 9,000 children younger than 6 are hospitalized annually for the accidental ingestion of prescription drugs; three-quarters of these are 1- and 2-year-olds,  a new study reports.

title: Word of the Day | dissection
description: dissection \di-sek-shn also di-, di-\ noun

title: At Tour Championship, Billy Horschel Has Large Payday
description: ATLANTA  Brandishing what constitutes a rebellious side in golf, Billy Horschel often turns his cap backward upon holing out at No. 18. He has pondered playing an entire round with that slacker look, even after being advised that the PGA Tour might assess a fine.

title: Heineken Rejects Takeover Proposal by SABMiller
description: Heineken, the Dutch brewer, said Sunday that it had rejected a takeover approach made by SABMiller, putting on ice what would have been a multibillion-dollar beer deal.

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 8 P.M. (ABC) DANCING WITH THE STARS The comedian Tommy Chong (above right with his professional dance partner, Peta Murgatroyd), the fashion designer Betsey Johnson, the track star Lolo Jones and the actor Antonio Sabato Jr. are among the new crop of dancers competing for the disco-ball trophy in this two-hour season premiere. Julianne Hough, a onetime professional on the show  whose brother, Derek Hough, will partner the YouTube sensation Bethany Mota  returns to sit alongside Len Goodman, Carrie Ann Inaba and Bruno Tonioli at the judges table.

title: Not a Young Mans Game
description: A bony, 73-year-old Dominican pitcher stood atop a mound at the northern edge of Manhattan, tossing curveballs and sliders to the rhythm of salsa music. In the batters box, a portly man with a white goatee, gnawing on a wad of tobacco, awaited the pitchers long, exaggerated delivery.

title: Yankees Grab Lead in the Ninth, but Then It Slips Through Their Hands
description: BALTIMORE  For the past couple of weeks, the Yankees have suffered several seemingly devastating losses, only to remain mathematically alive in the race for the second American League wild-card spot. Sundays loss seemed devastating enough to finally do them in for good.

title: Popular Demand
description: Gaming is drawing a lot of attention lately, with large deals involving Twitch and Minecraft.

title: Sinopec Stake Sale Leaves Investors Unimpressed
description: HONG KONG  Shares in China Petroleum & Chemical Corporation, known as Sinopec, fell on Monday as markets reacted to the companys plans to raise $17.4 billion by selling a stake in its nationwide chain of gas stations to outside investors.

title: In His Last Visit to Baltimore, Derek Jeter Expresses Pride in His Durability
description: BALTIMORE  Derek Jeter sat at the same lectern and spoke into the same microphone that he did a year and three days earlier, but the words and the tone this time were different.

title: Enviable Finish in Vuelta a Espaa Cant Brighten Team Skys Mediocre Season
description: MONTREAL  For much of Team Skys history, the black, custom-built buses that deliver its riders to most races were informally known as the Death Stars because of the teams extraordinary dominance.

title: Lloyds Banking Executive to Lead Troubled Portuguese Lender
description: The Bank of Portugal has appointed a new leader to run the good bank created after the bailout of the Portuguese lender Banco Esprito Santo, after the unexpected resignation on Saturday of its top management.

title: Danaher Agrees to Acquire Swiss Dental Implant Maker
description: LONDON  The Danaher Corporation, anAmerican science and technology conglomerate, said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire Nobel Biocare Holding in a deal that values the company, a Swiss dental implant maker, at about $2.2 billion.

title: Test Yourself | Minecraft and Microsoft
description: Below are six paragraphs from the Sept. 10 article Microsoft Sees More Than Fun in a Game Like Minecraft.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Brain Trauma to Affect One in Three Players, N.F.L. Agrees
description: In the article Brain Trauma to Affect One in Three Players, N.F.L. Agrees, Ken Belson writes about the high rate of severe brain damage among retired NF.L. players.

title: Should Parents Limit How Much Time Children Spend on Tech Devices?
description: Smartphones, iPads, game systems, laptops, desktops and TVs. For decades, Americans had only one or two screens in their home. Now a single household might have dozens. Are children spending too much time staring at screens?

title: Behind the Cover Story: Meghan Daum on the Confessions of Lena Dunham
description: Meghan Daum, a columnist at The Los Angeles Times, wrote this weeks cover story about the writer, actress, screenwriter, producer and director Lena Dunham. Daums new book of essays, The Unspeakable: And Other Subjects of Discussion, will be published in November by Farrar, Straus & Giroux.

title: A Car, a Camera and the Open Road
description: For a country whose central myths involve travel and its sidekick, reinvention, Americans are often clueless about the true nature of the road. It is not about freedom, rubber, the wind in your hair and Born to Be Wild on the stereo. The road is about hardship. Its the thing between the places we want to be  its where we are when were 50 miles from nowhere. Look at a typical car commercial, with a hot-looking red sedan carving beautiful S-curves on an empty highway: Youll never, ever be on that road, any more than youll wind up at the end of it with the ads blonde supermodel.

title: Ask Well: Plantar Fasciitis Relief
description: Question:

title: After Dog Rescues, Chinese Activists Left With a Daunting Task
description: Every morning since late August, Li Wei has started her day by putting on rubber boots and wading through a barrel of disinfectant before entering a shed filled with dozens of dogs that would have wound up on restaurant tables were it not for rescuers like herself. She and other volunteers in Lucun, a village on the southwestern outskirts of Beijing, then get to the days chores: feeding the dogs, filling their water bowls, washing the floor and helping veterinarians administer rabies shots. When the sickest animals die, the volunteerscarry the bodies out for burial. They cant afford cremation, Ms. Li said.

title: Paris Airports Quiet as Air France Pilots Strike
description: PARIS  Air France canceled roughly half of its flights on Monday, upending the travel plans of tens of thousands of passengers. The airline warned that disruptions were likely to worsen on Tuesday after a strike by its pilots.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Kerry Says U.S. Is Open to Talking to Iran, Even as Ayatollah Is Dismissive
description: PARIS  The Obama administration is open to talking with Iran on the security crisis in Iraq, Secretary of State John Kerry said on Monday, even after Irans supreme leader angrily said Tehran would no longer discuss Middle East issues with the United States.

title: New York Today: The R Roars Back
description: Good morning on this apple-crisp Monday.

title: Daily Report: As Tech Takes Over in Schools, Worries Rise About Use of Student Data
description: Technology companies are collecting a vast amount of data about students, touching every corner of their educational lives  with few controls on how those details are used, Natasha Singer reports.

title: A Burning Man-Style Finale for a Giant Rabbit in Taiwan
description: For 11 days, the giant white rabbit peacefully lolled on the grassy roof of a hangar at a former air base in northern Taiwan. But after the Taoyuan Land Art Festival ended on Sunday, the 82-foot-tall work by the Dutch artist Florentijn Hofman met a calamitous end.

title: Maker of Costly Hepatitis C Drug Sovaldi Strikes Deal on Generics for Poor Countries
description: NEW DELHI  The maker of one of the costliest drugs in the world announced on Monday that it had struck deals with seven generic drug makers in India to sell lower-cost versions of the medicine  a $1,000-a-pill hepatitis C treatment  in poorer countries.

title: In a Season of Deadly Rains in India, Does the New Prime Minister Believe in Climate Change?
description: More than 450 deaths were reported as monsoon floods ravaged parts of northern Pakistan and the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir last week. The area is weathering the heaviest rainy season in more than half a century. A photo essay compiled for The Atlantic illustrates the awful scale of the devastation.

title: Police Detain Tie Liu, Beijing Writer and Underground Publisher
description: HONG KONG  At 81 years old and after decades imprisoned in labor camps as a foe of the Communist Party, the Beijing writer and underground publisher Tie Liu had said that he was too old to seriously worry the security police anymore. But they raided his home over the weekend and detained him on a charge of creating a disturbance, his wife and friends said on Monday.

title: Roksanda Ilincic: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Limiting Choice to Control Health Spending: A Caution
description: To what extent will the recent moderation in the growth of health care prices and spending continue? This is a big question, and the answer relies on many factors. But for plans offered in the new health insurance exchanges as well as a substantial minority of employer-sponsored plans, it may depend, in part, on how long consumers are willing to trade lower premiums for less choice. History offers a cautionary tale.

title: The Problem With Going Into Business With a Friend
description: I spent a recent night consoling an associate who had fallen out with her best friend. They tried to start a business together, and she quit her high-paying job to do it. Three months in, the friend had yet to commit full-time and wasnt pulling her weight. They couldnt agree on how to split either the tasks or the ownership stakes. Tension built and eventually exploded, and the business died before it was born. Their 15-year friendship was over.

title: What the Apple Watch Says About Apple
description: Watching Timothy D. Cook last week as he introduced the Apple Watch to the world was almost touching, in his channeling of his predecessor. The back-and-forth pacing of the stage, the hand gestures, the cadence of his speech and the script unabashedly filled with superlatives We set out to build the best watch in the world were all reminiscent of the late Steven P. Jobs.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Sept. 15, 2014
description: Updated: Sept. 16, 2014

title: TDC to Acquire Norway Cable Provider for $2.2 Billion
description: LONDON  TDC of Denmark said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire Get, a Norwegian cable provider, for about $2.2 billion.

title: Outsourcing Firm Cognizant to Buy TriZetto for $2.7 Billion
description: LONDON  Cognizant Technology Solutions said on Monday that it had agreed to buy the health care information technology company TriZetto Corporation for $2.7 billion in cash.

title: TUI Finalizes Terms of Acquisition of Britains TUI Travel
description: LONDON  The German hotel and cruise ship operator TUI said on Monday that it had reached a final agreement to acquire the British travel and leisure company TUI Travel, in which it is already a majority shareholder.

title: Morning Agenda: Investors Hungry for Alibaba I.P.O.
description: INVESTORS HUNGRY FOR ALIBABA I.P.O. | With the Alibaba Group expected to price its initial public offering on Thursday, investors are lining up to get a piece of the Chinese e-commerce giant. The flood of orders has been even stronger than expected. Just five days into the companys journey to promote itself to prospective buyers, Alibabas underwriters told their sales staffs at the end of last week that they planned to close orders for the I.P.O. by this Wednesday, DealBooks Michael J. de la Merced reports. Given the intense interest, the companys bankers may eventually raise the price range for the offering, pushing it past a fund-raising goal of $21.1 billion. That could make it the biggest I.P.O. of all time.

title: Erdem: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: In Israels Hamas Fight, Evacuation Orders and Then Rubble
description: When residents of Zafer Tower No. 4 in Gaza City received evacuation orders on Saturday, Aug. 23, they never expected the entire building to be destroyed.

title: Alibaba Markets Its Shares in Hong Kong, a City That Turned Away the I.P.O.
description: HONG KONG  Alibabas executives put on the charm to woo investors in Hong Kong, the city where the e-commerce giant originally hoped to list, as part of the marketing roadshow for their companys huge initial public offering in New York.

title: Burberrys Spring 2015 Collection at London Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Burberry at London Fashion Week.

title: In the Running for a Young Peoples Literature Prize
description: The National Book Foundation announced the longlist of nominees for its 2014 Award for Young Peoples Literature on Monday with a diverse crop of books that underscores the growing breadth of young adult and childrens literature.

title: TRW Sold to ZF Friedrichshafen, Creating Huge Auto-Parts Supplier
description: Updated, 11:31 a.m. | LONDON  TRW Automotive, one of the largest safety parts makers, said on Monday that it agreed to be acquired by the German auto parts maker ZF Friedrichshafen in a deal that valued the company at $13.5 billion.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: A Big, Big Mistake in Voter ID Case
description: Wisconsin officials say they plan to enforce the states controversial voter-ID law less than two months before the 2014 midterm elections, after the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit lifted a stay on the law on Friday afternoon.

title: Challenging the Privacy of Statements Made During Jury Deliberations
description: WASHINGTON  In the summer of 2006, not far from Mount Rushmore, a truck collided with a motorcycle. The rider lost part of his leg.

title: Kiev Offers Special Status for Breakaway Regions
description: KIEV, Ukraine  In keeping with a provision of a recent cease-fire agreement with separatists, the Ukrainian government submitted a draft law to Parliament on Monday that would grant special status to the breakaway Donetsk and Luhansk regions for three years.

title: Australia Unveils Its Plan to Protect Great Barrier Reef
description: SYDNEY, Australia  In a bid to keep the Great Barrier Reef from being reclassified by the United Nations as in danger, the Australian government on Monday unveiled a 35-year plan to manage risks to the reef, one of the natural wonders of the world. But conservationists warned that the plan did not go far enough.

title: Nucor to Buy Steel Mill for $770 Million
description: Nucor said on Monday that it had agreed to buy Gallatin Steel for $770 million in cash from ArcelorMittal and Gerdau of Brazil.

title: Beauty and the Beasts
description: The London Zoo hosts a new installation by the unruly artist Cerith Wyn Evans.

title: AngloGold Ashanti of South Africa Abandons Spinoff Plans
description: LONDON  AngloGold Ashanti, one of the worlds largest gold mining firms, said on Monday that it would abandon plans to spin off its international mining operations and raise $2.1 billion in new capital.

title: Microsoft Says It Will Pay $2.5 Billion for Company That Created Minecraft
description: Microsoft agreed on Monday to buy the company behind Minecraft, the world-building computer game, for $2.5 billion in a cash deal meant to add the immensely popular title to its stock of content.

title: 2014: Appearance at Harkin Steak Fry
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton made a high-profile appearance at the Harkin Steak Fry in Iowa and touched on topics including her soon-to-arrive grandchild and a possible presidential run in 2016.

title: What the Poverty Rate Tells Us About the Overall Economy
description: On Tuesday, the Census Bureau will tell us whether the share of population thats officially in poverty went up, down or stayed the same in 2013. Theres tons of other data in the release, like the change in the real income for the median household and information on health insurance coverage.

title: A Fish That Spits With Perfect Aim
description: Hunting by spitting requires great control over the water jet shot at prey.

title: Archerfish Have Potent Aim and Brain
description: When an archerfish spots an insect on a branch as much as two feet away, it shoots a jet of water out of its mouth to knock its prey into the water.

title: At Burberry, Contradiction and Rebirth
description: LONDON  The Scottish question may be the biggest question in Britain right now, but in the smaller world within a world that is fashion, another issue loomed large on Monday  one with its own set of implications and repercussions.

title: Cosmic Cato Koch Convergence
description: Its one of those mornings when several small items I was thinking about blogging about have, oddly, merged into a single story.

title: Detroit Reaches Deal With Creditor, as Others Object to Bankruptcy Plans
description: DETROIT  As the city announced a final settlement on Monday with Syncora Guarantee, a creditor that had been one of its chief adversaries, other creditors pressed their opposition to Detroits plans to emerge from bankruptcy.

title: A Mellower Beastie Boy, in Brooklyn, Adds Home Building to the Mix
description: On Slow and Low, the penultimate song of their debut album, Michael Diamond and his fellow Beastie Boys rap: We dont only rock the house, but we house the rock. We dont stroll but we roll straight to the top.

description: London

title: O.S.C.E. Caught in Crossfire in Ukraine
description: Alexander Hug, the deputy chief of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europes monitoring mission in Ukraine, said his team came under artillery attack in the countrys embattled east.

title: 1889: Possible Murder Clue Found
description: LONDON  What may prove an important discovery in connection with the recent murder in Whitechapel was made on Saturday night [Sept. 14]. The fireman Etherden was standing on the floating fire station at Charing Cross when he noticed something floating gently by. He succeeded in reaching it and found that it was a brown paper parcel which contained a chemise covered with blood. The parcel was at once handed to the police at Scotland Yard. There is a large class of people here who are potently affected by Jack the Ripper and they form an amusing class.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 16, 1889

title: Ray Rice Is Expected to Appeal Suspension by N.F.L.
description: The N.F.L. Players Association is expected to appeal the indefinite suspension given last week to Ray Rice, the former Baltimore Ravens running back, after a graphic video of him punching his fiance was released, according to a person with knowledge of the decision.

title: Beating Back the Risk of Diabetes
description: This year, nearly two million American adults and more than 5,000 children and adolescents will learn they have a potentially devastating, life-shortening, yet largely preventable disease: Type 2 diabetes. They will join 29.1 million Americans who already have diabetes.

title: 1914: Prisoners Escape Paris Crowd
description: More than 300 German prisoners were expected at the Gare de lEst in Paris on Monday afternoon. But such a large crowd gathered that the Prefect of Police arranged at the last minute that they should be sent round by the Grande Ceinture Railway from Noisy-le-Sec to Juvisy. The rumor of their coming also promised that a real general would be among them. A correspondent of the Libert, who discovered the train on a siding at Juvisy station, saw the general in the flesh and learned that a document had been found on him, signed by the Emperor, nominating him the Assistant Governor of Paris! The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 16, 1914

title: The Plaster Master
description: Sexed-up Greco-Roman is how George Sellers describes his latest collection of furniture, lighting and peculiar objects. The Dallas-based sculptor, who started his career apprenticing with a master stone carver in Italy, works almost exclusively with the underappreciated medium of plaster. We study the frescoes and paintings on ceilings, but look right past the incredible moldings, says Sellers, whose seductive, gothic pieces  an alabaster snake coiled around the base of a lamp, tables with branchlike legs so angular they look arthritic  are available exclusively at Flair, a high-end design shop in New York, next month. From $400, flairhomecollection.com

title: General Motors Defect Now Faulted in 19 Deaths
description: The death toll from General Motors faulty ignition switch is rising.

title: Royal New Zealand Ballet Names New Director
description: The Italian dancer and choreographer Francesco Ventriglia has been appointed as the director of the Royal New Zealand Ballet, following the departure of Ethan Stiefel from the position on Sept. 1. The appointment, announced on Monday by the company, comes after an intensive recruitment process that followed the surprise resignation of Mr. Stiefel, a former American Ballet Theater principal dancer, who took on the job in 2011. Mr. Stiefel raised the profile of the company, bringing it on tour to New York and inviting guest stars from Ballet Theater to dance with the company.

description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

description: Voices of the residents of Zafer Tower No. 4.

description: Forecast: Low to mid-70s this week, possible precipitation on Tuesday.

title: Elena Bartels Transforms Backstage at Burberry Prorsum
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in London. Here, the model Elena Bartels before (left) and after (right) makeup by Wendy Rowe and hair by Neil Moodie.

description: You may be familiar with the video rsum. Now meet its younger sibling: the video college application.
