title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Ambassador Hotel Collection, Tulsa, Okla., chose Howerton & White, Wichita, Kan., as its agency of record. Spending was estimated at $2 million. The company  whose four hotels are becoming part of the Autograph Collection under the Marriott banner  had previously used various local agencies for advertising.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Afghan Court Confirms 5 Death Sentences in Rape Case That Led to Outrage
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An Afghan appeals court confirmed death sentences on Monday against five of the seven defendants in a notorious robbery and rape case, despite their claims that their confessions were extracted through torture.

title: Mississippi Death Row Case Faults Bite-Mark Forensics
description: In one of the countrys first nationally televised criminal trials, of the smirking serial murderer Ted Bundy in Florida in 1979, jurors and viewers alike were transfixed as dental experts showed how Mr. Bundys crooked teeth resembled a bite on a 20-year-old victim.

title: For Inspiration in Creating College Ratings, Look to Health Care
description: The Obama administration is preparing a system of college ratings that it hopes will improve college quality and hold down tuition by arming consumers with better information.

title: Zandra Vinegar and Rafael Cosmans Wide-Eyed Bullfrog Puzzle
description: Two weeks ago it was ants. Last week, bugs. This week our nature theme continues with bullfrogs, all beautifully illustrated by the Spot the Frog artist Mark Heath. The puzzle is an original collaboration by Zandra Vinegar, a recent graduate of MIT who lives, does math, builds furniture, and teaches in Berkeley, Calif., and Rafael Cosman, who is in his senior year at Stanford University, where he studies computer science.

title: Yayoi Kusamas Pumpkin Art, a Smorgasbord of Sake and More From the Cultural Calendar
description: Tuesday, Frederick, Md.Combat child hunger by eating a meal from top chefsBryan Voltaggio has teamed up with the Washington, D.C.-based nonprofit Share Our Strength to host a fund-raising dinnerat his flagship Maryland restaurant,Volt, featuring five award-winning American chefs. To date, Voltaggio has raised more than half a million dollars toward ending childhood hunger in the U.S.6 p.m., Volt restaurant, 228 N. Market St., Frederick, Maryland, ce.strength.org

title: Off the Drugs, Onto the Cupcakes
description: Rodney Zimmers was 21 years old and 135 pounds when he got off heroin and cocaine for good. Three years later, he was still drug free but had ballooned to 250. He blames his weight gain on the high-calorie, high-sugar food served in rehabilitation.

title: Beer Merger of Heineken and SABMiller Could Clear Antitrust Hurdles
description: Heineken has rebuffed a takeover approach from SABMiller as non-actionable. As you might expect from a combination of the worlds second- and third-biggest brewing companies after ABInbev, there are major competition concerns.

title: Greed Continues to Fuel Penny Stock Frauds
description: In his celebrated portrayal of fraudulent sales practices in The Wolf of Wall Street, Martin Scorsese did not show the victims who bought the penny stocks that fueled the profits of Jordan Belfort and the brokers at Stratton Oakmont. One would think that a blockbuster movie might teach investors a lesson about trusting such brokers, but fraud in the market for penny stocks continues unabated, as two criminal cases filed last week show.

title: Veteran Banjo Player Wins Bluegrass Honor
description: For any musician, winning a prestigious industry award brings the approval of your peers and the validation of your work. For Eddie Adcock, the winner of this years Steve Martin Prize for Excellence in Banjo and Bluegrass, the distinction and the $50,000 cash prize that accompanies it mean even more.

title: Christopher Kane: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Richmond, Va., Makes a Bold Appeal for L.G.B.T. Tourists
description: The cry Come out, come out, wherever you are has taken on new meaning as more Americans who are lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (L.G.B.T.) come out of the closet, telling friends and family about their sexual orientation. A regional tourism organization is now echoing the process a person goes through in coming out to present a city as a welcoming destination for L.G.B.T. visitors.

title: Capitoline Museums in Rome to Join With University of Missouri to Catalog Artifacts
description: ROME  Beginning this semester, students at the University of Missouri will get a hands-on opportunity to study ancient artifacts through a pilot project with the Capitoline Museums in Rome.

title: Vikings Adrian Peterson Cleared to Play as His Lawyer Denies a New Abuse Allegation
description: EDEN PRAIRIE, Minn.  Adrian Peterson, the Minnesota Vikings All-Pro running back who faces child abuse charges in Texas, never appeared in the locker room while it was open to the news media Monday. The only indication Peterson was back at the teams Winter Park headquarters came from a note taped to the chair at his locker, summoning him to report for a random N.F.L. drug test.

title: London Fashion Week: Erdem Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: Minecrafts Creator, the Ambivalent Billionaire
description: SEATTLE  In Minecraft, Markus Persson created one of the biggest, most enchanting games of the past decade. And now he has written one of the most unusual, refreshingly honest letters penned by a company founder who just got incredibly rich.

title: Google Introduces Android One Phone for Emerging Markets
description: BANGALORE, India  Google chose India to introduce on Monday the first of a series of affordable smartphones under its Android One initiative, a bid by the company to win over the next billion users in emerging economies.

title: Thomas Tait: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: O.E.C.D. Urges Stimulus Measures for Eurozone
description: PARIS  The European Central Bank should begin large-scale bond buying to ensure that weak price pressures do not further undermine demand in the eurozone, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said on Monday, as it cut its forecast for growth in the developed world.

title: Philadelphia Museum Losing Its Maurice Sendak Collection
description: A small museum and library in Philadelphia, the Rosenbach Museum and Library, is about to lose one of its biggest draws: a large collection of Maurice Sendak manuscripts, drawings and other materials  some 10,200 pieces  that the author and artist deposited with the institution, starting in the late 1960s.

title: Inside the World of Longsword Fighting
description: Longsword enthusiasts are resurrecting ancient sword technique as a modern, organized sport, with timed bouts and complex rules.

title: Orange Offers to Acquire Spanish Rival for $4.4 Billion
description: Updated, 8:18 p.m. | Orange of France offered Monday to acquire Jazztel, the Spanish telecommunications provider, in a deal valued at 3.4 billion euros, or about $4.4 billion.

title: Egyptian Activist Alaa Abd El Fattah Is Released on Bail
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian court on Monday released the left-leaning activist Alaa Abd El Fattah from prison on bail in a rare example of leniency in the thousands of cases of political dissenters arrested since the military takeover last year.

title: Joe on WNYCs Money Talking
description: With characteristic pomp and circumstance (and a performance by U2), Apple unveiled a host of new products last week: iPhones that are bigger and slimmer; a mobile payments system that will supplant credit cards; and a smart watch that tracks fitness, updates baseball scores, and opens hotel rooms with a flick of the wrist. Oh, and it also tells time. The digital wizardry is spectacular, but are the products real game changers?

title: Honey Skin and Matte Red Lips at Burberry Prorsum Spring/Summer 2015
description: This collection is all about the birds and the bees, said the Burberry makeup artist Wendy Rowe backstage before the labels show this morning. How that translates to the makeup is with honey skin and a tawny eye. Rowe used a selection of colors on the lids, depending on each models skin tone, to mimic the effect of a subtle shadow. She then used Burberrys New Eyebrows (out in October) to sculpt arches. Not only is the color amazing, you can create a shadow rather than a solid block of color, she said. Its completely foolproof and doesnt look drawn on; its not heavy, its more sophisticated. The models skin, meanwhile, positively glowed under an insect- and flower-printed, greenhouse-like tent. Rowe first treated the face with Fresh Glow Luminous Fluid Base in Golden Radiance before highlighting the cheeks. The Golden Radiance works on any skin tone and you cant see it, she explained. It just gives you a lift of a tan, which we want for summer. For lips, Burberrys Lip Definer in Brick Red was treated with a dusting of Fresh Glow Powder for a matte finish. Yes, the red lip can, of course, look classic, Rowe added. But we want to keep it modern  thats why we kept the eyes nude and the skin slightly darker.

title: A Pioneer as Elusive as His Particle
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland  On Oct. 8 last year, when the Nobel Prize in Physics was to be announced, Peter Higgs decided it would be a good day to get out of town.

title: An Uzbek Specialty, for a Special Occasion
description: On a quiet street in Rego Park, Queens, sits the small clapboard house of Aron Aronov, who speaks 10 languages, reads dictionaries for pleasure and once traveled as an interpreter for Richard M. Nixon.

title: A Sister, and Brother, in Arms
description: Just before Sept. 11, 2001, my teenage brother Mike, fresh from Air Force training, pressed something small into my palm: two pin-backings stubbed on a curled shape in dusky silver. Jump wings.

description: RESTON, Va.  After a generation of campaigns in which Republicans exploited wedge issues to win close elections, Democrats are now on the offensive in the culture wars.

title: Fighting Poisons With Bacteria
description: When Harsh Bais grows rice plants in trays of water in his greenhouse at the University of Delaware, he can easily spot the ones that have been exposed to arsenic: They are stunted, with shorter stems and shrunken, yellow-tinged leaves.

title: The Juan MacLean Triumphs Over Tragedy With a Sparkling New Dance Album
description: When John MacLean began making disco-inflected dance music for his old friend and LCD Soundsystem honcho James Murphys influential DFA label, he added a The in front of the Spanish variant of his name to ensure that his recordings could be more than just a solo project. In the 14 years since then, none of The Juan MacLeans many collaborators have become more central to the music than the singer and frontwoman Nancy Whang.

title: Conical Teeth and Crocodilian Snouts: On the Dinosaur Beat with Ken Chang
description: Science reporter Kenneth Chang reported in a Sept. 11 article about the unveiling of a new skeleton of a large swimming dinosaur. The Timess de facto dinosaur reporter explains how he works the dino beat  and how the story about the Spinosaurus found its way into the paper.

title: Walkabout: Marriott Encourages Tipping; Air France Pilots Strike
description: Please GiveMarriott Internationalis placing envelopes in more than 160,000 rooms in the United States and Canada to encourage tipping the people who clean guest rooms. (CNN)

title: In New Orleans, a Printing Collective That Does Things the Old-Fashioned Way
description: As a late summer downpour passes through New Orleans, Amelia Bird leans over a hulking platen press inside Baskerville Studio. An embossed plastic label that reads Beulah, Born 1901 identifies the apparatus, one of three, each weighing thousands of pounds, at the nonprofit printing collective located in the citys up-and-coming Bywater neighborhood. Bird spins a wheel of the antique machine with weary pleasure, then rolls out yellow ink and puts down sheets of paper one at a time. Shes producing a poster concept by the fellow Baskerville member Jeffrey Goodman that uses digitally designed polymer plates and metal type. The end product will be distributed as a souvenir during the film exhibitor Shotgun Cinemas upcoming screening of the Talking Headss 1984 documentary Stop Making Sense held at the nearby Marigny Opera House.

title: Confession in Etan Patzs Killing: I Tried to Stop, but I Couldnt
description: The confession came in a soft, unwavering tone. He recalled when he first spotted the boy, standing on the sidewalk outside a bodega where he worked at West Broadway and Prince Street in SoHo.

title: Investing Against the Odds, and the Facts
description: Earlier this summer, I was on a hike with a friend and mentioned that while wed started at about 9,000 feet, wed reach an elevation of 12,000 feet by the end of the trail. My friend replied, Thats a fact I just dont believe.

title: London Fashion Week: Thomas Tait Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: Online Orders for New iPhones Exceed 4 Million
description: Early signs show that bigger iPhones are already leading to bigger sales for Apple.

title: A Rising Guitarist Tries a New Challenge
description: Eric Clapton recently called him the last guitarist I heard that I thought was phenomenal. The producer Don Was says he is one of those rare musicians who come along once in a generation. He has played with the likes of Beck, Lana Del Rey and Neil Diamond.

title: That Itchy Feeling? It May Just Be Love
description: A theatrical blast of fresh air might seem an odd way to describe a show in which large quantities of (fake) insecticide are sprayed about the stage, but thats just the right phrase for Bedbugs!!!, at the ArcLight Theater.

title: N.F.L. Players Union on Its Role in a Possible Appeal by Rice
description: The N.F.L. Players Association is expected to appeal the indefinite suspension given last week to Ray Rice, the former Baltimore Ravens running back, after a graphic video showing him punching Janay Palmer, then his fiance, was released. The union has until 11:59 p.m. Eastern on Tuesday to appeal.

title: Cancer Screening at a Cost, Your Uncomfortable Flight, Fortunate Dinosaur Bones
description: Breast Cancer

title: Cairo Courtroom Erupts in Celebration at Dissidents Release
description: After a series of verdicts that have disheartened democracy activists in Egypt, there were rare images of celebration in a Cairo courtroom on Monday when a judge ordered the release on bail of three prominent dissidents imprisoned for attending a protest last year.

title: Deciphering the Menu
description: The menu at Root & Bone, a Southern restaurant that opened in Alphabet City in June, is loaded with precision-engineered descriptions like Drunken Deviled Eggs, Crispy Free-Range Bucket of Bird and a breadless BLT that promises to tickle your pickle.

title: Medieval Weapon Finds Modern Appeal
description: A hotel ballroom in Ellicott City, Md., seemed an unlikely setting for a four-day competition involving ancient martial arts, Longpoint 2014.

title: Flight Upgrades Much Harder to Secure, Even for Elite Travelers
description: Paul Dougherty flies more than 100,000 miles each year on United Airlines, which places him in one of the top tiers of the airlines frequent-flier program. This entitles Mr. Dougherty to early boarding, free checked baggage and spiffy luggage tags.

title: New York Fashion Week Accessories
description: Military-inspired bags at Marc Jacobs, 3-D glasses at Rebecca Minkoff and more details from the spring 2015 shows.

title: Loeb Classical Library Goes Digital
description: The Loeb Classical Library, the series of trim red (Latin) and green (Greek) volumes beloved of generations of students and design geeks, has slipped its distinctive color-coded covers and headed into the ether.

title: Reconsidering What to Call an Extremist Group
description: Philip B. Corbett is the associate managing editor for standards and oversees The Timess style manual.

title: Motorsports Monday: Formula E Has a Bang-Up Beijing Debut
description: Lucas di Grassi inherited the lead in the final turn and won the inaugural Formula E series event for electric cars on Saturday in Beijing, after Nicolas Prost and Nick Heidfeld crashed while dueling for the victory.

title: Broadways Curious Incident Off to a Strong Start
description: One of the most anticipated new plays of the fall season on Broadway, The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time, had solid ticket sales for its first set of preview performances last week, while the new revival of A.R. Gurneys Love Letters was off to a slower start, according to box office data released on Monday.

title: Technicolor Dream Sandals at Peter Pilotto
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Catarina Santos Transforms Backstage at Thomas Tait
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in London. Here, the model Catarina Santos before (left) and after (right) makeup by Thomas de Kluyver and hair by Duffy.

title: Tom Ford: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Cara Delevingne and Kate Moss, Side by Side
description: The Stars: Cara Delevingne and Kate Moss

title: About Urban Outfitters Blood-Stained Kent State Sweatshirt
description: Let us dwell for a moment  in the name of schadenfreude  on the mini tempest involving the clothing chain Urban Outfitters, which for some unfathomable reason offered up what sure looks like a blood-splattered version of a Kent State University sweatshirt.

title: Alibaba Raises Fund-Raising Target for I.P.O. to $21.8 Billion
description: With demand for the Alibaba Groups stock market debut proving even stronger than expected, the Chinese e-commerce giant has done the only logical thing: set its fund-raising sights even higher.

title: Nominee for European Post Voices Concern About U.S. Tech Giants
description: BRUSSELS  Google should be blocked from expanding into making goods like cars and televisions, the European Unions nominee for digital economy commissioner said over the weekend.

title: Porsches Pop-Up Shop
description: The sign on the door  The Sound of Porsche  might suggest the roar of an engine. But inside Porsches pop-up store on 14th Street next to the High Line in Manhattans meatpacking district is a music store, the old-style kind with bins of vinyl and listening stations.

title: London Fashion Week: Giles Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: Scots Are Told Painful Split Would Follow a Yes Vote
description: ABERDEEN, Scotland  With Scotlands independence referendum apparently too close to call, Prime Minister David Cameron on Monday used his final speech to Scots before Thursdays vote to warn that there would be no turning back from a painful divorce from Britain.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: In Performance | Lance Coadie Williams
description: Mr. Williams plays a preacher with a secret in Bootycandy, Robert OHaras comedy that explores attitudes toward homosexuality in black culture. The show is at Playwrights Horizons through Oct. 12.

title: Well Leaks, Not Fracking, Are Linked to Fouled Water
description: A study of tainted drinking water in areas where natural gas is produced from shale shows that the contamination is most likely caused by leaky wells rather than the process of hydraulic fracturing used to release the gas from the rock.

title: A Strikeout With Love and God
description: When Joshua Ferriss To Rise Again at a Decent Hour arrived in May, there was no reason to suspect it would make history. But Mr. Ferris, along with Karen Joy Fowler (We Are All Completely Beside Ourselves), is one of the first two Americans with novels to be shortlisted for the Man Booker Prize in 2014. (This is the first year in which writers from the United States have been eligible.) Happily for Mr. Ferris, it is also the year he far surpassed his first two books.

title: Replaying the 30s in Slow Motion
description: When the 2008 crisis struck, anyone who knew even a bit of history had nightmares about a replay of the 1930s  not just the depth of the depression, but the downward political spiral into dictatorship and war. But this time was different: the banking crisis was contained, the plunge in output and employment leveled out, and modern Europes democratic political culture proved more resilient than that of the interwar years. All clear!

title: Air-Bag Investigation: The View From Honda
description: To the Editor:

title: Two for One in Each Tune
description: An invitation from Barbra Streisand to record a duet is still the closest thing in pop to a royal summons. Her newest duets album, Partners (Columbia), with its blurred edges and pastel shades, is even mistier, gauzier and more texturally diffuse than such confections as Guilty. The instrumentation and the vocal tracks are so processed in pursuit of a high-gloss perfection that any sense of two people standing side by side and singing their hearts out is lost.

title: In Ferguson, a System of Injustice Through Fines
description: To the Editor:

title: Season Premiere of Sons of Anarchy Sets Ratings Record on FX
description: The premiere of the final season of the FX drama Sons of Anarchy scored the best ratings of any program in the 20-year history of the cable channel, with 9.25 million viewers between the live telecast and three days of playback.

title: White-Collar Sentences
description: To the Editor:

title: The Shifting Identity of Pariss Biennale des Antiquaires
description: Nobody turns out to support decorative arts like the French do, and every two years the beau monde of Paris show up en masse for the Biennale des Antiquaires. Once, this event was for Wall Street titans seeking to furnish their apartments on Park Avenue. Hubert de Givenchy could be seen squiring the wives of junk-bond kings, advising and conferring with the certainty that pretty much all of them wanted to live in environments like his.

title: The Long History of a Famous Sprint
description: Before he became a pioneering sports broadcaster, Marty Glickman was a Syracuse University track and football star, and Olympics ber Alles, now at St. Lukes Theater, recalls the notorious behavior that victimized him in 1936. Or would, if it could get out of its own way.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Iraq, India, Mexico and Romania.

title: A Hip Basement Plays Host to Mozart and Mendelssohn
description: SubCulture, the inviting performance space on Bleecker Street that celebrates its first anniversary this week, combines elements of a downtown basement music club with a traditional 120-seat recital hall. A welcoming bar serves drinks and snacks, but not during performances, which distinguishes SubCulture from Le Poisson Rouge, the other, very popular basement performance space on Bleecker Street.

title: A Show Within a Show About Another Show. Anyway, Its Complicated.
description: The online-only curiosity Play It Again, Dick is billed as a Veronica Mars spinoff, but it doesnt do that description justice. The most interesting thing about it is that a project featuring so many of the actors and characters from an existing series could feel so little like the original.

title: A Burial Ground Doubling as a Stage
description: There are about 600,000 graves in Green-Wood Cemetery, located on 478 picturesque acres in Sunset Park, Brooklyn. On Friday beginning at dusk, participants in Crossing Over: A Performance Adventure in Green-Wood Cemetery entered the graveyard in small groups and roamed through those vast, verdant grounds along sloping pathways lit with Tiki torches, hanging lanterns and electric votive candles. We stopped at the burial sites of significant figures in New Yorks performance history and, every so often, stumbled across a kind of choreographed reincarnation, as dancers appeared atop tombs, among headstones, inside catacombs.

title: What Is the Right Way to Fight ISIS?
description: To the Editor:

title: Stylized: One Dance Does Not Fit All
description: In the world of contemporary performance, shows come and go pretty quickly. It happens for three nights, and then its over is a common refrain, voiced sometimes with appreciation for the forms evanescence but more often in distress over its scarce economic resources.

title: Taking a Health Hazard Home
description: A new study of a small group of workers at industrial hog farms in North Carolina has found that they continued to carry antibiotic-resistant bacteria over several days, raising new questions for public health officials struggling to contain the spread of such pathogens.

title: A Baptism of Sorts in the Hollywood Hills
description: LOS ANGELES  Nearly a century ago, the Ford Amphitheater was built in the Hollywood Hills as a site for Christian pageants. Although in more recent decades it has been home to secular performances, the mood there was consecratory on Saturday night as Daniel Ezralows new company, Ezralow Dance, made its debut.

title: Science of Stem Cells
description: There is much hope and enthusiasm behind stem cell therapy. However, the science still has catching up to do.

title: An Empire Where the Curtain Would Not Fall
description: LONDON  When Howard Panter saw the budget for the 2005 Broadway transfer of Sweeney Todd, which he had produced a year earlier here in the West End, one line item surprised him  $50,000 for the pots and pans that would adorn the minimalist set. He told his producing partners in New York that he and John Doyle, the shows director and designer, would go to a little junk shop down in the seaside port town of Hastings and get everything for just 500 pounds (or about $900 at the time).

title: Surveillance Video of Robbery
description: The police are looking for three men who removed a cash register from behind the bar of Crema, a Mexican restaurant, on Friday.

title: How Keeping a Diary Can Surprise You
description: Many of us associate keeping a diary with our emotionally volatile teenage years. But new research suggests that recording our run-of-the-mill, daily experiences, rather than just our highs and lows, could bring us unexpected joy.

title: At Manhattan Restaurant, a Robbery and an Oblivious Customer
description: When masked men, including one who drew a machete, robbed an upscale Mexican restaurant in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan, the servers quickly edged out of the way or ducked out of sight.

title: After 17 Years, The View Isnt So Clear Anymore
description: The old bracketed the new View.

title: Q. and A.: Adam Brookes on China, Secrets and Spies
description: It has been almost a quarter century since the fall of the Soviet Union, but the settings for classic espionage and suspense novels have been slow to take root in the obvious new center of intrigue: Beijing. Adam Brookes, formerly a longtime China correspondent for the BBC, changed all that this year with the publication of Night Heron, a page turner that takes the reader from Chinas far west to the streets of the fascinating Chinese capital, pulsing with power and danger.

title: Betty Catroux-Style Shags at Tom Ford
description: Betty Catroux-style shag cuts with sideswept bangs that slyly revealed smoky, kohl-rimmed eyes  a signature Tom Ford beauty look since his heyday at Gucci  were the perfect complement to the rock-n-roll-influenced spring/summer 2015 collection the designer showed this evening.

title: Robert Griffin III and the Sunk Cost Fallacy
description: The Washington Redskins have a controversy over who ought to be their quarterback, and it illustrates one of the most pernicious mistakes in economic decision-making that all of us make. Its about the sunk cost fallacy.

title: The Trials of Stem Cell Therapy
description: Edgar Irastorza was just 31 when his heart stopped beating in October 2008.

title: What to Do When a Patient Admits an H.I.V. Phobia
description: A pretty young woman was sitting in the examining room with her right forefinger stretched out on the table for inspection. I had never seen her before, but at first glance, she looked fine, and so did the finger.

title: Quasicrystals and the Whimsy of Nature
description: This occasional column explores topics covered in Science Times 25 years ago to see what has changed, and what has not.

title: The Hidden Cities of World War I
description: Quarries and connecting trenches were nothing less than small cities, where the walls bear witness to the people who fought  and died  in World War I.

title: Among Malaria Parasites, Real Feel for Mosquitoes
description: Is it possible that malaria parasites circulating in the blood can actually sense that there are mosquitoes around? And that they react by increasing their numbers so the mosquitoes are more likely to carry them to a new host?

title: Playful Rings
description: Fun, colorful objects to brighten your hand.

title: ISIS Draws a Steady Stream of Recruits From Turkey
description: ANKARA, Turkey  Having spent most of his youth as a drug addict in one of the poorest neighborhoods of Turkeys capital, Can did not think he had much to lose when he was smuggled into Syria with 10 of his childhood friends to join the worlds most extreme jihadist group.

title: Calpers, Nations Biggest Pension Fund, to End Hedge Fund Investments
description: The California Public Employees Retirement System, the nations largest pension fund, will eliminate all of its hedge fund investments over the next year on concerns that investments are too complicated and expensive.

title: The Case of the Missing Horseshoe Crabs
description: Q. What happened to the horseshoe crabs I used to see from the bike path under the Throgs Neck Bridge, where the East River joins Long Island Sound?

title: Spot Chosen for Comet Landing
description: The robotic Philae will shoot for the cross marks for a Nov. 11 landing on Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko. After detaching from the European Space Agencys Rosetta spacecraft, Philae will aim for the spot known as Site J for what could be the first-ever soft landing on a comet.

title: Tree-Protecting Ants Cant Protect Themselves
description: In the savannas of Eastern Africa, ants live in the thorny, hollow bulbs of acacia trees and feed on the trees nectar. The ants also act as bodyguards, defending the trees from hungry elephants and giraffes by biting and stinging them. Now, an invasive species known as the bigheaded ant is killing the native ants.

title: A Green Blanket on the Arabian Sea
description: A winter bloom of phytoplankton is forming a thick carpet over an oxygen-starved dead zone in the northern Arabian Sea, a new study reports. Composed of tiny organisms called Noctiluca scintillans, the bloom thrives in low-oxygen conditions and colors the sea an emerald green each winter.

title: An Alliance of Major Players to Guide Open-Source Software
description: The combined force of cloud computing and mobile devices is changing our world, putting nearly infinite amounts of machine intelligence into billions of hands and millions of businesses.

title: London Fashion Week: Peter Pilotto Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Helga Traxler.

title: Google Report Shows Governments Increasing Demands for Users Data
description: Governments of all sizes are demanding that Google hand over growing troves of data about its users, according to the Internet giants latest transparency report. The report is a tally of all the times a government has used its legal authority to demand that Google hand over internal data about the people who use Google products like Gmail, YouTube or its namesake search engine.

title: Yoko Onos Instagram Project, Alabama Chanins Virtual Dose of Southern Charm and More
description: Every week, T rounds up five captivating online destinations you should be visiting often.

title: Art Entangled in Nature
description: At its core, Of Green Leaf, Bird, and Flower delights in that oh-so-human urge to catalog and collect, to understand, and then to pass that insight on to others  making it a book in which science and art blissfully hold hands.

title: New York Files an Antitrust Suit Against the Maker of an Alzheimers Drug
description: New York States attorney general filed an antitrust lawsuit on Monday seeking to stop a pharmaceutical company from forcing patients with Alzheimers disease to switch to a new version of a widely used drug. The lawsuit contends that the switch is designed to blunt competition from low-priced generic versions of the medication.

title: Tomas Maiers Outpost in Midtown
description: In the fifth of a video series on designers in their offices, Tomas Maier, the creative director of Bottega Veneta, explains his very special desk situation. (The conversation has been edited and condensed.) VANESSA FRIEDMAN

title: In the Studio | Tomas Maier
description: Tomas Maier, the creative director of Bottega Veneta, chats with Vanessa Friedman about how his clean white office space in New York City helps him appreciate the happy accidents in his clothing.

title: Airlines Head Abroad, and Also Inland
description: HERE are some things to ponder from back in 36-B, with your knees pressed against the seat in front and your elbows wedged between you and the armrests.

title: London Fashion Week: Tom Ford Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: More Than My Head Talks
description: OK, I didnt actually think I was giving a big talk this week, but one thing led to another and we will have a public lecture at Hunter College this Wednesday. I wonder what it will be about?

title: Middle Eastern Petrochemical Plants Are Targets of Hackers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Security researchers at IBM said they had uncovereda seriesof hacking attacks aimed at Middle Eastern petrochemical companies.

title: Try a D.I.Y. Fix for Public Housing
description: IN most of America, when the paint starts to chip or the sink starts to drip, the homeowner fixes it. In New York, a city of renters, he calls the landlord. Or, if he is one of the 400,000 people living in a building owned by the New York City Housing Authority, known as Nycha, he calls maintenance.

title: To Crush ISIS, Make a Deal With Assad
description: LONDON  LAST week, President Obama virtually declared war on the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria. But it is hard to reconcile the seemingly urgent need to confront the threat posed by this organization with the chosen means of doing so.

title: U.S. to Commit Up to 3,000 Troops to Fight Ebola in Africa
description: WASHINGTON  Under pressure to do more to confront the Ebola outbreak sweeping across West Africa, President Obama on Tuesday is to announce an expansion of military and medical resources to combat the spread of the deadly virus, administration officials said.

title: Tiger Woods Striving to Return at His Tournament in December
description: WINDERMERE, Fla.  After the playing of a video clip of highlights from Tiger Woodss golf trip to India in February, Woods stepped to the microphone Monday at Isleworth Golf and Country Club and joked, Thats my last good round I played all year.

title: Seeing the Invisible
description: This animated documentary celebrates the 17th-century citizen scientist Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, whose discovery of microbes would change our view of the biological world.

title: Animated Life: Seeing the Invisible
description: In 1674, Antonie van Leeuwenhoek looked at a drop of lake water through his homemade microscope and discovered an invisible world that no one knew existed. He was an unlikely pioneer  a haberdasher and city official by trade. In this film, we celebrate this 17th-century citizen scientist and a discovery that would ultimately change our view of the biological world, and our place in it.

title: New DNA Test Sought in Identical Twins Rape Case
description: BOSTON  The rape suspect, court papers said, was identified by a longtime friend who said they committed the crime together. The suspects DNA was tied to the crime. But prosecutors hoping to present an airtight case had a concern: The suspect, Dwayne McNair, has an identical twin, meaning the DNA testing pointed not to one person, but two.

title: Surfers Travels Accompanied by Whales and Wipeouts
description: WHEN I was 17 years old, I started entering Association of Surfing Professionals events as a wild-card competitor. To say flying was a grind would be an understatement. You basically wind up going across the globe to surf in hopes that youre good enough to qualify for an event. To be honest, I never wanted to look at a boarding pass again.

title: As Bond-Buying Ends, Yellen Now Will Chart Course for Federal Reserve
description: WASHINGTON  For Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserves chairwoman, the easy part is over. The first phase of the Feds retreat from its economic stimulus campaign, plotted by her predecessor, is nearly complete. Now, as Ms. Yellen nears the end of her first year in office, it is her turn to chart the way forward.

title: U.N. Moves Peacekeepers in Golan Over Safety Fears
description: Concerned about another attack or mass abduction targeting its Golan Heights peacekeepers, the United Nations said Monday that it had withdrawn many of them to the Israeli-controlled side of the peacekeepers buffer zone after unidentified armed groups from Syria moved menacingly close to their positions on the Syrian side.

title: District of Columbia Officials Push for Statehood at a Senate Committee Hearing
description: WASHINGTON  Local officials implored a Senate panel on Monday to approve a bill that would grant statehood to the District of Columbia and give its residents the same electoral rights enjoyed by other Americans.

title: At Work in a Bronx That Brims With Creativity
description: Lazarus Nazario started painting more than two decades ago in the East Village, but like many other artists she was forced to move by rising rents, to Chinatown and, later, Staten Island and New Jersey.

title: Going to War With the Allies You Have
Criminal Card Games
description: What is it going to take to get serious about data breaches?

title: General Motors Fuel Pump Recall Reveals Patchwork Approach to Auto Safety
description: In July 2013, an angry and worried Connecticut owner of a 2007 Chevrolet Equinox wrote federal regulators to complain about a gasoline leak that a dealer refused to repair under a recall. The reason, General Motors argued, was that Connecticut did not get hot enough.

title: French Premiers Push Toward Center Opens Rift on the Left
description: PARIS  Hours after President Franois Hollande purged leftist members of his government last month for opposing his economic policies, Manuel Valls, Frances combative prime minister, climbed a stage before hundreds of cheering French executives and called for a new relationship with business to lift France from its malaise.

title: Obama Must Get Congresss Backing for the Fight Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  THE current threat posed by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, or ISIS, will test not only the resolve and strategic judgment of America and its allies, but also our nations fidelity to a basic constitutional principle.

title: The Best Selling Sports Books
description: The 10 best selling sports books in August 2014, according to The New York Times Best Sellers List.

title: Goodbye, Organization Man
description: Imagine two cities. In City A, town leaders notice that every few weeks a house catches on fire. So they create a fire department  a group of professionals with prepositioned firefighting equipment and special expertise. In City B, town leaders dont create a fire department. When theres a fire, they hurriedly cobble together some people and equipment to fight it.

title: Medal of Honor Awarded to 2 Vietnam-Era Soldiers
description: WASHINGTON  Specialist Donald P. Sloats squad was conducting a patrol through the dense jungles of Vietnam in January 1970 when a soldier triggered a booby trap rigged with a live hand grenade, which Specialist Sloat quickly picked up.

title: Kashmiris Cope With Flooding, and Resentment of India
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  When an Indian military helicopter hovered low over a relief camp set up in a mosque in Kashmirs capital on a recent afternoon, a crowd formed on the ground below, but it was not the grateful, grasping crowd one might expect amid a natural catastrophe.

title: Warning of Terror Risk, Regional Leaders Show Their Focus on Safety
description: Two governors with eyes on the national political stage joined a mayor who is still untested in matters of national security to send what was meant to be an unambiguous message on Monday to New Yorkers: We are working hard to protect you.

title: U.S. Pushes Back Against Warnings That ISIS Plans to Enter From Mexico
description: WASHINGTON  Militants for the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria have traveled to Mexico and are just miles from the United States. They plan to cross over the porous border and will imminently launch car bomb attacks. And the threat is so real that federal law enforcement officers have been placed at a heightened state of alert, and an American military base near the border has increased its security.

title: SABMillers Bid for Heineken Opens the Door to Possible Beer Industry Mergers
description: When Anheuser-Busch InBev moved to take full control of the Mexican beer maker Modelo, it thought the deal would be a cinch.

title: Arizona Republican Official Resigns After Remarks About Medicaid Recipients
description: The former Arizona lawmaker who sponsored the states stringent anti-immigration law resigned as a top state Republican official late Sunday amid criticism for remarks he made supporting mandatory birth control or sterilization for Medicaid recipients.

title: Smartwatches and Weak Privacy Rules
description: Even before Apple announced a smartwatch that can measure someones heart rate and the number of steps climbed in a day, wearable devices and mobile apps that log your every move and vital sign were growing in popularity. Apples size and influence as a trendsetter has now focused attention on the privacy implications of these machines and software.

title: Dont Hide the Syrian Aid Vote
description: Its bad enough that Congress  instead of doing its job by passing appropriations bills to finance government operations for the fiscal year that starts Oct. 1 is, once again, relying on a stopgap spending bill that will keep the lights on only through mid-December. But its far worse that House leaders  at the urging of the White House  are using that bill as the vehicle for a major foreign policy decision: arming and training Syrian rebels to fight against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the extremist Sunni group known as ISIS.

title: Atlanta Hawks Owner Stumbles on Line Between Business and Bias
description: My theory is that the black crowd scared away the whites and there are simply not enough affluent black fans to build a significant season ticket base.

title: Needing More Drivers, Taxi Service for Women Delays Start
description: A new livery service for women that was supposed to start operating on Tuesday in New York City, in Westchester County and on Long Island has been delayed until later this month to allow the company to recruit more female drivers, a representative said.

title: Loved and Hated, Former Premier of Thailand Is Erased From Textbook
description: BANGKOK  His legacy is inseparable from the past decade of political tumult in Thailand, but high school students will not find the name Thaksin Shinawatra in the history textbooks that the countrys military junta recently ordered schools to use.

title: Electoral Chaos in Wisconsin
description: It is difficult to understand the reasoning of the federal appeals court panel that permitted Wisconsin officials to enforce a controversial voter ID law less than two months before Election Day. Thats partly because the panels five-paragraph order, issued late Friday only hours after oral arguments, offered the barest rationale for lifting the stay that Judge Lynn Adelman of the federal district court had placed on the law in April.

title: F.C.C. Revisits Net Neutrality Exemption for Mobile Broadband
description: WASHINGTON  High-speed cellular Internet access has been largely exempt from regulations aimed at preventing Internet providers from slowing down or blocking websites and applications. But wireless broadbands special status is quickly losing support.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 15, 2014
In League Ruled by Fiat, Response Seen as Flailing
description: The decision by N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell to increase Ray Rices suspension from two games to an indefinite ban has done little to quell the criticism that has surrounded the league this past week in its handling of domestic violence cases.

title: Utah Victim Was Fleeing, Autopsy Finds
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, Utah  Independent autopsy findings suggest that a 22-year-old black man was running from the police in Utah when he was shot six times and killed last Wednesday, and not lunging at officers with a samurai sword, as official police reports said, a lawyer for the mans family said Monday.

title: Pressure for High Marks at Harvard Extends to Its Investment Chief
description: The chief investment officer of the Yale endowment, David F. Swensen, set the bar for universities starting in 1988 when he created a widely imitated blueprint for high-octane investment returns with heavy doses of private equity and other alternatives to stocks and bonds.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, September 16, 2014
description: I wasnt sure it would be important.

title: For James Foleys Family, U.S. Policy Offered No Hope
description: The email appeared in Michael Foleys inbox a year after his brother James disappeared on a reporting trip in northern Syria. It made clear that the people holding him wanted one thing above all else: money.

title: Google Lends a Helping Hand to Madison Ave. on Digital Proficiency
description: GOOGLE is inviting Madison Avenue to go to the head of the class, offering tutorials to up-and-coming employees of advertising and media agencies on how to more effectively use digital tools like mobile, social platforms and video for marketing purposes.

title: Clarity Emerging as Playoff Races Wind Down
description: This is a good week to run a carpet-cleaning business or a beverage distribution center in Baltimore, Atlanta or Anaheim, Calif. By midweek, the Baltimore Orioles, the Washington Nationals and the Los Angeles Angels could all be toasting division championships with sloppy and soggy clubhouse celebrations.

title: U.S. to End Coverage Under Health Care Law for Tens of Thousands
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said on Monday that it planned to terminate health insurance for 115,000 people on Oct. 1 because they had failed to prove that they were United States citizens or legal immigrants eligible for coverage under the Affordable Care Act. It also told 363,000 people that they could lose financial aid because their incomes could not be verified.

title: In New Commercial, Astorino Laments the State of the State
description: First aired: Sept. 13, 2014

title: Game Day Reports: Off-the-Field Violence
description: In a week when the definitive Ray Rice domestic violence video emerged and the child abuse indictment against Adrian Peterson was handed down, it became clear that wise voices were needed on sports networks. These are serious subjects, not highlights or game analysis, or the legal areas that sports outlets have built an expertise in, like drugs and concussions.

title: Required School Purchase
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Im not saying that Gary Cee is a motormouth, as in his revealer, or that he goes ON AND ON AND ON, but he is a radio D.J. who makes a living talking to listeners, so its not surprising that he came up with this cute theme.

title: Challenger Upends Brazilian Race for Presidency
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  When Dilma Rousseff and Marina Silva were both cabinet ministers, they clashed on everything from building nuclear power plants to licensing huge dams in the Amazon.

title: Smugglers Rammed Migrants Boat, Sinking It, Group Says
description: GENEVA  Human traffickers rammed a boat filled with migrants they were smuggling from North Africa to Europe, making it sink in the open sea and deliberately drowning hundreds of the migrants, the International Organization for Migration said Monday.

title: Shakhtar Donetsk Plays On
description: Shakhtars soccer matches these days are not in Donetsk, which has been battered by months of shelling. The team has moved its base to Kiev, the capital of Ukraine.

title: Turkey Open to Bids for Refuge by Muslim Brotherhood Exiles
description: ISTANBUL  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey said on Monday that several exiled leaders of Egypts Muslim Brotherhood who fled to Qatar but lately have come under pressure to leave that Persian Gulf monarchy could perhaps find a new refuge in his country.

title: Last-Minute Campaigner Awaits Final Tally in a Close Assembly Race
description: SPRING VALLEY, N.Y.  On Sunday evening, with last weeks primary election receding from memory and the sun nearing the horizon, Aron B. Wieder was still hunting for votes on the streets of this Rockland County village.

title: Thomas Hale Boggs Jr., 73, Lobbying Giant, Is Dead
description: WASHINGTON  Thomas Hale Boggs Jr., who was the son of two prominent members of Congress and yet, as a pioneer of the capitals lobbying and fund-raising industry, was the one who came to be called King of the Hill, died on Monday at his home in Chevy Chase, Md. He would have been 74 on Thursday.

title: Tony Auth, Pulitzer-Winning Cartoonist, Dies at 72
description: Tony Auth, a Pulitzer Prize-winning cartoonist who for more than 40 years drew sharp and often darkly comic lines of attack across the spectrum of American life, finding absurdities in all corners of it, died on Sunday in Philadelphia. He was 72.

title: Winless Giants See Reasons for Hope
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The winless Giants on Monday learned that one of their prized free-agent acquisitions, the nickel cornerback Walter Thurmond, would be lost for the season with a torn pectoral muscle.

title: Hollywoods Old-Time Star Makers Are Swooping In on YouTubes Party
description: LOS ANGELES  A few months ago, CBS Films wanted Bethany Mota, an 18-year-old video blogger, to make a cameo appearance in the movie The Duff and tell her 7.2 million YouTube followers about the experience. CBS figured that Ms. Mota, known for making fashion videos from her Los Banos, Calif., bedroom, would jump at the chance.

title: New Rochelle Struggles Amid Rices Unraveling
description: Before the video of Ray Rice punching his future wife became public last week, he was a hometown football hero, a former star who brought bragging rights to New Rochelle High School. Mr. Rice, who grew up in a housing project in the city, led his squad to a state championship in 2003 and has donated duffel bags, compression shirts and headphones to his former team.

title: A New Spring in a Guards Step
description: Last September, Deron Williams hobbled down the red carpet of his annual charity dodge ball event with a boot around his right foot. It was an ominous sight that set the tone for yet another frustrating season for Williams, the Nets point guard.

title: U.S. Airstrikes Hit Targets Near Baghdad Held by ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  The United States, as promised by President Obama, has stepped up its airstrike campaign in Iraq, hitting targets near Baghdad in the effort to help the Iraqi government win back territory seized by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, Pentagon officials said Monday.

title: Jets Botched Timeout and Other Mix-Ups Leave Blame to Go Around
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The Jets deconstructed their self-destruction on Monday. The missed assignments. The improper technique. The mistakes, mental and physical, that precipitated their 31-24 collapse of a loss in Green Bay.

title: Regulators Are Faulted in Defects at General Motors
description: WASHINGTON  Federal regulators had ample information to identify the dangerous ignition defect in General Motors Chevrolet Cobalt and other cars as early as 2007, a House committee investigating the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has found.

title: Corrections: September 16, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: DeGrom Equals a Strikeout Record, but the Mets Fall to the Marlins
description: Once the first Miami Marlin had reached base Monday night, Jacob deGrom retook the mound, lowered his head and exhaled. The Citi Field crowd stood and applauded.

title: New Hydroelectric Plant to Be Built for New York
description: It seems as natural as, well, water: Harness the energy potential of a 95-billion-gallon reservoir to run four turbines and generate electrical power cleanly and at a profit.

title: Mother Both Calm and Confused After Sons Death, Paramedic Says
description: The paramedic entered a 16th-floor room at the Peninsula Hotel just after noon on Feb. 5, 2010, and found a small boy lying face up on a bed. It took him a minute, he testified on Monday, to determine that the boy, Jude Mirra, was dead.

title: Rafael Pineiro, First Deputy Police Commissioner, to Retire
description: Rafael Pineiro, the New York Police Departments second-highest-ranking official, will retire at the end of October, officials said on Monday.

title: Judge Convicts Police Officers in 2011 Assault on a Teenager
description: Two police officers were convicted on Monday of misdemeanor assault in the 2011 beating of a teenager in an alley near their Bronx police precinct station house, the district attorneys office said.

title: Masahiro Tanaka Near Returning, but Yankees Wild-Card Hopes Are All but Gone
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  It was difficult to tell where the more important Yankee game was being held Monday. There was one at night at Tropicana Field in front of an announced crowd of 16,058, and there was the one earlier in the day in Tampa at Steinbrenner Field in front of about two dozen reporters, a handful of prospects in street clothes and Jennifer Steinbrenner Swindal, the Yankees general partner and vice chairwoman, who watched from the stands.

title: Longtime Yankees Executive Is Retiring
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  The Yankees senior vice president for baseball operations, Mark Newman, who was part of player development during the glory years of the early 1990s and in later years when the fruits of the system were less obvious, is retiring after 26 years with the team.

title: The Brave Work of the Bouroullec Brothers, This Years London Design Medalists
description: Since 2007, beginning with Zaha Hadid, the organizers of the London Design Festival have bestowed the London Design Medal on a leading local talent. This year, the prize leaps outside the U.K. for the first time  and breaks with tradition by recognizing a team instead of an individual  with the renowned product designers Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec.

title: At the Swiss Institute, a Survey of Eccentric Chair Designs
description: In Eugne Ionescos 1952 absurdist tragedy, The Chairs, the last two survivors of an apocalypse speak to a group of chairs that purportedly have invisible occupants. That the vacant seats are not the only witnesses to the couples suicide at the end of the play  the chairs in the actual audience being occupied by viewers  heightens the sense of lost promise. In those chairs lies the slightness of the distinction between useful objects and relics. We are after the end of the world, in our culture and in our perception of stuff, says the Greek-Norwegian curator and architect Andreas Angelidakis, who conceived of the inaugural design exhibition at the Swiss Institute as a sequel of sorts to Ionescos play: just chairs, no people. He credits his therapist with the reference. These are not the key pieces of modernist design, but an eccentric selection, Angelidakis says of the survey, Fin de Sicle, opening tonight. I didnt curate it as museum overview, but as a casting director. Each chair was picked based on character, like casting actors.

title: Number of Americans Without Health Insurance Falls, Survey Shows
description: Federal researchers reported on Tuesday that the number of Americans without health insurance had declined substantially in the first quarter of this year, the first federal measure of the number of uninsured Americans since the Affordable Care Act extended coverage to millions of people in January.

title: Word of the Day | lope
description: lope \lop\ verb and noun

title: Fixing Climate Change May Add No Costs, Report Says
description: In decades of public debate about global warming, one assumption has been accepted by virtually all factions: that tackling it would necessarily be costly. But a new report casts doubt on that idea, declaring that the necessary fixes could wind up being effectively free.

title: New Estimates on Health Coverage Are Accurate but Outdated
description: The federal government released some very reliable estimates of how many people had health insurance in the first three months of 2014. But the data wont tell us much about how many people got insurance through the Affordable Care Act.

title: A National Admissions Office for Low-Income Strivers
description: Arianna Trickey was opening a piece of mail in her bedroom during junior year of high school when a pamphlet fell out of the envelope. The pamphlet seemed to offer the impossible: the prospect of a full scholarship to several of her dream colleges.

title: Afghanistan: Bomb Explodes in Kabul Outside Gates of U.S. Military Base
description: A large blast was felt throughout central Kabul in the middle of the morning rush hour Tuesday when a bomb was set off in front of the gates of an American military base, not far from the United States Embassy and the Afghan Supreme Court building. There were no initial details of casualties, but Twitter postings from the scene showed wounded Afghans. The area is normally crowded with car and foot traffic at that hour.

title: Cameron Implores Scots to Stay in U.K.
description: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain visited Scotland on Monday, three days before an independence referendum, to tell Scots why they should remain a part of the United Kingdom.

title: Russia: Putins Loyalists Dominate Vote
description: Candidates loyal to President Vladimir V. Putin won elections for governor in all 30 regions that held elections on Sunday, as balloting reflected the Kremlins total domination of political opponents and its iron grip on the countrys political system. Candidates from United Russia, the party that endorsed Mr. Putin for president in 2012, won 28 of the races. The winners of the remaining two races, in the Orel and Kirov regions, were allies of Mr. Putin but not members of the party. In Crimea, which Russia invaded and annexed this year, United Russia won overwhelming majorities in voting for the regional Parliament and for the Legislative Assembly in Sevastopol, the special military district that is home to Russias Black Sea Fleet. United Russia also won large majorities in the parliaments of 13 other regions.

title: Botox Maker Allergan Agrees to Hold Meeting That Could Lead to Takeover
description: Allergan has made a small measure of peace with Valeant Pharmaceuticals and Pershing Square Capital Management, the unlikely pair attempting a $53 billion hostile takeover of the Botox maker.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 7:30 P.M. (HBO) ALAN ALDA AND THE ACTOR WITHIN YOU: A YOUNGARTS MASTERCLASS For more than 30 years the organization now known as the National YoungArts Foundation has offered scholarships and mentors to emerging high school artists. In this installment of the Emmy-nominated MasterClass series  directed by the Oscar-winning filmmakers Karen Goodman and Kirk Simon and featuring sessions between acclaimed artists and students  Mr. Alda, above at far right, leads six young actors through a series of improvisational challenges. Improvising enables us to make something that we didnt expect, he says. His advice for pursuing a career in the arts: Every time you get slapped down, dont break. Just bend.

title: London Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 5
description: Wrap it up, buttercup.

title: How ISIS Works
description: With oil revenues, arms and organization, the jihadist group controls vast stretches of Syria and Iraq and aspires to statehood.

title: Blast at U.S. Base in Kabul Kills 3 Coalition Soldiers
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Three soldiers with the American-led coalition were killed and five were wounded on Tuesday after a suicide car bomber struck their convoy at the gates of an American military base in Kabul, according to Afghan and American officials.

title: Test Yourself | $50 Nail Polish
description: Below are six paragraphs from the Sept. 10 article What Makes a Nail Polish Worth $50?

title: London Repeats Offer of New Powers if Scotland Votes No
description: LONDON  With two days of fevered campaigning left before Scotland votes in a referendum on independence, the leaders of the three main British political parties renewed a pledge on Tuesday to grant Scots extensive new powers if they reject secession.

title: 6 Qs About the News | A Porpoise Is Ensnared by Criminals and Nets
description: In the article A Porpoise Is Ensnared by Criminals and Nets, Elisabeth Malkin writes about the endangered vaquita.

title: Will Portland Always Be a Retirement Community for the Young?
description: Like many residents of Northwest Portland, Matthew Hale doesnt own a car. Instead, he prefers to walk or ride the bus to the citys innumerable coffee shops and breweries and live-music spots. On weekends, he and his wife have no problem hitching rides to the Pacific Coast or the Cascade mountain range. Everywhere he looks, Hale told me, there are people just like him  bearded, on skateboards, brewing kombucha. Its really chill, he says.

title: The Hidden Cities of World War I
description: The last veterans of World War I died a few years ago. When we think of that war today, we imagine an age of Edwardian sensibilities, ragtime music and people with little connection to our modern world.

title: Do Teachers Assign Too Much Homework?
description: When you get home after school, how much homework will you do? Will it keep you up late at night? Will it cause stress in your family? Or do you have homework under control?

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Airbus Seeks to Sell Some Defense and Space Operations
description: LONDON  The Airbus Group, the European aerospace and defense giant, said on Tuesday that it intended to sell several defense and space businesses as it streamlines that division.

title: New York Today: Joyless in Mudville
description: Good morning on this drizzly Tuesday.

title: Final Days for Yangtzes 140 Million-Year-Old Sturgeon
description: In the English naturalist Isabella Birds 1899 account of her travels on the Yangtze River, she noted that fishermen regularly caught sturgeon weighing from 500 to 700 pounds off the port in the town of Jingzhou.

title: U.N. Investigators Cite Atrocities in Syria
description: GENEVA  As Western and regional powers prepared to step up the fight against Sunni militants of the Islamic State, United Nations investigators presented details Tuesday of more atrocities committed by Islamic extremists and the government in Syria, warning that there could be no battlefield solution to the madness in the civil war there.

title: Daily Report: Regulators Reconsider Mobile Broadbands Net Neutrality Exemption
description: High-speed cellular Internet access has been largely exempt from regulations aimed at preventing Internet providers from slowing down or blocking websites and applications. But wireless broadbands special status is quickly losing support, Edward Wyatt reports.

title: House Expected to Vote on Training Syrian Rebels to Fight ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  The House will vote on Wednesday on whether to grant President Obama the authority to train and equip Syrian rebels to battle the Islamic State, but Republicans will insist on a detailed accounting of how the program fits into a broader strategy to defeat the militants, Republican leaders said Tuesday.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Sept. 9-15, 2014
description: Have you followed the news this week?

title: Opel to Scale Back Operations in Russia
description: FRANKFURT  Opel, the European unit of General Motors, said on Tuesday it would cut production and hundreds of jobs in Russia amid declining sales and profitability, and dispatched a senior manager from Germany to take charge of operations there.

title: Remind Me Again, Why Am I in Business?
description: It sneaked up on me about six years ago. After years of building one business and then another, I felt the need  and felt that I had earned the right  to take some me time and some more time with my wife and children. I decided it was time to start having more fun and to reassess my talents and my interests.

title: The Anti-ISIS Coalition
description: A view from the ground.

title: Morning Agenda: Allergans Olive Branch
description: ALLERGANS OLIVE BRANCH | The Botox maker Allergan on Monday night made a small measure of peace with Valeant Pharmaceuticals and Pershing Square Capital Management, the pair pursuing a $53 billion hostile takeover bid, when the three companies agreed that Allergan would hold a planned special meeting on Dec. 18, DealBooks David Gelles reports. At the meeting, Allergan shareholders will have a chance to vote out the majority of the board, a move that could open the door to a takeover. The meeting was already set for that date, but there was a chance it could have been delayed because of litigation related to the takeover bid. Valeant and Pershing Square also agreed to drop pending litigation against Allergan in Delaware, where they had sued to force the meeting.

title: In Performance: Lance Coadie Williams of Bootycandy
description: This weeks video features a scene with Lance Coadie Williams as a preacher with a secret in Bootycandy, Robert OHaras play about attitudes toward homosexuality in black culture. In his review, Charles Isherwood calls the show a searing and sensationally funny comedy from a fearless playwright who wants to make his mark by shaking up the world, one audience at a time.

title: Wasted Words
description: I dont subscribe to the view that good editing invariably requires the ruthless elimination of every single word that is not logically essential to a sentence. Sometimes idiom or the natural cadence of English favors phrases that arent stripped to the bone. Theres nothing wrong with hurry up, even though hurry means the same thing.

title: National Book Foundation Names Poetry Finalists
description: The National Book Foundation on Tuesday released its longlist of poetry nominees for the 2014 National Book Awards.

title: House Report on N.H.T.S.A.
description: A House committee investigating the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration found that the agency had ample information to identify the dangerous ignition defect in General Motors Chevrolet Cobalt and other cars as early as 2007.

title: Despite Declines, Child Mortality and Hunger Persist in Developing Nations, U.N. Reports
description: The United Nations on Tuesday reported significant declines in the rates of child mortality and hunger, but said those two scourges of the developing world stubbornly persist in parts of Africa and South Asia despite major health care advances and sharply higher global food production.

title: Mail.ru Takes Full Ownership of VKontakte, Russias Largest Social Network
description: The Russian Internet giant Mail.ru said on Tuesday that it had bought the remaining stake in Vkontakte, the countrys largest social network, that it did not already own for $1.47 billion.

title: Simone Rocha: Spring 2015 RTW
description: London

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Clear Channel Renames Itself iHeartMedia in Nod to Digital
description: When it was introduced by Clear Channel Communications in 2008, the iHeartRadio app had a humble job as an online outlet for the radio giants 800-plus stations.

title: O.E.C.D. Calls for Coordinated Fight Against Corporate Tax Avoidance
description: Dozens of countries with the most advanced economies have agreed on principles for concrete action to prevent corporations from gaming the international tax system, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said in a report on Tuesday.

title: How Many Foreign Fighters Have Joined ISIS?
description: The killings ofJames Foley, Steven J. Sotloff andaBritish aid worker, David Cawthorne Haines,by an apparently Britishmilitantjust months afterMehdi Nemmouche, a French citizen who fought with ISIS, shot four people at the Jewish Museum in Brussels  have contributed to the growing concern about the number of disaffected and radicalized youth from the West joining ISIS, and what the trend may mean for security at home.

title: Police Chief Quits Over Child Sexual Abuse Scandal in English Town
description: LONDON  The police commissioner in charge of the northern English town of Rotherham resigned on Tuesday after weeks of pressure and intense public outrage over a sexual abuse scandal in the town involving as many as 1,400 children.

title: Aftermath of Suicide Attack in Kabul
description: Afghan security forces and NATO soldiers surveyed the scene of a deadly suicide attack near the United States embassy in Kabul.

title: When Discussing Books, What Does Taste Have to Do With It?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, James Parker and Adam Kirsch discuss whether reactions to books all come down to taste.

title: IBM Offers a Data Tool for the Mainstream, With Watsons Help
description: Developing technology is one thing; democratizing it is another. The latter involves finding the innovation that opens the door to widespread adoption with usefulness and usability.

title: Report Finds Slight Growth in Population of Inmates
description: Breaking three consecutive years of decline, the number of people in state and federal prisons climbed slightly in 2013, according to a report released Tuesday, a sign that deeper changes in sentencing practices will be necessary if the countrys enormous prison population is to be significantly reduced.

title: 1939: Women Adopt Military Style
description: LONDON  Fashionable London women who have joined auxiliary war-time services today [Sept. 16] were reported to be abandoning the expensively-cultivated coiffure for a boyish shingle in order to wear regulation service caps. At the same time West End manicurists reported that fingernails are being cut shorter with rounded tips. Service regulations require that no curls show and ban the use of nail polish. Many shops are featuring a hair harness to keep softly waved coiffures under control during work hours, but allowing a fully feminine appearance when the wearers are off duty.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 17, 1939

title: German Court Lifts Ban on Uber Ride Service
description: LONDON  After a series of legal setbacks in Europe and North America, the ride-hailing service Uber got some welcome news on Tuesday.

title: 1964: Madrid Blames U.S. for Raid
description: MADRID  Spain said today [Sept. 16] the United States must be held responsible for the attack on a Spanish freighter Sunday off Cuba in which the vessels captain and two other officers were killed. A Foreign Ministry spokesman said the United States has military control over the area where the attack occurred. He said Spain believed that the U.S. government had sufficient information to clarify the situation in a sector where its responsibility in all that happens  is evident. The ministry said that Spain is not disposed to tolerate acts of piracy against her merchant fleet. The Sierra Aranzazu, en route to Havana, was attacked 60 miles east of Cuba by two small boats.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 17, 1964

title: Bow Down to Bauhaus
Monk Parrots Nestle Nicely in Queens and Beyond
description: Stuck with two cockatiels and a lonesome love bird in a cage in Liz Lynchs sunroom in Howard Beach, Queens, Elvis the parrot seems like just another ordinary pet shop purchase.

title: U.N. Sees Need for $1 Billion to Fight Ebola
description: GENEVA  The Ebola virus outbreak in West Africa risks ballooning into a humanitarian catastrophe without a major surge in international efforts to contain it, senior United Nations officials said Tuesday, estimating the cost of this effort at $1 billion.

title: Death and Poppy Seed Bagels
description: Dear Diary:

title: When the Honeymoon Is Over: Settling Into Real Life After a Move
description: When my husband and I uprooted our 11-year-old son and 8-year-old daughter to move to Nashville from Atlanta, we timed it to happen over the summer. We thought it would be easier to handle the move-related chaos in a season when everythings a little more laid back. Cant find the box with sheets and pillows in it? Thats O.K. Theres no rush on bedtime. Dont have an oven in the kitchen yet? No problem. Lets throw something on the grill and eat outside.

title: In Kentucky, Health Law Helps Voters but Saps Votes
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  The Affordable Care Act allowed Robin Evans, an eBay warehouse packer earning $9 an hour, to sign up for Medicaid this year. She is being treated for high blood pressure and Graves disease, an autoimmune disorder, after years of going uninsured and rarely seeing doctors.

title: In Latin America Travel, Considering Safety Before Fun
description: Monica Drake is editor of the Travel section. She shared her thoughts on last weekends annual Latin America edition.

title: Former Amaranth Trader Settles Manipulation Suit
description: A former energy trader at a Connecticut hedge fund that collapsed in 2006 after losing $6.6 billion on natural gas has agreed to pay $750,000 to settle a regulators lawsuit.

title: Perceptions Havent Caught Up to Decline in Crime
description: Heres a narrative you rarely hear: Our lives are safer. This message is so rarely heard that half of all respondents to a recent YouGov poll suggested that the violent crime rate had risen over the past two decades. The reality, of course, is that it has fallen enormously.

title: Setback for Indias Ruling Party
description: NEW DELHI  The Bharatiya Janata Party, coming off a huge victory in Mays parliamentary elections, suffered a political setback on Tuesday with a poor showing in state legislative by-elections in three northern Indian states, including one that was swept by Hindu-Muslim tensions in the weeks leading up to the vote.

title: A Pay-Gap Fix Goes Down Again in the Senate
description: On Monday, just as they did last April, and a couple of times before that, Senate Republicans moved in lockstep to block an up-or-down vote on the Paycheck Fairness Act.

title: The Power of Fearing the Worst
description: Worriers, rejoice. Your fears may actually be the makings of your success.

title: Appreciating Arthur Russell, Pop Musics Most Influential Unknown Star
description: Though hes not widely known, Arthur Russell  the avant-garde multi-instrumentalist who bridged classical, dance and experimental music in the 1970s and 80s before succumbing to AIDS in 1992  has been one of the most influential forces in popular music. A new compilation, Master Mix: Red Hot + Arthur Russell  the latest in the 24-year-old Red Hot + series dedicated to raising money to fight HIV/AIDS  is helping to voice that legacy by putting his compositions in the hands of artists like Robyn, Devendra Banhart and Hot Chip.

title: At de Blasio City Hall, Scorn (and Quiet Affirmation) for Bloomberg Years
description: When Mayor Bill de Blasios administration unveiled a promotional video this summer in its bid to lure the Democratic National Convention to Brooklyn in 2016, most viewers saw a slick, breezy collage of a pulsing New York City  schoolchildren and Citi Bikes, culinary wonders and brochure-worthy parks.

title: New North American Tour for the Former Cat Stevens
description: Yusuf, the singer-songwriter formerly known as Yusuf Islam, and before that as Cat Stevens, has joined the roster of Sony Legacy, which will release Tell Em Im Gone, his first new studio album in five years, on Oct. 27, Sony announced. The label also announced that the singer would undertake his first North American tour since 1976.

title: Sears Turns to Its Chief for a Loan
description: Sears Holdings has closed stores, sold real estate and spun off assets, all in an effort to repair its troubled finances. Now, the retailer is turning to its chief executive for a loan.

title: Under Pressure, Ukraine Leader to Seek Aid on U.S. Visit
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Seeking elusive military and economic aid from the United States, President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine headed to North America on Tuesday, while also facing increasingly skeptical questions both here and abroad about the slow pace of change.

title: Alibabas Small Increase in I.P.O. Price Is Puzzling
description: Pricing initial public offerings is an inexact science. Predicting how investors will value a large, fast-growing Chinese e-commerce group involves even more guesswork. That makes Alibabas decision to lift the maximum price for its coming stock market debut by just $2 a share to $68 puzzling.

title: U.S. General Open to Ground Forces in Fight Against ISIS in Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas top military adviser said Tuesday that he would recommend deploying United States forces in ground operations against Islamic extremists in Iraq if airstrikes proved insufficient, opening the door to a riskier, more expansive American combat role than the president has publicly outlined.

title: American Ballet Theater Starts a YouTube Channel
description: In line with a growing trend among ballet companies, American Ballet Theater has created its own YouTube channel, the company announced. With our initial phase of videos, we hoped to give users a sampling of the content, said a spokeswoman, adding that the channel would be continually refreshed with new material. Most of the videos currently posted date back to May and June.

title: Electric Vehicles Are Cleaner, but Still Not a Magic Bullet
