But clarity of a historic nature emerged just a few yards from the first tee, where the Royal and Ancient Golf Club voted overwhelmingly to admit its first female members.

title: A Decision Clinched by a Yard
description: Eight years ago, when Dr. Anthony C. Watkins and Dr. Khadijah Booth Watkins moved into hospital staff housing, a two-bedroom rental was fine for them and their young son. A few years after their second son arrived, the family moved within the building to a three-bedroom.

description: The cloud just covered a little more of the old tech business.

title: 1889: Beer Crisis in Bavaria
description: BERLIN  Great discontent has been created in Bavaria by the announcement that the Finance Minister proposes to introduce a bill in the Bavarian Diet for increasing the tax on malt, which would mean a rise in the price of Bavarian beer. It is well to remember that what amounted to a revolution was once started in Bavaria through beer becoming dearer. The Beer Riots of 1848 were the forerunners of disturbances that led to the abdication of Louis I.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 19, 1889.

title: A Paris Vacation, Cooking Class Included
description: For many travelers heading to Paris, a fine-dining meal at one of the many notable restaurants is a must, but the Le Pavillon des Lettres hotel has a new package for its guests that goes beyond the standard dinner out.

title: When Pizza Is Political
description: Pizza has long been many things to many people  its a badge of hometown pride; its a test of appropriate manners; its the next Yo. So it should perhaps come as no surprisethat when two writers identified a new development in the rhetoric of gender and snacking, pizza was right at its cheesy center.

title: Poland Says Russian Veto Should Be Limited at U.N.
description: WARSAW  Frustrated by the United Nations passive response to Russian aggression in Ukraine, President Bronislaw Komorowski of Poland has said he intends to call on the organization to change its rules to prevent Moscow from vetoing Security Council actions on the region.

title: Man Is Arrested as Northern California Wildfire Rages, Threatening Thousands of Homes
description: PLACERVILLE, Calif.  If California needed a reminder that it was suffering the worst drought  and the hottest year  in recent history, it came in a flash on Thursday, after one of the 200 fires smoldering across this state this week exploded overnight, tripling in size to 71,000 acres and forcing the evacuation of 2,000 people, many of whom had been enjoying a September vacation in the El Dorado National Forest near here.

description: Bayers float of its plastics business could sow the seeds for another sale. Investors added more than $5 billion to the $114 billion market capitalization of the German blue-chip company on Thursday, after it unveiled plans to float MaterialScience, its capital-intensive plastics and polymers business.

description: For Week 3, fantasy football players may want to watch out for the Broncos Emmanuel Sanders, who should draw most of cornerback Richard Shermans attention in this Super Bowl rematch.

title: Living With Cancer: Making Room
description: When I started clearing my closet a few weeks after the 18th chemo infusion, I struggled against bitterness about my changed body. After all, someone else could wear the clothes that no longer fit me. Then why not bundle them up, along with jackets, shirts, pants and shoes unworn because they were a professional uniform no longer needed?

description: Helping start-ups raise cash is a hot area for entrepreneurs, ever since the government relaxed rules on asking for capital.

Jim Yardley wrote a front-page article for Thursday from Pozzallo, Sicily, and explains how he got his story.

title: Lost in Their Own Lives
description: The most underrated quality in fiction nowadays is intelligence; the most overrated, imagination. Donald Antrim possesses both  but his intelligence is what makes you sit up straighter when you begin his new collection, The Emerald Light in the Air. Very quickly you realize you are reading something different from the mass of competent, earnest and depressingly dull short stories that are as commonplace now as ever (only the styles change).

title: Deceiving Voters With Ballot Language
description: In New York, state elections officials write the ballot language for constitutional amendments. It should not be a difficult job. Their task is to make the proposals clear and straightforwardno slanting, no tricks. It doesnt always work that way in Albany.

title: Behind the Scenes From a Marriage
description: Ivo van Hove is a director who loves classic plays. Its just hard to tell sometimes. He doused Hedda Gabler in V8 juice. He parked a fully clothed Blanche DuBois in a bathtub. He staged a food fight in The Misanthrope. A dramaturgical provocateur, hes not keen on keeping the story straight.

title: Fendi, Alberta Ferretti, Max Mara: A Different Declaration of Independence
description: MILAN  Whether or not the pundits are right and the Scottish situation goes viral across Europe and beyond, with other nationalist groups announcing their intentions to leave whatever union they happen to be in (the Catalans, Spain; the Veneto, Italy; the Qubcois, Canada; the Texans, the United States  it could happen), one thing is certain: Fashion has seen independence as a potential trend.

title: Clip: Tracks
description: A scene from the film, featuring Mia Wasikowska and Adam Driver.

title: A Group Exhibition Traces the Evolution of Fiber Art
description: If the Drawing Center seems a strange place for a sweeping show about textile art, consider the concept of the line. The distance between two points is, as the artist Sheila Hicks says, from her Paris studio, the mother thinker of all form-making, whether it be two- or three-dimensional. It is the direct conductor from brain to materialization. Rendered in fiber, that line is just pulled a little tighter, and the tension is on full display in Thread Lines, opening Sept. 19.

title: 1964: Dr. King Gets Papal Pledge
description: VATICAN CITY  The Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. said today [Sept. 18] that Pope Paul VI promised him he would publicly denounce racial segregation. Pope Paul was very open and forthright in his statements on the situation, the U.S. Negro leader told reporters after a 25- minute talk with the pope. He said he was a friend of the Negro people and that he was following our struggle in the United States. The pope told me that he would make a personal and public declaration against racial segregation. However, he said he could not accept violence and I made it clear that we did not support violence either, he said. Dr. King said before meeting the Pope that he felt a statement reaffirming Roman Catholic opposition to racial segregation would be a profound help for us. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 19, 1964

title: Trial of Uighur Scholar Ends in China
description: URUMQI, China  The trial of a prominent ethnic Uighur economics professor, Ilham Tohti, on charges of separatism ended on Thursday evening with no verdict or sentencing, which will be announced later, a lawyer for Mr. Tohti said.

title: It Takes a Village of Photographers in Brooklyn
description: This time of year the Brooklyn waterfront has plenty of contenders: from Pulitzer Prize-winning photojournalists to up-and-coming photographers (and even a selection of Instagram images from around the world). Welcome to Photoville, the annual pop-up village and open-air mega-exhibit thats showcased in cargo containers transformed into galleries.

title: Raising Teenagers: Protect When You Must, Permit When You Can
description: I dont think this comes as news to anyone here, but it can be a real challenge to parent and to educate adolescents. My own specimens (boys, 11 and 15) spend their days vacillating between energetic and catatonic, optimistic and morose, ebullient and apathetic. Some days, I doubt that they will be able to forge a safe and successful path into adulthood without my constant help and intervention.

title: Carla Krbes, at 33, Announces Retirement From Ballet
description: When a ballerina of a certain age and stature  Alessandra Ferri, Kyra Nichols and, most recently, Wendy Whelan  announces her retirement, its heartbreaking, but makes sense. When a dancer, just 33, decides to do the same, its shattering, especially when that ballerina is Carla Krbes.

title: Ebola Deaths Doubled in a Month, Health Group Says
description: GENEVA  The number of people in West Africa who have contracted the Ebola virus and died from the hemorrhagic fever that it causes has doubled in the past month, the World Health Organization reported on Thursday.

description: With the Alibaba Group poised to hold one of the biggest initial public offerings on record, the Chinese Internet giant plans to mark the momentous occasion in its own way.
