description: HONG KONG  The Australian government intensified security at the national Parliament building on Friday, a day after the police detained 15 people in an operation that the prime minister said had been prompted by signs that militant Islamists were planning demonstration executions.

title: Angus Lennie, Actor in The Great Escape, Dies at 84
description: Angus Lennie, a diminutive Scottish actor who played the persistent but ultimately despairing tunnel man known as the Mole in the 1963 prison-camp movie The Great Escape, died on Sunday in London. He was 84.

title: F.D.A. Plans to Revise Food Safety Rules
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday proposed changes to new rules that will govern food safety in the United States. In an effort to account for concerns raised by small brewers, artisanal cheese producers and other food producers, the agency revised provisions for water testing, as well as those on manure, compost and spent grains. Brewers had objected to rules requiring them to write food safety plans for the spent grain they sell as animal feed. The changes will be open to public comment for 75 days; final rules are to be issued in 2015.

title: Fighting Enmity Against Sikhs With Art, Talks and Superhero Garb
description: ALFRED, N.Y.  Standing before his living-room mirror one morning in August 2001, Vishavjit Singh put his fumbling fingers to the task of wrapping on his turban for the first time in a decade. It slumped to one side. Then the creases were not crisp enough. Finally, he got it right, and headed to his job as a software engineer in suburban New York.

title: Jeters Real Gift
description: During the chaos and excitement of awaiting our firstborn child, my wife and I were decorating the nursery. Our son was due to arrive in late June of 2008 and we planned to put his crib in a baseball-themed room. So, in a rare act of handiwork, I tapped my inner do-it-yourself to paint the vaulted ceiling, and helped my wife pinstripe the walls.

title: A Soaring Debut for Alibaba
description: The long-awaited public market debut of the Alibaba Group, the Chinese Internet titan, did not disappoint on Friday, eclipsing every other company that has started to sell stock so far this year.

title: In Brooklyn Park, Chants Extol Full Moon as Thefts Empty Bike Shed
description: A friends email to Andrew Kluger arrived on a cloudy afternoon two Mondays ago.

title: The Hits Just Kept On Coming
description: Theres no drum in sight. But you can almost hear the ba-dum-bum following the jokes in Dinner With the Boys, a hokey comedy thats far more enjoyable than it really should be.

title: Saturdays College Football Games to Watch
description: 22 CLEMSON at 1 FLORIDA STATE

title: Cadillac Makes Big Plan to Woo Luxury Market
description: General Motors struggling Cadillac division is hoping that bigger is better.

title: One Big Unhappy Economy
description: Unhappy economies, it turns out, are all unhappy in the same way. A recent report on job markets globally showed that too few jobs are being created worldwide, and even fewer good jobs are. Wages are flat or falling in all major economies as corporate profits claim an increasing share of productivity gains.

title: The Met Opera Stands Firm
description: True to its artistic mission, the Metropolitan Opera remains firmly committed to presenting The Death of Klinghoffer, the widely praised opera that has drawn the scorn of protesters who plan to demonstrate outside the Mets season opening on Monday at Lincoln Center. The Mets board of directors and Peter Gelb, its general manager, are entirely correct in insisting the opera must proceed as planned next month.

title: Hurricane Watch in the Rockaways
description: Midway through the hurricane season, an interesting breed of aquatic New Yorkers  surfers  are religiously scrolling apps for the most promising waves. They could not resist dropping by Rockaway Beach this week to ride the remnants of Hurricane Edouard pounding the Atlantic beachfront of Queens. Were rooting for Edouard  up to a point, said Conrad Karl, an obsessive surfer who is happy to frolic at a hurricanes farther edges.

title: Women Allege Harassment and Abuse on Forest Service Firefighting Crews
description: WASHINGTON  Current and former female firefighters of the United States Forest Service have filed a complaint with the Department of Agriculture alleging that they suffered job discrimination, harassment and sexual abuse at the hands of male co-workers and that top agency officials failed to stop it.

title: Bill Cunningham | Stardust
description: Young people obsessed with fashion displayed wildly eccentric and creative styles of dress at New York Fashion Week.

title: A Peaceful Decision in Scotland, but Misery Elsewhere
description: If only all of the news we follow could be as satisfying as the referendum on Scottish independence!

title: Fleeing Gaza, Only to Face Treachery and Disaster at Sea
description: ABASSAN, Gaza Strip  Samir Asfour, 57, held a mobile phone that never stopped ringing in one hand, a cigarette in the other. His Palestinian passport was sticking out of the chest pocket of his white jalabiya.

title: Milan Shows So Good, Lets See Them Again
description: Fashion shows are expensive and brief. So why not double the fun?

title: Republicans Switch Firm Handling Obama Suit
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans on Friday replaced the firm handling their lawsuit against President Obama after the lawyer representing them pulled out over what was said to be political backlash among his colleagues at the firm, Baker Hostetler.

title: Roger Goodell Vows to Change N.F.L.
description: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell apologized for his role in poor decision-making surrounding domestic violence cases and promised a revamped personal conduct policy to address future cases.

title: Sierra Leones Aggressive Attack on Ebola
description: Sierra Leone imposed a three-day national lockdown, ordering people off the streets and into their homes in an effort to stamp out the deadly disease.

title: Beloved Vendor of Ices in South Bronx Is Killed
description: Alfredo Thiebaud sold creamy coconut ice in paper cups on the streets of the South Bronx in the 1970s, undeterred by the crime and poverty that drove other people away. He built a fleet of pushcarts, all doling out tropical flavors that became synonymous with summertime and homelands far away.

title: The Gandhis and Kings of Our Time
description: All but one of the quotations painted on the walls at the Museum at Bethel Woods Center for the Arts for an exhibition of photographs of human rights activists are from Robert F. Kennedy.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 19, 2014
Democrats Pin Senate Hopes on a Kansan
description: TOPEKA, Kan.  The Senate race in Kansas may suddenly be the most crucial contest in the country. Republicans are scrambling to protect a longtime incumbent. Bob Dole is back on the campaign trail. The states Democrats have no candidate and are trying to say as little about that as possible. And a 45-year-old investor from suburban Kansas City may hold the key to control of the Senate in January.

title: Exercising the Right to Rant
description: Congress is gone. But not forgotten.

title: Testimony in Etan Patz Case on Handling of Suspect
description: A defense lawyer tried to elicit testimony on Friday that detectives who interrogated a man suspected of killing Etan Patz in 1979 gently steered him to a confession, using expressions of sympathy, appeals to his religion and even a group hug.

title: Hospitals in Kashmir Struggle After Flooding, Deepening a Health Crisis
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  When the floodwaters of the Jhelum River rushed over the gates of the G. B. Pant Hospital, the top pediatric hospital here, on Sept. 6, the lights were the first to go. Half an hour later, the generators on the ground floor were drowned in water. Minutes after that, the oxygen tank that supplied air to the ventilators for newborns shut down.

title: But Will the Cows Like It?
description: The rolling hills of the 140-acre Saunders Farm are once again populated not only by Black Angus cattle and Queen Annes lace, but also by sculptures. The Farm Project 2014 presents 51 objects and installations, including brightly painted metal assemblages, 3D-printed creatures and massive stone constructions. Small ceramic heads clustered on a stone wall seem animated in conversation. In a shaded area, a chair is poised in the limbs of a tree.

title: Clayton Kershaw Keeps Aiming for New Heights
description: CHICAGO  There has been no doubt, for a while now, that Clayton Kershaw is the best pitcher in baseball. Dan Haren was aware of this when he joined the Los Angeles Dodgers this spring after more than a decade with other teams. But Haren still had to be reminded of just what he was about to witness.

title: Turkish Presidents Allies Increasing Pressure on Times and Reporter
description: Turkeys president and his supporters have been denouncing The New York Times and one of its Istanbul correspondents with growing furor for the past three days, reacting to an article and photograph about the recruitment of fighters in Turkey by the Islamic State, the militant group that has seized parts of neighboring Iraq and Syria.

title: In Domestic Violence Cases, N.F.L. Has a History of Lenience
description: On April 10, 2007, after more than 50 National Football League players had been arrested in the previous football season, Commissioner Roger Goodell was widely hailed for instituting a newly stringent personal conduct policy. Mr. Goodell threatened to banish players for off-the-field transgressions and installed himself as the judge and jury presiding over every case.

title: Omnipresence: New Stop-and-Frisk?
description: In the projects of Brownsville, Brooklyn, the New York Police Departments strategy, Omnipresence, is what it says. Despite promises of change, to some it feels like stop-and-frisk by another name.

title: In Death, Florida Family Reveals a Spiral of Domestic Abuse
description: BELL, Fla.  Sarah L. Spirit was 22 years old and eight months pregnant with her fourth child when she called the police in desperation: Her father was violent, she was afraid of him, and she had nowhere to go.

title: Share Your Story of Detroit
description: New York Times journalists would like to hear from current, former and new residents of Detroit about their experiences living in the city.

title: U.S. Hopes Face-Saving Plan Offers a Path to a Nuclear Pact With Iran
description: Over the years, the United States has shown considerable ingenuity in its effort to slow Irans production of nuclear fuel: It has used sabotage, cyberattacks and creative economic sanctions.

title: Looking Back to Gain a Fresh Perspective
description: Wayne Escoffery is a big man with a small earring and a face caught between a smile and a scowl  except, that is, when his lips are fit snugly around the mouthpiece of his tenor saxophone, summoning strikingly soulful sounds from it.

title: Boxing Is in Elijah Holyfields Blood, but Football Is in His Future
description: CLARKSTON, Ga.  The public address announcers setup for the opening kickoff  back for Woodward Academy, No. 13, Elijah Holyfield  was still echoing through the stadium Friday when the ball descended into the players midsection.

title: Lifes Good
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  Man, its tough out there for a solver, especially on a Saturday. You scan the clues  more than once  hoping to find even one Fill in the Blank or gimme, and sometimes you think you know what should be written in the grid, but you really dont, do you? You wrote CAD instead of CUR at 40 Down too, didnt you? Not to worry; its Saturday. Its O.K. for our brains to be at half-mast.

title: Indonesians, Optimistic About New President, Spend Freely
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesia is saddled with endemic corruption, poverty and shoddy infrastructure. Yet its consumers are among the worlds most optimistic, hopeful that a new government will lift the fortunes of the fourth-most-populous nation and put the economy on a par with emerging powerhouses like China and Brazil.

title: Stop-and-Frisk Ebbs, but Still Hangs Over Brooklyn Lives
description: In the housing projects of eastern Brooklyn, some young men no longer clasp hands when greeting each other, they say, fearful that their grasp might be mistaken for a drug deal and invite a search by the police. Friends heading to the bodega sometimes split up, worried that walking in a group will attract police attention.

title: At U.N., Kerry Thanks Other Nations for Their Support in Fighting Islamic State
description: UNITED NATIONS  Secretary of State John Kerry on Friday expressed gratitude to a host of allies for bolstering the American-led campaign against terrorist groups in Iraq and Syria, singling out the French for airstrikes and Saudi clerics for condemning the Islamic State as an order of Satan.

title: Ex-Employees Say Home Depot Left Data Vulnerable
description: The risks were clear to computer experts inside Home Depot: The home improvement chain, they warned for years, might be easy prey for hackers.

title: Getting It Wrong
description: I turned on ESPN about 15 minutes before Roger Goodells Friday afternoon news conference. There was a round table of analysts and reporters, led by Bob Ley, the journalist who covers the serious side of sports for the network. If I hadnt known better, I would have thought they were prepping for a coming news conference by a politician in trouble rather than the commissioner of the National Football League.

title: Judge Questions Plea Deal With Man Tied to Lethal Qaeda Bombings
description: An Egyptian terrorism defendant pleaded guilty in Manhattan on Friday to charges that he had helped Osama bin Laden pass messages that claimed responsibility for the deadly 1998 bombings of two United States Embassies in East Africa and that issued new threats.

title: Where Apples Are the Entertainment in New Jersey
description: Visitors who come to pick apples at Phillips Farms in Milford wont find a petting zoo, corn maze or giant inflatable moon bounce.

title: With John Tavares Back, Islanders Are Eager for Season
description: There is much to wonder about the Islanders coming season. The teams surplus of forwards, two new goaltenders and the return of a healthy captain, John Tavares, will all bear watching.

title: Group to Sue After M.T.A. Rejects Ad That Refers to Muslims Killing Jews
description: A pro-Israel group behind a public transit advertisement that refers to Muslims killing Jews plans to sue the Metropolitan Transportation Authority after the agency rejected the ad. The authority said the ad would be seen as a call to violence against Jews amid turmoil in the Middle East and security concerns in New York.

title: The Horses in Central Park Are to Show, Not Work
description: New York City remains divided between those who would have carriage horses trot the streets and those who would rather send them out to pasture. But on Friday night, the citys greenest paddock  Central Park  was nevertheless filled with horses, though of a very different sort than those hired nearby on West 59th Street.

title: Artisanal Effort at a Chain Hotel
description: It used to be that hotel dining rooms were scorned by gourmets, but in the past 20 years or so, as the food revolution has spread across the country, many hotel chains have joined in and now pay serious attention to serving good, often artisanal and interesting food.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, September 20, 2014
description: No open palm anymore; we just do elbows.

title: Breaking Silence, but Offering Little
description: Maybe Commissioner Roger Goodell should have extended his public silence about the domestic violence crisis that has been roiling the N.F.L.

title: Guinter Kahn, Inventor of Baldness Remedy, Dies at 80
description: Guinter Kahn liked to say that there had always been three things in history that could never get a patent: a divining rod, a perpetual motion machine and anything to grow hair. He was wrong about the last one.

title: Seafood With New England Flavor
description: Despite its out-of-the-way location and its history as a funky diner, the Ocean House restaurant has transformed its deficits, and without nets and ships wheels. Colonial-blue trim suggests an old fishermans cottage on a briny New England shore. But its the Hudson River that runs beyond the front door of Ocean House in Croton-on-Hudson.

title: Part of the Berlin Wall Comes Down, Again
description: The Berlin Wall has come down again.

title: Ellsbury Shows His Worth, and His Fragility, to the Yanks
description: Jacoby Ellsbury showcased the type of talent on Friday that the Yankees expected of him when he signed for more than $150 million in the off-season: doubling, homering, scoring twice, manning center field and using his speed to prompt an error on a throw to first base that allowed a crucial run to score.

title: A Former Fish Joint Cleans Up
description: Back in the day, Salivars Restaurant in Montauk was a typical dockside fishermens joint. The kind of place where a band of tattooed scalawags would jostle in after a three-day tuna hunt, throw back a few bushels of clam strips and the better part of a keg of Old Milwaukee, and then retire to the pool table, above which loomed the stuffed head of a great white shark.

title: The Knick Recap:  Sexual Politics  and the Early-20th-Century Woman
description: Season 1, Episode 6, Start Calling Me Dad

title: New Policy on Substance Abuse Reduces Josh Gordons Ban to 10 Games
description: The N.F.L. and its players association said Friday that they had finished overhauling their substance abuse policy, less than a week after they updated similar policies for performance-enhancing drugs.

title: Mapping the Decline of Stop-and-Frisk
description: Mapping and charting the decline of a controversial police practice.

title: Stop-and-Frisk Is All but Gone From New York
description: Mapping and charting the decline of a controversial police practice.

title: Children of Immigrants
description: The photographer, a daughter of immigrants, spoke with others who, like her, have felt the imbalance of cultural identity.

title: Jameis Winston Out for Entire Game as Florida State Extends Ban
description: Florida State reversed course late Friday, suspending quarterback Jameis Winston for the whole game, instead of the first half, against No. 22 Clemson on Saturday night.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 7 P.M. (HBO) THE SECRET LIFE OF WALTER MITTY (2013) Ben Stiller, who also directed this adaptation of the James Thurber short story, stars as Walter, a dutiful drone in the photography department of Life magazine who finds himself on a caper far beyond his wildest imagination when the negative for the publications final print edition goes missing. Kristen Wiig plays the crinkly-nosed co-worker on whom Walter has a crush; Adam Scott is the leader of the new tech-jerk bosses who have Walters job on the line. And Sean Penn is the mysterious photographer behind Walters travels to Iceland, Afghanistan and other stunning far-off places. Though it is a celebration of modesty, there is also quite a lot of vanity in The Secret Life of Walter Mitty, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. There is also a contradiction: An ordinary fellow should not have to be quite so special to win our admiration. And this version of Walter Mitty undermines some of the democratic whimsy that has made his story such an appealing and durable modern myth. He used to be one of us: a self-deluded dreamer charmed by his unruly creative powers, a willing prisoner of his appetite for escapism. But now our identification gives way to envy, and he is another one of those enchanted people the rest of us can only dream of becoming. The movie is followed at 9 by On the Run Tour: Beyonc and Jay Z, a concert special filmed on Sept. 12 and 13 at the Stade de France, near Paris, featuring performances of more than 40 songs during the couples only stop outside North America on the tour.

title: Milan Fashion Week Morning Report, Day 4
description: To put things in sports terms (sort of) in case you clicked here by mistake: Today the two opposing teams of Italian fashion  colorful flamboyance and understated tailoring  clash helmets on the gridiron.

title: Breach Prompts Review of White House Security
description: WASHINGTON  The director of the Secret Service ordered an internal review of its security procedures around the White House after a man armed with a knife who jumped the fence at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue on Friday night managed to make his way through the front door of President Obamas home before being stopped, officials said Saturday.

title: Corrections: September 20, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: Intruder Gets Through White House Doors Before Arrest
description: A Texas man who jumped the White House fence made it through the North Portico doors on Friday night before being apprehended, the Secret Service said. The intruder, Omar J. Gonzalez, 42, of Copperas Cove, Tex., was arrested and taken to George Washington University Hospital after complaining of chest pains, said Ed Donovan, a Secret Service spokesman. None of the Obamas were home when the security breach occurred, about 7:20 p.m., but White House staff members were evacuated as a precaution, Mr. Donovan said. Mr. Gonzalez was not armed, he added, and the incident was being reviewed.

title: Indie-Rock Antiheroes Get a Stadium Singing Along
description: Better late than never, in a way. More than 20 years after the Replacements initially broke up, leaving behind a fervent cult following but disappointing album sales, the reconstituted band had a stadium singing along on Friday night. Yes, Forest Hills Stadium is a fairly small stadium. But the crowds voices were loud through both verses and choruses, song after song.

title: Bottega Veneta: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Milan

title: Turkey Obtains Release of Hostages Held in Iraq
description: ANKARA, Turkey  Turkey secured the release of 49 hostages who had been held for more than three months in Iraq by the jihadists of the Islamic State on Saturday, marking a moment of joy for Turkey while raising questions about how it had managed to set them free.

title: Afghan Presidential Rivals Finally Agree on Power-Sharing Deal
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The two candidates for president of Afghanistan have agreed on a power-sharing deal that will give the losing candidate substantial influence in the next government, initialing the American-brokered deal Saturday night and promising to sign it at a formal ceremony on Sunday.

title: Analytics: What Readers Thought About Bill Gatess Idea For a History Curriculum
description: The following graphic appears on the Reply All page in the Sept. 21 issue of the magazine.

title: Making Big Data Think Bigger
description: Big-data management promises a significant shift in the way decisions are made across the economy. Abundant new sources of data from the web, sensors and smartphones, mined for patterns and insights by smart software, will mean that more and more decisions will be based on data and analysis rather than experience and intuition.

title: Pope Sets Tone in U.S. by Naming Inclusive Prelate as Chicago Archbishop
description: In his first major appointment in the United States, Pope Francis named Bishop Blase J. Cupich of Spokane, Wash., on Saturday to be the next archbishop of Chicago, replacing a combative conservative with a prelate whose pastoral approach to upholding church doctrine is more in keeping with the popes inclusive tone.

title: Giorgio Armani: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Milan

title: Top of the Medy Roc
description: A landmark sale of design treasures delivers a bit of Billionaires Bay to the Big Apple.

title: Jil Sanders Spring 2015 Collection at Milan Fashion Week
description: The live stream from Jil Sander has ended. [See the live stream.]

title: Small Boxy Bags That Make a Big Statement
description: A small square accessory thats roomy enough for every day.

title: On the Path Past 9 Billion, Little Crosstalk Between U.N. Sessions on Population and Global Warming
description: Updated, 11:43 a.m. | The United Nations and the streets of Manhattan are going into global warming saturation mode, from Sundays Peoples Climate March through the Tuesday climate changesummit convened by Secretary General Ban Ki-moon and on through an annual green-energy event called Climate Week.

title: Air France Pilots Vote to Extend Strike
description: PARIS  Nearly a week after beginning a strike to protest Air France-KLMs new European strategy, the airlines French pilots voted on Saturday to extend their walkout until at least Friday and asked to meet with Frances prime minister to make their case against the plan.

title: Roberto Cavalli: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Milan

title: Milan Fashion Week: Roberto Cavalli Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Bottega Veneta Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: Keeping a Rent-Stabilized Apartment
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Josephine Le Tutor Transforms Backstage at Roberto Cavalli
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in Milan. Here, the model Josephine Le Tutor before (left) and after (right) makeup by Pat McGrath and hair by Guido Palau.

title: To Win Back Older Voters, Democrats Talk Up Social Security
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats are stepping up their appeals to older voters in the final stretch before the midterm elections, spurred by polls showing the party has regained some support lost in the Obama years. The question is whether they can narrow the gap with Republicans enough to offset their broader disadvantages given widespread dissatisfaction with President Obama.

title: Antonio Marras: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Chinese Tourists Find a Movable Feast Best Left Behind
description: PARIS  Before arriving in the French capital, Wu Shuyun, a 56-year-old Chinese housewife, imagined Paris to be like a pristine film set for a romantic love story, picturing herself as a glamorous princess surrounded by elegant Parisians, decked out, perhaps, in Chanel.

title: Twists and Ties of Fabric Liven Up Simple Silhouettes
description: Trending on spring 2015 runways: knotted garments. We saw it first in New York at The Row, where Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen turned sleek silhouettes into interesting shapes with the addition of knots or crossed lengths of fabric in either the front or the back of dresses and shirts. Then in Milan, the Sportmax collection was all about tied-up skirts, trousers and sarong-like dresses. And again today in Milan, almost all the looks in Bottega Venetas laid-back, luxurious collection  loose trenches and cashmere leggings  were cinched at the waist. The styling was at its best in its most exaggerated form: a hooded sweatshirt with an oversize knot in the middle that looked almost like a corsage.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Giorgio Armani Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: A Busy Border in Iraqi Kurdistan
description: Thousands move daily across the 650-mile border that now separates Kurdistan and territory controlled by the Islamic State.

title: Back and Forth, Wearily, Across the ISIS Border
description: MAKTAB KHALID, Iraq  Around 6 each morning, with the sun already a threat, an officer at a security checkpoint here in northern Iraq rolls back the concertina wire just enough to allow travelers to pass one at a time.

title: Variety: An Acrostic That Will Make You Tut
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Well, if theres one thing I learned from todays acrostic, its that I need to memorize how to spell ORESTEIA. That one always confuses me.

title: Jil Sander: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Milan

title: Suspicions Run Deep in Iraq That C.I.A. and the Islamic State Are United
description: BAGHDAD  The United States has conducted an escalating campaign of deadly airstrikes against the extremists of the Islamic State for more than a month. But that appears to have done little to tamp down the conspiracy theories still circulating from the streets of Baghdad to the highest levels of Iraqi government that the C.I.A. is secretly behind the same extremists that it is now attacking.

title: Explosion Rocks Eastern Ukraine Hours After an Amended Cease-Fire Is Signed
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  A giant explosion shattered the stillness of an early fall morning here just hours after Ukraine and pro-Russian rebels signed the latest version of their cease-fire accord, illustrating the fragility of a truce agreed upon two weeks ago.

title: Catching Up With an Old Hand
description: There was a time when the pianist Kirk Lightsey was a first-tier fixture on the New York jazz scene, at Greenwich Village clubs like Bradleys and Sweet Basil. That time spanned roughly a decade, beginning with his arrival in the early 1980s and ending with his abrupt move to Paris in 1992. He has led a productive career in Europe since then, but his nearly total avoidance of New York has made him seem like that rarest of species: the one that got away.

title: New Zealands Ruling National Party Is Re-elected
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand  The dominant center-right National Party was re-elected on Saturday to a third term in government with a historic level of support, despite an election campaign tainted by political scandals and resignations.

title: U.N. Reports Yemen Deal With Rebels
description: SANA, Yemen  The special adviser to the United Nations on Yemen said late Saturday night that the government had agreed to a deal with a rebel group to end weeks of protests and days of violence around the capital.

title: U.S. Seeks Ryder Cup Miracle of Its Own
description: Two years after its Ryder Cup unraveling at Medinah Country Club, the United States team keeps looking for reasons to believe in a brighter day.

title: Emilio Puccis Spring 2015 Collection at Milan Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Emilio Pucci at Milan Fashion Week. [See the live stream.]

title: The Sock-and-Shoe Combo Gets an Upgrade at Jil Sander
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: In Ruins of Ukrainian Town, Residents Crave Food, Water and Peace
description: LUHANSK, Ukraine  Rebel fighters picked their way through the debris of this citys airport last week, pointing out the bloodstained stretchers and the corpse of a Ukrainian soldier tangled in the wreck of a burned vehicle. The battle for control of the city of Luhansk, one of the most ferocious of the six-month conflict in southeastern Ukraine, had left the airport and surrounding villages in ruins.

title: Breaking Through the Fog of San Franciscos Weather Reputation
description: The first thing visitors in San Francisco learn: Wear layers.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Jil Sander Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Helga Traxler.

title: Modest Drop Earrings Shine for Spring 2015
description: The singular statement earring is all the rage this season; but come next spring, expect to resume wearing the complete pair again. On spring 2015 runways, big, flashy sets have given way to smaller, more delicate drop earrings. In New York, the Altuzarra designers enhanced their ultrafeminine collection with classic cameo drop earrings. Even Miuccia Prada, who is known for her love of statement jewels, scaled back the bling and instead sent modest clusters of crystals down the runway on models ears. And today at Bottega, the designer Tomas Maier complemented his cozy collection with small Southwest-inspired turquoise earrings.

title: A Writerly Chill at Jeff Bezos Campfire
description: When Jeff Bezos tells writers to keep quiet, they obey.

title: After Blazing Trail, Li Na Exits and Leaves a Gap
description: Despite all of her evident athletic talent and all of her personal sacrifices, Li Na was a late bloomer in tennis, which is one reason  but only one reason  it feels as if she retired too soon.

title: A Casual, No-Nonsense Updo at Bottega Veneta
description: For spring 2015, designers seem to invite women to come as you are with the messy, everyday hairstyles theyve sent down the runway. At Bottega Veneta today, imperfect updos were a welcome break from the long, tousled, parted-down-the-middle waves trending down the runway. With a little length peeking out of the back, and strands of hair pulled out around the face, its a style any woman can pull off (if they dont already) with little-to-no effort.

title: On Cue, the Cardinals Rise in September
description: ST. LOUIS  The monthly records of the St. Louis Cardinals read like the yearly win-loss marks of a solid, dependable starting pitcher:

title: A Florida Race Strains Wallets and Loyalties
description: MIAMI  When Bill Clinton attended a recent campaign rally for his partys candidate for governor here, he whipped up the crowd with keystone Democratic issues  higher wages, better-funded schools and affordable health care.

title: Farewell, Rob Ford
description: IN 1950 the mayor of Toronto, the Hon. Hiram E. McCallum, objected to the display of a painting in an art exhibit at the Canadian National Exhibition. Sailors and Floozies had outraged the mayor and other moral guardians of the city by depicting seamen cavorting with strumpets.

title: Affordable Housing for Retirees
description: The population explosion among retirement-age Americans that demographers have long predicted has arrived. The number of adults 50 and over is expected to reach 132 million by 2030, an increase from 2000 of more than 70 percent. By that time, one in five citizens will be 65 or older.

title: Katie Paterson
description: Katie Paterson is a Scottish conceptual artist. Her most recent work is Future Library  1,000 seedlings growing in a Norwegian forest, which will be cut down in 100 years and made into previously unpublished books.

title: The Unlikeliest of Coalitions
description: The Obama administration needs to bring together a reliable international coalition as the backbone of its campaign to defeat the Islamic State, the Sunni extremist group that controls large parts of Iraq and Syria. So far, more than 40 countries have offered to help, and none are more important than the Sunni Muslim countries that are needed to give legitimacy to the American-led effort.

title: Helping the Needy
description: Readers discuss an article by Nicholas Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn on how to fight poverty.

title: Two Redheaded Strangers
description: WASHINGTON  WHEN Willie Nelson invites you to get high with him on his bus, you go.

title: Grand Illusion in Syria
description: ACROSS years of war and at an extraordinary cost, the United States built an army that was supposed to prevent jihadists from gaining a sanctuary in the heart of the Middle East. It had American-trained leaders, American-made weaponry and 250,000 men under arms  far more troops and firepower than any insurgent force that might emerge to challenge it.

title: Too Young to Die, Too Old to Worry
description: THIS weekend, the singer and songwriter Leonard Cohen is celebrating his 80th birthday  with a cigarette. Last year he announced that he would resume smoking when he turned 80. Its the right age to recommence, he explained.

title: Hidden Interests, Closer to Home
description: THE article ran above the fold on the front page early this month, a Times investigation into the influence of foreign money within American research organizations.

title: Three Cheers for Pluralism Over Separatism
description: MADRID  THIS was an interesting week to visit Britain and Spain  first to watch the Scottish separatists push for independence and then to watch Basque and Catalan separatists watching (with disappointment) the outcome of the vote. One reaction: Im glad a majority of Scots rejected independence. Had they not, it would have clipped the wing of Americas most important wingman in the world: Britain. Another reaction: God bless America. We have many sources of strength, but today our greatest asset is our pluralism  our E pluribus unum  that out of many weve made one nation, with all the benefits that come from mixing cultures and all the strengths that come from being able to act together.

title: Alicia Keys Asks: Why Are We Here?
description: ALICIA KEYS is a superstar singer who has mostly kept her clothes on and gossip off. So what is she doing in this photo, dressed only in a peace sign?

title: Climate Realities
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  ON Tuesday, world leaders will converge at United Nations headquarters in New York for a summit meeting on the climate that will set the stage for global negotiations next year to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and the threat of global climate change. The summit is titled Catalyzing Action, a decidedly hopeful characterization.

title: Getting Married Is Easy
description: I DID not expect to fall in love at 46, and I did not expect to plan a wedding at 47. Except that I always expect to be surprised.

title: Venezuelas Crackdown on Opposition
description: The Venezuelan government early this year responded to a wave of street protests by jailing opposition leaders, deploying the army against unarmed protesters and tightening control of the media. The deplorable tactics have largely driven an inspiring opposition movement underground, depriving Venezuelans of the right to challenge a leader who has put a once-prosperous nation on a perilous track.

title: The Vain and the Desperate
description: IN case you missed it, our nations officeholders, current and former, have been working overtime to make us proud.

title: Who Runs the Girls?
description: A FEW years ago, I attended a party at a nightclub in the meatpacking district of Manhattan with about 10 young women, most of them models, and two club promoters, men whose job was to bring beautiful women to exclusive parties. Beyoncs hit single Run the World (Girls) boomed, and the girls danced to the beat, singing, Who run the world? Girls! Girls! One promoter joined in, with his own twist on the chorus: Who run the girls? Boys! Boys! The men high-fived, and everyone laughed.

title: Can a Computer Replace Your Doctor?
description: AS a former physician, I shivered a bit when I heard Dr. Vivek Wadhwa say he would rather have an artificial-intelligence doctor than a human one. I would trust an A.I. over a doctor any day, he proclaimed at a recent health innovation conference in San Francisco, noting that artificial intelligence provided perfect knowledge. When asked to vote, probably a third of those in attendance agreed.

title: Slamming a Door on Hedge Funds
description: Are public pension funds over their crush on hedge funds?

title: Steven Mollenkopf of Qualcomm: If You Dont Know, Just Say So
description: This interview with  Steven Mollenkopf, the C.E.O. of Qualcomm, the mobile-phone technology company, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: A Taxi Financing Firm Isnt Switching Lanes
description: With its $17 billion valuation, Silicon Valley pedigree and disruptive technology, Uber has been making waves worldwide.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Sept. 21
description: Congress voted to back President Obamas decision to train and equip the Syrian rebels to fight the militants of the Islamic State. At the United Nations, Secretary of State John Kerry added to the international coalition of countries joining the American-led campaign against the extremists in Iraq and Syria.

title: Underwater Inspiration
description: Laure S. Katz, 30, is the seascapes program director for Conservation International, based in Arlington, Va., where her job includes leading scuba expeditions across the Asia-Pacific region to help develop marine protection programs.

title: Dancing With the Start-Ups
description: Since at least Sarah Bernhardts time, celebrities have looked for ways to parlay their name recognition into extra cash. Back in the 19th century, Bernhardt  the most celebrated actress of her day  endorsed a popular brand of soap. I have used Pears Soap and find theres nothing in the world so pleasing and satisfying, she enthused in one ad.

title: As Life Imitates Brutal Sport, Cheers Have Uneasy Resonance
description: Amid the images and reports of battered women and children, there may finally be consensus that N.F.L. games are superfluous, that the standings matter less than the blotter, bruises and brain scans. But the games go on as scheduled, as if nothing happened, no matter how far the league veers wildly off script.

title: Venezuela Moves Jailed Former Police Official to House Arrest
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  A jailed former police official whose nearly decade-long stay in prison has become a rallying cry for the political opposition was moved to house arrest, his wife and court officials announced on Saturday.

title: Zenefits Leader Is Rattling an Industry, So Why Is He Stressed Out?
description: Parker Conrads start-up, Zenefits, is thought to be one of the fastest-growing companies in recent Silicon Valley history, and his investors and associates describe him as an uncommonly talented software visionary. But lately, Mr. Conrad often finds himself petrified, his days a series of white-knuckled attempts to escape the clutches of sudden, inadvertent failure.

title: Return of the Bums on Welfare
description: Thinking some more about John Boehners resurrection of the notion that were suffering weak job growth because people are living the good life on government benefits, and dont want to work. It has long seemed to me that the issue of unemployment benefits is where the debate over economic policy in a depression reaches its purest essence. If your on the right, you believe  you more or less have to believe  that unemployment benefits hurt job creation, because youre paying people not to work. To admit that depression conditions are different, that the economy is suffering from an overall lack of demand and that putting money into the pockets of people likely to spend it would increase employment, would mean admitting that the free market sometimes fails badly. And of course disdain for the unemployed helps a lot if you want to oppose any kind of aid for the unfortunate.

title: In Scotland and Beyond, a Crisis of Faith in the Global Elite
description: In Scotland this week, a measure to become an independent country and end the United Kingdom as we know it failed, but it would have succeeded with a swing of just 5 percent of the vote. Earlier in the week, a right-wing anti-immigration party in Sweden claimed its largest-ever share of parliamentary votes. And in the United States, new census data released this week showed that middle-income American families made 8 percent less last year, adjusted for inflation, than they did in 2007.

title: Coming Soon, a Century Late: A Black Film Gem
description: For decades, the seven reels from 1913 lay unexamined in the film archives of the Museum of Modern Art. Now, after years of research, a historic find has emerged: what MoMA curators say is the earliest surviving footage for a feature film with a black cast. It is a rare visual depiction of middle-class black characters from an era when lynchings and stereotyped black images were commonplace. Whats more, the material features Bert Williams, the first black superstar on Broadway. Williams appears in blackface in the untitled silent film along with a roster of actors from the sparsely documented community of black performers in Harlem on the cusp of the Harlem Renaissance. Remarkably, the reels also capture behind-the-scenes interactions between these performers and the directors.

title: In Checking Accounts, the Less You Have, the More You May Pay
description: Financial complexity doesnt happen only on Wall Street. Even a basic checking account is often no longer simple, because account rules and fees can vary widely  so widely, in fact, that the annual cost can range from zero to more than $700, according to the 2014 survey of checking account costs by WalletHub, a consumer finance information and social networking site.

title: Why Federal College Ratings Wont Rein In Tuition
description: College costs have been rising for decades. Slowing  or even better, reversing  that trend would get more people into college and help reduce student debt. The Obama administration is working on an ambitious plan intended to rein in college costs, and it deserves credit for tackling this tough job.

title: In Suburban Seattle, New Nests for Chinas Rich
description: As wealthy Chinese stash more of their fortunes overseas, theyre bidding up the value of everything from Bitcoins and Burgundy to Picassos and pink diamonds.

title: How to Thwart a Texting Driver
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Heimatsicherheitsamt (Trivial)
description: Josh Marshall returns to an old topic  the strangely un-American terminology the Bush administration imposed after 9/11. As he says, Homeland Security really doesnt sound like the America I thought we believed in.

title: Push for New Pact on Climate Change Is Plagued by Old Divide of Wealth
description: At 1 p.m. on Sunday, tens of thousands of demonstrators in Manhattan are expected to make as much noise as they can  with whistles, trumpets, even the tolling of church bells  to raise an alarm about the risks of climate change. Similar demonstrations are planned across the United States and in 161 other countries.

title: Franca Sozzani, Vogue Italia Editor, on the Magazine Industry
description: MILAN  Franca Sozzani, the 64-year-old editor of Vogue Italia, was exhausted.

title: Pass the Word: The Phone Call Is Back
description: Just a few years ago, it seemed that the old-fashioned phone call was going out of style. Smartphones were on the rise, and many people were using them for everything except making calls.

title: Emilio Pucci: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Milan

title: Regardless of Defeats, Coughlin Wont Lose His Passion
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  To familiarize an inquiring news media with his next opponent, to convey the formidable challenge awaiting his 0-2 Giants on Sunday against the 2-0 Houston Texans at MetLife Stadium, Coach Tom Coughlin went to a midweek news conference armed with facts, figures and the occasional fulmination.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: A Chance For the N.F.L. To Lift Society

title: After Surgery, Surprise $117,000 Medical Bill From Doctor He Didnt Know
description: Before his three-hour neck surgery for herniated disks in December, Peter Drier, 37, signed a pile of consent forms. A bank technology manager who had researched his insurance coverage, Mr. Drier was prepared when the bills started arriving: $56,000 from Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan, $4,300 from the anesthesiologist and even $133,000 from his orthopedist, who he knew would accept a fraction of that fee.

title: Bill Cunningham | Stardust
description: All was normal outside the shows during New York Fashion Week. Young people obsessed with fashion displayed wildly eccentric and creative styles of dress, getting the madness out of their systems before entering the professional fashion world, which is about commerce, not arty dressing. Lord & Taylors window, left, caught the spirit, as did Thom Browne, with whimsical accessorizing on very practical clothes. His show  on a grass runway, below  was like buckets of stardust falling on a fashion world that takes itself too seriously.

title: Polly Bergen Dies at 84; Emmy-Winning Actress
description: Polly Bergen, an actress, singer and businesswoman who won an Emmy Award in 1958 for her portrayal of the alcoholic torch singer Helen Morgan and was nominated for another 50 years later for her role on Desperate Housewives, died on Saturday at her home in Southbury, Conn. She was 84.

title: U.S. Suspects More Direct Threats Beyond ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  As the United States begins what could be a lengthy military campaign against the Islamic State, intelligence and law enforcement officials said another Syrian group, led by a shadowy figure who was once among Osama bin Ladens inner circle, posed a more direct threat to America and Europe.

title: A Rich History of Duels Between Captains Picks
description: In assembling the Ryder Cup teams representing the United States and Europe, the captains made picks that were treated as afterthoughts: the three golfers joining the nine who qualified on a points-for-performance basis in weekly tournaments worldwide over two years. But in the aftermath of the matches that begin Friday at Gleneagles in Scotland, the success or failure of the picks by Tom Watson of the United States and Paul McGinley of Europe may well have helped to determine the winner.

title: Nascar Rocks!
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  For a puzzle whose title purports to be about racecars, this one had me singing while I solved. We have Michael Ashleys theme about song titles punned up as what seem to be interview questions asked of racedrivers, but theres quite a bit of extra musical goodness in his grid as well.

title: Provincial Vote Is Seen as a Test for Sri Lankas President
description: NEW DELHI  Voters in a southeastern Sri Lankan province headed to the polls on Saturday in what is widely seen as a crucial test of whether President Mahinda Rajapaksa is likely to win a third term in the coming months.

title: Monarch Butterfly: A Journey of 2,000 Miles Guided by Mysterious Maps
description: Each autumn, thousands of monarch butterflies sweep southbound through New York City in one of the worlds most famous migrations. A journey of more than 2,000 miles will eventually take them to central Mexican fir forests, where they will winter on south-facing slopes in numbers large enough to break tree boughs. It is a migration substantially unlike those of birds.

title: Pasta With Caramelized Lemons
description: Melissa Clark caramelizes lemons and adds them to linguine with parsley and celery leaves.

title: Many Veterans Adapt to a Strange World, One With Walls
description: LOS ANGELES  For 30 years after Vietnam, Art Harmons address was a dry wash under the 210 freeway, where he tried to forget his tour as a 19-year-old helicopter gunner.

title: Demanding Liberty or Death, or Maybe a Touchdown
description: Chartered in 1766 as Queens College, Rutgers was renamed in 1825 in honor of a trustee, Henry Rutgers, a brewery heir from Manhattan who was a colonel in George Washingtons army during the American Revolution. That military connection might be one reason the class of 1949 bought a cannon to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the first college football game, a 6-4 Rutgers victory over Princeton.

title: Polish Player With Texas Ties Wins U.S. Masters Title
description: A Polish grandmaster who coaches a Texas universitys chess team won the United States Masters Championship over Labor Day weekend in North Carolina. The winner, Bartlomiej Macieja, who runs the chess program at the University of Texas at Brownsville, finished a half-point ahead of Yaroslav Zherebukh, a grandmaster from Ukraine. The field included 17 other grandmasters.

title: Behind Quaint Exterior Beats State-of-Art Heart
description: SAN ANTONIO  With the press of a button, the H-E-B Performance Hall in the Tobin Center for the Performing Arts can be transformed from a concert venue with traditional raked seating to a flat-floored dance hall. A mechanized flexible floor system elevates the seats on platforms, flips the platforms over, and then lowers them to create a flat, stained maple floor. The process takes 23 minutes.

title: Caution Until the End: Last-Minute Surprises
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a column for The Tribune.

title: Former Hampton Creek Executive Says He Will Not Advise Company
description: A top executive at Hampton Creek, the high-profile food and technology start-up, who left after only nine days on the job said on Friday he would not remain as an adviser, despite an earlier statement by the company that he would.

title: Candidates Vow to Kill Tuition Law Makes Some in His Party Squirm
description: If elected lieutenant governor in November, State Senator Dan Patrick, a Republican, has vowed to work to repeal the law that allows undocumented students to pay in-state tuition at Texas community colleges and universities.

title: Questioning an Ambitious Chancellors Vision
description: HOUSTON  Charles Haston was wearing a shirt emblazoned with the University of Texas at Austin longhorn logo when he showed up for orientation at the University of Houston  home of the Cougars  in the fall of 2008.

title: Fans Adoration of Derek Jeter Continues, but the Yankees Winning Streak Does Not
description: The love directed toward Derek Jeter, who is playing in his final few games at Yankee Stadium, is abundant. Each time he walks to the plate, he is greeted by a standing ovation. Almost every time he does something as routine as fielding a ground ball, the crowd chants his name.

title: Terence Moakley, Advocate for Disabled, Dies at 69
description: Terence J. Moakley, a persistent advocate for the disabled who fought for wheelchair users to have access to taxicabs and transit systems, died on Sept. 5 in Manhattan. He was 69.

title: G.M. Recalls Impalas and Cadillacs Over Risk of Brake Fires
description: WASHINGTON  General Motors is recalling more than 221,000 vehicles because of a parking-brake defect that can cause brake pads to stay partly engaged, which can lead to excessive brake heat that may result in a fire, according to documents posted Saturday on the National Highway Traffic Safety Administrations website.

title: De Blasio Orders a Greener City, Setting Goals for Energy Efficiency of Buildings
description: In a sweeping effort to reduce its environmental impact, New York City is planning to overhaul the energy-efficiency standards of all its public buildings and to pressure private landlords to make similar improvements.

title: Response Uneven to Jameis Winstons Wrongdoing
description: On Wednesday, shortly after he was suspended for the first half of Saturdays game against Clemson for shouting an obscene comment in the student union the day before, Jameis Winston realized the significance of his action: It might cost his team a loss  a loss it could ill afford as it strives to defend its national title.

title: Lane Kiffin, Alabamas New Offensive Mind, Shows His Mettle Against Florida
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  When Coach Nick Saban filled Alabamas offensive-coordinator vacancy, he could have selected from the cream of the coaching fraternity. Many college football observers were baffled after he picked the problematic Lane Kiffin rather than a fresh up-and-comer or a less polarizing veteran.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 20, 2014
Paris Falls Out of Love With the Padlocks on Its Bridges
description: PARIS  The regal Pont des Arts may be one of the most romantic bridges in Paris, at least to judge by the thousands of couples from around the world who have clamped padlocks to the railings as tokens of their desire to be locked in love forever.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, September 21, 2014

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 8:30 P.M. (CBS) MADAM SECRETARY Ta Leoni stars as Elizabeth McCord, a college professor and former C.I.A. analyst turned newly appointed secretary of state, who battles office politics and circumvents protocol as she navigates issues in the White House and abroad. Then there are matters with her husband and two children at home. Tim Daly plays her supportive spouse; Bebe Neuwirth is her chief of staff; Geoffrey Arend is her speechwriter; Keith Carradine is the president, and her former mentor; and Zeljko Ivanek (above left, with Mr. Carradine and Ms. Leoni) is his Dick Cheney-esque chief of staff. Hillary Rodham Clinton is the obvious inspiration, but this is Hillary with a human face: Ta Leoni, who has a husky voice and a loose, engaging manner, is an unusually likable beauty, Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times. As Elizabeth McCord, she has all the brains and determination of the original and none of the political ambition and baggage. Ms. Stanley added that a closer model for Mrs. Clinton can be found in the character of Alicia Florrick, the wife of a politician brought down by a sex scandal in The Good Wife. That shows sixth season begins at 9:30, with Alicia refusing to run for states attorney. She stands by his side for a while, then leaves him and restarts her legal career from scratch, Ms. Stanley said. Of the two series, The Good Wife stands out because it strikes the right balance of network-mandated virtue and cable-inspired vice. Madam Secretary has some good moments, but it would be better if its heroine were just a little bit worse.

title: 1939: Reich Maps Show France Partitioned, Says Daladier
description: In a radio speech, Premier Edouard Daladier stated maps showing the dismemberment of France had already been printed in Germany, thus proving that Hitlers assertion that he wanted nothing from France was as false as his past statements regarding Austria, Czecho-Slovakia and Poland. He refuted Hitlers attempt to disclaim war responsibility, said it was futile for Germany to try to dissociate France and England, and declared French soldiers would fight to the end to crush the system of threats and alarms. A Radio Agency report from Brussels said some dikes of the Albert Canal had been opened to cause floods between Antwerp and Lige, thus making it impossible for an enemy army to pass the north and northeastern frontiers with offensive weapons. Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain said Englands war budget would be presented to the House of Commons Wednesday. German radio stations started anti-French broadcasts. After a prolonged silence, Propaganda Minister Josef Goebbels summoned newspaper men to his office to tell them Germany did not intend to invade Holland or Belgium and to deny that there had been riots in Slovakia.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 22, 1939

title: 1964: Otto Grotewohl Dies at 70
description: BERLIN  East German Premier Otto Grotewohl died of a stroke today after a long illness that had kept him politically inactive for several years. He was 70. It was expected he would be succeeded by Willi Stoph, who has been acting premier. Mr. Grotewohl, a former Social Democrat, was regarded as a traitor by West European socialists because of his leading role in merging the Social Democratic party with the Communist party in 1946 to form the Communist-run Socialist Union party. A spokesman for the West German Socialist party said Mr. Grotewohl will always bear the stigma of sacrificing the Social Democratic party in the Soviet zone of Germany. He was also responsible for the death and imprisonment of thousands of fellow Social Democrats, the spokesman said. Politically, he has been a dead man for the past few years, he said, but he still served as bait for the regime.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 22, 1964

Africa will promise a clean-energy corridor stretching from Cairo to Cape Town. Pledges will be made to halve the destruction of the worlds forests by 2020 and stop it by 2030. The World Bank will lead a big push to put a global price on emissions of greenhouse gases.

title: $750,000 Grant  For Gibney Dance
description: The Andrew W. Mellon Foundation will contribute $750,000 to Gibney Dance to support its Dance in Process residency program, bolstering an impressive fund-raising year for the organization, which operates a dance company, two dance centers and a community action program for victims of domestic abuse. In January, the Agnes Varis Trust announced a $3 million gift that allowed Gibney Dance to take over and renovate a 36,000-square-foot space at 280 Broadway, next to City Hall, that Dance New Amsterdam relinquished when it declared bankruptcy a year ago. Over three years, the Mellon gift will provide 30 artists with a three-week residency at Gibneys other Manhattan space, 890 Broadway in the Flatiron district, where the company has been based since its founding in 1991. In 2011 the company significantly expanded its footprint in the building with additional studios; with the Mellon grant, it is establishing a choreographic center there. The Dance in Process program has been in pilot mode for the past two years with virtually no financial backing. The Mellon support will give it real depth and will really ground it, Gina Gibney, the chief executive and artistic director of Gibney Dance, said in an interview. We will be able to support these dance artists at a whole new level. The residency will focus specifically on midcareer artists, a demographic often left out of major funding support in favor of so-called established or emerging artists.
