title: The Rising Designer Atlantique Ascoli Opens Up Her Paris Black Book
description: Atlantique Ascoli is to design-world lore whatCharlotte Gainsbourg is to music legend: a Parisian daughter of two extremely cool people who grew up to create extremely cool things on her own. Ascolis mother, the fashion designer and onetime model Emmanuelle Khanh, personified Parisian chic in the 70s and 80s; her father, Quasar Khanh, is an avant-garde icon who pioneered inflatable furniture and a glass-cube car, among other inventions. Such an upbringing, Ascoli says, taught her to be open, regardless of the situation.

title: Prolific but Unassuming, a Troupe in High Gear
description: In the fifth-floor studios of City Center on Friday, Miro Magloire was sharing statistics about what his New Chamber Ballet had accomplished in the 10 years, pretty much to the day, since the company first performed there. The largest sum was large indeed. The number of ballets presented, almost all of them premieres: 93.

title: Existential and Erotic, Like a Flower Yielding to a Butterfly
description: WASHINGTON  The three-day celebration of Indias maestros of music and dance, presented under the name Utsav last weekend at the Kennedy Center, was nonpareil. This was a sequel to Utsavs first edition in 2013; I hope others will follow. I hope, too, that word will spread more widely. Although attendance at the Terrace Theater was very good, the festival seemed to draw largely people of Indian descent.

title: A Sorceress Stirs Up a Sense of Adventurousness
description: So much has been missing since the dissolution of New York City Opera last year. While smaller organizations and festivals have filled some of the void, a particular regret is losing the intriguing, inventive directorial vision City Opera showed at its best. Imagine comparing Christopher Aldens staging of Mozarts Le Nozze di Figaro, scheduled for that company last season and canceled, with the traditional Richard Eyre version that opened the Metropolitan Operas season on Monday.

title: Workers Unite at an Argentine Hotel
description: When Argentinas financial crisis left workers at the Hotel Bauen unemployed, they took over the hotel and ran it themselves.

description: Gov. Paul R. LePage of Maine wants to help the N.F.L. address its domestic violence problem.

title: Vocals and Instruments, Weaving a Bach Tapestry
description: The early-music vocal ensemble Tenet opened its season on Saturday evening at the Holy Trinity Lutheran Church with resplendent performances of four Bach motets, conducted by Scott Metcalfe. The group has sung this richly virtuosic choral music in the past, but here, following a practice that scholars believe Bach employed, it joined forces with the period-instrument ensemble the Sebastians, with each instrumentalist doubling one vocal line. A soprano might be twinned with a violin, for instance; a baritone with a bassoon. Some of the tenor parts, with their difficult-to-match range, were doubled by an oboe da caccia, the scimitar-shaped hunting oboe of Bachs time, with its distinct, throaty sound.

title: Evoking a Paris Nightclub in the 1920s
description: A glassy-eyed woman stood at the front of the stage, holding a red Christmas stocking, as the violinist Colin Jacobsen and the pianist Steven Beck played Schnittkes sardonic Silent Night, at Roulette in Brooklyn on Thursday evening. A man unwrapping the presents next to her found a pistol, a noose and scissors in the boxes.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere

title: Music Director Laments Lockout

title: The Wrecking Ball Targets a Former Army Base
description: FORT MONMOUTH, N.J.  When the Pentagon decided to close Fort Monmouth almost a decade ago, the community lamented the loss of more than 5,000 jobs and wondered what would happen to the sprawling Army base.

title: A Pretty Good Outfield in Los Angeles (Some Would Say Two)
description: LOS ANGELES  When Yasiel Puig, the Los Angeles Dodgers dynamic but not-quite-grown-up outfielder, made his major league debut last season, the teams clubhouse manager, Mitch Poole, was instructed by General Manager Ned Colletti to place Puigs locker near Adrian Gonzalezs, hopeful that a Spanish-speaking veterans presence would be helpful.

description: SAN FRANCISCO  For years, Thomas Goetz had been a spirited armchair advocate of the use of digital technology and data to improve health care.

title: Laure Heriard Dubreuil on What to Pack for Paris
description: Laure Heriard Dubreuil calls her Paris Fashion Week schedule grueling, before adding, but I love it! The CEO and founding partner of the influential Miami boutique the Webster  and a statesideParisienne plans to take in runway shows at Chanel, Christian Dior, Saint Laurent, Givenchy and Cline. Also on Dubreuils docket: Esteban Cortazars much-anticipated presentation; a slew of market appointments for the hundred-plus brands that the Webster stocks; co-hosting Pierre Hardys 15 Ans Dj disco-themed party; and completing a swimwear collection for Ers, to debut at Art Basel Miami Beach in December.

description: The Treasury Departments notice of proposed regulations to curb so-called inversions is smart and narrowly tailored. The new rules would take away some  but not all  of the reasons that a company might want to give up United States citizenship.

description: A TELEVISION network with modest ratings is hoping that audiences are holding out for a hero or, better yet for network executives, scads of them.

title: Pivotal Drive at Previous Tournament Didnt Occur on Course
description: GLENEAGLES, Scotland  As the top-ranked player and lodestar of the European team, Rory McIlroy is right back where he was two years ago at the last Ryder Cup, won by the Europeans with a Sunday singles session for the ages. McIlroy was instrumental in the upset of the Americans, but not before giving his squad of elders a few more gray hairs.

description: The Whitney Museum of American Art has been promised 75 seminal photographs from the New York collectors Sondra Gilman Gonzalez-Falla and Celso Gonzalez-Falla.

title: Sirius XM Loses Lawsuit on Royalties for Oldies
description: In a case that could have wide implications for the digital music business, a federal judge in California ruled on Monday that Sirius XM, the satellite radio giant, was liable for copyright infringement for failing to pay royalties on recordings made before 1972.

title: Academic Skills on Web Are Tied to Income Level
description: Wealthier students tend to perform better on tests of reading comprehension than their poorer peers, a longstanding trend that has been documented amply. But with the Internet having become an indispensable part of daily life, a new study shows that a separate gap has emerged, with lower-income students again lagging more affluent students in their ability to find, evaluate, integrate and communicate the information they find online.

title: Former Vatican Ambassador Is Facing Sexual Abuse Trial
description: The Vatican said on Tuesday that it had placed under house arrest and opened criminal proceedings against one of its former ambassadors, Archbishop Jozef Wesolowski, who has been accused of sexually abusing boys he met on the street while serving in the Dominican Republic.

title: First Draft Focus: White House Adds Another Fence, Kind Of
The Ancestors of ISIS
description: CAMBRIDGE, England  IN the last few years, there has been a dramatic rise of a seemingly new type of polity: the Islamic rebel state. Boko Haram in West Africa, the Shabab in East Africa, the Islamic Emirate in the Caucasus and, of course, the Islamic State in the Middle East, known as ISIS, or ISIL  these movements not only call for holy war against the West, but also use their resources to build theocracies.

title: A Health Care Success Story
description: IT may have been the most influential magazine article of the past decade. In June of 2009, the doctor and writer Atul Gawande published a piece in The New Yorker called The Cost Conundrum, which examined why the small border city of McAllen, Tex., was the most expensive place for health care in the United States.

title: I Do Means Youre Done
description: In and around Rome, the talk is of Pope Francis sage acceptance of the 21st century, of his empathy, of his departure from the stern moralizing on matters of the heart that his predecessors engaged in.

title: Strikes on ISIS. Now What?
Advertisers Navigate N.F.L.s Handling of Domestic Violence Cases
description: When Under Armour signed a 10-year agreement to put its name on the Baltimore Ravens practice facility in 2012, the company and the team envisioned a link between two hip brands.

title: A Mayors Words Inflame a Debate Over Spanish Attitudes on Women
description: VALLADOLID, Spain  The mayor of this city defended his recent comments about women who make false rape claims as unfortunate words. But for many women here, his remarks were a good example of why violence against women remains a serious problem in Spain.

title: Will the U.N. Help Countries Sheltering Syrian Refugees?
description: Question:

title: Scott Brown Loses Cosmos Support
description: Scott P. Brown had a broad grin on his face when he posed nude for Cosmopolitan back in the 1980s. But his smile may vanish if he picks up the latest issue.

title: ISIS Crisis
description: There is a tension at the heart of President Obamas campaign to confront the Islamic State, and it explains a lot about why he has so much trouble articulating and implementing his strategy. Quite simply, it is the tension between two vital goals  promoting the soul-searching that ISISs emergence has triggered in the Arab-Muslim world and searching and destroying ISIS in its strongholds in Syria and Iraq.

title: Companies Take the Baton in Climate Change Efforts
description: With political efforts to slow global warming moving at a tortuous pace, some of the worlds largest companies are stepping into the void, pledging more support for renewable energy, greener supply chains and fresh efforts to stop the destruction of the worlds tropical forests.

title: In Central Park, Cyclists Still Compete With Pedestrians
description: Two days after a Connecticut woman died of injuries sustained after she was hit by a bicycle, pedestrians and cyclists were vying for space on the popular loop road in Central Park where the accident occurred.

title: U.N. Climate Summit Harvests a Host of Commitments
description: Its heartening to review the summary of governmental and private climate and energy commitments compiled by United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-moon at the end of his daylong climate change summit. They range from a substantial new push to reduce and eventually eliminate forest loss to boosted investment in a planned clean-energy corridor in Africa.

title: U.S. Is Carrying Out Vast Majority of Strikes on ISIS, Military Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  The vast majority of airstrikes launched against Sunni militant targets in Syria have been carried out by American war planes and ship-based Tomahawk cruise missiles, military officials said Tuesday, in what they described as the successful beginning of a long campaign to degrade and destroy the Islamic State.

title: Could the U.N. Meet Outside of New York?
description: Question:

title: Cracking Down on Corporate Tax Games
description: New rules from the Treasury Department are likely to slow the offensive practice that allows American companies to avoid taxes by merging with foreign rivals. Known as corporate inversions, these are complex, modern variations on the practices of yesteryear, when companies dodged their taxes by moving their addresses to post office boxes in the Caribbean.

title: While Syrian Volunteers Seek Support, Crisis Worsens at Home
description: Raed Saleh woke up in his Manhattan hotel room at 8 a.m. on Tuesday to news of airstrikes at home in Syria.

title: For High School Football Coaches and Fans, a New Digital Blitz
description: SAN ANTONIO  Time for some Texas high school football, heavily assisted by modern technology.

title: Wrong Turn on Syria: Helping Assad?
description: Its fair to assume that President Bashar al-Assad of Syria was awed, but not shocked, by the barrage of bombs that American planes dropped early Tuesday over insurgent-held areas in northern Syria. It appears, in fact, that he was quite pleased.

title: Under Affordable Care Act, 25 Percent Increase in Health Insurers Is Predicted
description: WASHINGTON  Consumers in much of the country will have a broader selection of health insurance plans next year, the Obama administration said Tuesday, as it predicted an increase of about 25 percent in the number of insurers that are expected to compete in federal and state marketplaces.

title: Where Profit Margins Are Hefty, Online Upstarts Muscle In
description: Venture capitalists see opportunity in facial stubble.

title: Blacks, Baseball and the Civil War
description: The Civil War era revolutionized the still-nascent game of baseball in America  and not just for whites. During the war black baseball clubs increased; in the postwar period they sought recognition and equal treatment by white clubs and state and national baseball associations. But as in so many parts of national life, those achievements were ultimately limited and soon foreshortened: While black players gained respect from some members of the ball-playing fraternity, racist stereotypes, discrimination and segregation barred them from achieving equality on Americas diamonds.

title: Philippines Concerned About China, Leader Says
description: The president of the Philippines expressed concern on Tuesday about what he called the hot to cold messages from China in the protracted territorial disputes with his country  and others in the region  over areas of the South China Sea.

title: Wrong Turn on Syria: No Convincing Plan
description: President Obama has put America at the center of a widening war by expanding into Syria airstrikes against the Islamic State, the Sunni extremist group known as ISIS and ISIL. He has done this without allowing the public debate that needs to take place before this nation enters another costly and potentially lengthy conflict in the Middle East.

title: Detective in Etan Patz Case Admits He Added Words to Suspects Transcript
description: Just before he was about to confess his role in the death of Etan Patz, the suspect offered a blander assertion, according to a transcript of his confession: I am here voluntarily.

title: In Offense-Rich Big 12, Defense Rises
description: In Morgantown, W.Va., on Saturday night, it looked like just another Big 12 scoring spectacle  for a half. There were sparks flying on the scoreboard, receivers out of breath and defenses flummoxed. No. 4 Oklahoma was tied, 24-24, with West Virginia, and all the conjecture that the Sooners, a national championship contender, had made strides in fixing their defense during the past two seasons seemed overblown in the 30-minute offensive bonanza.

title: New Rules Make Inversions Less Lucrative, Experts Say
description: Inversions, the hottest deal structure on Wall Street, appear to be safe for now. But they just became less profitable and more difficult to pull off.

title: Appointed to Redeem Secret Service, Director Will Discuss Another Misstep
description: WASHINGTON  Julia Piersons drive-time last Friday night was spent in her car listening to the radio traffic of her officers and agents as she headed home after a day immersed in the gritty details of how to protect President Obama and 140 world leaders at the United Nations this week.

title: Documents on A.I.G.
description: Maurice R. Greenberg sued the United States Treasury and the Federal Reserve Bank of New York in 2011, contending that their takeover of A.I.G. in 2008 was improper.

title: Toasting With a Half-Full Glass
description: David Brooks: Do you mind if I go the narcissistic route and ask you about my own column?

title: As Concerts Return to Forest Hills Stadium, So Do Complaints
description: Before the music came back, most people in the brick townhouses and apartment buildings of Forest Hills didnt give much thought to the crumbling, steel-and-concrete Romanesque stadium abandoned by the United States Open 37 years ago.

title: America Out of Whack
description: There is something out of whack in America. Instead of promoting equality, public policy has left millions locked into lives of restricted opportunity while bestowing the benefits of growth on the very few.

title: Remains of Sole Belgian Victim of World Trade Center Attack Are Identified
description: Patrice Braut. Among the hundreds of nameless who repose next to the National September 11 Memorial and Museum, there is now a name.

title: Rescued by Music Long Ago, He Sets His Life Story to Hip-Hop
description: Like Jean-Jacques Rousseau set to a hip-hop beat, Craig Grant offers his confessions in A Sucker Emcee, produced by the Labyrinth Theater Company. While a D.J. (Rich Medina) bops between two turntables, scratching and spinning, Mr. Grant tells the story of his life in rhymed couplets.

title: Get Off the Ground
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  For those of you who have not yet met him, Andy Kravis is sort of phenomenal. Hes an attorney working as a fellow at Lambda Legal, and hes not only an indie crossword puzzle constructor, but he also blogs the occasional puzzle over at Diary of a Crossword Fiend and was the first season winner of NBCs The Million Second Quiz Show.

title: Wall St. Bankrolls Ex-Executive as He Sues Over A.I.G. Bailout
description: One might call it chutzpah, as several irate lawmakers did, or rubbing salt in the wounds of the American taxpayer. But to a few Wall Street financiers, a lawsuit that accuses the government of shortchanging the American International Group in its 2008 bailout is something else: a promising investment in a cause they support.

title: Accused of Bilking Client, Long Island Democrat Ends State Senate Bid
description: David Denenberg, the Democratic candidate in a highly competitive State Senate race on Long Island, abruptly ended his campaign on Tuesday after his former law firm accused him of fraud.

title: Owner of Grand Central Vies With Developer Over Skyscraper on an Adjacent Block
description: A little-known investor who owns Grand Central Terminal made a $400 million offer on Tuesday to buy an adjoining block where he plans to build a skyscraper so tall that it would loom over the Chrysler Building.

title: Europes Anti-Semitism Comes Out of the Shadows
description: SARCELLES, France  From the immigrant enclaves of the Parisian suburbs to the drizzly bureaucratic city of Brussels to the industrial heartland of Germany, Europes old demon returned this summer. Death to the Jews! shouted protesters at pro-Palestinian rallies in Belgium and France. Gas the Jews! yelled marchers at a similar protest in Germany.

title: Suit Details Firing and Suicide of 92nd Street Y Director
description: The event raised $4.2 million and featured a performance by the singer Jennifer Hudson, but that is not what Deborah Adler mentions when she thinks back to the 92nd Street Ys spring gala in May 2013. Several board members came over to me and said he needs to take a little time off  hes looking a little tired, she recalled on Tuesday.

title: The Cost for Arab Bank Is a Complex Calculation
description: With a landmark judgment on Monday declaring Arab Bank liable for knowingly supporting terrorism, the case now turns to another complicated calculation: the cost of that liability.

title: Rookie Mistakes Haunt Geno Smith in Second Year With Jets
description: Rookie quarterbacks are expected to be confused by various defensive looks, leading to critical turnovers and red-zone failures, amid other problems. Geno Smith fit that profile last season with 21 interceptions and four fumbles, many of them putting the Jets into deep holes and significantly contributing to their 8-8 record.

title: Cleared After Nearly 23 Years in Prison, but Not Free
description: Striding across a jailhouse visiting room on Saturday, Everton Wagstaffe  innocent in the eyes of the law, a prisoner of the persistence that liberated him  craned his neck to see who was waiting. He grinned broadly, stuck out his hand to welcome visitors, then apologized for an undetectable shortfall in personal hygiene.

title: Lottery Numbers
New Yorks Slow Comeback to Title of the Big Oyster
description: Its a big one, Chris Anderson shouted through his divers mask when he surfaced.

title: Caldwell Jones, Shot-Blocking Basketball Star, Dies at 64
description: Caldwell Jones, a beanpole of a center and power forward who blocked more than 2,200 shots in his 17-year pro career and played in three National Basketball Association finals with the Philadelphia 76ers, died on Sunday in Stockbridge, Ga. He was 64.

title: In Colorado, a Student Counterprotest to an Anti-Protest Curriculum
description: ARVADA, Colo.  A new conservative school board majority here in the Denver suburbs recently proposed a curriculum-review committee to promote patriotism, respect for authority and free enterprise and to guard against educational materials that encourage or condone civil disorder. In response, hundreds of students, teachers and parents gave the board their own lesson in civil disobedience.

title: Pati Hill, Author Turned Artist of the Photocopier, Dies at 93
description: Pati Hill, an acclaimed author of fiction in the 1950s and 60s who later turned to visual art, distinguishing herself with images made from a relatively new artistic tool  an IBM photocopier  died on Friday at her home in Sens, France. She was 93.

title: Orioles Power Surge Pushes Yankees to the Brink of Elimination
description: Manager Joe Girardi, like many Yankee fans watching at home and at Yankee Stadium, had a happy vision in his head. It had to do with the man at the plate, Derek Jeter, who was batting with two outs in the ninth inning, the Yankees trailing by a run and a runner on first base.

title: Protection for Wolves Is Restored in Wyoming
description: A federal judge restored Endangered Species Act protection for wolves in Wyoming on Tuesday, ruling that the federal Fish and Wildlife Service accepted a state commitment to maintain the wolf population without requiring adequate safeguards.

title: A California Dream: Not Having to Settle for Just One Bedroom
description: IRVINE, Calif.  This was the state that embodied the middle-class American dream: Move west, acquire a small slice of property, perhaps with a palm tree or two.

title: His Future Secure, G.M. Sees a Bright One at Citi Field
description: The Mets had just announced that Sandy Aldersons contract as general manager had been extended through 2017 and that Terry Collins would return next year as manager, and the conference call had just started. Jeff Wilpon, the teams chief operating officer, was praising Alderson and the progress he had made.

title: The Best New Stands at the Paul Bert Serpette Antiques Market in Paris
description: In Pariss Saint-Ouen neighborhood just north of the city, the old is becoming new again: The Paul Bert Serpette antiques market inside the famed 129-year-old Les Puces flea market is experiencing a rebirth, thanks to a group of young dealers opening up shop there. In the fall 2014 design issue, T introduces readers to a few of these New Kids on The Block and their collections.

title: Apartment With the Brass Cube
description: The Scandinavian architecture firm Claesson Koivisto Rune infuses its pared-back aesthetic with warmth, lightness and a bit of good humor, all of which are on display in this home in Stockholm.

title: Pale Beauty
description: The renowned decorator Stephen Sills has remained in the same very small apartment that burnished his reputation more than two decades ago, when he was just starting out. Its recent renovation reveals he has spent that time perfecting his craft.

title: New Kids on the Block

title: Fringe Benefits
description: Worn by French ingnues, literary rebels or political heavyweights, the perfect bangs  long and full of mystery  are enough to make anyone pick up the shears.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (ABC) NASHVILLE Rayna (Connie Britton, above with Charles Esten) must choose between Deacon (Mr. Esten) and Luke (Will Chase) in this Season 3 opener, which features live performances by Mr. Esten, Chris Carmack and Florida Georgia Line inserted into the episode. Mr. Carmack will sing If Its Love, written by the Striking Matches, and Mr. Esten will perform I Know How to Love You Now, which he wrote with Deana Carter.

title: Is Exercise Bad for Your Teeth?
description: Vigorous exercise is good for almost all of the body  except perhaps the teeth, according to a surprising new study of athletes. The study, published in The Scandinavian Journal of Medicine & Science in Sports, found that heavy training may contribute to dental problems in unexpected ways.

title: Marriage Rates Keep Falling, as Money Concerns Rise
description: Of all the milestones on the road to adulthood, Americans are increasingly forgoing one of the biggest: marriage.

title: Saks Embraces Lower Manhattan
description: Saks Fifth Avenue will announce on Wednesday that it is making a major commitment to Lower Manhattan by opening a new Saks Fifth Avenue department store, opening Manhattans first Off 5th outlet store, and moving its United States headquarters to the heart of New Yorks financial district.

title: Western Governments Criticize Uighur Scholars Punishment
description: The United States and the European Union have criticized Chinas actions against the Uighur scholar Ilham Tohti, who was convicted of separatism on Tuesday and sentenced to life in prison.

title: Paris Fashion Week Morning Report
description: Its due to be a balmy 60-odd degrees (or around 17-18 Celsius for those reading along on this side of the Atlantic) in Paris, and Fashion Week has officially begun.

title: Corrections: September 24, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, September 24, 2014.

description: Below are the first six paragraphs of a Sept. 19 article, Right Up to Retirement, Derek Jeter Is Still Playing the Game.

title: Australian Police Say Terror Suspect Was Killed After Slashing Officers
description: SYDNEY, Australia  An 18-year-old man who was fatally shot after wounding two police officers near Melbourne was a known terror suspect whose passport had been confiscated, Australian officials said Wednesday.

title: Shareholders  Advised to Reject Sherborne Bid for Electra Seats
description: LONDON  Electra Private Equity said on Wednesday that two influential shareholder advisory services had recommended that investors reject a bid by the activist investor Edward J. Bramson for two seats on the firms board of directors.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Obama, After Airstrikes in Syria, Says U.S. Will Take the Fight to ISIS
description: In the article Obama, After Airstrikes in Syria, Says U.S. Will Take the Fight to ISIS, Mark Landler, Ben Hubbard and Helene Cooper write about the American-led coalition that conducted airstrikes in Syria against the Islamic State. Use both the video above and the article to answer the questions below.

title: Militant Cleric Acquitted of Terrorism Charges
description: AMMAN, Jordan  A militant Islamic cleric known as Abu Qatada walked free on Wednesday after a state security court here acquitted him on terrorism charges, punctuating 15 years of legal battles with the Jordanian and British authorities.

title: President Enrique Pea Nieto of Mexico to Address U.N. General Assembly
description: President Enrique Pea Nieto of Mexico is expected to promote a series of steps to modernize and remake the Mexican economy and raise the standard of living when he addresses the United Nations General Assembly on Wednesday morning.

title: Study Links Anxiety Drugs to Alzheimers Disease
description: I swear I dont go looking for alarming news about benzodiazepines, drugs widely prescribed for insomnia and anxiety. But it shows up with some frequency, so, mindful of your fervidly held views on the subject, I am donning a hazmat suit to bring you the latest findings from the medical journal BMJ.

title: Workers Unite at an Argentine Hotel
description: In the midst of Argentinas financial crisis, Martn Barzilai dropped in on meetings where workers who had lost their jobs defiantly organized themselves to revive the businesses their bosses had closed.

title: What Is Your Reaction to the Performance and Protest Piece Carry That Weight?
description: Have you read or heard about Emma Sulkowicz, the Columbia University student who has been protesting the universitys handling of a sexual assault she says happened to her as a sophomore?

title: On a Shoestring, India Sends Orbiter to Mars on Its First Try
description: NEW DELHI  An Indian spacecraft affectionately nicknamed MOM reached Mars orbit on Wednesday, beating Indias Asian rivals to the Red Planet and outdoing the Americans, the Soviets and the Europeans in doing so on a maiden voyage and a shoestring budget.

title: Hood by Air Takes Paris Fashion Week
description: The invitation for Hood by Airs Tuesday evening presentation, its first as part of the official Paris calendar, was printed on a pair of lace-bordered thong panties, which, the fashion consultant and eco-activist Julie Gilhart noted approvingly, were easily recyclable.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: A Safer, Cleaner United Nations Hall
description: Its sort of a yellowish-brown product, said Michael Adlerstein, an assistant secretary general of the United Nations. Like scum on a dirty sink.

title: New York Today: Hello, High Holy Days
description: Good fair Wednesday morning to you.

title: Why The Cosby Show Still Matters
description: No one expected The Cosby Show to change the world. If anything, NBC executives hoped the show might survive by riding the coattails of its namesake  the comedian Bill Cosby, who based much of the sitcom on extracts from his highly popular stand-up act and real-life interactions with his own family.

title: Santander and UniCredit in Talks to Combine Asset Management Units
description: LONDON  Banco Santander said on Wednesday that it was in talks to potentially combine its asset management arm in a joint venture with Pioneer Global Asset Management, a unit of UniCredit of Italy.

title: Daily Report: Digital Technology Transforms High School Football
description: On a recent 90-degree Saturday night at Heroes Stadium in San Antonio, with the lights flickering on at sunset, the Knights of Byron P. Steele II High School opened their season before a crowd of more than 6,500, Quentin Hardy reports.

title: Hong Kongs Former No. 2 Official Says Beijing Paid Him $1.42 Million
description: What is being called one of the biggest corruption trials in Hong Kongs history turned up an unexpected element when the citys former No. 2 official said he received a secret payment of 11 million Hong Kong dollars, or $1.42 million, from Beijing, the local news media reported.

title: A Birthday Party, of Sorts, for U.S. Prosecutors in New York
description: It is one of the oldest, unofficial legal fraternities in the United States: lawyers who either currently or once worked as a federal prosecutor in Manhattan. And on Tuesday night, more than 700 former and current prosecutors got together for a birthday party that also posed a bit of security challenge for law enforcement.

title: Amid a Maze of Alliances, Syrian Kurds Find a Thorny Refuge at the Border
description: SURUC, Turkey  Turkish tanks dot the hills here, guarding against Islamic State militants advancing just across the Syrian border. Lines of police officers fan out across fields, brandishing shields to stem the flow of Syrian Kurds fleeing the militants.

title: Civil Disorder, Out of the Curriculum and Into the Streets
description: Have you tried yet to teach your children how to change the world? Told them stories of world changers, like Mohandas K. Gandhi or the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, and how they led others in protest against the injustices they saw and believed society could not abide?

title: Hunting for the Source of the Worlds Most Beguiling Folk Music
description: On Sept. 20, 1926, the Greek violinist Alexis Zoumbas recorded one of the most devastating bits of music Ive ever encountered. The song, Epirotiko Mirologi, is a pentatonic lament  mirologi  that, for millenniums, has been sung beside fresh graves in Epirus, a historically contentious chunk of land on the Greek-Albanian border. The performance is a little over four minutes long, instrumental and largely improvised against the low anchoring drone of some unnamed accompanist dragging a bow across a double bass. Zoumbas was a technically proficient musician, even virtuosic, but his real gift was in effectively articulating disintegration. There is a palpable hysteria to his playing; each note trembles, as if he has recently suffered an emotional collapse of unknowable magnitude.

title: Thai-Style Thai
description: Pim Techamuanvivit is an old-school restaurateur, a person who knows her cuisine inside out, but she has found an intriguing new way to run a non-European restaurant. Born in Bangkok in the 70s, into a family where delicious food was cooked and showcased daily, she came to the United States in the early 90s to study cognitive science, specifically the subject of group collaboration. The skills appear to have set her up perfectly for opening a restaurant.

title: Cdric Charlier: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: With Apples iOS 8, Your Fingerprint Can Become the Master Password
description: Passwords stink. That was the lesson learned from the recent episode in which hackers broke into the Apple accounts of a number of celebrities.

title: Searching for Meaning at a Company That Finishes Metal Parts
description: A friends wife died of cancer. Her death grabbed me someplace deep inside. I didnt even know her that well. But it grabbed me and made me think.

title: Today in Politics
description: Obama on a War Footing at the United Nations

title: In China, Trial Begins for Former Official Accused of Taking Millions in Bribes
description: BEIJING  A former top Chinese economic official accused of taking millions of dollars in bribes went on trial on Wednesday, the latest step in a case prompted by an investigative journalist amid a widening campaign against corruption.

title: Fashions Just Gotta Dance
description: I blame Rick Owens. Ever since his fashion-week-stealing step-dancing show of this time last year, fashion has had something of an obsession with dance, and vice versa.

title: Morning Agenda: Wall St. Helps Out A.I.G.s Ex-Chief
description: WALL ST. BANKROLLS A.I.G.S EX-CHIEF | Maurice R. Greenberg, the former chief executive of the American International Group, is getting by with a little help from his friends. To help cover the cost of a lawsuit that accuses the government of shortchanging A.I.G. in its 2008 bailout, Mr. Greenberg has raised several million dollars from three Wall Street companions, Ben Protess and Aaron M. Kessler write in DealBook. The investors, who are entitled to a cut of any damages Mr. Greenberg collects from the government, are said to have contributed about 15 percent of the tens of millions of dollars in legal costs. The lawsuit is set to go to trial next week in Washington.

title: 1914: Germans Bring Up Guns
description: ANTWERP  There is information from a reliable source to the effect that, in spite of the very heavy rain, the Germans are bringing up toward Antwerp siege guns with a range of at least seventeen miles. It is also stated on good authority that there has been during the past few weeks a movement of German troops at Liege. Opinions are divided as to whether these are going to Russia or coming to reinforce the Germans in Brussels. Antwerp is provisioned to stand a twelve months siege. Cattle has been arriving from America at the rate of 3,000 head a week for the past six weeks. Fearing that the Germans will cut off supplies from Ostend, the Belgians had several thousand head of cattle and many thousand pigs placed in pens in the fields surrounding every town. The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 25, 1914

Instead, after their plane landed in the southern city of Marseille, they walked free while French intelligence officers waited at the wrong airport, hundreds of miles away.

title: Ban Ki-Moon Says U.N. Must Answer the Call to Fight Climate Change, Ebola and Extremism
description: Scolding the powerful and the power-hungry, the United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, opened the 69th annual session of the General Assembly on Wednesday morning, in a 13-minute speech that rued the state of the world, from the conflict in Ukraine to the bombing of United Nations schools in Gaza to beheadings in Iraq and Syria  all before warning of the Ebola outbreak.

title: Milan Fashion Week Accessories
description: Barbie-inspired bags at Moschino, 70s style boots at Gucci and more details from the spring 2015 shows.

title: Charlatans and Cranks Forever
description: Back when Paul Ryan released his first big-splash budget  the one that had the commentariat cooing over its seriousness  it included a link to an absurd Heritage Foundation analysis claiming, among other things, that the plan would drive the unemployment rate down to 2.8 percent. (Heritage then tried, unsuccessfully, to send its nonsense down the memory hole and pretend it never happened.) Ryan defenders tried to claim that the plan didnt actually rely on that Heritage stuff; but as some of us tried to explain, the plan actually didnt add up, relying on a multi-trillion-dollar magic asterisk on tax receipts. And we predicted that sooner or later Ryan would embrace magical theories about how tax cuts increase revenue.

title: The World at Night
description: To be a modern bedtime story is to exist in the shadow of Goodnight Moon. That laconic little 1947 book is so indelible that after reading it to a child night after night for a few weeks, you feel Margaret Wise Browns cadences burrowed into your brain. Its so subtly forceful that the flagrant red-and-green of Clement Hurds illustrations somehow never makes you think of Christmas, evoking instead the books own peculiar yet comforting universe.

title: South Korea Formally Announces Intent to Buy 40 Lockheed Fighter Jets
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea formally announced on Wednesday that it would buy 40 F-35A fighter jets from the American defense contractor Lockheed Martin in a deal that includes transfers of technology for the development of the countrys own advanced fighter jet.

title: Having It and Flaunting It
description: David Brooks is getting some ribbing for suggesting that the wealthy should follow a code of seemliness, not living the lavish lifestyles they can afford. I dont want to join in the jeering; instead, I want to talk a bit about the economics of flaunting your wealth (which was actually a topic I was working on before Davids last column).

title: Fort Greene, Brooklyn: A Neighborhood With Many Faces
description: Amid New Yorks variegated urban landscape, Fort Greene has been known since the 19th century for its low-rise human habitat: intimately scaled, tree-lined blocks of brownstones, brick rowhouses and occasional frame houses. But a lofty new habitat is emerging on the neighborhoods western edge, as a forest of mixed-use towers rises in the Brooklyn Cultural District around the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Peter Jay Sharp Building on Lafayette Avenue. Incorporating more than 1,200 new apartments into a kind of high-rise Lincoln Center, the district will be home in the next few years to more than 400,000 square feet of cultural space, including performance, rehearsal and studio facilities.

title: 1939: Advice on Heating Issued
description: The Secretary General of the Passive Defense yesterday issued a communiqu denying rumors that Paris buildings containing air-raid shelters have been instructed to cut off their central heating systems. Proprietors of apartments and boarding houses were advised, however, to take certain precautions. Entrance to the furnace room must not be by way of the shelter. During air-raid warnings the shafts of heating systems must be closed. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 25, 1939

title: 36 Hours in Florence, Italy
description: Florence was thrust into the spotlight in February when its mayor, the dynamic 39-year-old Matteo Renzi, became Italys youngest prime minister. But the Tuscan capital he left behind appears to be flourishing. Once-neglected landmarks have been repurposed as contemporary cultural spaces. This spring, the historic Mercato Centrale market hall unveiled a new floor filled with stalls from the regions top food artisans, and an ultramodern new opera house began hosting regular performances during the annual Maggio Musicale Fiorentino festival. Meanwhile, a spate of recent openings  bars, boutiques and restaurants squirreled away from the tourist throngs  suggests that the citys upward trajectory isnt changing course anytime soon.

title: Painted-On Lip Rings at Dries Van Noten
description: Its all about a modern girl who loves going to festivals like Burning Man, explained the makeup maestro Peter Philips about the Dries Van Noten beauty look this morning. Shes a little alternative and she loves nature. His earthy vision  totally clean skin, no mascara, no eyebrows and no blush  worked harmoniously with the nearly 120-foot-long moss-inspired carpet that spanned the runway, not to mention the wild fauna prints that surfaced over breezy, bohemian silhouettes. There was, however, one subtle beauty element, he said. Its a subtle golden line drawn down the center of the lip that resembles a lip piercing when it catches the light. Safer and far less painful than the real thing, Philips faux-metal adornment simply requires a slick of Make Up For Evers Aqua Liner in Diamond Gold, applied via a fine MAC eyeliner brush. Looking back to the Rodarte runway, where eyebrows were studded with clip-on hoops, it seems piercings are making their mark for spring 2015.

title: Shadows Return to Ellis Island

For veterans of a military that prides itself on discipline and strict adherence to protocol, it was careless at best and disrespectful at worst.

title: Hurricane Sandy Blows Through Brooklyn Again

On Tuesday, Landfall, a song cycle for string quartet, voice and electronics by the performance artist Laurie Anderson, swept over the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Harvey Theater, setting the auditorium awash in elegiac string sounds and postmillennial gloom.

title: Julien David Debuts His Spring/Summer 2015 Collection With a Dance Video
description: The Paris-born, Tokyo-based designer Julien Davids collections frequently riff on activewear and streetwear. For his spring/summer 2015 range, called Etudes et Preludes  which hell show in Paris on Friday  David turned to what he calls the athletic side of ballet dancing for inspiration, specifically the work of his friend Maria Kochetkova, a principal at the San Francisco Ballet. In this exclusive preview of a short film by the director Antoine Wagner, Kochetkova takes the collection for a spin at the barre and beyond.

title: A Nation in Transition: Investigating Evolving Research and Policy on Marijuana
description: Marijuana is illegal in the United States. Yet 35 states and the District of Columbia permit some form of marijuana consumption for medical purposes, and, as of this year, two states now allow its recreational use.

title: ISIS Harsh Brand of Islam Is Rooted in Austere Saudi Creed
description: BAGHDAD  Caliph Ibrahim, the leader of the Islamic State, appeared to come out of nowhere when he matter-of-factly proclaimed himself the ruler of all Muslims in the middle of an otherwise typical Ramadan sermon. Muslim scholars from the most moderate to the most militant all denounced him as a grandiose pretender, and the world gaped at his growing following and its vicious killings.

title: Video: Security Council to Address Threat Posed by Foreign Fighters
description: The United Nations Security Council will meet this afternoon to discuss a binding resolution, proposed by President Obama, that would commit all countries to put in place domestic laws to prosecute those who travel abroad to join terrorist organizations and those who help them, including by raising funds. Mr. Obama will lead the meeting, an encore to his morning speech to the General Assembly where he presented a new plan for United States involvement  and international cooperation  in the Middle East.

title: At Second Base, Stealing a Souvenir Moment With Derek Jeter

It was Aug. 1, 2009, and Beckham had just hit a double, knocking the pitcher out of the game. During the pitching change, he and Jeter engaged in the typical mundane banter to fill the gap.

title: White House Reporters Working on Pool End-Around

title: A Lesson in Risk Management in a Jets Defeat
description: Early in the fourth quarter of Monday nights game between the Jets and the Bears, Coach Rex Ryan found himself with a difficult fourth-down decision. The Jets were down by 8 points and facing a fourth-and-2 at the Bears 24-yard line. There were 9 minutes 56 seconds remaining  plenty of time. Ryan did what coaches do more than 80 percent of the time in those situations: He sent out his kicker. Nick Folk kicked the field goal successfully, cutting the Bears lead to 5.

title: Diversity, Strong Editing and Moving Forward From the Shonda Rhimes Furor
description: In more than two years as public editor at The Times, Ive encountered very few subjects that have aroused as much passion and reaction as an Arts & Leisure article about the TV producer Shonda Rhimes and the stereotype of the Angry Black Woman the story leaned on. I wrote about it on Monday, and quickly hundreds of readers responded in deeply felt comments; my email has been overflowing with more commentary; and many people I know, inside and outside The Times, have been eager to talk about it. And other writers (Emily Nussbaum at The New Yorker, Linda Holmes at NPR, and many others) have taken it up.

title: New British Center Seeks to Offer Ideas on Preventing Financial Crises
description: LONDON  The list of remedies to prevent a future financial calamity is long, and depending how closely you look, complicated. Banks must hold more capital, the system must have less risk and more rules now govern more institutions.

title: In Liberia, Home Deaths Spread Circle of Ebola Contagion
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  The family of the sick man, who had endured Ebolas telltale symptoms for six days, took him by taxi to treatment centers here in the capital twice, only to be turned back at the gate each time for lack of beds. He died at home, his arms thrashing violently and blood spewing out his mouth, in front of his sons.

title: A Calm Exterior, Sure, but Theres More Going On
description: Neither Wolf Hall nor Bring Up the Bodies is the Hilary Mantel book most relevant to The Assassination of Margaret Thatcher, her new volume of short stories. Instead, the germane book is her 2003 memoir, Giving Up the Ghost. That book describes a woman who is passive, illness-plagued and spooked. The narrators of these stories are much more like Ms. Mantels description of herself than like the ironclad Machiavellians who dominate her Thomas Cromwell trilogy-in-progress.

She lives in Florida, likes playing Dance Dance Revolution, and has known since she was about 14that she was not, nor would she ever be, sexually attracted to anyone. Ever. As she writes on her blog, Im thirty-six years old, not interested in dating or marriage, and not planning to have children. In other words, Im an aromantic asexual woman.
