description: Doctors and nurses are finally volunteering to fight the Ebola virus in West Africa after a long period of paralyzing fear in which almost none stepped forward.

title: Scaled-Down Luxury on East End Avenue
description: The philosophy behind 20 East End Avenue, a classically featured gray-brick apartment building taking up residence near such distinguished edifices as Vincent Astors 120 East End Avenue, is that you dont have to own a 20-room apartment to live as though you do.

title: Under Pact, Russians to Give Gas to Ukraine
description: BERLIN  European officials said Friday that they had brokered a deal between Russia and Ukraine aimed at ensuring gas flows to keep factories running and homes warm over the next six months, despite a dispute over the size of Ukraines outstanding bills.

title: Sounds Like a Gershwin Song
description: As the grooms kissed to seal their vows on a rooftop terrace in Long Island City, Queens, a quintet burst into the Gershwin tune They All Laughed. Most in attendance knew the words by heart and smiled knowingly as they listened and silently recalled the song: They laughed at me, wanting you. ... Now theyll have to change their tune. ... But ho, ho, ho, whos got the last laugh now?

title: Book Review Podcast: Texting While Driving
description: In The New York Times Book Review, Robert Kolker reviews Matt Richtels A Deadly Wandering: A Tale of Tragedy and Redemption in the Age of Attention, about Reggie Shaw, who crossed the line of a Utah highway in September 2006 while texting a girlfriend. Two men in another car were killed in the ensuing accident. Mr. Kolker writes:

title: At Ryder Cups First Hole, a Rousing Start, With a Chorus
description: GLENEAGLES, Scotland  You never know where a Ryder Cup match might finish, but you do know where one starts, which explained the crush outside of Gleneagles very early Friday morning.

title: FIFAs Sepp Blatter Says Corruption Report Will Remain Secret
description: Sepp Blatter, the president of FIFA, insisted Friday that an investigative report into the bidding for the 2018 and 2022 World Cups should remain private, despite growing pressure for its release from inside and outside soccers world governing body.

title: Vincent Piazza: 40 Blocks From Home, but a World Away
description: In five seasons of playing Lucky Luciano on HBOs Boardwalk Empire, Vincent Piazza never had to shoot scenes on a Sunday. Sunday is a reflective day, a thoughtful day, he said. Now, with the show heading toward a promised bloody end later this fall, Mr. Piazza has plenty to reflect on, including, as of earlier this year, a new neighborhood to call home. A native of Queens, Mr. Piazza, 38, speaks with a New York brio that makes a 40-block move sound like a journey across temperate zones. His new home, which he shares with his girlfriend of a year and a half and a miniature longhaired dachshund, is near the Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge. But Queens is not too far away. Its a pretty incredible thing to know I can walk across the bridge and end up there if I ever need to, he said.

title: Air France Outlines Latest Proposal to Pilots Union
description: PARIS  Nearly two weeks into a French pilots strike, Air France-KLM outlined its latest proposal on Friday, while union leaders called for an independent mediator to help break the deadlock.

title: Congress Avoids Being Least Productive Ever
description: Updated, 3:08 p.m. | Breaking News: The White House announced Friday that the president had signed 16 bills into law, pushing the total numbers of laws for the 113th Congress to 181. Improbably, that puts the current Congress into a tie with the 112th for the title of Do Nothing-est!

title: Maison Martin Margiela: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: A Jab at Indonesias President-Elect as Parliament Curbs Local Voting
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Democracy in Indonesia suffered a major setback, analysts inside and outside the county said on Friday, when the outgoing Parliament passed a last-minute law eliminating direct elections for mayors, district chiefs and governors.

title: A Ballpark Tour, in Every Major League City
description: Each spring, the start of the major league baseball season brings a fresh slate for teams and their fans, from the Green Monster in Boston to Dodger Dogs in Los Angeles. But as summer fades into the shorter days of autumn, the memories of a season past extend beyond the field, reaching into the slanted seats of the upper deck, onto the crowded sidewalks in front of a ballpark.

description: For the last 24 hours, Ive been watching my Twitter feed tick by with mentions of Ello, a new social network that is some amalgam of Twitter, Facebook and Medium, the online publishing start-up, rolled into one.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Builders Turn Focus to Housing Market
description: In a sign of New York Citys rapidly shifting real estate market, the Durst family, whose empire was built on a forest of Manhattan office towers, is plunging into the housing market with an ambitious plan for a sprawling residential development on the Queens waterfront.

title: A Parting Sentiment, Lost in Translation
description: Plenty of companies employ phone reps with a less-than-ideal grasp of the English language. That can lead to halting conversations with phrases that, while grammatical, sound slightly off to American ears, such as Thank you for patiently waiting.

title: Home Sales Around the Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Transportation Authority Archivist Seeks Tollbooth
description: Its 66 degrees and low humidity  and thats inside the Metropolitan Transportation Authority Bridges and Tunnels Special Archive in Lower Manhattan. But after five years on the job, Mary Hedge, the archivist, has grown accustomed to the carefully calibrated climate of her work space on the 22nd floor of 2 Broadway.

title: In the Northwest, 3 Trips, Planned by Others
description: In July, I got an email from my friend Caroline that read: I asked my friend Deepa from Seattle about yoga resort kind of places and she said this place is cool. She added a link to a retreat where sleeping options included quirky cabins with Hindi names and said the spa was clothing-optional.

description: A Glance at Madagascar.

title: Iowa Museum Regains a Grant Wood Notebook After Nearly 50 Years
description: A notebook of drawings by Grant Wood has found its way back to the Figge Art Museum in Davenport, Iowa, where it went missing nearly 50 years ago. The 48-page notebook contains sketches that Wood made in the 1920s for a large stained-glass window at the Veterans Memorial Building in Cedar Rapids.

title: Can a Social Network Stay Ad-Free?
description: In a prominent sidebar on its site, the social networkEllo describes itself as Simple, beautiful & ad-free. If you visit the Ello page of Sonos, a speaker company, youll still see that message, right next to this one: Sonos speakers bring all the music on earth to every room in your home, wirelessly:www.sonos.com.

title: Palestinian Leader Urges U.N. to Back a Deadline to End Israeli Occupation
description: Palestinian Leader Urges U.N. to Press for Deadline to End Israeli Occupation

title: In New Mexico, on the Cowboy Trail of Jack Thorp
description: For years, when I pictured the Rio Grande, it was as the spindly, concrete-encased trickle that marks the dividing line between the United States and Mexico. In my mind, it was as much a military installation as a body of water. But the Rio Grande can roar. It can carve an 800-foot-deep gorge into the Southwestern plateaus. It can sustain vineyards, pecan orchards, pinto bean farms and lavender fields. It can drown riverside hot springs. It can flow so fast and full that its water turns the color of adobe.

title: States of Mind: Why Alec Soth and Brad Zellar Went to Georgia
description: The Sept. 28 Voyages Issue includes photographs from a road trip through Georgia that was taken by the photographer Alec Soth and the writer Brad Zellar. It was their seventh such expedition since 2012; they have also visited California, Colorado, Michigan, New York, Ohio and Texas. When Soth and Zellar are on the road  they spent two weeks in Georgia in July  they post photos and writings every day on their Tumblr, called The LBM Dispatch. Afterward, they print their version of a newspaper as a record of their trip. I recently talked to Zellar about their sojourns.

title: Fantasy Football: Bortles, Cooks and Benjamin Among Top Rookies
description: Before Week 1, this years rookies were regarded by many as a mediocre group for fantasy owners. Only three weeks into the season, however, we can already see how many skilled players are in this class. Here, we break down the performance of these rookies by position, and highlight the most important players so far this season.

title: Hasty With the Will
description: A decade ago, I moved to Silicon Valley, got a job with people much, much smarter than I am, and prospered. I decided to leave the largest portion of my estate to a friend; she asked its value, and I told her. Since then, I have decided to leave more money to charity. And sadly, our friendship has soured. Thus I have changed my will and removed her bequest. Should I tell her?

title: Literary Biography of Jonathan Franzen to Appear Next Year
description: Few living novelists get the biography treatment. So why is the scholar Philip Weinstein, who has published critical studies of literary masters like William Faulkner, Marcel Proust and Franz Kafka, writing an in-depth study of the life and work of Jonathan Franzen?

title: How Israel Silences Dissent
description: JAFFA, Israel  On July 12, four days after the latest war in Gaza began, hundreds of Israelis gathered in central Tel Aviv to protest the killing of civilians on both sides and call for an end to the siege of Gaza and the Israeli occupation of the West Bank. They chanted, Jews and Arabs refuse to be enemies.

title: Black Swan Buns (and Crowns) at Undercover
description: Undercovers spring 2015 collection was very Swan Lake  ballerina tutus, swan-inspired accents  but with a Japanese twist, thanks to slightly theatrical, manga-inspired styling moments. The costume element peaked on the models heads, where crowns of colored leaves sat atop prim buns (and black-jeweled eyes). They, along with the occasional opulent mask, helped set the beautiful-yet-deranged tone of the show.

title: Obama Urges Global Effort to Help Prevent Epidemics
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Friday called on nations around the world to develop more effective health care systems to prevent deadly outbreaks like the Ebola virus that is rapidly spreading across West Africa.

title: Bill Gross and Janus Capital, Both With Past Glories
description: The old saw about past performance not necessarily being indicative of future results just found a new poster child: the bond king Bill Gross sitting on his Janus Capital throne.

title: Tune Into The Times
description: Over the past week, New York Times reporters and contributors participated in interviews regarding their coverage and other top news stories. Below are highlights from television and radio.

title: Woman Is Beheaded in Attack at Oklahoma Food Plant
description: A man beheaded a co-worker at a food processing company in Oklahoma on Thursday afternoon, and stabbed another employee before he was shot and wounded by a company executive, the police said Friday.

title: So Youre Not a Physicist ...
description: WHEN President Obama was asked, in 2012, to explain his caution in approaching advisers for guidance, he replied by invoking an idea from quantum physics. Its the Heisenberg principle, he said. Me asking the question changes the answer.

title: North Wests Fashion Week Debut, Rodartes Shocking Spring Price Tag and Why Karlies Worth It
description: All the weeks fashion news thats fit to reprint.

title: Boehner Prospects for Wins in the Northeast
description: Speaker John A. Boehner ended a campaign swing through New York and New England on Thursday, eager to revive his partys fortunes in a region where he says Republicans must be competitive if they hope to pad their House majority this November and have a future as a national force.

title: Using Scare Tactics to Fight Apple
description: Law enforcement officials are outraged that Apple will no longer install so-called backdoors that allow the police to search their customers devices.

title: Iraqi President Addresses United Nations
description: President Fuad Masum of Iraq spoke on Friday at the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: The New Classical Clique
description: Simon Wren-Lewis thinks some more about macroeconomics gone astray; Robert J. Waldmann weighs in. For those new to this conversation, the question is why starting in the 1970s much of academic macroeconomics was taken over by a school of thought that began by denying any useful role for policies to raise demand in a slump, and eventually coalesced around denial that the demand side of the economy has any role in causing slumps.

title: Cornmeal Plum Scones
description: Melissa Clark makes rich cornmeal scones with honey-plum jam baked on top.

title: Palestinian President Addresses U.N.
description: President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority spoke on Friday at the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: The One With the Replica Coffee Shop
description: The line stretched down Lafayette Street, past security officers in suits and earpieces, along Broome Street and back up Cleveland Place. Devotees of the sitcom Friends made the pilgrimage to SoHo on Tuesday to enter a pop-up replica of Central Perk, the coffeehouse where the gang on that long-running hit show sighed and shared the quirky woes of their 20-something lives. Warner Bros., in partnership with the Eight OClock Coffee company, had set up the shrine-museum, which will be open through Oct. 18, for the 20th anniversary of the shows debut. The coffee is free. The gift shop items are not. Memorabilia are displayed  Phoebes guitar; Joeys ceramic white dog; an invitation to Monica and Chandlers wedding; the bronze picture frame from the door of the huge loft Monica and Rachel shared in the shows early years. Fans got to sit on the shows pumpkin-color couch for 22 seconds and have their pictures taken. Many of them had barely been born when the show was first broadcast.

title: Jammy Goodness From the Inside Out
description: Spreading jam on scones is all well and good, but baking the jam directly into the scones is even better.

title: Cooking With Cauliflower, a Feisty Vegetable That Can Take a Punch
description: Cauliflower, though now in vogue, was once the least appreciated of the large family of cruciferous vegetables, no doubt because of memories of encountering it boiled, flabby and timidly seasoned, if seasoned at all.

title: This Gleneagles Is a Scruffy Cousin
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Among the things said last week at the golf course at Gleneagles, but not the famous one in Scotland where the Ryder Cup is being played, were these:

title: A Time Capsules Mr. Fix-It
description: This is Bobs world down here, said Robert Yucikas, 70, ducking his 6-foot, 8-inch frame into a cryptlike basement extending underneath an Orchard Street sidewalk.

title: Peter Mendelsunds 90 Versions of Yes
Digital War Takes Shape on Websites Over ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  Along with its surprising military success, the Islamic State group has demonstrated a skill and sophistication with social media previously unseen in extremist groups.

title: 2015 BMW M3 and M4
description: Despite two fewer cylinders, the latest Ms, now turbocharged, are more powerful and drink less.

title: A Little Efficiency Cant Hurt
description: If sales charts never lie, thenBMW can do no wrong. The German automaker has shoved Mercedes and Lexus aside to become Americas best-selling luxury brand.

title: Love Them or Loathe Them, Reverse Mortgages Have a Place
description: Executives from reverse mortgage companies know plenty about consumers feelings around inheritance. After all, theyre in the business of encouraging older Americans to drain equity now from homes they may pass on to their heirs in the future.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Maison Martin Margiela Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Creating a Role Twice, and in Stereo
description: SIDNEY, British Columbia  David Tennant has been here before. He has sat in this police interview room and stared across this metal table at a father suspected of killing his young son. Hes listened to this obviously false alibi, stood up in frustration and snapped, O.K., Mark Solano, Im arresting you for obstruction of a murder investigation.

title: More Change for a Traditional Force
description: The violinist Anne-Sophie Mutter was with the Berlin Philharmonic last year, recording Dvoraks Violin Concerto for the first time. After three days of work, the results were very good. But Ms. Mutter thought they could be even better.

title: Photos of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, Yemen, Hong Kong and Scotland.

title: Sprinting Downcourt to the High Life
description: ATLANTA  The title of Survivors Remorse, Starzs new six-episode comedy series about a fictional professional basketball player who has just signed his first multimillion-dollar contract, came from Maverick Carter, who is the manager and a childhood friend of the newly returned Cleveland Cavalier LeBron James, the most famous basketball player in the world. It is a phrase they had used often to describe their conflicting emotions about their enormous success, a life of private jets and manicured estates beyond anything they could have imagined when they were growing up in their poor and often dangerous Akron, Ohio, neighborhood.

title: Some Are Talking, Some Cant Stand Still
description: It is an exhibition, but nothing hangs on the walls. It is not a dance, yet there are dancers. It begins the instant a spectator enters the space. As for the performers? They move. They freeze into sculptural poses. They tell personal stories. And everything relates back to the work of one incisive and imaginative French choreographer: Xavier Le Roy.

title: Founts of Classic and Progressive in a Straight Ahead Way
description: Tashi Wada

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Christian Diors Woven Boots
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Lesser-Known Credit Card Perks Hide in Plain Sight
description: You probably know whether your credit card gives you cash back or rewards points when you use it to make a purchase. After all, thats most likely why you chose it.

title: Marvel Settles With Family of Comics Artist Jack Kirby
description: LOS ANGELES  A bitter and long-running legal dispute over the ownership rights to Marvel superheroes like Thor and the X-Men ended on Friday with a settlement between Marvel, which is owned by the Walt Disney Company, and the heirs of the comic book artist Jack Kirby.

title: Music in the Virginia Mountains
description: The 41st Blue Ridge Folklife Festival, set for Oct. 25 in western Virginia, will showcase musicians dedicated to preserving the art and authenticity of regional folk music.

title: Esteban Cortazar Returns to the Runway
description: There are fashion prodigies, and then theres Esteban Cortazar. The designer debuted his first collection at New York Fashion Week at the age of 17  the youngest person ever to do so  before moving to Paris at 23 to take the helm of creative director at Emanuel Ungaro, where he remained for two years. More recently, he has released capsule collections for Net-a-Porter under his own name, earning him countless comeback kid monikers in the press. Now 30, still living in Paris and armed with new backers, Cortazar is preparing for a full relaunch of his namesake line. And the spring/summer 2015 show, which will be held tomorrow at his spacious Marais studio, is shaping up to be one of Paris Fashion Weeks most anticipated events.

title: Decoding a Trickster
description: Richard D. James, an electronic musician from Britain, is renowned for his lively yet mysterious dance music and his reclusive trickster persona. Since the early 1990s, he has made music under monikers like Aphex Twin, AFX and Caustic Window; the frenetic new Syro (Warp) is his first studio album as Aphex Twin in 13 years. With cryptic song titles like minipops 67 (source field mix) and s950tx16wasr10 (earth portal mix), Syro suggests that Mr. James remains his playful self. Here, I chart Syro and 41 of his other known solo releases. There may be even more.

title: Pakistans Premier at General Assembly
description: Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif of Pakistan spoke on Friday at the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Yohji Yamamoto: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Video Reviews of The Equalizer, The Boxtrolls and Gone Girl
description: In this weeks video, Times critics share their thoughts on The Equalizer, The Boxtrolls and Gone Girl. See all of this weeks reviews.

title: Grant Achatz, April Bloomfield, Anthony Bourdain and Others Dish on the Plates They Made for Daniel Boulud
description: When Daniel Boulud opened his 16th restaurant, DBGB Kitchen and Bar, in Washington, D.C., earlier this month, the occasion marked a homecoming of sorts for the French-born chef. D.C. is where I spent my first two and a half years in America, says Boulud, who arrived in 1981 and assumed his first stateside job cooking for the head of the European Commission. DBGB is a restaurant I would have loved to open after a couple of years in D.C., but I couldnt afford to, he adds. I didnt have any money, nor did I have a name strong enough that I could raise money.

title: New Nations, Living in Limbo
description: Narayan Mahon documented breakaway states that go unrecognized by the international community. In doing so he went from idealist to world-weary.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: Alzheimers disease, endurance and the relationship between teeth and exercise.

title: Nawaz Sharif on Stability in Pakistan
description: Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif of Pakistan outlined his goals of peace, stability and economic growth for Pakistan at the United Nations on Friday.

title: T Time | Christian Louboutin
description: Shoe designer Christian Louboutin talks sneaking into Paris musicals as a preteen, a novel use for veal carpaccio, and how showgirls inspired some of his favorite designs.

title: How to Stop Time
description: IN the unlikely event that we could ever unite under the banner of a single saint, it might just be St. Expeditus. According to legend, when the Roman centurion decided to convert to Christianity, the Devil appeared in the form of a crow and circled above him crying cras, cras  Latin for tomorrow, tomorrow. Expeditus stomped on the bird and shouted victoriously, Today! For doing so, Expeditus achieved salvation, and is worshiped as the patron saint of procrastinators. Sometimes you see icons of him turned upside down like an hourglass in the hope that hell hurry up and help you get your work done so he can be set right-side up again. From job-seekers in Brazil to people who run e-commerce sites in New Orleans, Expeditus is adored not just for his expediency, but also for his power to settle financial affairs. There is even a novena to the saint on Facebook.

title: The Womans Heart Attack
description: IN medical circles, they call it the Hollywood Heart Attack. Youve seen it: grimace of agony, clutching of chest, sudden collapse, the whole purple-prose panoply.

title: In London, Houseboats Offer Alternative to High Rent, but New Problems Emerge
description: LONDON  In the Little Venice neighborhood of west London, the boats names appear as colorful as their paint does. The crimson Mayflower bobs in front of the dark green Esmeralda, not far from the navy blue Globetrotter, moored behind the violet Hobbit.

title: What Were Reading
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an email. Sign up

title: Cheek to Cheek to Cheek
description: Three Argentine tango dancers  Maria Blanco, Leonardo Sardella and Walter Perez  danced four duets on Tuesday at the Dardo Galletto Studios in Manhattan. The one-night event was of exceptional interest for several reasons.

title: The Weekly Wrap
description: Hello, Times Insiders. Dont miss this weeks highlights. Among them:

title: Refugee Flow to Industrialized Nations Is Poised for a 20-Year High
description: GENEVA  Conflict and instability in the Middle East and parts of Africa look set to push the number of people seeking asylum in industrialized countries to the highest level in 20 years in 2014, the United Nations refugee agency said Friday, warning that the flow of refugees was increasing the strain on already overstretched humanitarian aid budgets.

title: Flirting With Temptation, Deep Into the Night
description: Imagine this: A tango show has just ended, but its seven dancers dont feel like calling it a night. They feel frisky. Instead of going home to soak in a tub, they linger behind in the nightclub, toying with props  wineglasses, red beanbag chairs while teasing one another as a Nuit Blanche, or Sleepless Night, takes hold.

title: Transforming Sound Into Dizzying Sights
description: The rate at which New York City Ballet has been hurling its works back into the repertory at the start of its fall season is prodigious, even by this companys own rapid-fire standards. The first four nights are bringing no fewer than 17 ballets. And the first three register like company proclamations of the causes in which it most believes. Tuesday provided 21st-century choreography, with three world premieres; Wednesday presented ballets by the founding choreographer George Balanchine to music by Tchaikovsky; and Thursday honored the companys unmatched tradition of Balanchine choreography to music by Stravinsky.

title: The Weather Is Cold, the Feelings More So
description: Families were bigger then, and so were the casts of plays. In Alex Roes fine revival of Icebound, the Metropolitan Playhouses cozy upstairs theater is crowded with members of the Jordan family: grim grown sons and daughters, a sour daughter-in-law and two annoying grandchildren, all waiting in the parlor for the matriarch to die offstage, and all talking about how theyll spend her money.

title: Nursing Wounds Deeper Than Scars
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  Healing Wars, the latest production by Liz Lerman, begins backstage. Audience members, en route to their seats, file through a maze of meticulously reconstructed scenes from the Civil War. Along with a costumed performer or two, each tableau vivant comes with wall text imparting an interesting fact: the number of women who disguised themselves as men to fight, the number of letters that the American Red Cross founder Clara Barton received and wrote. At the end of the line, theres a real and much more recent veteran, the former Navy Gunners Mate Paul Hurley, calmly discussing his missing lower leg and his prosthesis.

title: As Catalonia Weighs Independence From Spain, Leader Seizes Spotlight
description: MADRID  Jordi Pujol, the patriarch of Catalan politics, told lawmakers on Friday that money that he has admitted to hiding offshore was inherited and not earned from kickbacks or other corrupt practices during his 23 years in charge of the regional government.

title: Facing Militants With Supplies Dwindling, Iraqi Soldiers Took to Phones
description: BAGHDAD  The Iraqi unit, bunkered in a village in Anbar Province, had held the militants at bay for four days. But running perilously low on ammunition, food and water, the soldiers finally took matters into their own hands.

title: Seeking Out the New, Still Rocking His Past
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y.  Near the midpoint of his shrewdly rollicking concert at the Capitol Theater here on Thursday night, Robert Plant paused to recall a late-night drive down a Mississippi highway and the spell cast by an AM radio signal. He was setting the scene for Turn It Up, a brooding new song that builds on this premise. But his words also had the ring of testimony, like a secular salvation narrative.

title: Provocations Sung Genially
description: On Caetano Velosos current tour, his drummer Marcelo Callado has the word Abraao spelled out on his bass drum in masking tape, in the style of an oppositional, no-budget punk band. The word is a slang intensification of abrao, Portuguese for hug, a typical Brazilian signoff in a letter. (Its also the title of the most recent album by Mr. Veloso, the Brazilian singer-songwriter, the best of three in what could be called, after the fact, a trilogy.) So, a big hug, written in the same style that you typically see words like Toxic Threat, or Riot Alarm.

title: Bill Cunningham: Accessories as Co-Stars
description: The spotlight at fashion week was on accessories, especially whimsical ones: lock and chain necklaces from Chanel, or Lagerfeld fur doll ornaments from Fendi.

title: In the Face of Nudity, Its All About Eye Contact
description: First, she removed all of her clothing. The act looked routine, as if she were preparing for a bath. She had the attitude of a nude model accustomed to disrobing for art students. Or, equally commonplace these days, of a contemporary dancer accustomed to performing in the buff.

title: Bill Cunningham | Accessories as Co-Stars
description: The spotlight at fashion week was on accessories, especially whimsical ones: lock and chain necklaces from Chanel, or Lagerfeld fur doll ornaments from Fendi. Strawberry ice cream cones appeared on a handbag, hat and tee, while tweeds and other traditional fabrics were integrated with sneakers, speeding into the mainstream. Sandals and lacy footwear held their own. The black cameras of photographers captured shows, but the newest models wore gold.

title: On This Day: Nixon and Kennedy Debate
description: From Ronald Reagans there you go again to Al Gores sigh, presidential debates have long featured flawed stagecraft and verbal stumbles.

title: Ted Cruz and Rand Paul Make Appeals to Social Conservatives
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Ted Cruz of Texas invoked the redemptive story of his parents, both plagued by too much drinking, to show the role that faith has played in his life. Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky, who took the stage as a video of a fetal ultrasound played for the crowd, said that liberty, virtue and God were intertwined, and he quoted Corinthians to make his point.

title: Seven Beds, Hudson River Views
description: It was perfect weather for hopping into bed, in public, with a total stranger. On Friday afternoon, the temperature was a glorious 75, and the water was glittering off Pier 45 in Hudson River Park.

title: Evening Hours | Night of Grandeur
description: The Metropolitan Opera opens in its usual style, onstage and off.

title: Chinas Top Design Talent Descends on Beijing
description: Across China, the start of October is synonymous with Golden Week, the public holiday commemorating the founding of the Peoples Republic. But since the launch of Beijing Design Week in 2011, its also become an occasion to celebrate the countrys burgeoning design scene. Running from Sept. 26  Oct. 3, the fourth edition of BJDW will be as massive and diverse as Beijing itself, featuring hundreds of events ranging from straight-laced industry forums at China Millennium Monument to experimental sound art on city buses. New additions this year include a design film festival, an original brand and e-commerce platform promoting Chinese designers, and Plug-IN Stations, architect-designed kiosks to help visitors and locals engage. Here, a selection of highlights from the Design Hop program, which spans four areas of the capital.

title: No Time for Car Shopping? Click Print to Make Your Own
description: The signs message was clear enough: Please Do Not Touch. For some visitors, however, the temptation was too great.

title: Christian Louboutin Shares Stories on Showgirls, Shoes and Theater
description: In the latest installation of our T Time video series, Ts senior market editor, Malina Joseph Gilchrist, interviews the shoe designer Christian Louboutin at the Studio 54 theater. Louboutin talks about sneaking into the second acts of musicals as a kid, interning at the famed Parisian cabaret Folies Bergre and the genesis of his signature red soles.

title: Change the Oil ... or the Toner?
description: Some recent innovations in large-scale 3-D printing technology enabled Local Motors, a Phoenix-area company, to build the Strati, a 3-D printed vehicle.

title: A Century of Speed, Weather Permitting
description: Designing a car that looks like an anchovy, has a 3,000-horsepower engine and is capable of going 500 miles per hour is not particularly difficult, said Ron Main, builder of the Speed Demon, a needlelike racecar that holds the record, at a fraction over 439 miles per hour, as the worlds fastest vehicle powered by a piston engine.

title: Less Tension, More Optimism
description: The mood should be lighter and brighter at this years Paris Motor Show than at the last one in 2012, when environmentalists demonstrated, disgruntled autoworkers violently protested and police tear-gassed a crowd that broke through barriers outside the show.

title: The Speed Trials at Bonneville
description: While its no longer the official fastest place on earth, competitors still flock to the Salt Flats  even when a soggy course forces the cancellation of Speed Week.

title: In the Studio | Clare Waight Keller of Chlo
description: Clare Waight Keller, the creative director for Chlo, chats with Vanessa Friedman about how her visual references, books and photos requires three separate desks for work and stockpiling.

title: Play Hits the Road; He Hits the Bank
description: For the playwright Christopher Durang, the view beyond the Hudson is looking very attractive these days. Vanya and Sonia and Masha and Spike, his American comedic riff on Chekhovian themes, will be produced in 27 theaters around the country in the coming season. That puts it at the head of the annual Top 10 list of most performed plays, not including Shakespeare or holiday shows, compiled by American Theater magazine.

title: The Artists Life, as Seen From a Piano Teachers Bench
description: Lana Turner was discovered at a Hollywood soda fountain. John Wayne got his big break while working as a prop man. But the path that took Seymour Bernstein, an 87-year-old piano teacher, to the silver screen this year must rank as one of the most improbable of all.

title: At Rikers, a Need for Accountability
description: To the Editor:

title: Thom Yorke, Radiohead Artist, Releases Album via BitTorrent
description: Seven years ago, Radiohead attempted a bold experiment in media distribution by letting its fans pay any price  even nothing  for the bands album In Rainbows.

title: From Scotland, a Bridge Hand That Might Need a Guess
description: Each of the daily bulletins at the fourth Commonwealth Nations Bridge Championships, in Glasgow from Sept. 8 to 14, included a card-play problem submitted by Jim Patrick of Scotland. The diagramed deal caught my eye. It was originally described in Tiger Bridge, by Freddie North and Jeremy Flint.

title: Casino Magnate Steve Wynn Sues Short-Seller for Slander
description: As far as billionaire spats go, the brewing fight between the casino billionaire Stephen A. Wynn and the short-seller James S. Chanos may be among the most unusual.

title: Just Say No
description: If part of being a happy person is having the ability to say yes  to new people, ideas and experiences  part of being a stylish one seems to be the ability to say no. Mastery of the art of refusal is something every person of great style Ive ever come across shares: the confidence to reject trends or conventions  whether of living, dressing or decorating  that dont feel uplifting or authentic.

title: After One Product Recall, Fitbit Faces a New Safety Inquiry
description: Fitbit, the popular maker of activity-monitoring wristbands, ran into trouble earlier this year after some consumers complained of severe skin irritations from the Fitbit Force.

title: Network Premiere Week Prompts Cheers at ABC and Groans at Fox
description: The traditional broadcast networks have faced an onslaught of challenges recently, including Netflix, binge viewing and a proliferation of hot shows on cable. But after the first four days of network premiere week, it appears that all is not lost.

title: Indelible Photos of Derek Jeter
description: As Derek Jeter retires from the game he dominated, Barton Silverman looks back on his favorite moments photographing the Yankee star.

title: For Arianna Huffington and Kobe Bryant: First, Success. Then Sleep.
description: They may have seemed an unlikely pair, but it didnt take long for Kobe Bryant, the Los Angeles Lakers star, and Arianna Huffington, co-founder and editor in chief of the Huffington Post Media Group, to develop the easy familiarity of old pals. Soon after Ms. Huffington, 64, arrived at Antonello Ristorante in Santa Ana, Calif., Mr. Bryant, 36, walked in, speaking fluent Italian to the waiters who trailed in his wake.

title: Protesters Plead With Rouhani to Free British-Iranian Woman Jailed Over Volleyball
description: As my colleague Rick Gladstone reported, President Hassan Rouhani was confronted by two protesters in New York on Wednesday, who held up images of political prisoners jailed in Tehran, a reminder that some of his reformist supporters are losing patience with his gradualist approach.

title: At the Wedding Dresser, Altering Before the Altar
description: Off the main drag of Flatbush Avenue and its jerk chicken counters and Caribbean grocers stocking fresh coconuts and live crabs is a six-story apartment building at 45 Linden Boulevard. With crown molding and an intricate tiled floor, the lobby evokes prewar opulence, now a little worse for wear. There are 57 units in the building, but 4E is surely the busiest. The space doubles as Susan Ruddies home and her bridal atelier, the Wedding Dresser. We used to have a living room, Ms. Ruddie said. Now all the furniture is in storage.

title: Was Painless Parker a Vaudeville Joke or a Real Brooklyn Dentist?
description: Q. I had always thought that the dentist named Painless Parker was a vaudeville joke, but my wife insists there was a real one in Brooklyn. Was there?

title: Dont Put the Sunblock Away Just Yet
description: Taking in the warm weather at Hudson River Park in Manhattan on Friday.

title: How the Roosevelts Achieved Peace in Our House
description: In our multigenerational household, we typically spend our weeknights in our own entertainment zones. Call it a food court of different visual and audio tastes, but we always gravitate to our own age or gender groups once darkness falls on our home.

title: Milton Cardona, Keeper of New York Salsas Beat, Dies at 69
description: Milton Cardona, a Puerto Rican percussionist who was a mainstay of New York salsa, a studio musician on hundreds of albums and a Santeria priest who introduced sacred traditional rhythms to secular audiences, died on Sept. 19 in the Bronx. He was 69.

title: In the Homestretch, Obama Comes On Strong
description: The enemy of my enemy is my friend, says the ancient proverb. But dont tell that to President Obama, who is furiously bombing Bashar al-Assads enemies in Syria while insisting that Mr. Assads regime is also the enemy. Best also not to remind Mr. Obama about leading from behind, or of his arguments against being drawn into the Syrian civil war or getting embroiled in any Middle Eastern conflicts.

title: Inside the T Fall 2014 Design Issue
description: T loves to say yes  to new people, places and ideas  but this issue is all about the power of restraint. Take the Scandinavian architects Claesson Koivisto Rune, who create warm, pared-back spaces that are low on embellishments but high on style, as evidenced by a Stockholm apartment distinguished by a single, spectacular brass cube. Or the couturier Stephan Janson, who years ago left the limelight in order to dress a more discriminating set of women. And after creating interiors for clients like Vera Wang and Anna Wintour, the decorator Stephen Sills passed up the opportunity to move into a palatial home, choosing instead to pour his heart and soul into a tiny, perfect apartment. Elsewhere in the issue, the Brussels-based designers Jorge Almada and Anna-Marie Midy forgo modern luxuries in favor of cowboy charm in their rustic Mexican casita; Jody Rosen gets twisted up in a convention as old as time  the humble knot  and meets one of its greatest champions; Malcolm Gladwell and Sarah Silverman politely decline cookies made of crickets, among other dubious temptations; and we examine the legacy of the legendary Braun designer Dieter Rams, whose career can be best summed up with the words less but better. See all stories from the issue >>

title: A Defining Question in an iPhone Age: Live for the Moment or Record It?
description: JetBlue Flight 1416 was just minutes into its trip from Long Beach, Calif., to Austin, Tex., on Sept. 18 when Scott Welch, a passenger in Seat 5A, heard a suspicious pop. Moments later, smoke began to fill the cabin, clogging the air to the point that he could see only a few rows in front of him, he said. The starboard engine of the Airbus A320, he soon learned, had blown.

title: Mexico Holds 8 in Army in Inquiry of 22 Deaths
description: MEXICO CITY   An army officer and seven soldiers have been detained by the Mexican Defense Department in connection with the killing of 22 people in what is being investigated as a possible massacre in western Mexico in June.

title: The Bro Hug: Embracing a Change in Custom
description: The danger is all too real: One weekend, you run into a work colleague at a bar in a city that is not the city you both work in. Mike? In Baltimore? In the same dive bar as you? Crazy!

title: U.S. Considers a No-Fly Zone to Protect Civilians From Airstrikes by Syria
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has not ruled out establishing a no-fly zone over northeastern Syria to protect civilians from airstrikes by the Syrian government, Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel and Gen. Martin E. Dempsey, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, said Friday.

title: A Night Out With Stephin Merritt, the Singer for Magnetic Fields
description: Stephin Merritt strolled into Bryant Park just before 6 p.m. on Tuesday for a Scrabble social and discovered that he was the only person who showed up to play.

title: Federal Court Declines to Take Up Wisconsins Voter ID Law
description: CHICAGO  With a competitive election for governor of Wisconsin less than six weeks away, a federal appeals court on Friday narrowly decided against hearing arguments on a recently instituted photo identification requirement for the states voters.

title: When It All Comes Down to Blurbs
description: It is a tabloid truism that tales of relationships between powerful women, no matter how nuanced, will be boiled down to a stereotype: Catfight!

title: Roger Goodell Cites N.F.L.s Efforts to Fight Abuse
description: In a letter to team executives on Friday, N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell said he had met with the players association, 11 former players and law enforcement officials to help create a new personal-conduct policy.

title: Joe on WNYCs Money Talking
description: Manhattan experienced historic marches, meetings, speeches and pledges this week as hundreds of thousands of people converged on the Big Apple to demand action on climate change. World leaders joined hundreds of business executives at the U.N. to reaffirm emission reduction commitments and pledge additional support for renewable energy initiatives. As the environmental activists and diplomatic representatives head home, its time to ask, Whats next? This week on Money Talking, Joe Nocera and Rana Foroohar discuss the impact of the Rockefeller familys divestment from fossil fuels and how businesses can take the lead in creating a green economy. Plus, Cadillacs move to New York  where will they find enough parking for all those Escalades?

title: Eight Mannequins at a Wisconsin Museum Tell of a Holocaust Tragedy
description: MILWAUKEE  Eight female mannequins stand in an exhibition room of the Jewish Museum Milwaukee here, clad in smart and urbane apparel, the sort that might have come from a Thin Man film, or something with Ginger Rogers and Fred Astaire. The clothing went on display about two weeks ago. The fashions are both text and textile, a story of life and death told in fabric, and a recollection during the High Holy Days of mortality and persecution.

title: Like Mother Used To Make
description: A short story from a writer participating in Literate Sunday, a writing workshop, literary social club and email list.

title: Submissions Welcome. No Names, Please.
description: Walk into the Plank, a dim, creatively furnished dive in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, on a Sunday around 5 p.m., and the number of patrons quietly reading is surprising. They are bent over their beer-stained pages while sitting at the bar, on nearby chairs and on the patio out back.

title: Giants Former Pro Bowler Leads a High School Powerhouse
description: LONG BEACH, Calif.  As Antonio Pierce, the football coach at Long Beach Polytechnic High, walked off the schools lumpy grass practice field on a recent afternoon, a crisp, detail-oriented, two-and-a-half-hour practice behind him, he laughed at the question tossed his way.

title: Iran Barkley Is Hoping to Fight Again, This Time to Be a Benefactor
description: Among the lean, glistening bodies of young boxers at Gleasons Gym in Brooklyn, a man in his 50s climbed into a boxing ring and began circling slowly, throwing a few easy jabs and soft hooks.

title: Policing and Minorities
description: To the Editor:

title: A Sentence of Service?
description: To the Editor:

title: Toronto, Restored
description: To the Editor:

title: Transmission of Ebola: Two Microbiologists Weigh In
description: To the Editor:

title: Protests in Venezuela
Tougher Shield for Soldiers Against Predatory Lenders
description: The Obama administration is proposing sweeping changes to a seven-year-old federal law that was intended to shield service members and their families from high-cost loans tied to their paychecks, a move that reflects the Defense Departments growing recognition that lenders have exploited loopholes in the law.

title: Colorados Perceived Left Turn Puts Governor in Tight Race
description: JULESBURG, Colo.  When a Democratic mayor and former brewpub owner named John W. Hickenlooper was elected governor four years ago, he did it with support from voters like Mark Turner. Mr. Turner is a gun dealer, a small-town politician in eastern Colorado and an avowed enemy of partisan labels  Just call me an American, he says. He liked Mr. Hickenloopers wonky centrism and positive campaigning style.

title: A Greek Politician Willing to Face the People
description: ATHENS  Rena Dourou, the new prefect of Athens and a member of the left-wing Syriza Party, was taking stock of the cavernous office she inherited recently, making plans to move to a cheaper and more functional alternative.

title: Friday Night Music: Quilt
description: I dont know what Id do without Bob Boilen  I think half or more the music I listen to over the course of a week comes from bands I discovered through his Tiny Desk Concerts. And heres another  a young band that makes me want to drop acid and wear tie-died clothing, which is a great feeling when youre 61.

title: A Virtual Butterfly Hunt
description: In the most recent N.Y.C. Nature column, Dave Taft wrote about the monarch butterfly and its migration. Unlike migratory birds, individual butterflies do not complete the trip from the northern United States to Mexico and back.

title: Raising Hands to Join Peacekeeping Forces
description: Japan said it would change its laws in order to be able to send soldiers on United Nations peacekeeping missions. Mexico said it would revive its involvement in United Nations peacekeeping. Indonesia, Mongolia and Bangladesh promised to prepare troops for rapid deployment.

title: Beatification Brings Opus Dei Into the Open
description: MADRID  Beyond reverence, there is always a hint of mystery, even politics, at play whenever the Roman Catholic Church decides to advance someone toward sainthood. But when that step involves one of the more revolutionizing popes of recent history advancing a figure from one of the most powerful and discreet of Catholic movements, the mysteries and politics seem to run even deeper.

title: Curses, Fooled Again!
description: I SPENT the summer producing new Candid Camera shows, and among the many things I observed after a 10-year hiatus was that people are more easily fooled than ever.

title: A Difficult Passage From Church to Condominium
description: In its first 100 years, it was an architecturally distinguished setting for the formal Sunday services of the Christian Scientists who built it. Then, until a few months ago, it was the East Coast base of a gospel-infused nondenominational church from Los Angeles.

title: To Hear Him Tell It on the Stage, Process-Serving Is a Lark
description: Angel Gutierrez, sporting a ball cap, with his beloved Pacino-as-Scarface arm tattoo peeking out from a T-shirt, arrived two weeks ago at a Bronx walk-up on his list. The front door was unlocked  a small gift  and he breezed in as if he lived there. He paused to press the buzzer for a top-floor apartment, but didnt stop to wait for a reply.

title: Judge Grants Temporary Stay in Argentina Default Case
description: A group of New York hedge funds that sued Argentina is now asking a New York court to lower the temperature a little on the long-running and acrimonious dispute.

title: Don Keefer, Actor, Dies at 98; Had Bad Thoughts on Twilight Zone
description: Don Keefer played many distinctive roles in a long acting career. He was the son of Willy Lomans neighbor in the original Broadway cast of Death of a Salesman, which opened in 1949, and for the next half-century he was a sought-after character actor onstage and in films, including The Caine Mutiny, Woody Allens Sleeper and Liar, Liar, starring Jim Carrey.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 26, 2014
In Derek Jeters Big Hit, an Echo of Ted Williamss Final Swing
description: There was no expectation Thursday night that Derek Jeter would end his final home game with a thunderclap of a hit. This has, after all, been his worst full season, statistically.

title: John Mack Carter, 86, Is Dead; Led Big 3 Womens Magazines
description: John Mack Carter, a Kentucky-born journalist who had the singular distinction of editing all of the so-called Big Three womens magazines and, in doing so, helped transform the genre during the feminist era, died on Friday at his home in Bronxville, N.Y. He was 86.

title: Iranian President Sees Little Progress on Nuclear Dispute
description: With a blunt demeanor that bordered on pessimism, President Hassan Rouhani of Iran said Friday that he was unhappy over the lack of progress in resolving his countrys protracted nuclear dispute with the major powers, less than two months before their self-imposed deadline for reaching a comprehensive agreement.

title: Rutgers to Endow Chair Named for Gloria Steinem
description: Rutgers University is to announce on Monday that it is endowing a chair named for Gloria Steinem, a symbol of modern American feminism.

title: 3 Chinese Students, Missing for Months, Surface to Denounce Uighur Scholar
description: URUMQI, China  The three students appeared one after another in video images broadcast to millions of Chinese, sitting behind bars and denouncing Ilham Tohti, the man they had once called their mentor.

title: Playing a Titanic Tuba
description: Carl Fischer Music owns what some believe is the worlds largest tuba. Playing it requires a strong set of lungs.

title: Signaling Post-Snowden Era, New iPhone Locks Out N.S.A.
description: WASHINGTON  Devoted customers of Apple products these days worry about whether the new iPhone 6 will bend in their jean pockets. The National Security Agency and the nations law enforcement agencies have a different concern: that the smartphone is the first of a post-Snowden generation of equipment that will disrupt their investigative abilities.

title: With Players Out of Sight, Knicks Preview New Look
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The gymnasium at the Knicks training center houses two full-length courts. On Friday morning, the courts were separated by a large blue curtain. On one side was a news conference, featuring Phil Jackson, Derek Fisher and Steve Mills. From the other side came the sounds of bouncing basketballs and squeaking sneakers. The players who were making the racket were hidden from view.

title: Georgia Senate Race Takes on Negative Tone
description: The tight race for Georgias open Senate seat has taken on a particularly harsh tone in recent days, with David Perdue, the Republican candidate, deploying attack ads that accuse Michelle Nunn, his Democratic rival, of financing groups with links to terrorism.

title: Pennsylvania Priest Accused of Abuse Was Reported 5 Years Ago, Records Show
description: Details of child sexual abuse that led to charges against a Roman Catholic priest on Thursday were reported to his Pennsylvania diocese nearly five years ago, court records show, but the church authorities did not remove him as a pastor.

title: Its a Giant. Its a Novelty. Its a Tuba Named Big Carl.
description: Once upon a time, there was a tuba named Tubby, a brassy musical instrument who boasted that he could sing. He was first given voice in 1945 through lyrics recorded by the comedian Danny Kaye and was later reincarnated by the Manhattan Transfer, Annette Funicello, Julia Child and Meredith Vieira. His story has been translated into dozens of languages.

title: Not for the Faint of Heart
description: In an ideal world, ads for congressional candidates would not look like promos for Homeland.

title: Impasse Over Irans Nuclear Program
description: With top leaders attending the United Nations General Assembly, this is the moment to break the logjam on a comprehensive deal limiting Irans nuclear program. But so far there has been no real sign of movement, much less a breakthrough, despite negotiations among Secretary of State John Kerry; Irans foreign minister, Mohammad Javad Zarif; and Catherine Ashton, the European negotiator. The fault lies mainly with Iran.

title: In Brooklyn, a Move to Thwart Deadly Domestic Abuse
description: With research suggesting that domestic violence-related homicides are predictable, the Brooklyn district attorneys office has begun to study whether they are preventable.

title: Losing the Race Against Ebola
description: The race to control the expanding Ebola epidemic in West Africa looks increasingly dire. Official projections of how fast the virus will spread have soared while pledges of help from advanced nations and global organizations have failed to keep pace.

title: Saturdays College Football Games to Watch
description: ARKANSAS vs. 6 TEXAS A&M

title: Harlems Flower and Chess Man, Forced Into an Unwanted Move
description: For 23 years, Sonny Gibbs sold flowers at the edge of Abraham Lincoln Playground on 135th Street and Fifth Avenue in Harlem and taught chess to anyone who wanted to learn.

title: Labor Rights for Home Care Workers
description: A new rule that will give home care workers basic labor protections is supposed to go into effect on Jan. 1, 2015. But several states are pushing for delay, saying they need more time to work through how the rule will affect their Medicaid programs, which pay many home care bills.

title: The Quickening Pace of Gun Sprees
description: It is a sorry commentary on the shooting sprees that regularly afflict the nation that only recently has the Federal Bureau of Investigation been authorized to delve into how prevalent the threat has become. The bureaus new survey across the past 13 years concludes that horrific shootings like those in 2012 at the Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., and the movie theater in Aurora, Colo., are occurring with greater frequency.

title: The Doomed Icon on the Balcony
description: Andrew Lloyd Webbers musicals rarely garner critical acclaim but often achieve enormous staying power, on Broadway and in regional theaters. Consider Evita, one of the composers most popular shows, now at the John W. Engeman Theater at Northport in a production that highlights the insistent allure of its melodies  and underscores some of its flaws.

title: Paralysis Isnt Inevitable
description: One of the hardest things for us to do is to envision a future that is different from the present. For instance, we live in an age of paralyzed politics, so it is hard, in the here and now, to imagine what could change that. A second example: It is difficult to think of a scenario where federal gun legislation could be passed over the objections of the National Rifle Association. And a third: Income inequality has been the trend for some three decades; doesnt it look as if it will always be that way?

title: Words From a Good Buddy
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  In a weird sort of way, this 69-worder by Martin Ashwood-Smith and George Barany has become a tribute puzzle. As Will Shortz notes below, this crossword was pushed up in the rotation to honor the passing of legendary performer JOAN RIVERS.

title: In an Opulent Space, Invoking Quaintness
description: I had high hopes for Cinque Terre, a new Italian restaurant that opened in June in Huntington Station. Anthony and Pam Page, the owners, also own the friendly and old-fashioned Verona in Farmingdale.

title: Presidential Candidate in Navajo Nation Protests a Language Requirement
description: TUBA CITY, Ariz.  In his run for president of the Navajo Nation, Chris Deschene has presented voters with impressive credentials: A veteran of the Marine Corps, he is a lawyer, a trained engineer and a former member of the Arizona House of Representatives, where he represented part of the tribes reservation.

title: Giants Offensive Evolution Continues in a 2-Win Week
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Lost in the pass-happy performance of Eli Manning during the Giants 45-14 stampede of the Washington Redskins on Thursday was the rarest of sights: an Eli Manning rushing touchdown.

title: Collection of Trains to Be Sold at Auction
description: POTTERSVILLE, N.Y.  In the heart of the Adirondacks, about 25 miles north of the well-trafficked T-shirt shops and arcades of lower Lake George, a familiar but solitary tourist attraction is making its last run.

title: Putting Tomatoes First, by Putting Them On Last
description: The tomato vine is a link between seasons. In summer, you stand over the sink, with a slurry of juice and seeds running down wrists and chin, chomping a sun-warmed fruit. In fall, the oven looks all right again and you begin to think about covering what food youve got in crust. In New Jersey, the tomatoes are still rolling in, but the nights are cool. What sounds better than tomato pie?

title: Violence on the Field Reflected on the Stage
description: The National Football League has plenty to worry about just now, and it isnt going to concern itself with an 85-minute, two-character play at a small barn theater in Rockland County. But football executives, fans, coaches and players at all levels would be well-advised to see  and ponder  David Robsons Playing the Assassin, the final offering of the season at Penguin Rep Theater.

title: Again, Nets New Season Brings With It New Coach
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Brook Lopez was asked if he knew how many different people had coached the Nets since the team picked him in the 2008 draft.

title: Slide Show: Scenes From the Values Voter Summit
Derek Jeters Final Farewell Begins, Hosted by His Greatest Rivals
description: BOSTON  Derek Jeters driver dropped him off at the wrong entrance at Fenway Park.

title: Three Cities in New Jersey Alter Bike Sharing Plans
description: HOBOKEN, N.J.  In February, when Hoboken, Jersey City and Weehawken announced that they planned to introduce New Jerseys first bike-share network, Dawn Zimmer, the mayor of this mile-square city, praised it as the blossoming of a great transportation partnership.

title: The Knick Recap: Soderberghs Efficient Tour de Force
description: Season 1, Episode 7: Get the Rope

title: Fans Come to See Isles in Future Home. Not All Succeed.
description: John and Nizzette Conlon and their two sons, all Islanders fans from St. James, N.Y., walked to their seats in Section 3 at the southwest end of Barclays Center and took one flabbergasted look.

title: Everywhere You Look at the Craftsman Ale House, Brews and Batter
description: Here, some recent tweets from the Craftsman Ale House (@TheCraftsman):

title: Virginia: Suspect in Disappearance Awaits Hearing
description: The suspect in the disappearance of an 18-year-old University of Virginia student was flown back to Charlottesville from Texason Fridayto face abduction charges, the authorities said. The suspect, Jesse Leroy Matthew Jr., 32, was being held without bond at the Charlottesville-Albemarle Regional Jail until a hearing scheduled forOct. 2, said a city spokeswoman, Miriam Dickler. He had been in custody in Galveston, Tex., since Wednesday, when he was arrested after a woman called the police to report a man camping on a beach. The police have said that Mr. Matthew was the last person seen with the student, Hannah Graham, before she disappeared on Sept. 13.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We told them we would be slaughtered if they did not provide us with ammunition.

title: In Pursuit of Everything
description: Set in the bustling hub of Bishops Corner in West Hartford, Blue Plate Kitchen seems to be a restaurant perfectly in tune with the spirit of the age.

title: Royals Clinch First Postseason Berth Since 1985
description: CHICAGO  Once catcher Salvador Perez squeezed a foul pop-up the final out, first baseman Eric Hosmer embraced him. Then one by one, the rest of the Kansas City Royals converged to celebrate, players pouring out from the dugout and sprinting in from the bullpen. They jumped and shouted, and when they finally started to disperse, they hugged one another.

title: Sex and Death, and Other Tough Subjects
description: When the curtain goes up on Angels in America on Wednesday night at Playhouse on Park  when the ghost of Ethel Rosenberg sings a lullaby to Roy Cohn on his deathbed, when a Valium-loving young Mormon wife realizes her husband is gay, when heaven itself joins the wobbly Reagan-era fight against AIDS  it will be a highly personal triumph for its director, Sean Harris. And a huge risk for this five-year-old theater company in West Hartford.

title: Enter Sandman
description: How much pain relief do doctors owe their patients? And how unorthodox can the remedies be? These could be up-to-the-minute talking points in a discussion of medical marijuana; they are also the questions animating the characters in Elizabeth Egloffs play Ether Dome, about the 19th-century physicians, frauds and cranks who pioneered surgical anesthesia.

title: Suit Protests Turf for Womens World Cup
description: Several players said they would file a gender discrimination lawsuit in Canada next week against FIFA and the Canadian Soccer Association over plans to play the 2015 Womens World Cup on artificial turf.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 9 P.M. (NBC) MUSIC FOR CHANGE: THE GLOBAL CITIZEN FESTIVAL Jay Z, Alicia Keys, No Doubt, Carrie Underwood, Fun, the Roots and Tiesto headline this concert on the Great Lawn of Central Park, which features performances interspersed with the stories of people who enacted change in vaccines, education, sanitation and water, and hope to end extreme poverty by 2030. Tamron Hall oversees this hourlong prime-time special; Chris Hayes and Alex Wagner will host preshow coverage starting at 3 p.m. on MSNBC, with Ronan Farrow and Joy Reid reporting from backstage.

title: Corrections: September 27, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Paris Fashion Week Morning Report
description: The fashion week wheel, ever turning, is now spinning fast enough for the scene to blur. Yes, you may have to remind yourself, it is Saturday; its the weekend. That will give you something to chew over as you sit at Junya Watanabes show all the same, at the workweek hour of 9:30 a.m. No, theres no rest for the fashionably weary. Saturday is packed. Haider Ackermann, the Colombian-born, Belgian-based specialist in louche luxe, follows at 10:30 a.m.

title: Daughter for Chelsea Clinton (and Granddaughter for a Certain Couple)
description: Former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton finally have the titles they have long wanted: Grandpa and Grandma.

title: Junya Watanabe: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Pro-Democracy Group Shifts to Collaborate With Student Protesters in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  The police in Hong Kong began tightening on Sunday a ring of security around thousands of pro-democracy protesters who have besieged the city government for three days. But by clearing the protesters and appeasing the Chinese Communist Party, the Hong Kong authorities could risk a bigger backlash from even more city residents, said experts.

title: 100 Million Smart Things: A Conversation With Scott McGregor of Broadcom
description: The technology industry is adding to its already impressive capacity for seeking the greatest possible scale. In a little over five years, it is said, 50 billion devices will be connected to the Internet. That is on top of data centers with millions of computer servers, several billion mobile devices, and all the gaming devices, personal computers, and other things with a chip inside.

title: Analytics: What Readers Thought About A. O. Scotts Claim That Adulthood Is Dead in American Culture
description: The following graphic appears on the Reply All page in the Sept. 28 issue of the magazine.

title: Leader of Catalonia Calls for Independence Vote
description: MADRID  The regional leader of Catalonia signed a decree on Saturday to hold an independence vote, which the Spanish government has promised to block, pushing his northeastern region into a risky and direct confrontation with the central government in Madrid.

title: Bad Economic Ideas
description: I review Jeff Madricks new book.

title: Gross Gone
description: I dont know anything about whats been going on internally at Pimco; I just read the same stories as everyone else. I have, however, written a lot about Pimcos macroeconomic analysis (which drove its bond-investment decisions).

title: Haider Ackermann: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Mugler: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: BNP Paribas, After Scandal, Says Chairman Will Resign
description: PARIS  The chairman of BNP Paribas, Frances largest bank, is stepping down as the institution seeks to move beyond the fallout from its guilty plea and nearly $9 billion in fines in the United States for its dealings with blacklisted countries.

title: Pearls of Career Wisdom, Found in the Trash
description: As a business owner and television executive, Ive interviewed lots of job candidates. They have their rsums ready, and theyre primed to show off their knowledge of the business. But theyre often thrown by a question I ask early in the interview: What did you do in the summers during college and high school?

title: Turning Programming Into Childs Play
description: Dash is a small blue robot that can be programmed to play the xylophone, kick a ball, act like a dog and deliver messages  for instance, a prerecorded rendition of the Happy Birthday song. Its head, which spins around, has a single, Cyclops-like eye. Sometimes Dash emits a cheerful chime  a sign that it approves of its programmers actions.

title: How Ads Can Push Too Hard
description: People like to associate with brands that reflect how they see themselves. Thats an axiom of advertising. And so we have slogans telling us that Choosy Moms Choose Jif. Or, If you call yourself a sports fan, you gotta have DirecTV!

title: $199 Apple iPhone 6 Is Fiction, if Not Fantasy
description: What does it cost to buy a basic new iPhone 6? If you think the answer is $199, and youre happy believing that, you may want to stop reading now.

title: Giving Away Software to Make It More Valuable
description: A big-data start-up just destroyed itself to save itself. That is perhaps not a big deal, but it says a lot about where the world of big computing is headed.

title: Penny Herscher of FirstRain: What Parents Can Teach a C.E.O.
description: This interview with  Penny Herscher, the chief executive of FirstRain, a business analytics firm, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Looking at Productivity as a State of Mind
description: Policy makers often fret about the pace of worker productivity. But each of us also frets about the pace of our own individual productivity.

title: Court Casts a New Light on a Bailout
description: I think by the time we get finished with this case and we have our trial, were going to have the full picture on everything that occurred regarding the governments rescue of A.I.G., said Thomas C. Wheeler, a federal judge. Why did they do it the way they did here?

title: Viktor & Rolf: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Paris Fashion Week: Junya Watanabe Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: Keeping Residents Safe and Healthy
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Haider Ackermann Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Hotels Move Into Manhattans Garment District
description: For visitors to New York who are put off by the crowds  or the assertive super heroes  of Times Square,Manhattansgarment districtoffers a growing number of lodging options within walking distance to Broadway theaters.

title: 1914: British Prime Minister Urges Irish to Enlist
description: LONDON  Mr. Asquith made a most stirring speech last evening at a citizens meeting in Dublin in support of the recruiting campaign. The meeting was held in the Round Room of the Dublin Mansion House, and was attended by 3,000 persons, mainly Nationalists, but including many Unionists, among them Professor Mahaffy. The Nationalist Lord Mayor of Dublin presided, and among the speakers were Mr. John Redmond, Mr. Joseph Devlin and Mr. John Dillon.

title: Nautical Ropes Set Sail for Spring/Summer 2015
description: Ahoy! Nautical ropes have looped in several European designers this season. The look was first spotted in London at J.W. Anderson, where the designer wove ropes into sleeveless shells. Isabel Marant showed knottedropes as belts atop frayed tunic dresses. Finally, at his show in Paris yesterday, the Tokyo-based designer Julien David used roping as an embellishment on gray sweatshirt blazers.

title: A Day Old, and Already a Potential Nominee (in 2052)
description: Chelsea Clinton announced the birth of her daughter, Charlotte, with a tweet in the wee hours of Saturday morning. Much of Twitter responded with best wishes for the new mother, father and grandparents. But some have teasingly suggested there could be a third generation of the Clinton political dynasty.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Are you good at recognizing your cues? It helps if you want to become good at cryptic crosswords.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Viktor & Rolf Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Presidents Drive for Carbon Pricing Fails to Win at Home
description: President Obama stood in the chamber of the United Nations General Assembly last week and urged the world to follow his example and fight global warming. But a major new declaration calling for a global price on carbon  signed by 74 countries and more than 1,000 businesses and investors  is missing a key signatory: the United States.

title: Long Shots Loom as Spoilers in Tight November Races Across Nation
description: WASHINGTON  In an election year shaped by voter anger toward the political establishment, the outcome of an unusually large number of close Senate and governors races could be determined by the outsize role of third-party candidates.

title: Behind the Otherworldly Makeup at Haider Ackermann
description: A tribe of otherworldly creatures, was the makeup manifesto at Haider Ackermann today, according to the MAC makeup artist Yadim. Everything is washed out and pale, but elegant with subtle traces of color, he explained. The models ethereal transformations began with the complexion. Were buffing MACs Shell Cream Color Base onto the high contours, then patting a translucent finishing powder over the entire face, Yadim said. I know its unusual to mattify a highlighter, but Haider just loved it. We thought it made the girls look as though they were glowing from within.

title: Kicking the Facebook Habit
description: THE trouble began in 2009, on a rickety boat in the Peruvian Amazon. As I relaxed with a beer, my friend Fiorella snapped my picture with my phone. Oh! she said. Thats a Facebook profile photo for sure! And it was.

title: In M.V.P. Race, as on Mound, Kershaw Is Hard to Beat
description: In 1986, Don Mattingly hit .352 with 31 homers, 113 runs batted in and the best on-base plus slugging percentage in the American League. He believed he should have won the Most Valuable Player award, but he finished second to Roger Clemens.

title: For Many New Medicaid Enrollees, Care Is Hard to Find, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  Enrollment in Medicaid is surging as a result of the Affordable Care Act, but the Obama administration and state officials have done little to ensure that new beneficiaries have access to doctors after they get their Medicaid cards, federal investigators say in a new report.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Mugler Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Columbine Goldsmith.

title: Turkey Inching Toward Alliance With U.S. in Syria Conflict
description: KARACA, Turkey  No American ally is closer to the threat of the Islamic State than Turkey, and no country could play a more important role in a coalition that President Obama is assembling to combat the extremist Sunni militants. Yet Turkey has been reluctant to enlist, in part because of the desperate conflict playing out on its border with Syria.

title: With His Words and Deeds, Derek Jeter Never Entered Foul Territory
description: Remember when Derek Jeter was spotted walking into a Toronto strip club with a former exotic dancer? Wait: That was his Yankees teammate Alex Rodriguez.

title: Cuomo, With a Delegation, Arrives in Afghanistan
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York arrived in Afghanistan on Saturday as part of a delegation of governors visiting troops and receiving briefings on counterterrorism and security issues, his office said.

title: India Official Found Guilty of Corruption
description: NEW DELHI  The powerful chief minister of the southern state of Tamil Nadu, Jayalalitha Jayaram, will be forced to step down after a court convicted her of corruption and sentenced her to four years in prison on Saturday, an unprecedented ruling against a sitting chief minister.

title: Andjela Ilic Transforms at Haider Ackermann
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Spring 2015 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Andjela Ilic before (left) and after (right) makeup by Yadim and hair by Eugene Souleiman.

title: Ryder Cup 2014: Europe Takes Commanding Lead Over U.S. Team
description: GLENEAGLES, Scotland  With one day and 12 singles matches still to play, it is 10-6 again at the Ryder Cup: a score that rattles plenty of skeletons in European and American team rooms.

title: U.S., Defending Kurds in Syria, Expands Airstrikes Against Islamic State Militants
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon saidon Saturdaythat it had conducted its first strikes against Islamic State targets in a besieged Kurdish area of Syria along the Turkish border, destroying two armored vehicles in an area that has beenthesubjectof a weeklong onslaught by theIslamic State.

title: In a Final Act, Karzai Orders Execution of 5 Men in Rape Case
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Hamid Karzais last major act as president of Afghanistan may well be his order on Saturday to execute five men who were convicted of rape after a trial that the United Nations top human rights official has denounced as unfair.

title: Comme des Garons: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Hats Off to Junya Watanabe
description: While natural, loose waves have been a prominent presence on the spring/summer 2015 runways, leave it to Junya Watanabe to offer up a much-needed dose of over-the-top beauty fantasy. At the designers show in Paris today, models sported orblike clear plastic hats  part swim cap, part space helmet  with colorful cutouts around the face. Each matched the models eye shadow (applied on one eye) and nail polish  and why not?

title: Benefits of Joining the Herd
description: It was time for the running of the bulls.

title: Narendra Modi, in U.N. Speech, Inserts India Into Terrorism Fight
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India reminded the world on Saturday of his countrys abiding battle against extremist groups, and took a swipe at countries that give them shelter before capping his speech with a call for an International Yoga Day.

title: So Close to Goal Line and Yet So Far From It, Jets Feel Red-Zone Blues
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Twelve times this season, the Jets have moved the ball into the red zone. The good news is that they advanced closer to the goal line. The bad news is that they advanced closer to the goal line.

title: Doctors Billing Practices
description: Readers discuss the unexpected bills, often shockingly high, that patients sometimes face.

title: Nir Barzilai
description: Nir Barzilai is the Israeli-born director of the Institute for Aging Research at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine in the Bronx.

title: Stranger Danger and Guns
description: EARLIER this month, my iPhone vanished.

title: The Great Firewall Gets Bigger
description: Chinas Communist government has tightened its control over the Internet so much recently that businesses, researchers and ordinary people are finding it hard to complete basic and innocuous tasks, like placing ads on websites, sharing documents and reading technical documents.
