description: If the floor-to-ceiling Halloween decorations in your local drugstore arent enough of an indication that summer is gone, maybe the dip in temperatures will be.

title: Christopher Owens on Growing Up, Modeling and Quitting His Band Girls
description: Of all the paths to indie-rock stardom, Christopher Owenss has certainly been one of the most unlikely. He spent most of his childhood in Europe and Asia, sheltered from pop culture as a member of the religious cult Children of God. After escaping, he became the personal assistant to the eccentric Texas oil billionaire Stanley Marsh III. That unconventional background didnt stifle Owenss preternatural songwriting gifts, which were first revealed in his group Girls, which released two passionately received albums  2009s Album and 2011s Father, Son, Holy Ghost  before splintering.

title: Emanuel Ungaro: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Toxic Gases Delay Rescue on Volcano in Japan
description: TOKYO  Rescue workers trying to reach fallen hikers on a volcano in Japan were forced to turn back on Monday for a second time because of high levels of poisonous gases near the smoldering peak.

title: 1964: Silent Comic Harpo Marx Dies
description: HOLLYWOOD  Harpo Marx, the one who never spoke, died in a hospital here last night following surgery. He was 75, according to his family. The death of Harpo, whose real name was Arthur, leaves only Groucho of the three brothers whose films had the world rocking with laughter in the 1930s. Harpos contribution to the Marx brothers act was a harp, a battered opera hat, baggy pants and an improbable frock coat, from which he pulled a wild assortment of junk.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 30, 1964

title: Tracking the Gift of Presidential Gab
description: President Obama has been more generous than his recent predecessors with his interview time, as we wrote Monday morning.

title: Andreea Diaconu Transforms at Stella McCartney
Hotel Cuisine, Beyond the Hotel
description: The chefs at Rosewood Hotels & Resorts are taking their cooking out of the kitchens of the companys 18 hotels through a new program called A Sense of Taste.

title: Postseason Relief
description: Well, New York baseball fans, it happened again. And this time, it is more complicated.

title: For Christie, Middle of the Road Passes Through Ohio
description: Its not exactly a close race. So why is Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, chairman of the Republican Governors Association, traveling to Ohio on Monday to stump for incumbent Gov. John Kasich, who holds a seemingly insurmountable double-digit lead over his foundering Democratic rival, Ed FitzGerald.

title: Turn to the Light and Watch Your Back
description: PARIS  Ever since Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi of Iraq let slip during his United Nations visit last week that his government had uncovered information about an ISIS plan to attack the subways in New York and Paris, there has been a niggling sense of unease hanging over the final fashion city of the season.

title: Waterfall, a New Musical With Thai Inspiration, Aiming for Broadway
description: The veteran Broadway songwriters Richard Maltby Jr. and David Shire (Baby, Big) are teaming up with theater artists from Thailand on a new musical romance, Waterfall, that will have productions in Pasadena, Calif., and Seattle next year before a planned move to Broadway in 2016, the creators and producers announced on Monday.

title: Amal Alamuddin Gets Fashionably Wed in Stella McCartney
description: The Star: Amal Alamuddin

title: Guards at Refugee Camps in Germany Are Accused of Abuse
description: At least six guards at refugee camps in Germanys most populous state are under investigation and suspected of abuse at three facilities, the authorities said on Monday.

title: High-Gloss Pouts and Barely-There Brows at Giambattista Valli
description: As you can see, I am busy bleaching this young ladys eyebrows with a little peroxide, said the makeup artist Val Garland backstage at Giambattista Valli today while peering over her signature cat-eye specs. It adds a modern uniformity to the look, which is otherwise very pretty and lustrous. Giamba absolutely loves gloss. He likes the girls to glow from head to toe on that runway.

title: No Comment Necessary: Will the 2016 Election Take Place?
description: Dr. Ben Carson, the retired neurosurgeon famous for saying the Affordable Care Act was the worst thing that happened in this nation since slavery, is thinking about running for president in 2016. But hes not actually sure that an election will take place.

title: Toolmaking May Have Risen Independently
description: The so-called Levallois technique  which early humans used to make knives and other instruments by flaking off bits of stone  was long thought to have originated in Africa 500,000 to 600,000 years ago, then taken to Eurasia as part of an exodus from Africa.

title: Poll Contains Hidden Nugget of Good News for Thom Tillis
description: Its not usually wise to focus too much on individual polls, but Sundays CNN/ORC poll in North Carolina is worth a little extra attention.

title: Judge Recommends Firing Officers in Rikers Beating Case
description: A letter and report from Judge Tynia Richard to Joseph Ponte, commissioner of the New York City Correction Department, dated Sept. 25, 2014.

title: In Rare Rebuke for Rikers Officers, Judge Urges Firing of 6 Who Beat Inmate
description: In April 2012, on a cellblock for inmates with mental illnesses, five Rikers Island guards and a captain hogtied Robert Hinton, cuffing his hands behind his back and shackling his ankles, then carried him face down, by his arms and legs, into a solitary confinement cell.

title: Magic Opens Doors, No Tricks Required
description: MY perspective of traveling is probably similar to that of other business travelers, except that Im in a nontraditional career. Im an illusionist and an escape artist. Houdini is my hero. When I started flying to give performances I thought it was really exciting. That lasted for about 30 flights. Now, flying is so routine I dont even think about it much. Its like brushing my teeth.

title: The Thermopylae of the West
description: In the fall of 1862, Confederate armies under Robert E. Lee and Braxton Bragg invaded the slaveholding states of Maryland and Kentucky, but their ambition to conquer the border South was famously quashed at the battles of Antietam and Perryville. Two years later, in September 1864, a Confederate army under Sterling Price invaded another slave state, Missouri, likewise intending to wrest it from Union control. This, too, ended in failure. But while nothing in Prices campaign reached the scale or importance of those previous battles, the pivotal engagement, at Pilot Knob, Mo., was noteworthy for the odds overcome by the vastly outnumbered Union  indeed, some called it Thermopylae of the West, recalling that ancient battle in which a small band of Spartan warriors held off an overwhelmingly larger Persian force.

title: Fall Foliage Travel Turns Adventurous
description: Leaf viewing has moved off-road, sometimes far off-road.

title: The Childs Village Leaves Lifetime Scars
description: When I was 10 and in the habit of following my father on his errands, I accompanied him on a trip to an electrical supply store. Just after wed parked and gone inside, a clerk told my father that a police officer was about to give him a ticket. We rushed outside and, after receiving an apology for overlooking a no-parking sign, the officer let my father out of the ticket, provided he moved the car. I stood next to the officer as my father searched for another space. He asked how old I was and remarked that I was big for my age, a comment I was accustomed to hearing. Then he crudely asked if I was anatomically proportionate.

title: The Latest Player in the Polling Game? Its Microsoft
description: Microsoft on Monday will begin to apply its technological know-how to the world of politics with the release of of a new Prediction Lab, a website that will let people submit opinions and predictions on a range of topics.

title: Crimped Strands at Stella McCartney
description: Long, sleek ponytails have become commonplace at the spring 2015 fashion shows. And at first glance, it seemed like Stella McCartneys models were wearing them on todays runways. But upon closer inspection, the do was actually streaked with a few chunks of crimped strands a nice texture element that felt modern thanks to the resistance to crimp the whole head of hair. Pink lids and lips added to the very 80s feel of the fresh beauty look.

title: Children of a Lesser God to Return to Broadway
description: Children of a Lesser God, a groundbreaking play about the relationship between a deaf woman and a hearing man, who clash over ideas about speech even as they fall in love, will be revived on Broadway during the 2015-16 theater season, the producer Hal Luftig announced on Monday. The director will be Kenny Leon, who won a Tony Award in June for staging the Broadway revival of A Raisin in the Sun last spring.

title: Bank of America Settles S.E.C. Case on $4 Billion Accounting Error
description: Bank of America has agreed to pay $7.65 million to settle federal charges that it violated record keeping and internal rules in overstating its capital levels.

title: The Art of Recycling
description: Sometimes, the oldies are still the goodies.

title: 65 Floors Up, a Classic Returns
description: The Rainbow Room was born with good bones, but that was 80 years ago. So when Tishman Speyer, the company that owns and manages Rockefeller Center, decided to reopen it five years after it closed, the goal was to restore the glitter to one of New Yorks most romantic settings.

title: Closing House Door, After White House One Was Left Open
description: Julia Pierson, the director of the Secret Service, will face a skeptical and angry crowd Tuesday morning when she testifies before the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform about security breaches at the White House.

title: American Apparel Hires New Interim Chief Executive
description: The troubled retailer American Apparel named a new interim chief executive on Monday in a bid to move on from a public battle with its founder and former chief, Dov Charney.

title: Protests in Hong Kong Have Roots in Chinas Two Systems
description: Hong Kong belongs to China. But the grass-roots political movements responsible for the protests underway in the heart of the citys financial district would never have taken root in any other Chinese city.

title: Swaths of Suede Storm the Spring/Summer 2015 Runways
description: A 1970s undercurrent is coursing through the spring/summer 2015 collections, which have championed the return of bohemian prints, bell bottoms, unruly hair  and suede. The material was first spotted in New York at Derek Lam, but it really started to trend in Milan.At Gucci, the creative director Frida Giannini presented a boho-charged collection of floral, beaded minidresses, colored fur vests and the suede belted dress above, that looked straight out of the brands archives. Yesterday in Paris, the designer Claire Waight Keller introduced a similar silhouette on the Chlo runway: a shorter, belted jacket paired with shorts. And finally at Loewe, the British designer Jonathan Anderson used leather and suede heavily in his debut show for the Spanish luxury leather-goods brand  which peaked with this buff suede trench coat with wide-leg trousers. The bag reinforced the message loud and clear: suede is in.

title: Scientists Trace Extreme Heat in Australia to Climate Change
description: The savage heat waves that struck Australia last year were almost certainly a direct consequence of greenhouse gases released by human activity, researchers said Monday. It is perhaps the most definitive statement climate scientists have made tying a specific weather event to global warming.

title: Being Mindful Can Help Guide a Decision
description: Were really good at telling ourselves stories.

title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg on the Worst Supreme Court Ruling
description: In an interview for The New Republic, Jeffrey Rosen asked Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg to name the worst ruling the current Court has produced. Maybe her hemming-and-hawing was edited out, but it looks as though Justice Ginsburg didnt hesitate at all in choosing Citizens United, in which the Court took the radical step of deciding that the First Amendment prohibits the government from restricting independent political expenditures.

title: Prince Celebrating New Albums With a Paisley Park Livestream
description: With two new albums to be released on Tuesday, Prince announced that he would celebrate the albums  his own Art Official Age and a collaboration with 3rdeyegirl, Plectrumelectrum  by throwing a party at Paisley Park, his studio complex in Chanhassen, Minn., and inviting his fans to tune in online.

title: Sonia Rykiel: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Ah, to Be Popular
Senate Update: G.O.P. Shows Gains in Blue States
description: Winning Senate races in blue states wont be enough for the Democrats to maintain Senate control, but it will probably be necessary, which is why Democrats should be worried if the next set of polls in Colorado and Iowa back up last weeks numbers.

title: Work Boot-Inspired Platforms at Sacai
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Attacking Cuomo on Ethics, Astorino Remakes the Daisy Ad
description: First aired: Scheduled to air Sept. 30, 2014

title: Netanyahu Links Hamas With ISIS, and Equates ISIS With Iran
description: UNITED NATIONS  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Monday called Hamas and the group known as the Islamic State branches of the same poisonous tree, and he said Iran was the most dangerous country in the world.

title: Weekly Quandary: Talking Racism and Sexism With Children
description: In the Weekly Quandary, we pull from the comments, the weekly open thread or email a question that we know (or at least suspect) plagues more than one parent. You  the readers  provide the advice: How have you made this work better in your family? In last weeks open thread, solitaire wrote:

title: California Is Burning
description: Californias Central Valley is one of the most fascinating places in America. The grassy, flat-bottomed basin occupies the coreof inland California, roughly 13 percent of the states total land area,sprawled out between the Sierra Nevada range to the east and theCoast Ranges to the west. Once a primordial seabed, its now fertile ground.

title: Consumer Agency Penalizes Flagstar Bank Over Mortgage Servicing
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau took aim at one of the most powerful players in the housing market: the mortgage servicing firms that have great sway in deciding whether struggling homeowners lose their homes to foreclosure or win a reprieve.

title: For China, Limited Tools to Quell Unrest in Hong Kong
description: BEIJING  Chinas Communist Party has ample experience extinguishing unrest. For years it has used a deft mix of censorship, arrests, armed force and, increasingly, money to repress or soften calls for political change.

title: Future U.S. Ryder Cup Teams Need to Adapt to the Times
description: GLENEAGLES, Scotland

title: Can a Company Reimburse Employees Who Buy Their Own Health Insurance? Maybe
description: Two weeks ago, in a post answering questions about how the Affordable Care Act affects small businesses, we returned to the beguiling matter of whether business owners can use tax-free dollars to reimburse employees who buy their own insurance.

title: Right-Clicking Without a Mouse
description: Right-Clicking

title: Cecilia Malmstrom, E.U. Trade Nominee, Points to Toxic Element in U.S. Talks
description: BRUSSELS  The nominee to be the European Unions next trade commissioner said on Monday that a crucial provision sought by the United States in current trans-Atlantic trade talks was a toxic element that should be modified or eliminated.

title: Reading The Times With Bill Maher
description: Bill Maher hosts Real Time With Bill Maher. News is a source of comedy, puzzlement, outrage and material for the HBO show. We read Sundays paper with Mr. Maher.

title: Mr. Krugman and the Classics (Trivial and Self-Indulgent)
description: Joe Gagnon, traveling in Asia Minor, sends me a picture from a museum:

title: Paris Fashion Week: Giambattista Valli Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Congress Will Miss Jeter, Too
description: In case you missed it, Derek Jeter played his last game on Sunday, capping a 20-year career that featured five World Series titles, 14 All-Star appearances, 3,465 hits and 27 mentions in the Congressional Record.

title: EMusic Returns to Indie Roots Amid Shift in Online Market
description: EMusic, a pioneering digital music store that has struggled to find its place in the rapidly shifting online market, has changed directions again.

title: Monday Motorsports: Lorenzo Wins in MotoGP at Aragon; Mrquez and Rossi Crash
description: Jorge Lorenzo won a crash-plagued MotoGP race at Motorland Aragn in Spain on Sunday, with the help of a prudent decision to switch bikes with just four laps left in the race, when rain started to pour down. The race leader, Marc Mrquez, and his Honda teammate, Dani Pedrosa, tried to tough it out and ended up crashing in the wet conditions.

title: Generating a Molecule With Star Quality
description: Scientists at the University of Manchester in England have generated a highly complex star-shaped molecule made of interlocking rings that could be used to produce light, flexible, resilient materials. The Star of David molecule, described in the journal Nature Chemistry, consists of two molecular triangles entwined three times into a hexagram with a perimeter of 114 atoms. It is modeled on the tough, light shells of certain viruses, the researchers said, and should produce a chain mail effect when linked with others like it.

title: Yankees See Alex Rodriguez as a Starter, as Long as He Earns It
description: Less than 24 hours after his teams final game of 2014, Manager Joe Girardi returned to Yankee Stadium on Monday and addressed questions about the failures of the season and the preparations for 2015.

title: Contaminants Everywhere
description: A wide range of chemicals are finding their way into rivers, fertilizers, plants and animals.

title: Atlanta Symphony Orchestras President Quits
description: First the Atlanta Symphony Orchestras opening weeks of concerts were canceled after its musicians were locked out in a labor dispute. Now the orchestras president is gone.

title: Red Floral Motifs Bloom on the Spring/Summer 2015 Runways
description: Florals are set to be a bona fide trend for spring/summer 2015 thanks to Cline, whose designer, Phoebe Philo, broke up the mostly muted collection with a series of floral dresses in the middle of yesterdays presentation in Paris. Her red-on-black look echoed the red rose-printed pieces at Maison Rabih Kayrouz and Simone Rochas ultrafeminine spring collection, which featured a series of floral prints on a crimson background.

title: Science Events: Dancing Particle Physics and Science-Inspired Fashion
description: October events at the intersection of science and art.

title: Michigan Coach Brady Hoke Chided for Sending Quarterback Back on Field
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Criticism of how Coach Brady Hoke and his staff handled a potentially concussed player, coupled with the Wolverines 2-3 start, has raised questions about Hokes future as coach of the proud Michigan program.

title: Working Long Hours Tied to Diabetes Risk
description: Working long hours may increase the risk for Type 2 diabetes, a new review has found, but the risk is apparent only in workers of lower socioeconomic status.

title: Amusement Park Ups and Downs
description: The average visit to Walt Disney World or any similar theme park isnt a profound experience, but its an amusing enough diversion. That statement also describes Happyland, a series set behind the scenes at such a park.

title: Overseas Trade Alters a Lizards Stocks
Saint Laurent: Spring 2015 RTW
description: Paris

title: Rating Pain Relief
description: Q. How is the effectiveness of pain relievers measured? Is there a list that quantifies them by strength?

title: Polls Show Tight Senate Races in Critical States
description: With just over five weeks until Election Day, polls released over the weekend find close Senate races in Iowa, Louisiana and North Carolina, with the leads in each poll falling within the margin of sampling error.

title: Uniteds Deal With Uber Raises Concerns
description: UNITED AIRLINES has been reprising its old advertising slogan about the friendly skies. But some airports think the airline was a bit less than friendly when it formed a partnership with the ride-sharing company Uber without seeking airport input.

title: Cisco: The Internet Needs More Control
description: Cisco Systems is making an unusual case for itself: The Internet must be subject to a higher amount of control, and big companies will work with governments to make that possible.

title: Forecasting the Fall of the Two-Hour Marathon
description: Will the two-hour marathon be the four-minute mile of our day? Just as a sub-four-minute mile once seemed as if it might be beyond the limits of human speed and endurance, a sub-two hour marathon is both remarkably close yet seemingly impossible.

title: Readers Debate Online Piracy and the Future of Digital Entertainment
description: On Sunday, The New York Times published the story of a popular and illegal website that let people stream and download movies and television shows at their leisure. The site was taken offline in 2010 by the federal government, and the administrators behind the site were charged with conspiracy and copyright infringement. Nearly all served time in prison. The article touched a nerve among Times readers, eliciting hundreds of reactions about copyright infringement and intellectual property, and how the digital world complicates both.

title: Pictures of the Day: Hong Kong and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Hong Kong, Turkey, Liberia and Japan.

title: Armed Intruder at White House Got to East Room
description: WASHINGTON  An armed man who jumped the White House fence this month made it far deeper into the mansion than previously disclosed, overpowering a Secret Service agent inside the North Portico entrance and running through the ceremonial East Room before he was tackled, according to a member of Congress familiar with the details of the incident.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Walkabout: Flights Delayed in Chicago, But Resuming in Paris
description: Standstill A fire set at an air traffic control center in Chicago late last week is still causing flight delays at both city airports. (The New York Times)

title: Renewed Fighting Around Donetsk Airport Tests Ukraine Cease-Fire
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Deadly fighting has broken out again between the government and rebels around the strategically important airport outside Donetsk, a continuing source of friction that is testing the resilience of a recent cease-fire agreement.

title: In Performance | Anthony Wayne
description: Mr. Wayne, with Anthony Miller on piano, sings the title song from Mighty Real: A Fabulous Sylvester Musical, about the pop star Sylvester. The show runs through Oct. 5 at Theater at St. Clements.

title: Toyota Recalls 790,000 Tacoma Pickups
description: Toyota is recalling 790,000 Tacoma pickup trucks from the 2005-11 model years worldwide, including about 690,000 in the United States, because a rear suspension part could break and possibly puncture the gas tank or damage a brake line, the automaker said Monday.

title: White House Intruder Got Farther Than First Reported, Official Says
description: Armed Intruder at White House Got to East Room

title: Visiting an Ailing Relative
description: Across the United States, laboratory chimps are being sprung from their cages. Last year, the National Institutes of Health announced that it would be retiring most of its chimpanzees and sending hundreds of its hairy, knuckle-walking charges to live out their lives in sanctuaries.

title: Austerity Leads Ensemble to Adapt
description: William Christie plans to lead his Baroque ensemble, Les Arts Florissants, in a pair of concerts at Versailles next summer to commemorate the 300th anniversary of the death of Louis XIV, whose patronage established the French musical style that Mr. Christie has helped revive.

title: A Strange Disappearance and What the Neighbors Have to Say About It
description: In light of the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 in March, David Langs The Difficulty of Crossing a Field, a musical-theater piece about a man who suddenly vanishes, has a particular resonance. With a libretto by Mac Wellman, the piece is based on the 1888 one-page story of the same name by the American journalist and fiction writer Ambrose Bierce, an abolitionist who was wounded in the Civil War and whose own disappearance at 71  possibly in Mexico or by suicide in the United States  has never been explained.

title: Atomic Espionage
description: The Manhattan Project employed nearly 400,000 people to create the first atomic weapons. The security apparatus around the effort was immense  but according to a newly declassified report, plenty of secrets got out.

title: Sharply Dressed Gangsters
description: As a title, Peaky Blinders manages to be both more intriguing and more off-putting than usual. In early-20th-century Birmingham, England, apparently, the term referred to peaked caps worn by gang members that had razor blades sewn into the seams. In the new BBC series about those gangs, whenever someone whips off his cap during battle the action suddenly goes slow-motion and balletic, as if were watching a rhythmic gymnastics broadcast with blood instead of streamers.

title: Copying PC Photos to an iPhone
Keeping Up With Kendall Jenner on Twitter, A Journalistic Survey of Street Style and More
description: Every week, T rounds up five captivating online destinations you should be visiting often.

title: Twangy Homilies About Shouldering Through the Pain
description: Lucinda Williams made her first album for her own label, Highway 20 Records, a magnum opus: two discs, 20 songs and a summation of what has endeared her to a large, loyal following. Shes pithy and penetrating, bruised but steadfast, proud of the grain and drawl of her voice. Her music places itself in a vanishing, idealized Southland where country, soul, blues and gospel all share a common spirit and a vocabulary of twang, and where life lessons can be delivered by a bar band.

title: Forces of Nature, Haunting, Changing and Just Plain Happy
description: At New York City Ballet on Friday night, Ashley Bouder and Andrew Veyette kept bursting back onto the stage in Donizetti Variations with a twinkling, ebullient, heart-catching virtuosity that had seasoned audience members asking, When was it last this good? In the title role of La Sonnambula, Wendy Whelan paced through the sharply changing paths of her sleep with a bleak urgency that gave an unfamiliar darkness to this always amazing drama. And in Firebird, the contrasting capacities of Teresa Reichlens style for superhuman amplitude and quiet intimacy opened up fresh meanings in this ballet.

title: The Partisan Court Blocks Extended Voting in Ohio
description: On Monday afternoon the Supreme Court justices decided 5-4, on party (of-the-president-who nominated-them) lines, to block extended voting hours and days in Ohio, 16 hours before voting was to begin there. The decision affects everyone in the state but will disproportionately harm poorer and minority voters, who rely on weekend and evening hours to avoid forbiddingly long lines on Election Day.

title: A Child of the Troubles of Northern Ireland
description: Belfast Blues is full of impressive physical moments, when the flow of Geraldine Hughess words is either emphasized or countermanded by the casually coiled force of her body. On Saturday afternoon at the Barrow Street Theater, where the show has returned to New York for a limited engagement, one moment in particular stood out: Ms. Hughes standing very still and straight, embodying a British soldier.

title: Love, Loss and Local Color Make a Bluegrass Musical
description: SAN DIEGO  Darkness and light are blended in even proportions in Bright Star, a sepia-toned new musical by Steve Martin and Edie Brickell making its premiere at the Old Globe theater here. The characters in this musically vibrant if overstuffed show, set in the Blue Ridge Mountains of North Carolina during two separate decades of the 20th century, endure hardship, heartache and almost melodramatic loss. But, as the title suggests, their eyes remain fixed not on the black canopy of night but on the beacons of hope that pierce it. A telling song from the second act reminds us that no matter how gray the future seems, the sun is gonna shine again.

title: Trial Opens in Atlanta School Cheating Scandal
description: ATLANTA  The criminal trial of a dozen public school educators opened here Monday with prosecutors alleging that the teachers and administrators had engaged in a widespread, cleverly disguised conspiracy to cheat on standardized test scores in an effort to protect their jobs and win favor and bonuses from administrators.

title: Clintons, Now Grandparents, Take Political Breather
description: Family duty has taken precedent over politics, at least for awhile, as Hillary Rodham Clinton cuts back on her public schedule to spend time with her new granddaughter.

title: The Difficulties of Nuclear Containment
description: In December 1945, four months after atomic bombs brought an end to World War II, the United States Army published a secret report on security surrounding the Manhattan Project, the vast government effort that developed them.

title: Supreme Court Blocks Order to Restore 7 Days of Voting in Ohio
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday blocked an appeals court ruling that would have restored seven days of early voting in Ohio.

title: Seeking Global Role, German Military Stumbles
description: BERLIN  In a spectacle that a leading weekly likened to a slapstick movie, Germanys military, especially its air force, has repeatedly stumbled in recent days as it tried to ratchet up its international involvement by delivering personnel and matriel to forces battling Islamic extremists in Iraq and aid supplies to Africa to ease the Ebola crisis.

title: Nature in the Balance, Gene Tests, Artificial Sweetners and Diabetes
description: Climate Change

title: A Dogs Life in Chad: Filling Up on Fish Guts and on Guinea Worms
description: A surprise has turned up in the fight against Guinea worm: In Chad, more dogs have it than people do  and fish guts are apparently to blame.

title: Biopics and Noir Dominate a Festival
description: With three high-profile mysteries  Inherent Vice, Gone Girl and Maps to the Stars  it might seem as though film noir was the dominant flavor of this years New York Film Festival. But another theme runs through four selections: artist biographies. Call it a continental face-off between North America and Europe.

title: Route Taken by the White House Intruder
description: The intruder who jumped the fence this month made it to several rooms inside the White House.

title: Rom-Com Echoes of Ephron
description: Three network comedies begin this week, and while they all have one obvious thing in common  the perils of dating in the age of Twitter, Tinder and Snapchat  what they really share is Nora Ephron.

title: Japanese Swordsman With a Camera
description: Whether on Japans street or shores, Issei Suda takes pictures like a swordsman, with light swiftly slicing the scene.

title: After Surgery, Predicting a Speedy Recovery
description: After surgery, some patients rebound quickly, and some endure weeks of fatigue or pain.

title: Clip: Men, Women & Children
description: A scene from the film directed by Jason Reitman.

title: Nominee for European Digital Job Explains Positions in Hearing
description: LONDON  Telecommunications investment. Data protection reforms. Cellphone roaming charges.

title: First Draft Focus: Around Town
Judge Holds Argentina in Contempt of Court in Bond Payment Case
description: Updated, 9:06 p.m. | For more than a year, Judge Thomas P. Griesa of Federal District Court in Manhattan has warned that Argentina would suffer repercussions if it defied his orders regarding payments to bondholders.

title: Vets Face Rising Worry Over Fleas
description: Are fleas making a comeback?

title: McConnell Softens Image in the Homestretch
description: The rhetorical gunfight in Kentuckys Senate race seems to have been holstered, for the moment.

title: Spanish Premier Insists Vote on Catalan Independence Will Not Happen
description: MADRID  Two weeks after Scotland voted against leaving Britain, another and more contentious secession fight is hurtling ahead in Europe, with Spain and its independence-minded region of Catalonia increasingly at odds and showing few signs of willingness to compromise.

title: White House Has Long History of Unwanted Visitors
description: The Secret Services mishandling of a recent White House intruder, who got deeper into the presidential residence than previously thought, might make it appear that the agency has little experience with trespassers.

title: Indian Anchors Scuffle in New York Draws Supporters and Critics
description: Standing outside Madison Square Garden on Sunday, ahead of a rally for Indias new prime minister, Narendra Modi, the Indian television anchor Rajdeep Sardesai reminded viewers back home that the New York arena had been the site for many famous events, including "Muhammad Ali versus Joe Frazier.

title: Growing, and Growing Vulnerable
description: QUOGUE, N.Y.  As the president of the Fire Island Association, Suzy Goldhirsch has a message she says she often offers property owners. We are living on a sandbar in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, she tells them. We are in a high-risk environment. We on barrier islands are on the front lines of climate change.

title: The Odds, Continually Updated
description: Statistics may not sound like the most heroic of pursuits. But if not for statisticians, a Long Island fisherman might have died in the Atlantic Ocean after falling off his boat early one morning last summer.

title: Why Drivers Get Away With Murder
description: IN June, Mayor Bill de Blasio signed 11 bills related to Vision Zero, the citys initiative to eliminate traffic deaths and serious injuries over the next decade. One was Coopers Law, named for my 9-year-old son, Cooper Stock, who was struck and killed by a cab on Jan. 10.

title: Hirohito: String Puller, Not Puppet
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  LAST month, I received a startling email from an employee at one of Japans largest newspapers, about a development Id long awaited. The government was about to unveil a 12,000-page, 61-volume official biography of Emperor Hirohito, which a large team of scholars and civil servants had been preparing since 1990, the year after his death.

title: Screening Smokers for Lung Cancer
description: To the Editor:

title: Rules on Overtime
description: To the Editor:

title: Dissent Over How Israel Treats Dissent
description: To the Editor:

title: Deaths Tied to G.M. Ignition Rise to 23, as Compensation Offers Go Out
description: The number of deaths linked to General Motors defective ignition switch has risen again  to 23, according to new figures posted Monday by the program set up to compensate victims.

title: Chicago Flights Are Returning to Normal After Attack on Air Traffic Center
description: Amid efforts to rebuild an air-traffic control communications center near Chicago after an attack by a contractors employee on Friday, the Federal Aviation Administration said Monday that a patchwork of equipment and procedures had allowed it to increase flights at OHare International Airport to about 80 percent of normal, and at Midway Airport to 90 percent of normal.

title: The More Popular Obama Rallies the Base
description: MILWAUKEE  Some had waited six hours, standing outside in the unseasonable heat and then in a packed auditorium. But all seemed forgotten once the first lady finally came out on stage.

title: As Catholic Church Seeks Proof, Venezuela Sees a Saint
description: ISNOT, Venezuela  Venezuela needs a miracle. Preferably two. But this is not about finding a way to reconcile the countrys bitterly divided politics or fix its crippled economy. It is about something more spiritual.

title: Tony Stewart Ponders a Death He Cant Forget
description: KANNAPOLIS, N.C.  Tony Stewart has been exonerated in the sprint-car accident that killed the driver Kevin Ward Jr. at Canandaigua Motorsports Park in upstate New York on Aug. 9. He may be cleared, but a soft-spoken Stewart said Monday that he was not past the anguish he has lived with since that night.

title: The Hole in Holders Legacy
description: A few weeks ago, Attorney General Eric Holder Jr. gave a speech at the New York University School of Law on the subject of white-collar prosecutions. In it, he offered a full-throated defense of his departments efforts in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis. With his resignation announcement coming eight days later, one cant help but view his speech as a kind of valedictory.

title: Some Judicial Opinions Require Only 140 Characters
description: To judge by his Twitter feed, Don Willett seems like an all-around solid guy: native Texan, proud conservative, three charming kids, loves Blue Bell ice cream and Baylor football, skilled at selfies, and not above the occasional lowbrow joke.

title: The Hague: Bosnians Trial Nears End
description: Prosecutors on Monday demanded a life sentence for the former Bosnian leader Radovan Karadzic as his trial draws to a close, accusing him of being the driving force to rid large parts of the ethnically mixed Bosnia of its non-Serb inhabitants during the 1990s. Mr. Karadzic, 69, denies responsibility for the killings. The Bosnian conflict, from 1992 to 1995, tore apart communities where different ethnic groups and Christians and Muslims had long lived together. It left more than 100,000 people dead and uncounted others maimed or traumatized by rape. Four years of court hearings dealt with the 11 charges, including genocide, brought against Mr. Karadzic. He is accused of being responsible for the siege of Sarajevo, the execution of more than 7,000 captive men and boys in Srebrenica, and the brutal ethnic cleansing of towns and villages in 1992. Mr. Karadzic has led his own defense and will speak on Thursday and Friday.

title: F.C.C. Appears Poised to Loosen Sports Blackout Rule, Despite Protests by the N.F.L.
description: WASHINGTON  For decades, football fans in various markets wondered whether, come Sunday, they would be able to watch their lamentable but beloved team on television. If tickets to that weeks game were not sold out, the National Football League could keep the game off television in the local market as a way to protect gate receipts.

title: Mexico: Students Missing After Protest
description: The authorities in Guerrero, one of Mexicos most violent states, are searching for 57 students from a teachers college who have been missing since Friday when gunmen fired on a demonstration they were attending, killing three students and three others nearby. The gunfire also wounded 25 people. The Guerrero state prosecutor, Iaky Blanco Cabrera, said that witnesses identified the gunmen as local police officers in Iguala, where the protest occurred, and that more than 20 had been detained. Mr. Blanco described the episode as an instance of undoubtedly excessive force by the officers. The federal interior secretary, Miguel ngel Osorio Chong, called the conduct of the police incredible and said federal authorities would join the investigation. Witnesses said police officers had put the missing students on a bus and escorted them from the scene.

title: Scenes From the Edge of War
description: Anne Barnard is a correspondent based in Lebanon and covering the Middle East. Recently, she has been in Turkey, along with Karam Shoumali, a Times stringer, and Bryan Denton, a freelance photographer working for The Times, to cover the ripple effect of a war they can scarcely see. She reflects on life along the border between Turkey and Syria and the challenges of reporting there.

title: A U-Turn for a Terminal Built in Texas to Import Natural Gas
description: SABINE PASS, Tex.  The giant Golden Pass natural gas import terminal here, meant to bring Middle Eastern gas to energy-hungry Americans, sits eerily quiet these days, a sleepy museum to a bygone era.

title: Vatican Investigates Missouri Bishop Who Shielded Pedophile Priest
description: The only American bishop ever convicted of shielding a pedophile priest is now under investigation by the Vatican.

title: Delayed Justice for the Navajos
description: The long struggle of American Indian tribes to be fairly compensated for decades of federal mismanagement of their tribal lands resources reached an important point last week with an agreement by the largest tribe, the Navajo Nation, to accept $554 million in settlement of long-running litigation over breach-of-trust claims.

title: Shawn Vestal Wins PEN/Robert W. Bingham Prize
description: The PEN American Center on Monday announced that Shawn Vestal is the winner of this years $25,000 PEN/Robert W. Bingham Prize for Debut Fiction. Mr. Vestal earned the honor for Godforsaken Idaho, a collection of short stories. He received the prize from Louise Erdrich at a ceremony at the New School.

title: A New Attack on Antibiotic Resistance
description: Antibiotic-resistant germs are an increasing threat, causing at least 23,000 deaths and two million illnesses in the United States each year, and requiring treatment costing $20 billion in direct medical expenses. The Obama administration announced some good measures this month that should help reduce the overuse of antibiotics in humans and much, though perhaps not all, of the overuse in animal husbandry that together are fueling the emergence of drug-resistant germs.

title: Ford Cuts 2014 Profit Estimate, Sending Shares Lower
description: Ford Motor warned on Monday that its profit for 2014 would be as much as $2 billion lower than earlier estimates, after a series of events that included a recall of hundreds of thousands of vehicles in North America.

title: James Shields, an Imported Ace, Is an Important Piece for the Royals
description: The day after the Kansas City Royals traded for James Shields in December 2012, Dave Eiland, the teams pitching coach, called Shields to brief him on the state of the pitching staff. Eiland felt that after decades of futility, a sense of resignation had set in.

title: With Crouching Tiger Sequel, Netflix Takes Aim at Hollywood
description: In a first deal of its kind, Netflix and the Weinstein Company said Monday that they planned to release next years sequel to the movie Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon simultaneously across the globe on Netflix and a select number of Imax theaters.

title: De Blasios Executive Order Will Expand Living Wage Law to Thousands More
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to sign an executive order on Tuesday significantly expanding New York Citys living wage law, covering thousands of previously exempt workers and raising the hourly wage itself, to $13.13 from $11.90, for workers who do not receive benefits.

title: Gotham Recap: Batman as a Goth Boy, the Butler as an Angry Young Man
description: Season 1, Episode 2, Selina Kyle

title: Chinas Crackdown in Hong Kong
description: If China had honored the political commitments it made before taking control of Hong Kong from Britain in 1997, it is likely there would be no protests in the city streets and no crackdown over the weekend by riot police using tear gas, pepper spray and batons against pro-democracy demonstrators.

title: Opposition in Syria Is Skeptical of U.S. Airstrikes on ISIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Across insurgent-held Syria over the past week, images have proliferated of protesters burning American flags, calling President Obama the enemy of God, and declaring that the American-led airstrikes against the Islamic State extremist group are helping the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Drug Patents Held Overseas Can Pare Makers Tax Bills
description: As the Obama administration tries to stop companies from avoiding taxes by moving their headquarters overseas, the makers of some of the worlds most lucrative and expensive medicines are using another tactic to reduce their payments to the government.

title: A.I.G. Trial Witnesses Will Be Central Cast From 2008 Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  Six years after the government rescued the American International Group from the brink of collapse, the bailout came under a new microscope on Monday, with the opening of an unusual trial that challenges the legality of the governments actions.

title: Questions About Clippers Remain After Sale to Steve Ballmer
description: PLAYA VISTA, Calif.  Los Angeles Clippers Coach Doc Rivers was sitting on stage, a microphone in hand, just starting to answer a question about the teams new owner, Steve Ballmer, when he paused.

title: Many Missteps in Assessment of ISIS Threat
description: WASHINGTON  By late last year, classified American intelligence reports painted an increasingly ominous picture of a growing threat from Sunni extremists in Syria, according to senior intelligence and military officials. Just as worrisome, they said, were reports of deteriorating readiness and morale among troops next door in Iraq.

title: Lena Dunhams About-Face: Shell Share the Wealth With Tour Acts
description: When Lena Dunham put out an open call for talent this past summer on her website, she was flooded with nearly 600 video responses. She was casting comedians, musicians and artists to perform as warm-up acts on an elaborate book tour for her new essay collection, Not That Kind of Girl. The seven performers she chose were so eager to be associated with Ms. Dunham that they apparently did not mind that the gig was unpaid.

title: The Big Dangers of Fighting Bad Press
description: Its a billionaire cage match.

title: New System and Season Bring Carmelo Anthony and Knicks Fresh Perspective
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  If any doubt lingered over whether Carmelo Anthony had finally emerged from the dungeon of despair that was the 2013-14 season, he seemed determined to squash it on Monday when he took the dais at the Knicks training center.

title: Club Shooting in Rough Miami Neighborhood Continues a Cycle of Violence
description: MIAMI  Along the battered storefronts and dilapidated homes in Liberty City, the barrage of gunfire that wounded 15 people inside a club over the weekend, many of them teenagers, has become an all-too-familiar ritual this year in a neighborhood long considered one of the poorest and most dangerous in Florida.

title: More Debate on Plea Deal for Suspect in Terrorism
description: The debate over whether federal prosecutors in Manhattan had granted too lenient a plea bargain to a terrorist defendant who, under its terms, would face no more than 25 years in prison, continued on Monday, with defense lawyers and prosecutors both asking the judge to accept the deal.

title: A Winning Start Whets Appetites at Advertising Week
description: THERE are no signs that Martin Sorrell, chief executive of WPP, the worlds largest agency holding group, plans to change careers. But if he were to do so, he might make a decent living on the conference circuit as a moderator.

title: In Jets Dismal Start, Faith in Geno Smith Faces an Exacting Test
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Rex Ryan sat at the round conference table in his office. An unlit candle, scented Bahama Breeze, rested in the middle. Madonna played softly on the speakers as Ryan gushed about his quarterback, Geno Smith.

title: California Law on Sexual Consent Pleases Many but Leaves Some Doubters
description: Facing what many regard as an epidemic of campus sexual assault, some colleges have cracked down on binge drinking, others have reined in fraternities, while still others are training incoming students not to be passive bystanders when they see signs of trouble.

title: Link Is Seen Between Virginia Students Disappearance and 2009 Killing
description: The arrest last week of a suspect in the disappearance of a University of Virginia student has led to a significant break in the investigation into the killing of another college student five years ago, officials said on Monday.

title: Once Considered Won, Battle Against Invasive Beetles Is Renewed
description: It is a menace from Asia that over the past two decades has ravaged tens of thousands of trees in several states. But after being wiped out in New Jersey, it seemed to be in retreat in New York thanks to a warlike response from federal and state governments. It was gone from Staten Island and Manhattan, and the battle against it was tilting toward eradication in Queens, in Brooklyn and on Long Island.

title: Judge Rules Against Grooveshark in Copyright Infringement Case
description: In the music industrys second big legal victory in a week, a federal judge in New York ruled on Monday that Grooveshark, an online music service long vilified by the major record companies, infringed on thousands of their copyrights.

title: Cuomos Ad Faults Astorino on Health Care for Older Adults
description: First aired: Sept. 26, 2014

title: Proctors Command
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Im not an avid television game show viewer, but a person would have to have been living under a rock not to be aware of THE PRICE IS RIGHT. Even so, I was only vaguely familiar with the SHOWCASE SHOWDOWN segment of the show, and wasnt really familiar with its name. No matter; I thought that the setup for Kyle T. Dolans puzzle today was interesting and that kept me going, even if the puzzle itself didnt solve like a Tuesday for me.

title: Sleepy Hollow Recap:  Ben Franklin Taps His Inner Frankenstein
description: Season 2, Episode 2, The Kindred

title: Giants Say Extra Rest and Scouting Opportunity Give Them Edge on Falcons
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants woke Monday feeling more or less the same about themselves, while the league around them had changed.

title: A Bid to Make the Park Lane Hotel a Landmark, but Not by the Usual Suspects
description: The masterpieces of Central Park South are myriad: The Plaza, the St. Moritz, the Gainsborough Studios and the Essex House all come to mind.

title: Revisiting the Lehman Brothers Bailout That Never Was
description: Inside the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, time was running out to answer a question that would change Wall Street forever.

title: Harlem Man Pleads Guilty to Assisting 2009 Death
description: One of the strangest cases of assisted suicide in recent New York history was resolved on Monday, as a Harlem man pleaded guilty to manslaughter for his role in stabbing a Long Island motivational speaker who wanted to die, and paid the man who helped him do so.

title: At Montauk Point, Albacore on the Feed Prove a Tasty Pursuit
description: Every year, the first faint hint of a cool snap kick-starts the migration of tiny bay anchovies by the billions out of the tidal creeks and back bays of the East Coast. Then, for a few weeks, the rolling sea turns into bloody mayhem as the little fish run into packs of hungry false albacore slashing through the schools of baitfish, lighting up the waves beneath Montauk Point with their glinting green flanks.

title: Four Charged in a Bribery Scheme to Gain Clients in Arraignment Court
description: In the bowels of the Criminal Courts Building in Manhattan, as the newly arrested awaited arraignment, those who appeared to be wealthy were often handed an unsolicited piece of advice.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Sept. 29, 2014
Ukraine Turmoil Keeps Veteran Moving
description: NEWARK  The Devils have invited veterans to training camp. A few even have their names engraved on the Stanley Cup.

title: Song Sung Nostalgic: After Years of Hits, a Son of Erasmus Hall Returns
description: Neil Diamonds Brooklyn heritage is not as obvious as that of the Beastie Boys or Spike Lee. After all, he sings about Kentucky women, and his classic Sweet Caroline has been adopted as an anthem in enemy territory, at Fenway Park.

title: Police Fatally Shoot Man After Deadly Brooklyn Stabbing
description: A man was shot and killed by a police officer in Brooklyn on Monday night and another man died after he was stabbed at the same location, officials said, in one of two episodes involving New York City officers who fired their weapons.

title: Sheldon Patinkin, Force in Chicago Theater, Dies at 79
description: Sheldon Patinkin, a writer, director and teacher who helped shape the theatrical life of Chicago over half a century, died there on Sept. 21. He was 79.

title: Going Back, Back, Back, Back
description: On Tuesday, the Kansas City Royals will play their first postseason game in almost 29 years. Those Royals, led by George Brett, beat the St. Louis Cardinals in seven games to win the World Series. The year was 1985.

title: From the Fat Radish, a Cure for the Common Cookbook
description: When the Fat Radish opened four years ago on the lower Lower East Side, it was a harbinger of change for that rapidly transforming neighborhood and an indication of New Yorks changing food preferences. The brainchild of Ben Towill and Phil Winser, childhood friends in England and the duo behind the catering concern Silkstone, it featured a menu with a British tilt, in keeping with the duos origins and the gastropub fad of the moment. But it worshipped at the altar of the vegetable, not the hearty cut of meat, and prized seasonal cooking above all else. Immediately, fashionistas and food cognescenti began trekking south of Delancey Street to indulge in the Fat Radishs healthy comfort food, and in short order the duo opened two more spots: the East Pole, a slightly more upscale establishment on the Upper East Side, and the Leadbelly, an oyster bar across the street from the Fat Radish.

title: 10 Designers on 10 Iconic Dieter Rams Designs
description: As explored in By the Numbers: Dieter Rams, in Ts fall design issue, the designers prolific four-decade career at Braun and his work for the British company Vitsoe have earned him a place as a living icon. His 10 Principles of Good Design have earned exalted status in the design world. With those in mind, T asked 10 of the most exciting designers working today to talk about 10 of the most innovative products Rams had a hand in, and the influence his work has  or hasnt  had on their careers.

title: Word of the Day | inert
description: inert \i-nrt\ adjective

title: Democrats Are Spending More on the Ground in Key Senate Races
description: With a strong possibility that Democrats could lose control of the Senate in the midterm elections, they are investing heavily in voter turnout efforts.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 9 P.M. (13, 49) MAKERS: WOMEN IN COMEDY Last season, Makers: Women Who Make America chronicled 50 years in the womens movement. This season, six new documentaries produced in collaboration with AOL focus on female trailblazers, starting with this examination of the rise of women in comedy, from subversive 1970s sitcoms like Maude to blockbusters like Bridesmaids. Chelsea Handler, MoNique, Sarah Silverman, Joan Rivers, Ellen DeGeneres, Jane Lynch and Kathy Griffin share their perspectives; Leslie Mann narrates. Ms. Griffin will also host a screening of the documentary at makers.com at 8 p.m. on Wednesday, after which the show will be available for streaming.

title: At Martyrs Day Ceremony,  Solemnity and Goose-Stepping
description: In a short, solemn ceremony in central Beijing on Tuesday, Chinas top political leaders and a backdrop of 3,000 handpicked extras inaugurated the countrys newest national holiday  Martyrs Day.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It just boggles the imagination and is deeply destabilizing in terms of public confidence in the Secret Service and how it is carrying out its mission.

title: Corrections: September 30, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: The iPhone 6 Coming Soon to China, After Stern Look at Security
description: The Chinese government on Tuesday granted Apple the final license required to release the new iPhone 6 in mainland China, but the announcement came with a twist.

title: Zalando I.P.O. Values German Online Retailer at $6.7 Billion
description: LONDON  The German online retailer Zalando announced late on Monday that it had priced its initial public offering near the top end of its expected pricing range, valuing the company at about $6.7 billion.

title: Paris Fashion Week Morning Report
description: As the song goes, its the final countdown.

title: Test Yourself | Celebrating the 20th Anniversary of Friends
description: Below is the first paragraph, broken up into shorter sentences of the Sept. 26 article The One With the Replica Coffee Shop.

title: 6 Qs About the News | White House Intruder Got Farther Than First Reported, Official Says
description: In the article White House Intruder Got Farther Than First Reported, Official Says, Michael D. Shear writes about new revelations about the White House fence jumper.

title: No Casualties After South Korean Tourist Boat Runs Aground
description: SEOUL, South Korea  All 109 people on board a South Korean tourist boat were rescued on Tuesday after their vessel ran onto a submerged rock, coast guard officials said.

title: Told to End Protests, Organizers in Hong Kong Vow to Expand Them
description: HONG KONG  Hong Kongs leader on Tuesday called for the pro-democracy demonstrators who have blocked major roads in the city to return home immediately, but protest leaders responded with defiance, threatening to expand the demonstrations and to occupy government buildings.

title: Mitt Isnt Ready to Call It Quits
description: Hey, Ann, can you come here a sec? Mitt Romney called out, sinking into the cushions of a walnut-colored easy chair, his legs outstretched on a matching ottoman. Romneys blue work shirt was tucked into faded jeans; sockless ankles peeked out from his New Balance sneakers. He paused as Ann Romney entered from the kitchen, where she was baking chocolate-chip cookies. Sweetie, he continued, what are some of the items we gave away at the Yankee swap?

title: R.B.S. Expects Fewer Charges for Bad Loans in 2014
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland said Tuesday that its outlook continues to improve as the British lender benefits from further declines in charges for bad loans.

title: Japanese Swordsman With a Camera
description: Postwar Tokyos bustling streets might seem very different from a traditional Japanese coastal festival. Not for Issei Suda, whose approach has always been the same.

title: What Objects Tell the Story of Your Life?
description: Carefully curating a limited set of objects has lately become a popular way for museums and historians to tell vast histories (e.g., the history of the world, or of New York City). After all, artifacts can help us visualize the past and see complex events as something tangible or relatable.

title: Eurozones Drop in Inflation Carries More Fears of Another Recession
description: FRANKFURT  The drop in eurozone inflation reported Tuesday was, in one sense, just a decimal point, another digit in the daily flow of depressing economic data. Yet it raised an increasingly urgent question: What will it take to arrest the Continents slow-motion descent toward another recession and, possibly, a renewed existential crisis?

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Sneak Peek at Iowa: What the Early Voting Suggests
description: There are still five weeks until the midterm elections, but early voting is underway in several of this years pivotal contests. As always, the state leading the way is Iowa, where more than 150,000 absentee ballots have already been requested and 15,000 votes have already been received.

title: New York Today: The Living Wage Law Expands
description: Good cloudy Tuesday morning to you.

title: Fighting Human Nature
description: A variant of the oft-made argument that the Internet makes people terribleis the idea that people are naturally terrible, and the Internet just allows them to express their terrible selves. At Slate, Eric Michael Johnson seeks to rebut the latter notion, with an emphasis on the natural part.

title: Europeans Accuse Ireland of Giving Apple Illegal Tax Break
description: In a warning shot to companies shopping for tax deals around the globe, the European Commission publicly accused Ireland on Tuesday of giving illegal subsidies to Apple and cautioned that the country might need to collect back taxes from the company, which outside analysts said could reach into the billions of dollars.

title: Protests in Hong Kong
description: Pro-democracy demonstrators take over Hong Kongs streets.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Sept. 23-29, 2014
description: Have you been following the news this week?

title: Jiang Zemin, Former President, Makes Rare Appearance
description: Jiang Zemin, Chinas former president and Communist Party chief, made a rare public appearance on Monday in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, smiling and clapping at a concert titled Beautiful China, Glorious Dream to mark the approach of National Day on Wednesday.

title: Bill Gross, Calpers and the End of the Investment Guru
description: There were two big developments last week that seemed unrelated but are really part of the same big story of how finance is changing.

title: EBay Does About-Face in Spinoff of PayPal Backed by Icahn
description: At eBays annual board retreat in Half Moon Bay, Calif., in June, the companys 12 directors found themselves moving in a somewhat unexpected direction: breaking up the company just as the hedge fund billionaire Carl C. Icahn had suggested.

title: My Quest to Create Pride and Joy in Work Runs Into Reality
description: In my most recent post, I talked about my attempts to find meaning in my work. I havent really figured this out yet, but I decided the answer lies in finding ways to create pride and joy in the work one does, whatever that work may be. With that in mind, Ive tried looking at my company and its employees with fresh eyes.

title: Daily Report: Netflix Aims at Hollywoods New Releases
description: In a first deal of its kind, Netflix and the Weinstein Company said Monday that they planned to release next years sequel to the movie Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon simultaneously across the globe on Netflix and a select number of Imax theaters, Emily Steel and Brooks Barnes report.
